story:
Greetings!

I’m Jeremiah Clarke, an actor, writer and producer. Like many of us, quarantining during COVID gave me extra time to learn how to bake, gain weight but also on a serious note, time to reflect on my life and experiences. Walk By Faith started out as a diary. A way I was finally able to say what I’ve held in for so long. While getting these thoughts on paper, it became therapeutic and it made me realize how many others have, are currently experiencing or sadly will experience,..Domestic Violence. Walk By Faith’s theme is Traumas, Triggers and Triumph. I want this film to not only entertain viewers, but also bring AWARENESS and EDUCATION and MAKE A DIFFERENCE in many people’s lives. Domestic Violence comes in so many forms and no one is exempt. Walk By Faith will show the almost untold story of a male survivor and the story of a woman survivor.  JeKai Entertainment has completed a proof-of-concept trailer. So, without further ado check out this amazing trailer and interview with me.  

Walk By Faith – Synopsis 

In today's world, many of us seek out a certain “type” of relationship to fill a void. In this relationship, you strive to what society calls a “fairy tale ending” but instead you realize the void that is so missing in your life is something that only you can fill spiritually and emotionally. Through the traumas, triggers and triumph, Walk By Faith shows when a man or woman truly commit to the journey far beyond sight, professional guidance, along with a strong support system, is a necessity to be used as a compass to navigate the uncharted pathways to a sustained life of happiness. 

What We Need & What You Get

Our objective is to raise close to 50 thousand dollars to meet the budget of making the movie,  pre and post production costs.  

By DONATING, you will help us reach the goal of AWARENESS, EDUCATION, PREVENTION and MAKING A DIFFERENCE. I will be donating a percentage of all money that is raised to the National Center on Domestic Violence, Trauma and Mental Health (NCDVTMH). With your assistance, together we can make a difference. In addition to helping this project a reality, we have lots of PERKS to honor YOU!  

The Impact

While Walk By Faith touches on many aspects of life and realities within relationships, the most important is the effects of loneliness and abuse.  We want to spread the realities of domestic violence not only against women but all people, including men.  In addition, how black and other minority communities are not prone to go to therapy though sometimes, it is needed to overcome certain struggles in their lives to become the person they are destined to be.  All in all, you have to have faith!   

We Need You!

Independent film making takes team work and every contribution, share and mention go a long way.  We are dedicated to our craft and this project.  We will get  it done and if you contribute  you will know that you had a hand in bringing it to life. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  Help us spread the word by sharing this page with the Indiegogo share feature and also on social media.

story:
The Summary

Welcome to our campaign! We are Equinox Production Group, LLC, a local film production company out of Maryland and Pennsylvania. We are campaigning a budget for our 3rd FULL Feature film titled "Mortician". So far we have produced 2 Full Features with minimum to zero budget and want to make a better film each time we produce. You CAN help with your support!

So, what is this film about? "Mortician" is a horror genre film like no other, mixed with comedy elements and dramatic sequences which will have some massive special effects (blood, make-up, and gore)!  Synopsis: The funeral home business is never short of clients. For mortician Edgar Crow, Crow's Funeral Home is no different! Edgar is a proud 4th generation funeral director, but after 163 years in business, he is faced with legal troubles that shut down his funeral home forever! But to Edgar, forever is not an option, which leads him with a plan. Edgar along with his assistant Cyrus, will now adventure down a very dark path that will leave a trail of blood everywhere they go, all for the love of the dead!

The Cast/Crew

This film will be directed together for the first time by Davy Lantz Jr and Cori Coulter! Davy Lantz Jr has directed one film titled "The Ungulate" while also starring in films like "Hogmaul: The Legend of Abrams County", "Bottom Creek", and the short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" as Jack Tarmite himself! He will also be acting in this film as the character Michael, a man on an adventure with his girlfriend when they cross paths with Edgar Crow. Cori Coulter has directed the short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" as well as starring in films like "Bottom Creek" and "Hogmaul: The Legend of Abrams County". She too will be acting in this film as Nelly, the wife of a man whose car breaks down, and they are picked up by Edgar Crow and Cyrus for a wild nightmare of a time!

The Star of the film will be our mortician himself, Eric Hurd! Eric has been in many theater productions locally of Maryland and Pennsylvania, he has also starred in the short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" as the abusive uncle of Jack. Welcome to the cast Eric Hurd as Edgar Crow!

Josue Salinas is the silent star of the film as he will be playing the assistant to Edgar Crow, Cyrus! This will be his first Full Feature film he will be acting in and we are very excited to have him onboard!

The writer of the film is Jeffery Miner. He is the brains of the story and has the mind of a psychopath when it comes to writing! He has written the films "Bottom Creek", "The Ungulate", and the short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning". This will be his second film he has written without a role in the feature as he did co-star in "The Ungulate" and had an appearance in "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning".

Our Director of Photography will be Jake Waybright as this will be his first Full Feature under the role. He will also be acting as the character Paul, who is the husband of Nelly, who goes on a nightmare ride when picked up by Edgar Crow and Cyrus. Jake has appeared in "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" in multiple small roles, most notably the bartender who likes to clean and ease drop during a card game. He also did some camera work on that short film as well as did some boom mic/sound recording for the feature film "The Ungulate", and did a little set construction on the feature film "Hogmaul: The Legend of Abrams County".

One of our biggest assets to this production is our next crew member who has many talents including Special Effects, Special Make-up Effects, Set Designing, and more! He is our Special Effects Supervisor/Department Head, Kraig Sturtz! He provided special effects and special make-up effects on our short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" and has been a part of many bigger productions as well. One of the biggest reasons for this campaign is for this exact department of production. Welcome Kraig Sturtz!

And now for another big name when it comes to local productions, we have Jesse L Green! He has starred in films such as "Killer Campout", "The Ungulate", even appeared alongside Eric Roberts in a scene in "Bottom Creek" and played a bartender back in the 80's in a movie titled "Sweet Dreams" starring Ed Harris and Jessica Lange! He will serve as an Executive Producer for this film and act in a small appearance as a Drunk who is snatched up by Cyrus and brought to Edgar for their first official victim after being closed down. He has also been an Executive Producer on the film "Bottom Creek", and acted in multiple local film productions. He is most famous for his alter egos Captain Mango, who has been out and around locally and Key West, FL along with being on stage with country singer Kenny Chesney; and Captain D Capitate who is a indie wrestling manager/wrestler with a few local wrestling promotions! Let's give a big welcome to Jesse!

Now that is just a piece of who we have as more will come with updates throughout the campaign! You didn't think we would spill all the gore right away did you? We always have more up our sleeves!

 

What We Need & What You Get

Our campaign GOAL is to raise $5,000.00 to build our budget. Our Budget will include the money to go towards paying:

Actors/Crew

Set Design

Special Effects

Location Permits (if needed)

Catering

Props/Wardrobe

Music Score

DVDs/Merchandise

The nice thing with us is there are some pretty cool perks and more that will be added as the campaign goes. The perks included are:

A Thank You (ending credits) - Get your name in the ending credits under a Thank You

Pre-Ordered DVDs - Want to be the first to receive your DVD before anyone else? You can with this perk!

Associate Producer Package - You can be an associate producer of the film with this perk including an IMDB credit, Your name in the opening and ending credits, a DVD copy of the film, and be an extra in the film! (Travel/Stay expenses are NOT included and will need to sign a video release form)

Producer Package - You can be a producer of the film with this perk including an IMDB credit, Your name in the opening and ending credits, a DVD copy of the film, a movie T-shirt, and be an extra in the film! (Travel/Stay expenses are NOT included and will need to sign a video release form)

Executive Producer Package - You can be an executive producer of the film with this perk including an IMDB credit, Your name in the opening and ending credits, a DVD copy of the film, a movie T-shirt, an autographed movie Poster by cast and crew, and be an extra in the film! (Travel/Stay expenses are NOT included and will need to sign a video release form)

Edgar's Organ Jar - You can own some movie memorabilia with this perk! Inside a mason jar labeled Edgar's Jar, you will receive stickers, buttons, fake organs, and along with the Jar a DVD copy of the film!  

Coffin Suite Deal - This is a really cool perk, you will be getting a handmade 9"x 12"x 4" coffin box stuffed with a movie T-shirt, buttons, Autographed 5x7 movie photo by cast and crew, and a DVD copy of the film!

On Screen Extra - Want to be an extra in the film? This perk will land you a spot! Also, you will receive a DVD copy of the film when they become available! (Travel/Stay expenses NOT included and will need to sign a video release form)

So many awesome perks, don't ya think? Now there is always the question what happens if you don't reach your goal? Where does the money go? Well no worries, WE are 100% making this film NO MATTER WHAT the budget! Every penny COUNTS and WILL go into this production 100% whether we HIT our goal, PASS our goal, or DON'T make our goal! 

The Impact

So leading in from the last part of the previous section, the Impact you guys will have on this film is HUGE! We really want to provide a very well made, special effect driven storyline for you and the whole world to enjoy! Everything has been done in the past by us Equinox Production Group, LLC with what sources we have had. We have produced 2 full features that have been completed and released, "Bottom Creek" was strictly released by us and filmed by High Rock Pictures, LLC, "The Ungulate" was filmed and released by us, and the short film "Jack Tarmite: The Beginning" was filmed and released by us as well. We have been in business for a year and a half but recently revamped since July 2020 and what we can promise is a completed and released film for a 4th time overall! (3rd Full Feature).

The difference between this production and the past productions, is YOU! Your support will help us make our best film to date! We have the equipment, we have the talent, we can taste the heart, YOU have the SPIRIT! With that spirit and faith in us, we will NOT disappoint! 

Risks & Challenges

The MAIN risk and challenges to any production in today's world, is COVID-19. We do plan and will have all the safety precautions in place while moving forward on this production. Overall this film will get made with safety in tacked! If any delays arise due to this pandemic, we will remain up to date with our supporters and do everything possible to continue ASAP! 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute to our campaign at this time, NO WORRIES! You can share this Indiegogo campaign freely and as much as possible, because as they say, word of mouth is the way!

story:
NOTE: This is a film based around 80's hair band music - and it would be a enormous leap of faith to ask for your assistance without hearing any of the music - THANKFULLY, we have music from the film in the  teaser and on our Facebook page! We hope you enjoy, now a little bit about our film:

HOW:

We want to assure you that every penny raised for this project goes directly to the areas that would make this project a stand-out success. We are currently knee deep into filming and looking for funds needed to bring us across the finish line! Any money received would be allocated towards:

-Sound / Soundtrack/ Sound production. Priority number 1 is the music. With this being a movie based around music, we need to ensure that we're able to record a studio quality soundtrack and in addition have it adequately mixed. Additionally we want to make sure the film has pristine sound quality. If there's anything that will immediately take you "out" of a quality looking film, its poor sound quality.

- A quality film crew; including a professional Director of Photography and Sound Director. 

- HQ Film Equipment Rentals. In addition to this film sounding amazing, we need to make sure that this film looks just as good.

-Locations; because we intend to have live performances - we will need to be able to book performance space.

WHAT:

So what is TURN UP THE NIGHT? It is a movie that's takes place circa 1987-1989 and it falls the rise and ultimate fall of the (fictional) hard rock/ "hair band", Boy Elroy. There is a phrase called the "golden prison" - where essentially you've gotten everything in the world you could have ever imagined, but then you are ultimately shackled by it. In our story, Derek Carver - the lead guitarist, is struggling to find his place in the world. Having an almost virtuoso type guitar playing ability, he travels to Los Angeles to try making it on his own. While in Los Angeles he joins the band, Boy Elroy, and forms a contentious relationship with lead singer Kimmi Gaines; they could be the best of friends or worst of enemies. Kimmi , who is extremely talented in his own right, feels insecure and second fiddle to Derek; not being able to find his own place in the world his jealousy drives him down a path of self-destruction. The crux of the story focuses on their relationship - Derek seemingly on the incline, Kimmi on the decline - and that middle ground is where they are legendary. Additionally, there are themes about identity - and having to lose yourself as an individual as a result of fame; then ultimately becoming a "product". This film will include riveting music, dramatic performances, and a story that's so unique compared to what else is out there. 

WHO:

My name is Rick Masi, from Buffalo, NY - I am the writer and director of the film TURN UP THE NIGHT. I have been making films for just about the last 5 years, to which I very humbly and thankfully say - I have found a lot of success since I've entered this crazy world called filmmaking. My philosophy to this point has been to get the best quality film with what limited resources I have - and I have ran with that philosophy to the point where I can now call myself a multi-award winning national (and international) writer/ director. This would be the first time I am ever attempting any kind of fundraising for a project - my ambitions were to prove myself with limited or no-budget. My ongoing webseries, TALES OF DARKENED LIGHT has gotten the most acclaim, and I write and develop this project for no-budget. I feel at this point in my career - I can confidently say that, "now that I've proven what I can do with no money, here's what I'd be able to do with a little more".  We have gathered together a phenomenal cast to realize these characters, including Sebastiano Spurio ("Last Trip"), Melodie, Roehrig ("FANG"), Will Nemi ("T.H.E.M"), as well as the very talented Buffalo Music community, including members of First Ward, Nerds Gone Wild, and Eric Rovner on guitars. 

WHY:

Because I believe that each part of us has a little bit of whimsy that starts when we're young and evolves over time. I think a commonality we all have is at some point or another we've looked at someone or something and said - how cool would it be do that. For me it was Slash from Guns N Roses. More specifically it was Slash in the music video for "November Rain" - to me, that was what a rock star "does". As far as my musical ambitions, it didn't happen that way I wanted it to - but this is a way for me and for many of the people involved to vicariously live out that fantasy - and we feel that its universally relatable. This is a story for dreamers. We specifically wanted to have this story set in this era because of how quickly this genre came; how high it rose in popularity - and how quickly it crashed and burned. The 80's has been making a huge comeback, and we want to share this story within that frame of nostalgia. 

We graciously want to thank you for taking the time to check out our page and how you view out pitch video. If for nothing else, I implore you to check out the music of this film, which can be found in the tail end of the pitch video. We sincerely hope you consider supporting a project like this and our willing to offer the additional benefits listed. Thank you!

I have been making films for just about the last 5 years, to which I very humbly and thankfully say - I have found a lot of success since I've entered this crazy world called filmmaking. My philosophy to this point has been to get the best quality film with what limited resources I have - and I have ran with that philosophy to the point where I can now call myself a multi-award winning national (and international) writer/ director. This would be the first time I am ever attempting any kind of fundraising for a project - my ambitions were to prove myself with limited or no-budget. My ongoing webseries, TALES OF DARKENED LIGHT has gotten the most acclaim, and I write and develop this project for no-budget. I feel at this point in my career - I can confidently say that, "now that I've proven what I can do with no money, here's what I'd be able to do with a little more".  We have gathered together a phenomenal cast to realize these characters, including Sebastiano Spurio ("Last Trip"), Melodie, Roehrig ("FANG"), Will Nemi ("T.H.E.M"), as well as the very talented Buffalo Music community, including members of First Ward, Nerds Gone Wild, and Eric Rovner on guitars. WHY:Because I believe that each part of us has a little bit of whimsy that starts when we're young and evolves over time. I think a commonality we all have is at some point or another we've looked at someone or something and said - how cool would it be do that. For me it was Slash from Guns N Roses. More specifically it was Slash in the music video for "November Rain" - to me, that was what a rock star "does". As far as my musical ambitions, it didn't happen that way I wanted it to - but this is a way for me and for many of the people involved to vicariously live out that fantasy - and we feel that its universally relatable. This is a story for dreamers. We specifically wanted to have this story set in this era because of how quickly this genre came; how high it rose in popularity - and how quickly it crashed and burned. The 80's has been making a huge comeback, and we want to share this story within that frame of nostalgia. We graciously want to thank you for taking the time to check out our page and how you view out pitch video. If for nothing else, I implore you to check out the music of this film, which can be found in the tail end of the pitch video. We sincerely hope you consider supporting a project like this and our willing to offer the additional benefits listed. Thank you!

story:
A DEER IN THE WOODS 

A Deer in the Woods is a feature-length horror/thriller/dark comedy which follows a group of amateur film students who set out to make a horror film in a secluded cabin in the woods. Harper, an aspiring actress, has signed on to Director Cyrus Wakefield's horror project as an understudy. However, when Abby, the lead actress, mysteriously disappears, Harper is given the opportunity of a lifetime to star in her first movie. But, when Harper arrives to the secluded cabin, she begins to notice that Wakefield and members of his crew are hiding something sinister. As Harper tries to survive the night, she slowly starts to uncover the truth: that she may be trapped in a horror film herself.

The cast and crew of A Deer in the Woods are also creating an accompanying short film to go along with the feature entitled, "The Droste Effect" which follows Abby, the original actress from Cyrus Wakefield's horror film and the backstory around her mysterious disappearance.

Both A Deer in the Woods and "The Droste Effect" are not yet rated. However, they are assumed to be similar to an "R" rating for language, violence and blood. 

WHAT WE NEED

In order to successfully produce our full-length student film, we created a budget of $10,000. The breakdown of where the funding will go can be found below: 

SCREENING FEES – To bring A Deer In The Woods to life and give viewers an unforgettable experience, we will need funding for festival submissions and theater screening costs.

COSTUME – This film includes a wardrobe consisting of modern fashion as well as costuming that involves supernatural story-piece purchases.

EQUIPMENT – In order to bring the film to life and achieve the desired look, we must purchase specific cameras, lighting equipment, sound devices, etc. Due to limited access between semesters, we do not have full access to our university's equipment rental, so we need to purchase many of these items.

PROPS – To create the horror-based world in which A Deer In The Woods takes place, props are a must! Props range anywhere from fake weaponry, items for set design and even fake blood ingredients. The overall costs may vary, but allotting a good chunk of our budget to props will ensure the safety of our cast and crew, and a high production value for our film. 

POST-PRODUCTION – This section will cover areas such as an original soundtrack, purchase of foley recordings, costs associated with music composition and overall editing expenses.

CATERING – Given the nature of the film, our shoots usually run late into the night. In order to keep our cast and crew productive, we plan to ensure everyone is well-fed and hydrated on set. 

TRAVEL – Due to the remote location of the film, travel costs are significant for our cast and crew. We usually film after dark as well, which creates more shooting days than a typical production. 

WHAT YOU GET

*To donate any dollar amount, please select the 'BACK IT' option near the top of the page. If you would like to receive a perk for your donation, please donate through the perk that you prefer. Perks will be provided with funds from donations.

$10 Donation – A  Personal Thank You Note from the cast and crew and a Social Media Shout-out for your support!

$35 Donation – A printed version of our Official Poster signed by all the cast and crew ALONG WITH a social media shout-out and a personal thank you note.

$50 Donation – A Private Screening of the accompanying short film, "The Droste Effect," before it is released to the public through a private link/download ALONG WITH a signed poster, a social media shout-out, and a personal thank you note. 

$75 Donation – ONE A Deer In The Woods T-shirt of your size choice ALONG WITH  a private short film screening, a signed poster, a social media shout-out, and a personal thank you note. 

$150 Donation – An Early Private Screening of the final cut of A Deer In The Woods before it is released to the public, either an invitation to the private event or an exclusive link/download depending on availability/location ALONG WITH a T-shirt, a private short film screening, a signed poster, a social media shout-out, and a personal thank you note. 

$250 Donation – You will receive an Associate Producer Credit ALONG WITH an early private screening, a t-shirt, a private short film screening, a signed poster, a social media shout-out, and a personal thank you note. 

$500 Donation – You will receive an Executive Producer Credit ALONG WITH an early private screening, a t-shirt, a private short film screening, a signed poster, a social media shout-out, and a personal thank you note. 

WHO WE ARE  

CAST

Emma Parks as Harper

Theodore Rosenblum as Cyrus Wakefield 

Shane Troxell as Eli 

Lance Joos as Josh 

Carrie Zurliene as Claire

Daniel Tracht as Jesse 

Chaney Belle as Abby

CREW

Wyatt Bumbarger - Writer, Director, Producer

Chris Alderfer - Director of Photography

Matt Nickolaus - Editor, Gaffer

Tusha Pham - Producer

Brian Ellis - Composer

Nikolai Sunday - Sound Designer

Jeff Brady Jr. - Lead Production Coordinator

Shawn Coulter - Production Coordinator

Marco Falcucci - Production Coordinator

Mike O'Brien - Production Coordinator

Abbrielle Tuel - Production Coordinator 

Follow @aditwfilm on Instagram and Facebook to see pictures of the cast and crew and stay updated with the film's release!

OUR STORY

A Deer in the Woods is the first feature-length film from writer/director/producer Wyatt Bumbarger and many other members of our talented cast and crew. As Penn State students, we decided to create a learning opportunity for ourselves and challenge our filmmaking abilities by working on a full-length film. We also sought to make a film that could create a community experience by screening it at local movie theaters around the Central Pennsylvania area. Our team plans to submit the film to festivals and competitions as well so that we can make valuable connections and open doors within the film industry. 

Pre-production for A Deer in the Woods started in March 2021, shortly after a previously planned project had to be scrapped due to COVID. Thanks to our resilient crew, a new script was created, additional characters were cast, and production started in May 2021. Filming is planned to continue through November, after which the film will be edited together during the post-production stage starting in December. A Deer in the Woods is currently slated to be released in Spring/Summer 2022.

OTHERS WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can't contribute during this time? Help us by sharing this link:

https://igg.me/at/aditwfilm

story:
Short Summary

Ripples of Remorse is a short film that tells the story of two brothers with a strained relationship who get stranded on the way to their father’s funeral, forcing them to confront uncomfortable feelings about their faith, life, and each other.

Who we are

We are a team of 4th year film students at Humber College creating our final capstone project. We have spent the last four years learning and growing together as filmmakers to be able to bring it all together in this one film. Written by Amaan Khan and directed by Jacob Phair, the team is ready to make their real debut into the film industry with Ripples of Remorse. 

What We Need & What You Get

For this film, we are travelling to Milton Ontario for the filming. We need to pay for food for our actors and crew, transportation for both equipment and crew, pay for props, wardrobe, etc. We are asking for your help to make this possible. For your contributions, you can receive these perks!

$10+ Donations:

- Name Credits and special thanks at the end of the film

$20+ Donations:

- Digital copy of the poster for the film

- All perks above

$35+ Donations:

- Invitation to virtual screening of film 

- All perks above

$50+ Donations:

-Physical copy of the poster

- All perks above

$100+ Donations:

-Behind the scenes and blooper reel from the film

- All perks above

$200+ Donations: 

-Executive Producer Credit for film

- All perks above

 

Risks & Challenges

Our biggest risk is the weather. As the film primarily takes place outside the filming schedule relies on the weather cooperating with us. If this isn't the case and the weather prevents us from filming, we will have backup shoot days that will be set in place to insure the film will be completed.  

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially please feel free to share this on whatever social media you can! Thanks in advance!

story:
In order to hit deadlines for 2022 festivals, this film is being fast-tracked through shooting & into post production. I can only spare 20 days from our launch date for this fundraising campaign,  instead of the usual 30-60 days campaigns.  It's so important that you consider contributing as soon as you can so that we will meet our goal by December when we head into production!!!

                

BAD MAGGIE is a story two women, a daughter and mother, written by a woman, produced by three women, shot in an all female punk rock salon, Talking Headz Salon, and it will be shot by my mostly female production and post production crew. Please support these brilliantly talented females who have busted their butts to get where they are to bring this story to you! 

                               

Bad Maggie, 9, takes her Mom, CINDY up on her idea that neither of them go to school or work on this Friday morning. She spends the morning at Cedar Park, skateboarding and crossing-off bad deeds on her BAD DEEDS TO DO LIST.  When she gets bored with this, she goes into her mom's salon, TALKING HEADZ, and is greeted by the the hairstylists, and by RICKY, the salon manager, who has brought her repaired skates for the record release party being held at the salon that night. She tries them on and takes some loops around the salon.  When her Mom comes in carrying some ice behind more folks carrying booze, Bad Maggie hopes to show her her new skates and help her decorate the salon for the party, but her mom is busy setting up the bar, and slips away. Bad Maggie ends up prepping for the party with some of the hairstylists, as more and more punks file into the salon after hours.

Bad Maggie has a group of friends lined up against the red-lip shaped couch, in order of tallest to smallest. Bad Maggie is up on the tallest kids back, piggy back. They play a game of telephone that Bad Maggie starts, with a whisper that makes its way down the line to the youngest and smallest kid in her posse. They nod to Maggie in understanding. Bad Maggie secretly gets the DJ to let her hook up her karaoke machine into the sound system. Cindy flirts with a guy, and calls the salon her baby. Maggie and her friends are covertly collecting cigarettes, cell phones and lighters into a clear vinyl backpackBag Maggie's best friend EMMA holds. Ricky and Cindy smoke and speak outside about Cindy having a rough time.  Cindy learns that Ricky has been keeping an eye on Bad Maggie when she's at the park. A loud noise of feedback is coming through the speakers. Cindy goes rushing into the salon to catch Bad Maggie singing lyrics over a punk rock song about everyone needing to leave, telling them the party is over. By the time Cindy can get to Bad Maggie, she's holding up the backpack full of cell phones and cigarettes, and threatens to fill the backpack with water if they don't leave, and giving a nod to her best friend, who sprays water all over the large room with the nozzle from the shampoo sink, soaking the partiers and making the floor slick. Chaos and falling and confusion prevails. Cindy grabs Bad Maggie down off the table and hauls-off with her into the back, to her office, where she can get to the bottom of what's going on. 

They have an explosive one-on-one, that reveals Bad Maggie's real reason for her bad behavior. As they embrace, time stands still. The camera hovers over Bad Maggie's face as her head leans back, taking in a long slow breath. Bad Maggie's exhale of this breath pushes the camera up toward the ceiling, and comes back down to hover over Cindy's face, who is just finishing a long intake of breath. They make eye contact again, and begin to dry off. Cindy has a suggestion for how to end the night, just the two of them. The party rages on, and the two sneak out the back entrance of the salon. The camera follows them down the back alley. The music from the party getting more and more faint.  They become two silhouettes in the moonlight. 

I love my neighborhood! I've lived in West Philly now for 20+ years. Shooting this film in West Philly gives me the honor of celebrating people who live and work here, and who strive to create the community that makes West Philly special. Contributions will go to restaurants in West Philly for catering, Park Services, Grocery stores, and a handful of artists who are graphic designers, print makers, jewelry makers, and clothing designers, boutique owners, whose products and will be featured throughout the film. I'm honored to be able to celebrate these iconic people with gigantic hearts, like Heather Deforrest, the Master Stylist and Colorist, founder and owner of Talking Headz. Heather opened her salon ten years ago this year, and has dedicated her time and energy into making her salon one that is an inclusive, safe space for all people. She intentionally keeps prices extremely low so that everyone can have the style that best suits them. The salon serves as a center for community via the many fundraisers Heather organizes every year, like the one I attended yesterday to support LGBTQIA Afghan refugees find their way to a safer country, and safer life. Their mission statement is, RAD HAIR FOR RAD PEOPLE. Please visit their website, check them out! https://talkingheadzsalon.com  I'll be adding more and more people like who make this neighborhood great in the updates section, so please check back! 

                            

Can't contribute? I totally get you! Please share my campaign however you'd like on social media or use one of these not-too-annoying prompts I've created below! Thank you for your time and for getting the word out about my film! 

I just found out about an indie film that involves punk rock, bad deeds and roller skating, and that's taking place in West Philly! Check it out at https://www.instagram.com/badmaggiethefilm/

Checkout this Temple University thesis film my friend is making!  https://www.instagram.com/badmaggiethefilm/

Want to support women's voices in front of, and behind the camera? Support this short film my friend is making!  https://www.instagram.com/badmaggiethefilm/

 

 

  •

story:
After almost two decades, it can finally be seen!

February 2004: Mel Gibson's The Passion of the Christ was opening worldwide, and the media, always hungry for a scandal, zeroed in on Mel's father Hutton. Hutton Gibson was vilified by the press as a “racist,” “bigot,” “anti-Semite,” and “Holocaust denier.” He was condemned by so-called journalists who had never met or interviewed him.

And Mel himself was attacked for not “denouncing” his father.

The media hysteria and vitriol led many people to ask the question: who is Hutton Gibson? Who is this man who inspires hatred in some, but passionate loyalty and high esteem in others? For many Americans, the only thing they knew about Hutton Gibson, apart from the attacks in the press, came from a few call-ins Hutton had made to radio shows. But who was the man behind the voice? To those who knew him, he was an author, theologian, World War II veteran, and dedicated family man who lived his faith on a daily basis and garnered thousands of loyal friends and followers worldwide.

As the media firestorm swirled around him, Hutton reached out to a documentary filmmaker whose work he knew to be fair, and who had a history of tackling controversial topics. David Cole was invited to bring a camera crew to Tomball, Texas (where Hutton lived at the time) to spend a weekend and document Hutton's life and views. What resulted was a lengthy shoot that covered everything Hutton wanted to discuss, everything he wanted to preserve on the record for posterity: his faith, his personal history, his family, and his views on religion (not just Catholicism, but Judaism, Islam, and secularism), marriage, children, politics, the Holocaust, and the most pressing issues of the day.

It was at the time, and remains to this day, the only in-depth, sit-down, on-camera interview that Hutton ever allowed.

Hutton spoke as a scholar, a spiritual leader, and a family man. The wide-ranging interview included moments of rigorous intellectual discourse, and humorous personal anecdotes. No topic was off-limits. Cole was a passive interviewer; this was Hutton's film, a testament that would be released after his death.

Cole and Hutton stayed in touch for many years following the interview. Hutton's wishes were that, upon his passing, the footage would be released as a documentary film.

Hutton Gibson passed away on May 11th, 2020, three months before his 102nd birthday. The mainstream media, and the powers-that-be in Hollywood, rejoiced like vultures.

“Hallelujah! Neo-Nazi loving, anti-Arch Diocese, bizarre rogue Catholic Hutton Gibson is dead,” crowed “journalist” Roger Friedman on the Showbiz411 entertainment website. Friedman, who has covered Hollywood for Fox, NY Magazine, The New York Times, and The Washington Post, could not contain his ghoulish joy at the passing of a father, grandfather, and great-grandfather: “Hutton Gibson was a bad, bad guy who was a Holocaust denier and all around crazy person. Hell is too good a fate. So roast in Hell, Hutton.”

Yes, this man is considered a “serious journalist” in today's warped environment.

The New York Times called Hutton an “extremist anti-Semite” in its June 4th obituary. Stephen Silver of The National Interest marked Hutton's passing by calling him a “Jew-hating psycho,” and New York Magazine's Yashar Ali celebrated the death by vulgarly tweeting “Bye, bitch.”

More examples of “serious journalists.”

Right now, THESE are the people defining Hutton Gibson in the public mind. These cowards are heaping abuse on a man who can no longer defend himself.

But you can help him have the last word.

Hutton knew that after his death, the people and institutions he spoke out against and stood up to in life would attempt to control his legacy. That's why he shot the interview, the “video autobiography.” This would be his last word.

Our goal is to take that weekend of footage from 2004 and create a professional, engaging documentary film anchored by Hutton's words, and expanded in scope and context with additional interviews with the people who knew him personally or through his work. We have already filmed several supplementary interview with parishioners (including a filmmaker) who attend the Gibson family's church in Southern California. Additional interviews are being sought with family members and colleagues.

Ultimately, we want to create a high-quality documentary that will present an unbiased view of Hutton Gibson's life, in his own words, accompanied by the words of the people who knew him, and professionally presented in a documentary feature form for streaming services, DVD distribution, and other platforms, to give it the largest possible audience worldwide.

Were Hutton Gibson's views controversial? Indeed. But we as filmmakers believe that they should still be heard, and that everyone – Hutton's friends, his foes, and those who are not familiar with him – should have the opportunity to watch and decide for themselves. Hutton was an influential man, and his story, which is also the story of Mel and the entire Gibson family, is fascinating regardless of one's perspective.

Please help this project become a reality, so that this fair and respectful look at the life and beliefs of a truly fascinating and influential figure can be given the proper vessel in a well-produced and engaging documentary film that will do justice to its subject.

Who we are:

Robert Stark is a filmmaker, author, journalist, radio show host (1680 AM in Fresno), and podcaster (starktruthradio.com). He has a long history of interviewing prominent figures in the entertainment industry – Steve de Jarnatt (Miracle Mile), Éva Gárdos (Budapest Noir, Apocalypse Now), Everett Peck (Duckman), and Matthew Wilder (Dog Eat Dog) are some recent examples. He's also known for his fair and unbiased interviews with compelling and provocative figures in journalism, literature, and politics, including Peter Brimelow, Jared Taylor, Ron Unz, Aleksandr Dugin, former Congressmen Pete McCloskey, and Professor Robin Hanson of George Mason University and Oxford.

Robert's motion picture Supply won the award for Best Guerrilla Film at the Melbourne Underground Film Festival in 2018.

David Cole is a documentary filmmaker, author, and journalist. For the past five-and-a-half years, he's written a weekly column for Taki's Magazine, and his op-eds have appeared in The Los Angeles Times and The Agonist. He's the author of the Amazon bestseller Republican Party Animal (Feral House, 2014), and he's appeared on 60 Minutes, 48 Hours, The Phil Donahue Show, and a number of other television news programs.

* For any amount donated, you will receive a DVD of the final film, which will include in the special features the entire raw unedited footage of the Hutton Gibson interview sessions.

* For a donation of $100 or more, you will receive on-screen thanks in the movie itself.

* For a donation of $1,000 or more, you will receive on-screen Associate Producer credit, and an invitation to the private premiere of the completed film in Los Angeles.

~~~

Update: On June 14th, Roger Friedman of Showbiz411 tweeted a hateful message about this fundraiser:

"No one in their right mind should contribute to this crap. I'm so glad Hutton is dead. I don't want to hear another word from him or about him. You have to be crazy yourself to be involved with this."

This is exactly why you SHOULD contribute to this project. The Hollywood bullies can't stop gloating over Hutton Gibson's death. They want to control the narrative. Let Hutton's words be heard, so that people can decide for themselves if he deserves such vitriol.

story:
His Name Was Jason is a short film based off of Jason Voorhees from the Friday the 13th Franchise. It takes place between parts 1 and 2 of the movie franchise. Jason is now in his late 20's early 30's but has been presumed dead due to the drowning incident, or is he? Camp Crystal Lake has been shut down and abandoned for years on the account of the horror that unfolded on the night of Friday the 13th, 1979. The town folk of Crystal Lake are finally putting it past them and cautiously moving on but never forgetting. Only whispers and stories are told to the children at times when they misbehave and are instructed to never go in to the woods of “Camp Blood, or Jason is gonna get ya!”. "Camp Blood" is the nick name given by the locals.

This film will show you the story of 3 lifelong high school friends: Bo Thompson, Charles (Chuck) Roberts and Mickey (Mick) Bowetz. All 3 friends are avid deer hunters that made an ill-fated decision to venture into the foreboding area of Camp Crystal. Their belief of tracking and hunting a prized Buck that has eluded most hunters of the community for many years, will bring the town's name back on the map. This Buck seems to have found refuge and solitude in the foreboding area of the lake on the account that man hasn't tread there for so long. Once these lifelong friends enter the woods, they feel that time has almost come to a complete stop and direction seems to be off kilter. In the far-off distance, they get a glimpse of their prize and the thrill for the hunt begins! As quickly as it begins, they are also quick to realize the hunters have now become the hunted. The truth behind those scary ghost stories and of the legend that lurks at Camp Crystal Lake, is very much alive and has been living well without being disturbed by outsiders until that fateful November day.

I will also tell the story of Jason and his life of solitude, living in the wooded areas and abandoned camp ground of Camp Crystal Lake, as he forages and scavenges in order to survive. He is also constantly tormented by his mother’s voice and her words in his head to "guard and protect the camp ground", including the surrounding lake because this is now his domain. It’s all he’s ever known and is closest to a home he'll ever have.

We will bear witness to how Jason protects his home through this short film.

On the subject of the rights to Friday the 13th, we would again, like to formally acknowledge that we are in no way affiliated with Paramount Pictures, New Line Cinema, entity, person or individual associated with the Original Friday the 13th Franchise. If anyone from those entities takes issue with what we are trying to accomplish, we will happily comply with whatever is asked of us by those parties.

 

Little about me... I decided to take on this feat 2 years ago because my family and friends all gave me the encouragement  to pursue this seemingly impossible dream. I have been writing this back story for a few years now and I’m stoked at this becoming a reality. This short film is really for the fans of the Friday the 13th Franchise and those who have been trying to piece together what happened to Jason between the first 2 movies. A bit about myself…….I grew up in the '80s, being a huge fan of ALL HORROR MOVIES!!! Needless to say, Friday the 13th was, is and continues to be my all-time favorite. There was always something about that boy jumping out of the lake that terrified me! And the Sack Mask Jason in Part 2. Growing up in South New Jersey, where Friday the 13th was filmed, made it feel like it was in my own backyard and that is where my love for the films came from!! AND…….most of the filming for my short film will be located in close proximity to the original film location of Part 1 .  Now in my late 40's, having a career in the creative field for 20 plus years, dabbling with prop making and creating screen accurate costumes for fun, I want to bring it all to life in this small fan film. I can’t afford to do this alone and will need all the support and funding I can get. I know I can bring this story to reality but only with your help. I know there are a lot of Friday the 13th fans out there and we can do this TOGETHER!! This film will be mine as much as it will be yours. After all, it is you, the fans, who will ultimately decide whether this project will become a reality. To those of you who do decide to back this project, I will forever be grateful and humbled by your generosity for this opportunity. I promise you this will be a film that will be as close to the originals as they come. Thank You in advance for your support and to those who have been following my Facebook Fan Page since July 2018!

Thanks Again for your support!

Dave Brown creator of HNWJ.

PS ~ Remember……Jason is not dead. We just have to wake him up!

 

Risks and challenges

Indiegogo- This portion of the budget will go towards Indiegogo fees and the purchase of rewards for backers.

Volunteers: This project would not be where it is today without a dedicated team of volunteers who have donated their time at no cost to the project. Made up of friends, family, and colleagues, this group also includes the core.

Actors: Gotta throw them something! Food and Travel.

Risks and challenges 
As you know it takes more than the $20K we are asking to make a film of this quality. Costumes, wardrobe, props, flights, hotels, craft services/ food and equipment rentals are very costly. This campaign will help to fund the film. We may run a second campaign in the future based on needs if any amount over our goal does not cover production and or post production expenses.

story:
About the Project

An instrument invented in 1928 continues to captivate the hearts of musicians across the world. When Maurice Martenot, creator of the Ondes Martenot, came to Japan in February 1931 he introduced a haunting and expressive electronic instrument that would one day affect the destiny of an impassioned Japanese craftsman (Naoyuki Omo). This documentary will not only follow one American's journey toward acquiring this unique and rare instrument in Japan but also that of hundreds of devoted Ondists around the globe.

About the Filmmaker

My name is Ata Alford, I am a 24-year-old American musician with an immense passion for the Ondes Martenot, an instrument that I never thought I'd have the opportunity to play. I hope to recognize and honor the history of the Ondes and its community with this film.  My goal is to put as much love and care into this documentary as I can, with the hope that it will adequately reflect the beauty of the Ondes Martenot. 

What I Need & What You Get

There is no budget for this film. It is a small project with the soundtrack, editing, filming, and marketing done solely by myself. Unfortunately, I cannot fully fund this project on my own. With your help, the cost of my flight to Japan along with my hotel room will not be such a burden and will allow me more time to work on this film. 

  • I am asking for $2,000.
  • This will cover my flight to Japan as well as a hotel room for a couple of weeks.
  • If the goal is exceeded, the money will go into purchasing better equipment, filming more locations, translations, and physical releases of the film and original soundtrack. (If you choose the $75 perk or above you will receive the physical release regardless.)

Legacy of Love

  • The film will showcase interviews with Ondists around the world as well as Ondomo inventor Naoyuki Omo
  • An overview of the Ondes Martenot design and features 
  • Featurette of influential musicians Takashi Harada and Jonny Greenwood
  • A personal journey of music and life. 

Over the past few months, since I reserved my Ondomo from Mr. Naoyuki in Japan, I have been learning Japanese, preparing equipment, intensely researching, and selling many of my belongings in order to fund this passion project. It is an exciting adventure. By helping finance this film you will give me the freedom to fully express the wonderful history that Japan shares with the Ondes Martenot, as well as showcase the fascinating man Naoyuki Omo, and his creation, Ondomo.

Will this documentary be free to watch online?

Yes, I plan on making this documentary available on YouTube and other platforms for free!

What other films have you made?

If you would like to view my other work, please check out my YouTube channel. I am primarily a musician, and this will be my first full-length film. I have, however, filmed and edited several music videos and art projects which you will see on my channel: https://youtube.com/playlist?list=PLy3ofylGqKhjmTHeE_gu6stF64CkNWXKM

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Send me your experience with the Ondes Martenot or recommend those whom I can interview. 
  • Follow the project online! 
  • Share when it is released!

And that's all there is to it. Thank you so much! どもありがとございます!  Merci beaucoup!

story:
Greetings Horror friends and fans! 

Rene Rivas Productions, Left Lane Labs, and Womp Stomp Films are proud to present the IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign for our new short psychological horror-thriller “JUDY”


 

 


On the eve of her wedding, JUDY (Alaina Laethem) feels lost. Although happy to be engaged to her supportive and charming fiancé, PETER (Vincente DiSanti), she can’t help but feel hidden in the shadow of his success. As she longs for a deeper meaning to her life, Judy’s prayers are answered when a dark force calls out to her in her dreams. With a renewed sense of purpose, Judy proceeds down a new frightening path and embraces a change that will cost her everything she has ever known. (approx 25-30 min)



Founded by award-winning director Rene Rivas in 2011, Rene Rivas Productions is a production company based out of Flagstaff, Arizona. Working alongside Bryan Goff of Left Lane Labs, this duo has produced several commercial and narrative productions such as the indie Zombie Western Feature “Bloody Border” (2013), feature suspense thriller-noir “Northern” (2016), Halloween Fan Film “The Spirit of Haddonfield” (2018), & the recently released original short horror film “The Tent” (2019). 

Co-Producing alongside  Rene and Bryan are Vincente DiSanti and Ben Meredith of Womp Stomp Films. They are best known for their work on the popular Friday the 13th fan film series "Never Hike Alone," "Last Broadcast," and the award-winning short horror film, "Pathosis." 

Working together, our team has developed a uniquely haunting tale that will lead audiences on a wild ride of psychological thrills and suspense. 



Our goal is to raise a minimum of $5,000 to help with the resources needed to finish filming the final sequences and post-production costs for the film. Costs include permits, insurance, camera and lighting gear rentals, special make-up effects, studio rental time, catering, and other vital components that are essential for getting us to the finish line. 

Additional funding beyond our original goal will help us add additional crew members and resources that will benefit the project greatly.

 Here is how we intend to spend the funding that you help us raise:
 



Film Production (40%)
With a majority of the film already shot, our intention is to focus a majority of our fundraising towards completing the final scene of the film in September of 2021. This scene involves additional cast and crew, special FX makeup, equipment and location rentals, and insurance fees.

Post Production (35%)
Post-production is an important step to delivering a professional-looking and sounding project. Funding will go a long way in order to help us enlist the help of a Colorist, Sound Designer, Sound Mixer, ADR recording booths, and professional final export of the final film and soundtrack. 

Fulfillment (15%)
No crowdfunding campaign is complete without something for backers to walk away with. A portion of the funding collected will go towards purchases physical rewards and shipping them around the world to you. 

Indiegogo Platform Fees (10%)
Platform fees are the price we pay for Indiegogo hosting our campaign and sharing it with the built in community of backers who are big supporters of independent and genre films. A small price to pay for the opportunity to share our project with you. 



Rene Rivas (Writer/Director/Producer) 

Bryan Goff (Co-Writer/Producer) 

Vincente Disanti (Co-Writer/Producer) 



Ben Meredith (Associate Producer / Director of Photography)



Sam Ward (Executive Producer)
Wagner Wiles (Executive Producer) 
Jeremie Dalaba (Associate Producer / Gaffer) 



Filmmaking is a labor-intensive and stressful venture which will surely throw several roadblocks our way throughout production. Our well-seasoned team is no stranger to these challenges and knows what it takes to see a project all the way through to completion no matter the obstacles.  



We hope to welcome you as a part of this campaign and greatly appreciate any support you can provide. After making your contribution, we also ask that you please share this campaign with any friends or family you believe will enjoy this film.

Feel free to contact us with any questions or concerns at renerivasproductions@gmail.com 

Thank you for your donations and continued support!

Greetings Horror friends and fans! Rene Rivas Productions, Left Lane Labs, and Womp Stomp Films are proud to present the IndieGoGo crowdfunding campaign for our new short psychological horror-thriller “JUDY” 

 

On the eve of her wedding, JUDY (Alaina Laethem) feels lost. Although happy to be engaged to her supportive and charming fiancé, PETER (Vincente DiSanti), she can’t help but feel hidden in the shadow of his success. As she longs for a deeper meaning to her life, Judy’s prayers are answered when a dark force calls out to her in her dreams. With a renewed sense of purpose, Judy proceeds down a new frightening path and embraces a change that will cost her everything she has ever known. story:
Lotus Cycle is an intense psychological horror story following the main protagonist named Lotus. Lotus lives in a small country town by herself. Her night is suddenly interrupted when she encounters a strange...yet familiar man on her doorstep. Ignoring the concerns of her intuition, she reluctantly invites him inside. Lotus is quickly swept up into a terrifying and intense night as the man she invited inside her home manifests. The monster preys upon Lotus as it torments her, distorts her reality and eventually reveals his true form. Lotus is forced to confront the menacing monster that threatens to steal all her memories before it is too late.

 

  Writer/ Director - Claudia Secen

Claudia is a creative and passionate film maker aspiring to work on influential projects in the film and television industry. The projects that excite her the most are stories that have clever writing, depth and hidden meanings. Having produced the short film Unprecedented Times and directed Tianna Karris’s music video Not Coming Back she is thrilled to step into her role as the director for Lotus Cycle. She is very excited to work with her passionate crew of talented and motivated creatives to help bring her story to life. 

Producer/ 1st AD- Tess Bretag

Tess is a passionate, self driven and ambitious filmmaker having previously worked as the cinematographer for the drama short film Unprecedented Times, as well as currently writing and directing her own documentary Miss Karla’s Side. She is also extremely interested in the horror genre, and as the producer for Lotus Cycle she is passionate to create something new and interesting. 

Director of Photography- Marcello Anthony

  Marcello is a driven and inspiring filmmaker known for his most recent work as the cinematographer for the music video Remember by Red Radaza. He specialises in camera work and editing having previously worked as a 1st Ac for the short film Bunker and the Editor for Follow your Bliss. His passion for filmmaking is evident in his videography and his love for photography.

Production Designer- Kasia Zongollowicz

Kasia is passionate and driven film maker who has previously worked as a cinematographer for the short film Campus Life. She is excited to delve into the role of production design for the first time, combining her creativity and expertise for visuals with art direction to help bring the visuals of Lotus Cycle to life.

Editor/ Continuity- Liam Agosta

Liam is a passionate and motivated film maker who is looking forward to  working closely and collaboratively with the passionate crew of Lotus Cycle. He is most known for his most recent work as the sound recordist and music composer for the short film ‘Unprecedented Times.' He has experience working on all forms of productions specifically working with the camera and lighting, as well as editing and colour grading programs in post production. He is always looking for new ways to test his skills, work with passionate creatives and learn something new.

The budget of $1,300 will fund the entire production of Lotus Cycle. Your generous contributions will help us secure a location (5 day shoot), cover the catering for our crew and cast, props and any other costs we may require.

Location (hiring an Airbnb): $800

Catering: $300

Production Design: $100

Indiegogo Platform Fees (5%) + Miscellaneous Fees: $100

Check out our exclusive PERKS for more details about the incentives you can receive when making a contribution to this film! 

This story was inspired by the myth of the ‘false hydra,’ monster. The concept of a homebrew monster that creates a paranoia inducing experience by stealing its victims memories has driven the director to create Lotus Cycle. It is an intense story following the main protagonist named Lotus who is haunted by her trauma, and as a result she is trapped in an endless cycle of pain and paranoia. 

Horror is far more than just frightening stories. We’ve all experienced painful experiences in life, and Lotus Cycle aims to shed a light on this in a truly chilling and thought provoking way. At its core Lotus Cycle is a confronting story about the manifestation and resurfacing of trauma. On an emotional level the audience will be able to connect to the protagonist and the emotional truth present in it’s storytelling, specifically with the emotional abuse that Lotus experiences. 

Overall Lotus Cycle works not just on our fears of the dark and the unknown, but also on our fears about the worst in all of us and the demons we must face in life in a fascinating yet frightening way.

The crew of Lotus Cycle are prepared to solve any challenges that may arise during the shoot. The production and post production process is where the majority of challenges will arise. By sticking to the horror genre, ideally we need an appropriate location to film at, and an intense amount of work dedicated to composing the score and the sound effects in the editing stage. By successfully conquering these challenges Lotus Cycle will be able to look as realistic as possible, while also staying authentic to it’s eerie and creepy tone. 

Due to the unpredictability of COVID we will also have a designated COVID Safety Officer on set monitoring the safety of the crew and cast. 

We would love for you to join us on this exciting journey to bring this story to life. Stay up to date with all our news and progress updates by following us on social media and sharing our campaign! 

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000712...  

Instagram: @lotuscycleshortfilm

Email: lotuscycleshortfilm@outlook.com

story:
Greetings Halloween Fans! 

The entire team of BAT Productions is thrilled and excited to welcome you back to The Haddonfield Nightmare: A Halloween Fan Film Indiegogo fundraising campaign! 

Due to the demand we received after the final trailer dropped online, we have decided to reopen this mini-campaign to give fans one last chance to become a part of this project. We welcome you as a part of this campaign and truly can't express enough how much we appreciate any support you can give us. After you make your contribution we ask that you please share it with friends/family that you believe will enjoy this film! 

The Haddonfield Nightmare is a fan film that is set in the Halloween H20 universe and centers on John Tate (Peter Djuric) who must once again come face to face with Michael Myers (Connor Whitman) 22 years after his encounter with him when he was in pursuit of his mom, Keri Tate/Laurie Strode in Summer Glen, CA in 1998.

Our primary goal for this campaign is to give fans one last chance to get their names in the credits of the film and /or pre-order the first edition blu-ray. The funding raised by this campaign will cover the cost of printing and shipping the additional discs.

Additional funding  raised will go towards additional post-production costs for The Haddonfield Nightmare. 

This campaign is very simple with a limited option of perks, but we still think these are great for fans who are willing to back and support! For your gracious contributions, we have bundled together some OUTSTANDING perks for you all that include the following: 

WORLD PREMIERE TICKETS 

BLU RAY

DVD

T-SHIRTS 

HOODIES 

REPLICA MASK

NOTE: If you are looking to purchase one of the perks, please be sure to look at each of them carefully to see what they each include! Feel free to reach out to us at batproductionsbusiness@gmail.com with any sort of perk questions! 

BAT Productions is the production company that is leading this production. BAT Productions was founded in early 2018 by company owner Braden Timmons. The company specializes in aspects of media such as film, screenwriting, editing and financing production. 

This production is the effort of BAT Productions, MTT Productions, Tallstory Studios and its volunteer associates. It is in no way affiliated with, or representative of Present Compass International Pictures, Trancas International Films, Blumhouse Productions, or Universal Pictures, the Halloween film property, or its characters.

This project was created by fans for the fans to show our appreciation for the Halloween franchise. When completed, this project will be released for FREE. 

Thankfully, as higher quality fan films begin to rise, more and more studios are seeing the value in them; free marketing for their most beloved properties. As long as a fan film stays within a reasonable length and budget (as not to confuse audiences into thinking it's the real thing) and avoids commercial ventures, fan films can be a valuable tool to help keep beloved properties relevant and in the pop culture consciousness. They are also great portfolio pieces for actors and filmmakers to showcase. 

Thank you to everyone who assisted in bringing this project to life. BAT Productions and company are forever grateful for your time and dedication to the project. Thank you all for checking out our campaign and Happy Halloween! 

Share this page on social media, whether it be Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, or YouTube. The more people we can get excited about the project, the better. We appreciate and value your help and contribution. THANK YOU! 

Backers contribute to campaign owners, not to Indiegogo.  However, Indiegogo is able to refund your contribution before any of the following occur: The contribution funds were disbursed to the campaign owner; The campaign ends; or The perk(s) is “Locked”, which means the campaign owner has indicated the perk(s) is ready for shipment, or “Shipped” by the campaign owner.  

Once the Indiegogo campaign ends, BAT Productions has a NO REFUND policy
