story:
About the film:

He stands about 4'2", is a gangsta rapper, lost his eye to gun violence and doesn't compromise for anyone.


Richard Shaw.  
Bushwick Bill.  
Bushwick Mother F**kin' Bill. 

Any motherf*cker wanna get with Bushwick ?
Bring it on cause your size ain't sh*t!

Bushwick Bill is a gangsta' rapper who became famous in the group The Geto Boys (originally spelled Ghetto Boys).  He may be short in stature, but he is a giant in what he has been able to accomplish and overcome.  A pioneer of gangsta and horror core rap, Bill has spewed some of rap's most controversial, violent, and offensive lyrics.   He has gone toe to toe with the US government fighting against music censorship; he has been demonized by the media and the politicians. Unwavering and tough as nails. Bushwick Bill always tells it like it is, and he usually has the last word. 

2013 BUSHWICK BILL - GETO BOY TEASER

For the past 3 years, we have been filming and documenting the life of the infamous Richard Shaw, AKA Bushwick Bill, original member of the Geto Boys and all around fascinating presence and one of the most unique entertainers ever.  Our desire to do a documentary on Bill has been one that stretches over a decade long.  It finally became a reality a few years ago when we were able to track Bill down in Austin, Texas.  A bit of a rolling stone, Bill may jump from town to town, but one thing is certain, no matter where he lands, people always recognize him. He is undoubtably a hardcore rap legend. He has the stories to back it up.  He has rapped lyrics that command it.   And he literally has the scars to prove it.   

Photo by Gregory Bojorquez

Brief Summary

The film shows a now more mature Bill reflecting on his highly controversial life as one of the original Geto Boys, the South’s first rap group to gain national exposure.  Bill recounts his most memorable triumphs and failures, both public and private. 

Famous but not rich, Bill has struggled with both notoriety and the blurred lines between a person and his persona. 

Despite a life full of challenges, let downs and bad decisions, the diminutive Bill has managed to overcome the obstacles, sometimes with a wink and a smile.  Bill is living proof that truth is undoubtably stranger than fiction.  His story is outrageous, compelling, and often borders on the surreal, and it needs to be heard and shared.  Which leads us to YOU.

What We Need & What You Get

We are just about through production and headed into post production. We have a few more interviews to finish and we are now about to cross the bridge into licensing of archival footage/materials and music (all very pricey).  We also need  to build our post production team who will help us shape this phenomenal story. We've used up a lot of our favors and thankfully we have some generous and  talented friends and colleagues who were able to help us get this far!  The $50,000 we are trying to raise will barely scratch the surface of our overall costs, so we hope to be able to raise above and beyond this amount.  
We have self-financed everything up until now and have been working on this film in between our "day jobs" but we know with the appropriate support from the Indiegogo and indie film community, not only will we be able to finish it faster, we will be able to make the film the best it can be. We don't want to do a watered down film.   To do it right, and to get it done this year, we need your help. 
Know that any amount given will go towards finishing the film and will help get Bill's remarkable story out there.  We have some pretty sweet perks available (see them to the right). We teamed up with a talent designer and have hats, t-shirts and stickers available as a way of saying thank you. We even one perk for the super fan/super supporter called the PLEDGE OF A LUNATIC. This is one for the bucket list!

STICKERS, HATS AND T-SHIRTS AVAILABLE FOR OUR SUPPORTERS
T-Shirts! Please specify shirt size. Sizes range S-XXL. Please add $2 extra for size XXL.

Official Bushwick Bill Geto Boy Film Stickers!



Who are we?

In the late 80s/early 90s, when the director of the film, Greg Roman, was working at Eide's Records and Comics in his hometown of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, his way of protesting censorship was to buy every single record that came out with the Explicit Lyrics Advisory logo on it.  Greg was immersed in underground culture, which at the time gangasta rap fell into.   Already a huge fan of hip hop, Greg knew he stumbled upon something monumental when he first got his hands on the Geto Boys, self-titled Def American Release.  They spoke the truth. They answered to no one, and it was the most hardcore sh*t to hit the street.  Ever.  

Greg has always been drawn to underdogs, outsider characters and great stories. Bushwick Bill's life story encompasses all of the above.   Greg currently is a filmmaker who shoots and directs documentary shorts/branded content as his day job.  Bushwick Bill Geto Boy is Greg's absolute dream project.   It is not every day that you have the opportunity to help someone realize a dream!  


The Impact

Bushwick Bill is most often known for his size (he is a little person), his hardcore lyrics, and the tragic incident where he lost his right eye (which led to the infamous We Can't Be Stopped Album cover.)  The album cover went down in rap, if not music, history.  

Bill's persona is such a strong one, and so many people really think he is only that persona. We've spent so much time with Bill that the lines have started to blur for us as well. He is not just the notorious "one-eyed dwarf gangsta rapper." The more time we spend with him we see an artist who has overcome so many obstacles;  we see a musician, still hustling; we see a father trying to provide for his family; we see a charming person with a killer sense of humor. 

Risks & Challenges

Shooting AND completing a film requires the dedication and passion of so many people.  Any independent filmmaker will tell you that filmmaking is hard but incredibly fulfilling.  We hope to have a full rough cut by the end of the year.  We are committed to this project and will finish it regardless, but with some help, we can share Bill's inspirational and remarkable story sooner.  Bill told us last year that he was really eager to get the film out as soon as possible.   He confided that some people who have the same affliction as him start to experience health problems when they reach a certain age - all the more reason to support this project and get this film out soon.   



Other Ways You Can Help

Any donation can help, no matter how small.  In addition to giving to our campaign, please share the link on your Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, or email. We know that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by sharing the news about the film and the campaign. Email or share the link on your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. 

http://igg.me/at/bushwickbillfilm

Like us on Facebook!

https://www.facebook.com/bushwickbillfilm

Follow us on Instagram!

https://instagram.com/bushwickbill.getoboy/

Check out our website!

http://bushwickbill.com

Follow us on Twitter!

https://twitter.com/bushwickbillGB

And finally

Thank you, thank you, thank you!  We are grateful for any support!  It means the world to us (and Bill!) that you would support this film and are just as excited to hear Bill's story.  Anything you can do to support this film is greatly appreciated.   
Live, love, laugh,

Bushwick Bill, Greg Roman, and the rest of the Bushwick Bill Geto Boy film team/posse.

 Please contact us with any questions - bbgbfilm@gmail.com

  • Please specify Tee-shirt size. Sizes range from S-XXL. Add $2 for size XXL.
  • Shipping on perks not included 
  • Promo music courtesy of Glass Candy
story_txt:
About the film:
He stands about 4'2", is a gangsta rapper, lost his eye to gun violence and doesn't compromise for anyone.

Richard Shaw.  
Bushwick Bill.  
Bushwick Mother F**kin' Bill. 

Any motherf*cker wanna get with Bushwick ?

Bring it on cause your size ain't sh*t!


Bushwick Bill is a gangsta' rapper who became famous in the group The Geto Boys (originally spelled Ghetto Boys).  He may be short in stature, but he is a giant in what he has been able to accomplish and overcome.  A pioneer of gangsta and horror core rap, Bill has spewed some of rap's most controversial, violent, and offensive lyrics.   He has gone toe to toe with the US government fighting against music censorship; he has been demonized by the media and the politicians. Unwavering and tough as nails. Bushwick Bill always tells it like it is, and he usually has the last word. 


2013 BUSHWICK BILL - GETO BOY TEASER




For the past 3 years, we have been filming and documenting the life of the infamous Richard Shaw, AKA Bushwick Bill, original member of the Geto Boys and all around fascinating presence and one of the most unique entertainers ever.  Our desire to do a documentary on Bill has been one that stretches over a decade long.  It finally became a reality a few years ago when we were able to track Bill down in Austin, Texas.  A bit of a rolling stone, Bill may jump from town to town, but one thing is certain, no matter where he lands, people always recognize him. He is undoubtably a hardcore rap legend. He has the stories to back it up.  He has rapped lyrics that command it.   And he literally has the scars to prove it.   



Photo by Gregory Bojorquez

Brief Summary The film shows a now more mature Bill reflecting on his highly controversial life as one of the original Geto Boys, the South’s first rap group to gain national exposure.  Bill recounts his most memorable triumphs and failures, both public and private. 
Famous but not rich, Bill has struggled with both notoriety and the blurred lines between a person and his persona. 
Despite a life full of challenges, let downs and bad decisions, the diminutive Bill has managed to overcome the obstacles, sometimes with a wink and a smile.  Bill is living proof that truth is undoubtably stranger than fiction.  His story is outrageous, compelling, and often borders on the surreal, and it needs to be heard and shared.  Which leads us to YOU.
What We Need & What You GetWe are just about through production and headed into post production. We have a few more interviews to finish and we are now about to cross the bridge into licensing of archival footage/materials and music (all very pricey).  We also need  to build our post production team who will help us shape this phenomenal story. We've used up a lot of our favors and thankfully we have some generous and  talented friends and colleagues who were able to help us get this far!  The $50,000 we are trying to raise will barely scratch the surface of our overall costs, so we hope to be able to raise above and beyond this amount.  
We have self-financed everything up until now and have been working on this film in between our "day jobs" but we know with the appropriate support from the Indiegogo and indie film community, not only will we be able to finish it faster, we will be able to make the film the best it can be. We don't want to do a watered down film.   To do it right, and to get it done this year, we need your help. Know that any amount given will go towards finishing the film and will help get Bill's remarkable story out there.  We have some pretty sweet perks available (see them to the right). We teamed up with a talent designer and have hats, t-shirts and stickers available as a way of saying thank you. We even one perk for the super fan/super supporter called the PLEDGE OF A LUNATIC. This is one for the bucket list!
STICKERS, HATS AND T-SHIRTS AVAILABLE FOR OUR SUPPORTERS
T-Shirts! Please specify shirt size. Sizes range S-XXL. Please add $2 extra for size XXL.

Official Bushwick Bill Geto Boy Film Stickers!




Who are we?

In the late 80s/early 90s, when the director of the film, Greg Roman, was working at Eide's Records and Comics in his hometown of Pittsburgh, Pennsylvania, his way of protesting censorship was to buy every single record that came out with the Explicit Lyrics Advisory logo on it.  Greg was immersed in underground culture, which at the time gangasta rap fell into.   Already a huge fan of hip hop, Greg knew he stumbled upon something monumental when he first got his hands on the Geto Boys, self-titled Def American Release.  They spoke the truth. They answered to no one, and it was the most hardcore sh*t to hit the street.  Ever.  


Greg has always been drawn to underdogs, outsider characters and great stories. Bushwick Bill's life story encompasses all of the above.   Greg currently is a filmmaker who shoots and directs documentary shorts/branded content as his day job.  Bushwick Bill Geto Boy is Greg's absolute dream project.   It is not every day that you have the opportunity to help someone realize a dream!  






The Impact


 Bushwick Bill is most often known for his size (he is a little person), his hardcore lyrics, and the tragic incident where he lost his right eye (which led to the infamous We Can't Be Stopped Album cover.)  The album cover went down in rap, if not music, history.  


Bill's persona is such a strong one, and so many people really think he is only that persona. We've spent so much time with Bill that the lines have started to blur for us as well. He is not just the notorious "one-eyed dwarf gangsta rapper." The more time we spend with him we see an artist who has overcome so many obstacles;  we see a musician, still hustling; we see a father trying to provide for his family; we see a charming person with a killer sense of humor. 
    Risks & Challenges Shooting AND completing a film requires the dedication and passion of so many people.  Any independent filmmaker will tell you that filmmaking is hard but incredibly fulfilling.  We hope to have a full rough cut by the end of the year.  We are committed to this project and will finish it regardless, but with some help, we can share Bill's inspirational and remarkable story sooner.  Bill told us last year that he was really eager to get the film out as soon as possible.   He confided that some people who have the same affliction as him start to experience health problems when they reach a certain age - all the more reason to support this project and get this film out soon.   



Other Ways You Can Help Any donation can help, no matter how small.  In addition to giving to our campaign, please share the link on your Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, or email. We know that not everyone can contribute, but you can still help us by sharing the news about the film and the campaign. Email or share the link on your Facebook, Instagram, and Twitter. 
http://igg.me/at/bushwickbillfilm
Like us on Facebook!
https://www.facebook.com/bushwickbillfilm
Follow us on Instagram!
https://instagram.com/bushwickbill.getoboy/
Check out our website!
http://bushwickbill.com
Follow us on Twitter!
https://twitter.com/bushwickbillGB

And finally

Thank you, thank you, thank you!  We are grateful for any support!  It means the world to us (and Bill!) that you would support this film and are just as excited to hear Bill's story.  Anything you can do to support this film is greatly appreciated.   
Live, love, laugh,

Bushwick Bill, Greg Roman, and the rest of the Bushwick Bill Geto Boy film team/posse.
 Please contact us with any questions - bbgbfilm@gmail.com

Please specify Tee-shirt size. Sizes range from S-XXL. Add $2 for size XXL.

Shipping on perks not included 

Promo music courtesy of Glass Candy

story:
The Movie

In this thriller, Rebecca (Skyler Wexler) befriends a strange, lonely girl named Nadia (Cynthia Galant), who has a dark secret: a twin sister named Aidan who is malicious and not quite what she seems. An old man, McKenna, (Andrew Gillies, also known from “Orphan Black”) dutifully watches them and their controlling mother, Eve, (Carmen Gillespie) from across the street in an attempt to keep everyone safe, but things have already gone too far, and Rebecca may be in grave danger. 

Message from us & VFX test:

Some background info on creators and twinning test of Cynthia Galant:

 

Storyboard 

Scn 11 (no spoilers)

 

The Team

DIRECTOR & CO-WRITER: Alexander Galant

Alexander is an award-winning filmmaker and novelist. His previous thriller shorts had success in the festival circuit: The Missing Piece (Silver Remi Award for Suspense Thriller at WorldFest Houston), First Light  (International Festival of Cinema and Technology; WorldFest Houston; &  Festival of Fantastic Films, UK) and The Jigsaw Puzzle (New York Film Festival).  Alexander's writing experience includes being the ghostwriter of a Gothic historical novel which was on the New York Times Best Seller list, and co-writer of the corresponding screenplay adaptation which was briefly optioned. His own novel Depth of Deception: A Titanic Murder Mystery received an award at Book Expo of America.  Alexander also freelances as a Script Supervisor in the film and television industry.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1067711  Alexander's Website

PRODUCER, CO-WRITER & "Eve": Carmen Gillespie

Carmen previously collaborated with husband Alexander Galant on numerous short films. They co-wrote Star Wars: Blasted Behavior (a Star Wars spoof) which was in the top 20 of the Atom & Lucasfilm's Star Wars Fan Film Competition in 2009 (George Lucas was one of the judges) and wrote/directed Grouchy Tiger Hiding Dragon (a puppet spoof) which was an Official Selection of the Los Angeles International Children's Film Festival.  Carmen has been part of Canadian Improv Showcase for many years and has played many zany characters on stage (Wicked Witch in Wizard of Oz, Lina in Singin' in the Rain and Agnes Gooch in Mame) but Shadowed gives her a chance to flex her dramatic muscles.    http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1085454/  Carmen's Official Website

DIRECTOR OF PHOTOGRAPHY: John Holosko c.s.c.

John is excited to be working on this project and brings with him many years of experience shooting film & TV all over the world. Notable credits include DOP for the series La Femme Nikita, Nancy Drew, Starhunter and recently behind the camera on the films: IT (Stephen King's 2017); Suicide Squad, and xXx: Return of Xander Cage.  John and Alexander met working together on the feature film Nursery Rhyme of a Madman.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0392248/

The Cast

Skyler Wexler ("Rebecca")

Skyler is best known for her role as Kira Manning on the TV series Orphan Black. She started appearing on the small screen in 2011, making her debut on Against the Wall. She soon landed roles in Warehouse 13, Alphas, Really Me and Saving Hope.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4585214/

Cynthia Galant ("Nadia" & "Aidan")

Cynthia is known to Orphan Black fans as the younger version of the clone Rachel Duncan as well as the new, flawed clone, Charlotte Bowles. Cynthia first appeared on television at the age of 4 in a Tim Horton's commercial with Sidney Crosby. She then made her feature film debut the following year as the daughter of Edwin Boyd in Citizen Gangster. Other film roles include Helium Junkies and Christmas with Holly.  http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4341896/

Andrew Gillies ("Mr. McKenna")

Aside from playing clone creator Ethan Duncan in Orphan Black, Andrew Gillies is also known as Dr. Adler in 12 Monkeys, and for recurring roles in Mutant X, Degrassi: The Next Generation; Trailer Park Boys; Murdoch Mysteries and Code Name: Eternity. Andrew spent 14 seasons at the Shaw Festival; 2 seasons at the Stratford Festival and has appeared on stage in Hamlet, Educating Rita, Cyrano de Bergerac and many more. Andrew was directed by Alexander Galant in the Canadian Premiere of the New Adaptation of The Diary of Anne Frank.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0319164/

Eric Charters ("Ben")

Eric has been singing, dancing and acting his way across the stage for over 25 years, including  as Don Quixote, Judas in Jesus Christ Superstar, the title role(s) in Jekyll & Hyde, and Riff Raff in The Rocky Horror Picture Show. When playing Javert in Les Misérables, he was directed by Alexander Galant. Eric recently made the transition to the screen in the final season of Reign.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm8989980/

Sarah Hemphill (Nadia & Aidan Double/"Paramedic")

Originally from Alberta, Sarah started acting on the stage at age 6. Her on-stage credits includes Unity 1918, RENT, and Reasons to be Pretty.  She's been in the feature films Year After Year, The Northlander and recently on the series Run For Your Life.  Both Sarah and Alexander worked together on the feature film The Bet.    http://www.imdb.com/name/nm5394938/

Tammy Everett (Stunt Choreographer/"Police Officer")

Tammy is a certified Fight Instructor with Fight Directors Canada, and a black belt in Wu Xing (5 animal Kung Fu). On stage Tammy has performed in Shakespeare, Musical Theatre and Opera (coloratura soprano) and has been a stunt performer in film in Judgment Control and Team Epic.  Tammy choreographed the fights in Alexander Galant's production of Les Misérables.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm4286740/   Tammy's Website

CREW

COMPOSER: Janal Bechthold

Janal is a composer for film, TV, games, and interactive media, having worked on numerous scores including the horror noir feature Art of Obsession, the documentary Gods In Shackles, the videogame The Rival Books of Aster, and interactive graphic novels, Dystopia 2153 and 80 Degrees North. Her music for television has been broadcast on CBC/SRC-Radio Canada, CTV, TSN, Discovery, and TV5 international among others. In addition to being a participant in the Canadian Music Centre’s 2018 electronic music incubator EQ, she is the recipient of the 2016 Chris Dedrick Music Fund Award for Live Musicians in Media Soundtracks, the founder of Toronto Women Composers, and serves on the Board of Directors for the Screen Composers Guild of Canada.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm1644795/   

PRODUCTION DESIGNER: Aaron Morrison 

Aaron was recently Art Director on an episode of American Gods.  Other Art Department credits include Hannibal, Arrival, Chloe , Prisoners, Sicario, Backseat and also on Alexander's short films First Light and Star Wars: Blasted Behavior.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0607055/

PRODUCTION MANAGER: Ayah Hart

Ayah is a film maker working on her own documentary and has worked in the Production Department on TV commercials, music videos, documentaries, web series, shorts and feature films. Ayah and Alexander worked as crew together on the feature The Bet and the Shaftsbury webseries CLAIREvoyant.   http://www.imdb.com/name/nm6458185/   Ayah's website

KEY MAKE UP: Deborah Krymuza

Deborah is currently working at Mindwarp Productions Inc. (Prosthetics and Special Make-up Effects).  She recently worked on Alias Grace and American Gods and has been the Key Make Up artist for many of Alexander's films and even some stage productions. She also teaches at Seneca College in the Special Effects Make-up Artistry Program.     http://www.imdb.com/name/nm0473008/

 

How Your Support Will Be Used:

Every donated dollar will go towards the production of this film, its completion and getting it out into the world.  No donation is too small.  Even a five-dollar donation can go toward what we need to spend on equipment, location fees or post-production fees like visual FX, editing & sound mixing, and music scoring.

     

    Location

    This is the main location we want to use for Shadowed:

    Some eagle-eyed fans of Orphan Black may recognize it from one episode. It's perfect for our shoot. Secluded with a rustic, creepy atmosphere. 

    The rental rate for this location is: $5,000 per day. 

     

    Can we do the 'twinning' effect?

    Some of you may wonder, "Wait, just because some of the cast was in Orphan Black (where Tatiana Maslany played 12 clones) that doesn't mean they can successfully have one actress (Cynthia) in a dual role, by themselves!" 

    Fortunately, we learned a lot from being on the set of Orphan Black. Not only as the three cast members, but Alexander filled in as Script Supervisor on a few days on two episodes. 

    Alexander used his Orphan Black experience on set for the Canadian Film Centre short Perfect (Official TIFF selection) where one actress played twins. As script supervisor, Alex checked eyelines, interaction, and coordinated (constantly) with the people doing the visual effects and editing/post-production as filming went along. 

    For Shadowed, we will employ an acting double as was done in Orphan Black and as seen in the above still of the monitor from Perfect.  In our shot, Sarah Hemphill will act opposite Cynthia Galant for the scenes where the twins interact. Our challenge is in their knock down fight! 

    Cynthia and Alexander also have experience with working on greenscreen to create the cloning effect. First, in this reinactment of the infamous four-clone dance (from season 2 of Orphan Black). 

     

    And then again, in this parody that was made as a thank you to the fans/cast & crew. This Orphan Black/Les Miz parody contains homage to all 12 clones. 

     

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We know there may be many people out there who would like the idea of this project but don’t have money to contribute. If this is you, we appreciate you helping out by simply spreading the word to anyone you think might be interested.

    To keep costs down, there are many tangibles and intangibles we will be seeking to secure through partnerships, in-kind donations and other routes. If you have a non-monetary idea that you would like to contribute to the film, or want to know more about this, please E-MAIL us. 

    Like us on Facebook

    Follow us on Twitter

    Please share the news of this campaign and any related materials far and wide!

    Thank you for reading all the way down to here. Boy, this was long! Make your donation now, feel really good about it, and reward yourself with a nice hot beverage. You deserve it!

story:
Short Summary

Hidden beneath the World Heritage mountains of Tasmania, giant prehistoric spiders the size of dinner plates seek kinky love in the dark... Neil Gaiman brings a real-world “Charlotte’s Web” into our world of rapid change. Through award-winning cinematography, SIXTEEN LEGS looks at the challenge, humour and science of capturing something never-before-filmed, against all the odds!

We are a group of biologists and educators working with some of the most unusual animals and in some of the most remote places on the planet. We've also provided opportunities for students working on positive environmental projects from Fiji to Antarctica. Over seven years, we produced SIXTEEN LEGS, a documentary about the life-cycle of giant prehistoric spiders still living in Australia's deepest caves. This project has received international acclaim and awards, and this has allowed us to educate and entertain people around the globe with the difficulties of underground life. Having produced versions of the film for cinema, television and exhibitions, we now wish to produce a Special Edition Blu-Ray and DVD set of this film that includes the full theatrical and main broadcast versions (including a special shorter version designed for younger audiences), as well as behind the scenes making of material. We also want to use the wealth of unused natural history footage, interviews with global experts, and additional popular culture material to produce a fun and fascinating online multimedia resource on caves, spiders, and the underground realm for schools and the public. We're inviting you to be a part of the next stages of this exciting project. Our resources are always stretched between our environmental and educational work, and your contributions will play a major role in taking SIXTEEN LEGS into the next big steps of its multi-legged journey.

What We Need & What You Get

The film and its broadcast variants are already complete, so no additional funding is required for production. However, we need to raise a minimum of $20,000 to make the Special Edition release viable. Of this amount, about 50% will go to factory mastering and pressing of the double disc Blu-Ray and DVD sets, including PAL and NTSC options for supporters (see FAQ). About 15% will go to formal rating and classification of the variants of the documentary and the extra features, and licensing. Editing will take another 15%, and about 7.5% each will go to third-party licensing and design. The final 5% is the platform fee for Indiegogo. These amounts will let us reach the minimum Special Edition production costs, as well as baseline editing for the online multimedia resource. Any funds over and above $20,000 will provide more detailed editing work on the online resources, which will get bigger and better with the more support we receive.

In return for helping this great educational cause, you get your own copy of the film - whether as the standard 98 minute theatrical version for online streaming, or the Special Edition Collection on your choice of DVD or Blu-Ray. The DVD will be a two-disc set featuring the full 98 minute theatrical version of the film, plus a special 1x 50 minute broadcast version of the film edited to better suit younger audiences. The Blu-Ray will upgrade the first disc of the set to the full HD Blu-Ray format, and will also include a special alternate 2x 50 minute broadcast version of the feature film. (This will be made available to DVD supporters as an online extra). Both the DVD and Blu-Ray sets will include the award-winning behind the scenes film '16 Legs: Spider Love' as well as additional featurettes on overcoming arachnophobia, the story of the SIXTEEN LEGS concept, the music of SIXTEEN LEGS, and trailers. There will also be a viewing guide to assist educators in showing the film to students.

As a special incentive to order early, we are offering a discount early-bird price until 10 November for the first 200 DVD sets, the first 200 Blu-Ray sets, and the first 200 sets of either that are coupled with online community option. These early-bird options also include the opportunity to get a name-checked 'thank you' on the discs, and we will also aim to get the first batch of discs sent out for Christmas (Covid-19 delivery times allowing). The earlier you order, the better your chances of that happening!

As well as the film, there are also additional rewards and benefits available, including packages of 2x hardback books showcasing the artwork and photography of the film. ‘SIXTEEN LEGS: A Visit to the Queen of the Dark’ is a 44 page hardback showcasing expanded versions of Jodee Taylah’s superb production art from the film and the SIXTEEN LEGS: Enter the Cave Exhibition, alongside the story components that were then under development with Neil Gaiman, Niall Doran and Craig Wellington. The book also contains the scientific background to the story, a glimpse behind the research and personal reflections on the involvement of the participants above. ‘SIXTEEN LEGS: Kinky Love’ is a photographic journey through the ecology and reproductive biology of the Tasmanian Cave Spider, also in 44 page hardback.

If you choose the DELUXE option for the books, you'll get one of only 75 available sets signed by Neil Gaiman and a selection of the filmmakers, artists, scientists and other key production crew behind the film. We'll also throw in some of the archival production posters and postcards with this option. This is the ultimate pack for an individual supporter!

In collaboration with supporters who choose the web exclusives option (also included with the books), we will develop the online community resource from the hundreds of hours of additional expert interviews, public comments, and extensive cave and animal footage that were left on the cutting room floor. This is an enormously valuable archive with significant educational benefits, and we'd love to make it accessible.

We'll also have watch parties and online Q&A sessions through this community resource. This component will be as big as you can help us make it: the further we go over our $20,000 target, the more comprehensive, vibrant and interactive this exciting resource can be!

There are also reward options to support school engagement with the project. You can support a local school with the donation of a  curriculum aligned education pack of SIXTEEN LEGS materials. We’ll send your nominated school (or, if you prefer, one we choose on your behalf) a tailored educational pack including online community access with special school-specific educational opportunities including student Q&A sessions with the filmmakers and scientists behind the project, and opportunities to submit materials for the updated touring SIXTEEN LEGS exhibition in 2021-2022.

If you want to sponsor a swathe of schools to be involved, we're offering a mega-sponsorship option for 15 schools, with a discounted rate per school. We'll include additional expert support with this option to curate a special sponsor-named component of the touring exhibition (above) from your cluster of schools, and will work with you to tailor a school package that meets your philanthropic and sponsorship needs. Contact us for more details at info@bookendtrust.com

For more information on the rewards, please see the photos of reward inclusions at the bottom of this project description, or in the reward categories in the side bar!

UPDATE 26 NOVEMBER: 4x NEW REWARDS HAVE BEEN ADDED FOR BLACK FRIDAY, including a beautiful glowworm book, art and photo cards, a limited edition mug (out of print since 2019), promotional posters, and a mountain book combo signed by the author. See Project Update #6 and the reward photos for more details.

UPDATE 7 DECEMBER: We've hit our target ahead of time, but a few more sales will really help us boost the design of the online educational archive, so we're offering a BONUS filmmakers' commentary track with the warts & all behind-the-scenes goss on the enormous challenges of making of the film if we can hit our stretch goal at AUD$25k!!!! Jump into the dark underworld with us and add to the fun!

 

STRETCH GOALS

If we reach our goal quickly, the film's co-directors are also promising to record a special online commentary on the film as the first stretch goal, with exclusive behind the scenes details on the trials and tribulations of seven years of production, warts and all. Additional stretch goals will be added if this target is reached.

 

THE FILM

Featuring: Neil Gaiman, Kate Miller-Heidke, Stephen Fry, Tara Moss, Adam Hills, Mark Gatiss and scientific researchers and experts from around the globe.

Journey into a world like no other, where giant prehistoric spiders the size of dinner plates seek kinky love in the dark. As the world rapidly descends into the next period of global mass extinction, a message of hope comes from an unlikely hero: a creature, often unfairly reviled, that has survived prior mass extinctions and climatic change in a magical ecosystem hidden beneath the World Heritage mountains of one of the world's last great wildernesses. With spectacular imagery and a dark-fantasy twist by master story-teller Neil Gaiman, this real-world “Charlotte’s Web” brings a story of stability and solitude into our world of rapid change. Award-winning cinematography documents the 25th anniversary of scientific research into animals that outlasted the dinosaurs, survived the splitting of the continents and have endured the entirety of human civilisation in Australia’s deepest caves. From the visually stunning wilderness of Tasmania to an underworld few people have seen, this film excites and inspires modern audiences with the joy of adventure in the natural world, and celebrates the wonder of an ecosystem that preceded us and may still outlast us.

REVIEW QUOTES

  • “A playful, stunning documentary... as epically gorgeous as it is fantastically artful.” – Edhat Review, Santa Barbara International Film Festival.
  • “A beautiful nature documentary, expertly presented... a masterful feat captured with resonance!” – True/False Film Festival.
  • “Your story brought a charming, creative and delightfully humanizing dimension to spiders which - from the survey comments we've seen so far - audiences enjoyed immensely.” – Barbara Stauffer, Session Chair – Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History (D.C).
  • “I don’t think it could ever be said that the work of Attenborough will at any point be irrelevant – but, like all art, there is always room for adaptation and imagination. SIXTEEN LEGS arguably does just that.” – Wild Melbourne Review, Melbourne test screening of the rough cut.
  • "Even those of you who don't like spiders will find this story so charming... It's beautiful. They are so elegant, and they move so gently. Astonishing creatures, fascinating!" Gillian O'Shaughnessy, ABC Radio Perth.
  • "This documentary has got rave reviews around the world... You're not overselling it, it looks spectacular!" Jules Schiller, ABC Radio Adelaide.
  • "Mission accomplished: you've changed my mind. I will give spiders a second chance... I like them now. It's happened!" Teri Campbell, RTR FM 92.1 Perth.
  • “Giant Tasmanian Cave Spiders and NEIL GAIMAN!! What more could you possibly want???” – GEORGE R.R. MARTIN (Game of Thrones).

AWARDS & ACCOLADES

  • WINNER: Gold Award – Australian Cinematographers Society 2016
  • WINNER: 4x Awards of Excellence & 1x Award of Merit Special Mention – Accolade Global Film Competition 2017 (Documentary Feature, Natural History, Cinematography, Editing & Score)
  • WINNER: Accolade Global Film Competition Humanitarian Award 2017 - Outstanding Achievement
  • WINNER: Frack Fest Multimedia Film Festival 2017, USA (Best Documentary)
  • WINNER: 8x Awards of Excellence – Impact DOCS Global Competition 2018 (Documentary Feature, Natural History, Direction, Originality, Script/Writing, Cinematography, Editing & Score)
  • FINALIST: Jackson Hole Wildlife Film Festival 2017 (Best Educational Film)
  • FINALIST: Leonardo Da Vinci Film Society/MIFF Awards 2017, Italy (3x categories: Best Film, Best Documentary & Best Score)
  • OFFICIAL SELECTION: Santa Barbara International Film Festival 2017
  • OFFICIAL SELECTION: Environmental Film Festival in the Nation’s Capital, D.C. (DCEFF) 2017
  • OFFICIAL SELECTION: Philip K. Dick Film Festival 2017, New York
  • OFFICIAL SELECTION: Nayri Niara Good Spirit Festival 2019, Australia
  • OFFICIAL PRESELECTION: New Zealand International Film Awards 2017
  • First public screening personally hosted by George R. R. Martin (Game of Thrones) in Santa Fe 2016
  • SPECIAL EVENT TOUR: Breath of Fresh Air (BOFA) Film Festival 2017 – Tasmania
  • SPECIAL EVENT TOUR: Wildscreen Festival University Tour – United Kingdom 2018 (Bristol, Nottingham, Oxford, Imperial College, University College London & the Royal Zoological Society).
  • SPECIAL EVENT TOUR: Palace Cinemas, ExiMAX & CMAX – Australia 2018-19 (including special introductions from Neil Gaiman, the Office of the Chief Scientist, the Governor of Tasmania, the Queensland Museum, the WA Screen Academy, the Cave Divers Association of Australia and local researchers, educators and presenters).
  • SPECIAL EVENT: International Congress of Speleology 2017.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: American Museum of Natural History (NYC) 2018. Special public screening, co-hosted with the New York Entomological Society.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Dark MOFO Festival 2018, Museum of Old and New Art (MONA)
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Marakoopa screening series 2019. Supported by National Science Week.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Australian Speological Federation 2019. Including the launch of the Australian Cave Animal of the Year Program.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: From the Heart Film Festival 2019 (Kangaroo Island, presented with Richard Harris, joint Australian of the Year for the Thai Cave Rescue). Supported by National Science Week & the South Australian Film Corporation.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: International Congress of Arachnology 2019, Christchurch, New  Zealand.
  • SPECIAL PREVIEW: National Convention of Churchill Fellows 2019, Winston Churchill Memorial Trust (plus following regional screenings).
  • Global broadcast versions in collaboration with National Geographic Channel and ARTE
    • FINALIST & SPECIAL COMMENDATION (broadcast version): Television Documentary Translation Award, France 2018
    • OFFICIAL SELECTION (broadcast version): Wildlife Film Festival Rotterdam 2018

Associated materials:

16 Legs: Spider Love (behind-the-scenes short doco)

  • WINNER: 2x Awards – Gold Award Winner and Award of Distinction - Australian Cinematographers Society 2014 & 2015
  • WINNER: Accolade Global Film Competition Humanitarian Award 2016 – Award of Distinction
  • WINNER: 2x Awards of Excellence – Accolade Global Film Competition 2016 (Documentary Short, Natural History)
  • FINALIST: Banff Mountain Film Festival, Canada
  • FINALIST: Jackson Hole Wildlife Film Festival, USA (Marian Zunz Emerging Filmmaker Award)
  • FINALIST: CINE Golden Eagle Finalist 2016, 59th CINE Golden Eagle Awards, Washington DC
  • Frack Fest Multimedia Film Festival 2015, USA
  • FINALIST: New Zealand Mountain Film Festival 2015
  • OFFICIAL SELECTION: Breath of Fresh Air (BOFA) Film Festival 2015, Australia
  • INTERNATIONAL PITCH SELECTION: Sunny Side of the Doc 2014, France

SIXTEEN LEGS: Enter the Cave Exhibition

  • Special Event Tour: Australia 2014-17 (Hobart 2014, Naracoorte 2015, Ulverstone 2015-16, Launceston 2016, Kangaroo Island 2016, Sydney 2016-17 & Penrith 2017). Supported by the Australian Department of Education, Festivals Australia & the Tasmanian Community Fund. Being revived for regional QLD and WA in 2021-2022.
  • WINNER: Project of the Year 2016-17, Kangaroo Island, South Australia
  • SIGNATURE EVENT: Australasian Cave and Karst Management (ACKMA) Conference 2015
  • SIGNATURE EVENT: International Congress of Speleology 2017
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Jean Cocteau Cinema – Halloween Display 2016, Santa Fe, New Mexico, USA
  • SPECIAL EVENT: The Australian Science Festival, Australian Museum 2016, Sydney.
  • SPECIAL EVENT: SPIDERS ALIVE! Exhibition, Australian Museum 2016-17, Sydney
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Dark MOFO Ogoh display 2018, Museum of Old and New Art (MONA)
  • SPECIAL EVENT: Children’s Festival 2019, Tasmanian Museum & Art Gallery (TMAG)
  • SPECIAL PREVIEW: Australian Assoc. for Environmental Education (AAEE) Conference 2014

The Impact

We are passionate about helping people understand and appreciate the world around them, whether they are students, researchers or members of the wider community. There are so many untold stories in the natural world, and we also face a lot of challenges in ensuring the ongoing survival of these unusual species and places. People cannot value what they do not know about, and likewise people disengage from constant stories of doom and gloom if they cannot see the beauty, fascination and even humour behind these unusual stories. While this specific story is about an unusual ecosystem in Tasmania, has connections and importance that span the globe. But more than that, it shows us that every part of the planet has its own story. If this story inspires the next generation to look and learn about unknown things in their own backyards, the world will be a better place.

 

Risks & Challenges

The risk to this project is minimal, given that the film already exists in its theatrical and broadcast forms. So too do most of the extra materials that will be added to the physical discs. Aside from some minor editing and layout work, delivery of the film is mostly a process of mass production of what we already have in hand, which is why this is the major part of the target cost. The biggest risk is therefore one of delivery time rather than delivery itself.  While we aim to send the first discs out before Christmas, the world is currently subject to changing timelines due to Covid-19. It is possible that an outbreak or issue in the supply chain or delivery services may extend these project timelines. However, if we are successfully funded they will still go ahead.

Similar risks may apply to the creation and development of the online multimedia resource, but as a digital-only project, that will be less prone to physical disruption.

Bookend has been running logistically challenging projects for nearly fifteen years. Over the past seven years, we have not only managed conservation and education projects from Fiji to Antarctica, but we have also managed an intensive seven year documentary production schedule. From working in the difficult and dangerous environment of Australia's deepest caves through to delivering final prints of the film in a range of formats to a range of countries for cinema, television, film festival and exhibition screenings, we're definitely up to the challenge of adding DVD and Blu-Ray production to that list. :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be in a position to contribute financially to this project, but we would still like you to be involved. If you like the sound of what we're doing, or if you've already seen the film or any of our other projects, please help spread the word. The inhabitants of Tasmania's caves have been waiting for hundreds of millions of years - it's time their story reached the world!

 

REWARDS SUMMARY

 

STRETCH GOALS

As mentioned above, if we reach our goal quickly, the film's co-directors are promising to record a special online commentary on the film as the first stretch goal, with exclusive behind the scenes details on the trials and tribulations of seven years of production, warts and all. Additional stretch goals will be added if this target is reached.

UPDATE 7 DECEMBER: We've hit our target ahead of time, but a few more sales will really help us boost the design of the online educational archive, so - as threatened above - we're offering a BONUS filmmakers' commentary track with the warts & all behind-the-scenes goss on the enormous challenges of making of the film if we can hit our stretch goal at AUD$25k!!!! Jump into the dark underworld with us and add to the fun!

Short Summary
Hidden beneath the World Heritage mountains of Tasmania, giant prehistoric spiders the size of dinner plates seek kinky love in the dark... Neil Gaiman brings a real-world “Charlotte’s Web” into our world of rapid change. Through award-winning cinematography, SIXTEEN LEGS looks at the challenge, humour and science of capturing something never-before-filmed, against all the odds!
We are a group of biologists and educators working with some of the most unusual animals and in some of the most remote places on the planet. We've also provided opportunities for students working on positive environmental projects from Fiji to Antarctica. Over seven years, we produced SIXTEEN LEGS, a documentary about the life-cycle of giant prehistoric spiders still living in Australia's deepest caves. This project has received international acclaim and awards, and this has allowed us to educate and entertain people around the globe with the difficulties of underground life. Having produced versions of the film for cinema, television and exhibitions, we now wish to produce a Special Edition Blu-Ray and DVD set of this film that includes the full theatrical and main broadcast versions (including a special shorter version designed for younger audiences), as well as behind the scenes making of material. We also want to use the wealth of unused natural history footage, interviews with global experts, and additional popular culture material to produce a fun and fascinating online multimedia resource on caves, spiders, and the underground realm for schools and the public. We're inviting you to be a part of the next stages of this exciting project. Our resources are always stretched between our environmental and educational work, and your contributions will play a major role in taking SIXTEEN LEGS into the next big steps of its multi-legged journey.

While this specific story is about an unusual ecosystem in Tasmania, has connections and importance that span the globe. But more than that, it shows us that every part of the planet has its own story. If this story inspires the next generation to look and learn about unknown things in their own backyards, the world will be a better place.

 

Risks & Challenges
The risk to this project is minimal, given that the film already exists in its theatrical and broadcast forms. So too do most of the extra materials that will be added to the physical discs. Aside from some minor editing and layout work, delivery of the film is mostly a process of mass production of what we already have in hand, which is why this is the major part of the target cost. The biggest risk is therefore one of delivery time rather than delivery itself.  While we aim to send the first discs out before Christmas, the world is currently subject to changing timelines due to Covid-19. It is possible that an outbreak or issue in the supply chain or delivery services may extend these project timelines. However, if we are successfully funded they will still go ahead.
Similar risks may apply to the creation and development of the online multimedia resource, but as a digital-only project, that will be less prone to physical disruption.
Bookend has been running logistically challenging projects for nearly fifteen years. Over the past seven years, we have not only managed conservation and education projects from Fiji to Antarctica, but we have also managed an intensive seven year documentary production schedule. From working in the difficult and dangerous environment of Australia's deepest caves through to delivering final prints of the film in a range of formats to a range of countries for cinema, television, film festival and exhibition screenings, we're definitely up to the challenge of adding DVD and Blu-Ray production to that list. :)

 

Other Ways You Can Help
You might not be in a position to contribute financially to this project, but we would still like you to be involved. If you like the sound of what we're doing, or if you've already seen the film or any of our other projects, please help spread the word. The inhabitants of Tasmania's caves have been waiting for hundreds of millions of years - it's time their story reached the world!

 
REWARDS SUMMARY














 
STRETCH GOALS
As mentioned above, if we reach our goal quickly, the film's co-directors are promising to record a special online commentary on the film as the first stretch goal, with exclusive behind the scenes details on the trials and tribulations of seven years of production, warts and all. Additional stretch goals will be added if this target is reached.
UPDATE 7 DECEMBER: We've hit our target ahead of time, but a few more sales will really help us boost the design of the online educational archive, so - as threatened above - we're offering a BONUS filmmakers' commentary track with the warts & all behind-the-scenes goss on the enormous challenges of making of the film if we can hit our stretch goal at AUD$25k!!!! Jump into the dark underworld with us and add to the fun!

story:
The COVID-19 pandemic has hit the entire globe in the worst way ever with repercussions that are continually being felt each and every day. Not only has it led most of us to isolation and changed the way we used to carry out our day to day activities, but in a move to follow the guidelines laid out, businesses have suffered and have had to lay off employees, send them on paid leave, go through cut backs on certain services, or even kept workers on but without any pay in the meantime.

This loss of income has pushed some people over the edge resulting into instances such as stress and depression, homelessness, conflicts within homes and amongst friends, and crime as we all adjust to this new normal of staying at home to stay safe, harsh economic times, unemployment and a disease that is running unchecked. With little to no hope for the future as far as most people are concerned and a prevailing culture of being used to doing manual, physical jobs that in most cases cannot be continued at home, many people’s lives have been drastically changed with mental health cases being on the rise.

Hello, my name is Cameron Hicks and I am a screenwriter, director, and film student at San Francisco State University. I am here to seek your financial support, which will help me create A Figment of My Exaggeration - a non-fiction, comedy documentary short film that will explore the implications that the pandemic has on mental health using humor and help people gain a better understanding of mental health within our environment. The documentary will highlight a group of fictional characters discussing problems of 2020 including the COVID-19 pandemic, relationship struggles, making money, depression, and conspiracy theories.

The characters involved will be Kayla who is using the pandemic to make money through sponsors from TikTok and Instagram, Ashley and Sam who are a couple that moved in together during the pandemic, KC who’s dealing with depression because of Covid, Shayla who’s working overtime to make money but she’s exhausted and becoming hungry, and Kevin who’s a conspiracy theorist. What’s more, the film will be highlighted by two non-profit organizations Art with Impact and Dakar Foundation that are both foundations which use art to highlight social justice and mental health. 

Please support me in making this short film a reality and help raise the awareness of mental health through humor. Thank you again from the bottom of my heart for your support and please remember that every donation helps no matter how big or how small. Together we can make a difference during these uncertain times. I wish you all good health and stay safe.

story:
Synopsis:

In the world of the Ottoman Sultans, a poor child from Jerusalem makes an unimaginable desert journey to Cairo and back to save his mother and siblings from a rapacious aristocrat.

He has nine days…

Shalom / Salaam / Hello and Peace, Dear Friends!

With optimism and joy, we want to welcome you to the world of Ariel, a story that has roots and versions throughout many countries in the Middle East.  This is a tale of wonder and adventure, embracing unique communities woven together to create the tapestry of the diverse culture in the time of the Sultans.

Sephardi/Mizrachi Jewry is an ancient civilization little-known in the west.  But at the dawn of the 20th century the most Jewish city in the world wasn’t New York or Vilna - It was Baghdad, with a 40% Jewish population!  Ariel brings the rich tradition of Middle-Eastern/North African Jewry to life, through this dynamic story of family, love and resilience.

Help us raise some of the money needed to fund the animation phase of our production and tell this story to a new audience!

I’m Conor MacFinn and I’m the Director and Creative Lead on this project for CGMuse. 

I’ve been a Director, Screenwriter, Animator and Chief Bottle Washer for our five previous award-winning shorts, as well as animated apps.  I’ve also done animation for a major NY museum, iTune apps showcased at SIGGRAPH, other films, and children’s media from major outlets. I was honored to be a recipient of the New York State Arts Council on the Arts Arts Alive grant for the initial storyboarding of this film.  On Ariel, I’m lucky to work with a talented team of dedicated artists from around the world, including our Creative Producer Clare Kohavi, Lighting Artist Marcello Ruvollo, 3D Artist Donald Hebel and Storyboard Intern Erica Murphy.

CGMuse was created to bring human stories to the world through animation. 

Since 2013, our team of artists has crafted tales in a variety of animated mediums, and we’re grateful for the honors and awards given to our work. 

Our animated story apps have twice been chosen to showcase at SIGGRAPH; Our five animated shorts and two of our animated advertisements have won prizes, nominations and screenings at forty international festivals and been distributed through AOL and Hulu on Tribal TV.  Most meaningfully for us, we were invited to screen three of our movies at Mní Wičhóni Nakíčižiŋ Owáyawa (Defenders of the Sacred Water School) at The Water Protector's Camp in Standing Rock, North Dakota.

We’re excited to move forward with a growing team of international artists from a wide variety of cultures, telling stories about people’s lives from our backyard and around the world.

The Impact

Ariel is based on a story that I loved as a child, full of magic and majesty.  Like most kids, I identified with the vulnerable but determined child hero whose character and bravery triumph over poverty and dishonesty.  Our version expands the story, including the family that give Ari his support and strength, Ari’s mother Yasmina and his three siblings, and their wise friends, like the Tuareg scholar, Ismail.  This dynamic story of family, love and resilience is one that children and adults everywhere can identify with and experience together on different levels.

Experts and Leaders from the Mizrachi / Sephardi Community

The story of Ariel has deep roots in the Middle Eastern/North African Jewish community. We have been fortunate to have the advice and support of Rav Ely Allen, former Rabbi of Sharei Orah, the Sephardic Congregation of Teaneck, NJ, and The American Sephardi Federation in sharing the story with others.

 

What We Need & What You Get:

Your helping funds will go towards:

  • Animating the film!

Our characters, assets and environments are ready to go!  But animation is a labor-intensive, detailed process - We need your help to put them all together and bring this world to life!

We Thank You with Exclusive Gifts, including:

  • Early download of the film before it's released
  • Access to our “backers only” blog, which follows our production process behind the scene and shares fun insights into Sephardi/Mizrachi culture.
  • Limited Edition items, including:
    • Posters signed by the director and team
    • Beautiful Ariel t-shirts
    • A special 3D Ariel sculpture only available during the campaign

Risks & Challenges

Animation is an incredibly laborious, iterative process combining a high level of artistry with technical expertise.  It's hard to produce high quality animation on time and on budget.  This is our biggest project yet!  Luckily, our team at CGMuse has created a strong track record over the years with five films, and our flexible pipeline allows us to meet the toughest deadlines.

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you agree with us that experiencing other cultures and world views is important to children and grownups – if you love magic and adventure – then, in addition to donating,

please

  • Like us on Facebook
  • Follow us on Instagram and Twitter
  • Please ask all you friends to do the same!

The more people who like, follow and donate, the better off we are!  

 

Toda raba / Shukran / Grasyas / Thanks!

 

BIOS OF THE TEAM


 

Conor MacFinn (animator, writer, director) is an American/ Canadian filmmaker, whose animated shorts have been distributed by Tribal TV on Hulu, AOL On, Roku and Amazon and have won awards, been nominated and screened at over 40 festivals internationally. His animated storytelling mobile media was twice selected for SIGGRAPH’s Appy Hour showcase of creativity and innovation, and distributed through iTunes. Other 3D character animation credits include The Museum of the Dog in New York City, Pearson and Behrman House. A 2019 New York State Council on the Arts Arts Alive grantee to support the storyboarding and development of Ariel, he also received a 2020 Artist’s Support Fund grant from The Arts Council of Rockland.


Conor was honored that his trilogy of shorts inspired by his Native heritage was invited to show at Mní Wičhóni Nakíčižiŋ Owáyawa (Defenders of the Sacred Water School) at The Water Protector's Camp in Standing Rock, North Dakota.


Currently, Conor is excited to draw inspiration from other parts of his family’s inheritance, developing an animated series for families, Ariel. This story of a Middle Eastern Jewish boy and his widowed mother fighting to save their family and their trade routes, it is set against the diverse ethnic and cultural tapestry of the 19th century Ottoman Empire.

 

Clare Kohavi’s (writer, creative producer) soup-to-nuts production involvement in five 3d animated shorts, two PSAs and two story-telling mobile apps has contributed to awards, nominations and screenings in 40+ plus international festivals; two selections for SIGGRAPH’s showcase for innovative mobile media, Appy Hour; and distribution by Tribal TV on Hulu, Amazon and AOL On.  She is particularly proud of the honor of a special invitation to screen her films at Mní Wičhóni Nakíčižiŋ Owáyawa (Defenders of the Sacred Water School) at The Water Protector's Camp in Standing Rock, North Dakota.

Through her projects, Clare seeks to share the richness of communities of which she is a part, and tell traditional tales in innovative ways.  Ariel, an animated series for families now in development, reveals the resilience and daring of a quick-witted young widow and her savvy “tween” son as they battle to rescue their family’s fortunes in the tumultuous 19th Century empire of the Ottoman Turks.

 

Marcello Ruvolo (lookdev & lighting artist) has fun creating his own projects - But the most satisfying thing to him is to be part of a team! He loves that everyone has a specific role, and that when you put together the efforts of people that work in harmony, the final result is amazing!

Marcello’s always loved things related to good graphics and visuals.  As a kid, he would start games from the beginning again and again just to re-watch the cinematics trailers. He started drawing and became passionate about that. When he grew up he studied digital arts, and when he discovered that animation and VFX schools existed, he knew that his true passion could be pursued for real.

After graduating from the Academy of Fine Arts in Catania, Marcello moved to Rome to study Animation and VFX at RUFA (Rome University of Fine Arts).  And after getting a grasp of every aspect of the CG work, he pursued the one that allowed him to communicate emotions to people using colors and lights, which make a huge difference in telling a story.

Marcello takes inspiration from live action and animated films and some video games, all visual fields that require the talents of a team working in harmony.  To light the shots of Ariel he’s taken references and inspirations from TV and movie lighting and 19th Century artwork that was researched for Ariel’s period details.

 

Donald Hebel (3D artist) hails from Queens, NY. He creates 3D art and animations for CGMuse and Goodnight Games, teaches animation classes on line and also works as an IT technician. Donald loves playing video games, hanging out with his dog, Rocky, and watching Dragon Ball Z and Godzilla movies.

 

Erica Murphy (story artist) is influenced by both animation and comic books, and her work reflects her love of character and storytelling.  She strives to express the life-like spirit of a character in a story. Her illustrations and concept work are informed by everything from correct attire for a character to the setting they live in.  As the artist explains, “Everyone should get the chance to see themselves within art.”

Erica is excited to part of Ariel as storyboard artist intern.  She believes that everyone will enjoy and be captivated by this whimsical tale. 

 

Rabbi Ely Allen (cultural advisor), has roots deep in the Middle Eastern/North African Jewish Community. Both of his parents are from Cairo, Egypt, a Jewish community which dates back a thousand years before the Common Era, and his family also traces to Iraq, Syria and Tunisia. Rav Allen’s parents were forced to flee Egypt in the 1960’s, escaping government antisemitism, arrest of Jews and seizure of Jewish assets.  They met in the United States.  Rav Ely  grew up steeped in Sephardi / Mizrachi culture, with a father who spoke many different Arabic dialects, while also learning the dominant European Jewish culture of his American surroundings.  After earning a BA in Psychology at Fairleigh Dickinson University, he received Smicha (Rabbinic ordination) from Yeshiva University.

Before moving to Israel, Rav Ely was Director of Northern Jersey Hillels and a faculty member at Yeshiva University focusing on Sephardic studies. He is the Founder of the Jewish Outreach Network, which has hosted thousands of people, and served as the Rabbi of Sharei Orah, the Sephardic Congregation of Teaneck, NJ. Rav Allen currently lives with his wife and family in Ramat Beit Shemesh. In addition to teaching at three different institutions where his work includes educating people about Sephardic culture and tradition, he also spends time as an investment manager and business consultant.

story:
Synopsis: 

A group of soldiers are lost behind enemy lines in the Italian wilderness. Pursued by an axis brigade, they fight to make it back to safety and go back home.

We need your help to make WWII movie making history. Claim a perk and join our team!

The Impact

Over 500,000 Hispanic Americans served in the U.S. Armed Forces during World War II

  • This will be the first feature film to focus on latino soldiers in WW2
  • We have started shooting and will complete the film. Six of our previous films have all been released.
  • We will provide daily updates on all our progress.

What We Need & What You Get

In order to bring this film to light we need community support and teamwork.

  • The funding we gather will be used to directly help with production costs: sound and music, actor and crew wages, self distribution costs. 
  • We have many unique perks including memorabilia, autographs, screen credits and more!
  • If we don't reach our goal, we'll still pursue finishing the project.

Risks & Challenges

There are many risks in crowdfunding, especially in the film community.

  • "What if the movie never gets finished?" - We've released six feature films so far, two of which were crowdfunded. Those projects are all available on multiple streaming sites and dvd.
  • "How long will it take before i get my perks?"- It takes about a full year to complete and release a feature film. However, the more post production funding we gather, the more it'll help with hiring top talent to complete tasks efficiently.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people can't contribute right now, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Tell your friends, family, and even strangers about our project.
  • Share on social media, links, photos, videos, etc!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
SYNOPSIS: 4 TEENS OFF TO UNIVERSITY HAVE TO ESCAPE FROM A DERANGED TRUCK DRIVER WITH A TORTURE CHAMBER IN THE BACK OF HIS MURDER BUS.

We have already filmed this feature, It's been edited and on the final stages as we shipped our movie from Las Vegas up to Canada with a two time Leo award winning sound engineer Aaron Tchir. We have a long list of deliverables to deliver to High Octane Pictures for our world wide distribution deal! Till this point Writer, Director Evan Allen and Producer Brandon Petersen have funded every step of the way to get us this far. Evan Allen is a Writer, Producer, Director, Editor, Props Master, Set Decorator and has even done film Security and started out as a Production assistant in Vancouver B.C. Canada. He's also owned a film school at one point.  He has resided in Las Vegas since 2008. Evan Allen, Brandon Petersen and Bradley Rumery started Cybrid Entertainment in Las Vegas when the world closed down in early 2020. 


Writer, Director, Producer Evan Allen. Click on any pic to link to their IMDB.

 

We need to raise at least $5000.00 to cover the remaining post production costs. Anything more than that will go to help with festival entries. Shockfest already contacted us to view the film and can't wait to see it. The Mother Trucker would love to hit up some conventions as well as it won't be long before Mark Baca's "Mother Trucker" character is a household name when this movie becomes a cult classic. High Octane Pictures has been with us since the early days as they stalked our IMDB and loved what they were seeing and can't wait to distribute our film. We have had other offers as well! We have come up with some incredible perks and even some NFT's for you all.  We may add more as we go as go. We can't wait to bring you all on our next movies as well. 

We may be a low budget independent film but we sure didn't shoot it like one. Top tier casting by Evan and Michael Forsch led to some of the best acting performances we have seen on set in a long time. We shot on the Red Epic W. with award winning D.O.P./2nd Unit Director/Camera Opp - Dustin Robison from Quantum Arc Media. Edited by the incredible Hank Tracy. Brenda Occhipinti came on board and delivered us amazing make up and effects. 

 

Challenges were many. Just prior to shooting this film, the Writer and Director had to shut down a beloved film camp for youth. He had to walk away from the land, the business and couldn't even sell due to the pandemic. He handed the keys back to the previous owner at a total loss  and walk away with empty pockets after five years of hard work. Devastated but not deterred Evan started writing "6 Wheels From Hell!" After meeting up with Mark Anthony Baca at a karaoke bar in Vegas called Dino's, he contacted Dustin at Quantum Arc. The script was finalized a day before camera and the rest is history. Bradley introduced Brandon to Evan, who came on half way through to help fund us to this point, and Cybrid Entertainment was born.

Considering this was all shot in the early day of the Pandemic we know a lot of people are struggling and money is hard to go by. We are all feeling that struggle. Your help means the world to us over at Cybrid Entertainment. Times are tough but you can still help. If you can't get a perk then please share the hell outta this campaign for us. We will have so many more movies coming down the Indiegogo pipeline once the world see's "6 Wheels from Hell!" This is just the beginning and we want you all to come on this incredible ride with us. Thank You!
story_txt:
SYNOPSIS: 4 TEENS OFF TO UNIVERSITY HAVE TO ESCAPE FROM A DERANGED TRUCK DRIVER WITH A TORTURE CHAMBER IN THE BACK OF HIS MURDER BUS.We have already filmed this feature, It's been edited and on the final stages as we shipped our movie from Las Vegas up to Canada with a two time Leo award winning sound engineer Aaron Tchir. We have a long list of deliverables to deliver to High Octane Pictures for our world wide distribution deal! Till this point Writer, Director Evan Allen and Producer Brandon Petersen have funded every step of the way to get us this far. Evan Allen is a Writer, Producer, Director, Editor, Props Master, Set Decorator and has even done film Security and started out as a Production assistant in Vancouver B.C. Canada. He's also owned a film school at one point.  He has resided in Las Vegas since 2008. Evan Allen, Brandon Petersen and Bradley Rumery started Cybrid Entertainment in Las Vegas when the world closed down in early 2020. 
Writer, Director, Producer Evan Allen. Click on any pic to link to their IMDB.

story:
The lyric video you see above is the song "The Only" which features prominently in the film. 

TURN UP THE NIGHT to be directed by Melodie Roehrig (FANG, Bottom Feeders) and is written by Rick Masi (On the Level, I Saw Red, & the award winning Tales of Darkened Light). 

INTRO (Our Story)
Hi. I’m Rick Masi - I’m the writer and Executive Producer of the 80’s hair band film, Turn Up the Night.  The year is 1992, it’s February - I am 5 years old, sitting on the floor of my parents living room in Buffalo, NY - my older brother is watching MTV - and this was when "Music Television" actually played music videos - and on our TV is the music video for “November Rain” by Guns N’ Roses. A 9 minute epic of a song.. and 9 minute spectacle of a music video. And even at 5 years old - I realized this was the coolest thing I’d ever seen. This blew the doors open for me and I took a deep dive into all of the classic bands of the 80’s hard rock and hair metal genre. Motley Crue, Bon Jovi, Winger, Ratt, Dokken, Winger, Skid Row, L.A. Guns, and the list goes on..

Years later, it would inspire the story which is "Turn Up the Night" - a story about the rise and falls of an 80's hard rock / "hair band" named Boy Elroy.

OUR ASK (1st Verse)
The reason we’re making this campaign is because we are *this* close to making this film and dream a reality - but the honest and humble truth is - we need some help. WE NEED YOUR HELP.

And I’m sure you have many questions. Your first impression is "Wow, that's a big ask. How do I know if it’s worth it? Where does all of the money go to - I don’t want to be swindled by somebody I don’t know. What do I get out of the deal?"..

Well, We're going to try and answer all those questions for you.

WHAT IS IT ABOUT? (2nd Verse)
So, first question - what is "Turn Up the Night" and what is it about? As I mentioned earlier - it is a film about the rise and fall of (fictional) 80’s hard rock band, Boy Elroy. It’s a band we created for the film - (think along the lines of Bon Jovi, Motley Crue, LA Guns, etc). But how is this film different than what’s out there - "I’ve seen "Spinal Tap" and I’ve seen "The Dirt", how is this different?". Well, to start - we have a completely original soundtrack of “new” 80’s music  performed by virtuosos in their fields. In fact, in conjunction with the release of this campaign, we’ve released a lyric and concept video on our Facebook page of one of the original songs from the film called “The Only”.  

I don’t know about you - but I think the song is pretty rad. But you’re probably wondering - why tell a story like this? Because at it’s core - what it’s about is a story of individuality.. and to bring everything full circle, it’s a story about finding your purpose. You see there’s this element of the story we discuss a concept called a “golden prison”. It’s when you’ve gotten everything you’ve ever wanted - but you’re shackled by it. We also explore the striping of one’s identity by the big corporate music machine… when people become products. But by the end of this movie we want people to feel empowered that they have some control over their lives.

WHAT & WHERE YOUR MONEY GOES TO (Chorus)
So the biggest elephant in the room - is where does the money go to! Well, we came fully prepared for that question - and I brought some pictures to back me up.

So we’ve estimated that to pull this off in the most ideal and comfortable fashion would be to have a budget of approximately $10,000. To explain the breakdown.

Right off the Bat; Over half of that proposed budget is expected to be paid to our Crew over the course of a 10-12 day period. These are people like our directors of photography, our crew, our sound people, set managers, production assistants, and our director. These are extremely hard working people, who are eager to get back into a COVID-free and safe filming environment. They all deserve to be paid for their expertise and the time they spend for their hard work. 2020 was tough for a lot of people - but we've got a deeply resilient bunch of people involved in this project. Every single one of them has the drive to make it happen come hell or high water. 

Next is our Cast. We have a close tight-nit group of talented actors who have been preparing to take on this film for approximately 2 years. We want to pay them adequate daily rates - again, hard working people who need to make a living.

Also, our Musicians - with whom we wouldn’t be able to do any of this without. They are some of the true behind the scenes heroes of the film. With a film revolving entirely around music - they will always be at the core of this film. They deserve to be paid. 

 

Craft Services - with all of those long days; people need to eat. Additionally with new COVID guidelines - we want to have a Covid safe set - and that requires some additional sanitary items, like sanitizer, wipes, and additional masks.  We take the pandemic seriously, and want our team feeling safe. 


Next we have Rentals - some authentic looking locations like studios or office buildings require an hourly rate. We want to be able to have access to the most realistic and authentic sets.

Here’s a very important one - Wigs and Wardrobe - this is what keeps you invested in the movie. You want to see a movie about the 80’s that looks like it was made in the 80’s. We can’t skimp on wigs and wardrobe - they are characters in and of themselves.

And lastly, there are smaller Miscellaneous expenses we will need to take care of; things like props, marketing, rentals or supplies for the cast and crew.

OUR ASK AND WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU (Outro, repeats until end)
So again, what are we asking - we are asking that you consider donating to our film. And I get it - I am very much aware of what kind of an “ask” that is. These times have been weird to say the least. We understand the value of your hard earned money. That is why every tier of donation comes with a specific perk - and they range from all shapes and sizes. To a personalized shout out on Facebook to our almost 20,000 thousand followers - as well as your name in the credits - or even the eventual opportunity to get a digital download of the soundtrack, cd version of the soundtrack - or even a signed BluRay of the film.

So to close, I want to simply ask that you please consider donating to make this dream a reality. And if it is any consolation to our group and it’s character it’s this. For years I’ve been saying - if you’re passionate, if you’re earnest, and if you’re willing to do the work - people will believe in you… and the rest will be history.

Thank you for our time, please check us out on Facebook at  https://www.facebook.com/TUTNMovie and join our almost 20,000 followers for constant updates and “metal meme” mondays!

We thank you graciously for your time and support. 

Kind Regards, 

Rick Masi
Writer/ Executive Producer - "Turn Up the Night"
