story:
About The Project

Hi, my name is Nick Acosta. I am an avid horror fan, a YouTube content creator, and a filmmaker. I have been watching and talking about movies throughout my entire life. I became a fan of the horror genre when I was 6 years old and have always been fascinated with storytelling and allegories based on real life tragedy and events. It’s because of my own personal experience with almost losing my brother to a drug overdose in the year 2017, that I decided to write this film. 

Addict tells the story of Daniel, a recently sober drug addict who falls back into a relapse and is stalked by a terrifying and disturbing entity. 

Your contribution will help me have the creative freedom to tell the story that I have been planning for over the last 4 years. 

 

How You Can Help

I am hoping to raise $4,000 for the project through this campaign. These contributions will go towards the equipment, the talent in front of and behind the camera, location expenses, travel expenses for shooting, catering for the crew during production, and festival submission fees. Attached below is a chart on how the funds will be divided up for production. See chart below.

The best thing about this campaign are the different perks that are offered with your contribution. You can see the different perks of this campaign on the right hand side of this page. Your contribution, no matter how big or how small, will help me make the best film possible for you. Thank you so much for your support!

 

The Impact

Addict is a film that was written about the horrors I faced after almost losing my brother to drug addiction. The damage that this addiction caused for my family and others. You will be supporting a young filmmaker who is working hard to become a professional in the industry. This story is a reflection of the real life horrors that we face in our everyday lives with our own addictions and personal adversities.

 

Risks and Challenges

Filmmaking is not easy and can get expensive. As a young filmmaker, I need all the help that I can get with making an ambitious project like this. Whether you are able to donate/contribute to this campaign or simply share this campaign with friends and family, you are helping me get closer to making this dream a reality. I have been in the pre-production stage for this project over the last 4 months and I am planning to begin shooting in the early months of 2022. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, do not worry. You can still help this project by letting people know about this campaign. Please feel free to share this project with friends and family. Thank you for checking out this campaign!

 

For questions or accommodations please contact me via email at nickacosta88@gmail.com

story:
13 days left of campaign-

Here's a peek at the print! Love it and this horror short WILL get made!

Social media is getting worse every day when you're trying to to spread the word and it has become a total pay to reach your audiences service, which makes it even harder to let you all know about fun projects like this. It's a lot of dedicated time and money, lots of costs involved and the work put into sets, lighting, sound, scoring, shooting and more.  So every bit of your support helps to make this project bigger and better. I love this stuff and appreciate you Fiends that want to see me be a kickass slasher! 

 

13th: Awakening

Hello my fellow Fiends!

I've been working hard on putting this project together for some time and I hope you will want to be a part of helping to bring this film to life!

Did you see the 13 second teaser I posted and are you a fan of Friday The 13th?

That 13 seconds was actually a lot of work. And making a fan film, short or hopeful feature length is in the works and I would love your support to make it happen.

Why "13th: Awakening" ?

There have been 12 Friday The 13th movies made, and it's been well over a decade since the last! It's time to awaken Jason for the 13th time! This tale is about revenge, the conjuring of Jason's spirit as well as his mask and machete to lend a girl sick of being abused, the tools and the power to seek vengeance.  It's going to be a killer good time!

 

Making it happen with your support!

We want to make it awesome for you to enjoy! Making a film is no easy task and it's not cheap. The crew and I are looking for support from you to help with the films budget to pay for things like; lighting, generators, hard drives, media storage etc. As well as other camera gear, rentals and supplies for effects and so much more.

The more we raise, the more blood, kills and thrills we can provide for your creepy little hearts. The goal amount set will cover our basic production costs, but surpassing this goal means more flexibility to bring you more horror and more perks! 

 

What YOUR support means to us

Quite simply... your help means everything!

Are you a fan of Friday The 13th?

Do you love campy horror flicks?

Would you like to see the spirit of Jason live on and kick some more ass?

Yeah so do I, so let's do this and make something killer together!

 

 

UPDATE -30 days to support a fun film! We have until OCTOBER 13th!!!

Plus new goodies to give to some of you backers supporting $100 or more will get some LIQUID DEATH goodies!

Thanks for the support =) Now let's kill it!

*USA Residents Only due to shipping costs.

 

All Challenge, No Risk

Making films is always a challenge and it always comes down to budget and time.

There's no risk to our project other than the budget determining how much we can give to the production value and how long we can make it, whether it's a short or feature length.

Let's make something awesome! Are you in?

 

How You Can Help Even MORE!

Thanks for helping to support this project and we'd love for you to help SPREAD THE WORD!

Share the link! Tell your friends and family that love horror and Friday The 13th to help make something awesome even more awesome by getting more involved and becoming a part of something killer!

SHARE THIS LINK -- https://igg.me/at/13th

 

FOLLOW ME

I can't wait to share more with you Fiends and keep you updated on this project!

http://www.instagram.com/vamp

http://www.instagram.com/vamp

story:
SYNOPSIS

“We Still Here” introduces the incredible youth of Comerío, Puerto Rico navigating the aftermath of Hurricane Maria, a disaster that brought an unprecedented level of devastation to an island already in economic and political crisis. In the lush mountains of Comerío, 24-year-old Mariangelie Ortiz leads a group of young residents who never thought they would become the leaders of their community, nonetheless find themselves traveling to Washington D.C. to protest in the halls of Congress and in front of FEMA. Follow them in this coming of age story to find their power and begin creating a sustainable future for themselves and their community.

 

ABOUT THE DIRECTOR

Eli Jacobs-Fantauzzi is an internationally-recognized and award-winning filmmaker. He is the founder of FistUp.TV, a media platform uplifting and telling stories from underrepresented communities across the world. His work has circulated through National Broadcast: Free Speech TV, Teaching Channel, and PBS. Online he has created content for Remezcla, OkayAfrica, TIDAL, and VIBE. Spike Lee is one of the reasons Eli became a filmmaker, and in 2019 he hired Eli to work on set with him as a photographer for "She's Gotta Have It Too." Eli is the co-founder of Defend Puerto Rico, a multimedia project designed to document and celebrate Puerto Rican creativity, resilience, and resistance. He is currently touring the world with his new film Bakosó: Afrobeats of Cuba and curating his 11th Annual Fist Up Film Festival. His dedication to his craft is deeply connected to his commitment to social justice and the belief in the transformative power of film.

WHAT WE STILL NEED

We are thankful for the help of our community and volunteers, who have gotten us this far. Right now, we are asking for support to finish the film at the level of quality this remarkable story deserves. I am honored to receive a grant from the East Bay Fund for Artists at the East Bay Community Foundation. They will be matching all funds up to $5K.

All funds will go to the following services:
Editing 
Color grading and correction
Graphic design
Music composition
Securing music rights
Sound effects and sound mix
Marketing and film festival expenses
Promotion
 

THE TIME IS NOW!

We have a tight timeline and need to raise money to bring this film to life! We believe in the power of community and hope it can be harnessed now to support us with the production. 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP
We appreciate every dollar, but if you are unable to make a financial contribution right now, please share this campaign with others:

 

Follow Eli on Instagram (@fistuptv) and on Facebook! Help spread the word

Bring Eli to your school or organization for a preview screening and filmmaker-led workshop or discussion. You can contact Eli at eli@fistup.tv for details.

Credits On Trailer:

Produced and Directed by: Eli Jacobs-Fantauzzi, Additional producing by: Kahlil Jacobs-Fantauzzi, Mikey Cordero, Frances Medina; Camera by: Paul Sepulveda, Eli Jacobs-Fantauzzi; Additional Footage: Juan Cruz, Mikey Cordero, Camille Alexandra, Javi Colón; Edited by: Mikey Cordero; Writing by: Ana Castillo Muñoz, Mariangelie Ortiz; Drone work by: Eli Jacobs-Fantauzzi, Paul Sepulveda, Javi Colón, Juan Cruz, Jerriel “Yeyo” Cátala Lopez, Jossiel Maldonado Diaz; Music by: El Individuo; Made Possible with the support from: Mensajeros De Paloma, La Maraña, Another Golf Is Possible, Sol Collective, Working Films; Presented by: Clenched Fist Productions, Defend Puerto Rico, FistUpTv

story:
There you found me is a powerful story of how a single prayer brought two men together in a way they never thought possible.

Meet Sheldon. He was a beautiful soul, my best friend and someone I loved more than words can express. He was a brother. A guide. An Influencer. An Encourager. He loved God so very much and his love and connection for people was masterful. He touched everyone who ever came into his life and his voice was like butter. You could listen to the man sing for hours on stage. Sheldon was deeply loved by all who met him. It was impossible not to love him instantly.

In 2007, I met him at the Savannah Theatre for the first time. And from then, I didn't realize how much we needed each other.

 

Writing powerful stories and evoking truthful and raw emotion has been at the very core of my creativity since I can remember.

My name is Jonathan Brent Burgard and I have been a creative for over 20 years. I am the writer and producer of There You Found Me and from performing on stage and film to producing live shows, it has been my dream to write and produce my very first film. This is an endeavor I never thought possible and one I never thought I could pull off. But then I wrote it and I began to realize how hungry the hearts and minds of people are for a story that defies the status quo and reinvents love in a way we haven't seen in a long time.

I am honored to be partnering with Gravitywell Films, a Lancaster, PA based production company that specializes in narrative films and has a depth of artistry that is truly rare. They are tackling the most stringent requirements and conditions to make this film a beautiful and powerful piece of cinema to remember.

Your contribution is more vital than you know and we are counting on you.

This is not a documentary. This is a short film.

From the start, I always pictured this film on location. With the best cast & crew, the best locations, the best lights, the best equipment, and the best sound. And to honor a friendship like ours, Sheldon deserved to have this done the right way. With that being said, your part in contributing plays an integral role in the creation of this film. Being on location in Savannah, GA and Philadelphia, PA where this story took place is by far one of the biggest elements to getting this right.

 

 

Every good film requires more than just talent. It requires an excellent budget.

First, it is essential to note, I, Jonathan Burgard, will not be receiving or taking any compensation from this film other than what happens after the film is made. I will only reimburse myself for funds I've already paid in order to lock down certain necessities like travel and lodging. The focus will remain the story and I will make sure that my cast and crew are compensated for their tireless efforts on this film.

 

Below is the exact breakdown of where every single penny contributed will go in order to make this film a reality.

Travel & Lodging ~ $2,770

  • RV Rental for 5 Nights - $1,300 (Cast and Crew will travel from PA to GA)
  • Travel Fuel - $300
  • Travel Reimbursement for Crew - $300
  • AirBnB for Crew - $870

GA Locations ~ $1,970

  • Savannah Theater - $945 (5 Hours)

 

  • Origin Coffee Bar - $400 (2 Hours)

  • Deli/Bakery - $200 (2 Hours)
  • Apartment - $425 (4 Hours)

Production Staff & Crew ~ $7,160

  • Sasha Bilik, Director - $1000 ($500/day @ 2 days)
  • George Winchell, Director of Photography - $1500 ($750/day @ 2 days)
  • Kiri Allen, Producer, Production Design - $400
  • Alissa Hawk Madera, Producer, Script Supervisor - $400
  • Gaffer, Day 1: 1 Gaffer - $300 ($300/day @ 1 day)
  • Gaffer, Day 2: 2 Gaffers - $600 ($300/day @ 1 day)
  • Grip: Day 1 & 2, 2 Grips - $1200 ($300/day @ 2 days)
  • 1st AC: Day 1 & 2, (1) 1st AC - $600 ($300/day @ 2 days)
  • 2nd AC: Day 1 & 2, (1) 2nd AC - $200 ($100/day @ 2 days)
  • Sound: Day 1 & 2, 1 Location Sound Mixer - $700 ($350/day @ 2 days)
  • Hair & Makeup - $260 ($130/Day @ 2 days)

Cast ~ $1,200

  • Wes Wilson as Sheldon Pinckney - $800 ($400/Day @ 2 days,)
  • Anna Bilik as Claire - $300 ($150/Half Day @ 2 half days)
  • The Lover - $100 (3 hours - not yet cast)

Props ~ $100

  • $100

Crafty ~ $300

  • Snacks, water, coffee - $100
  • Lunch on Day 1 & 2 of filming - $200

COVID Precautions ~ $500

  • Rapid Testing - $410
  • Masks - $50
  • Hand sanitizer - $40

Insurance ~ $603

  • Overall (one time payment) - $603
    • $1,000,000 General Liability/$2,000,000 Aggregate
    • Medical, dental, location, property insurance

Production Total

  • Savannah, GA - $14,603
  • Philadelphia, PA - $2,397
  • Post Production - $4,000 (Editing, Sound, Color Grading)
  • Film Score - $3,000 (Music Production)
  • Festival Entries & Marketing - $1,000
  • Total Budget - $25,000

 

 

I felt called to write a film that, for just a moment, reminds us of why human connection and to love and be loved by someone is so vital to the human spirit.

With the unprecedented times we've encountered over the last few years, the separation from affection, the distance and loss of our loved ones, the aching to have human connection, is exactly why I needed to write a film with such robust and raw emotion.

We have been rocked as a globe with division. It can, at times, feel like loving someone different  has sadly become an after thought. Whether they are like you or not, love is universal and this film is the bridge from the dense fog of brokenness and uncertainty to the acceptance and compassion that love brings. Moving us as people and challenging us to be better at just loving others.

“If you don't take risks, you'll have a wasted soul.”
― Drew Barrymore

Our goal is extremely ambitious. Our film schedule is zealous. In our limited time frame risks always pose a threat. Equipment can break. Technology can crash. Batteries can die. Actors and crew can get hurt or sick. And no matter how uncompromising we are in our preparation, there are a number of things that can go wrong. And with an extremely tight time frame, we will make mistakes and it is inevitable that problems will arise. We take measures to mitigate, measures to limit...

And, it doesn't have to define the project.

Our team has swept contingency plans for practically everything that could go wrong and how we can make it right or at the least, take a detour to obtain the same lasting result. Our schedule is thorough and all avenues regarding locations have been set up to prevent issues. We have amazing insurance that can also get us back up and running should any issues arise with equipment or technology.

To end, we undeniably understand that giving money can be scary at times, especially when we have gone through the scary times we have gone through. But regardless, even if you cannot offer anything financially, we still need YOU.

WORD OF MOUTH is so vital to making our project happen. If you can't give money, that is more than okay, please offer us your voice and share this message and this dream of ours with the world.

story:
Our project:

CANCR Synopsis: Tomas lives in a world made small by the disruption of cancer treatment. Now in remission, Tomas meets Dustin on Cancr, the dating app for people who have the disease. Dustin (Single. Musician. Currently staying in the burbs. #incurable) is by turns silly and serious, but always honest. Their connection may be brief, but the care and understanding that passes between them opens something new for both young men.

Director’s statement: I’m so thrilled to put this tender story on screen. Building off Zak Payne’s script, which is filled with subtleties, humor, and a deep respect for consentful intimacy, we filmed so that the camera mirrors Tomas’ progress from claustrophobic to expansive as he learns about self-acceptance. 

We have assembled an awesome team of creatives from the LGBTQ community in Chicago. We committed to making it a collaborative and positive growth opportunity for everyone involved. We hired crew who were enthusiastic about the project. Most identify as LGBTQ and BIPOC. Our filming spanned only three days (pre-COVID-19), yet the safe environment on set allowed everyone to reach deep into their respective reservoirs of honesty, vulnerability, and empathy to create a moving piece of art. All that remains is for the post team to continue that hard, beautiful work to translate the footage into the best visual and auditory story it can be.

 

See full crew list and bios here.

The Impact

We need more uplifting films from diverse perspectives in the world. Representing untold stories on screen is a form of love and respect. People of color deserve this. Queer people deserve this. People with serious or terminal illnesses deserve this.

Your support means we’re able to pay women, LGBTQ, and BIPOC creators to get this and other important stories out into the world.

Our distribution plan includes submitting to film festivals and curating a virtual event featuring queer shorts made by Chicago artists to provide a platform to lift up the artistic works of our community.

 

The Financials

This is the amount we need to complete the film. Please help us get there!

Goal: $4586

  • $3,000 - Edit by Linh Tran
  • $1250 - Post Sound Mix and Design by NoiseFloor LTD
  • $336 - Indiegogo cut and fees

 

Stretch goals:

  • $700 - Colorist
  • $500 - Music licensing from SuperKnova
  • $150 - Festival submissions

 

 

Perks

$1
Thank you credit + invite to special events

$15

All of the above plus a private Link to the film

$25
All of the above plus a digital copy of the script

$35
All of the above plus queer sticker pack (limited)

$50
All of the above plus outtakes reel

$100
All of the above, plus get your face in the spinoff dating app, Backr! (Limited up to 10)

$1,000
All of the above plus Associate Producer credit

 

Risks & Challenges

We have already filmed the project and paid the cast and crew. We have contracts with an experienced and passionate editor and a well-established post house to finish the film. Art making is always a bit of a gamble and a big labor of love. But we are determined to finish this film and get it out in the world. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Spread the word about our campaign so more people know about this beautiful project.
  • Check out the film's webpage for more about the artists featured here and links to their work.
  • Let us know about any screening opportunities, particularly to partner with groups who support LGBTQ people and people with cancer.

story:
Summary

Mountain V Productions presents The Shoreline Crime, a short film with an interlocking narrative that will captivate and shock audiences from beginning to end. 

In a sleepy beach town, college students Jenna and Katie have always admired how Alexis ruled the men she found on dating apps and allegedly ended up leaving the town with a rich guy. The two girls pressure their roommate Katie to try it out and get new experiences, but without realizing it, they have become victims of cybercrime (Catfishing) and lured into a new venture that will change their lives forever. Meanwhile, bereaved former detective John moves to the area and quickly ends up throwing himself into a private investigation of a missing woman. He befriends the well connected local bar owner Leo who helps build up his case. But the more information John uncovers about the missing woman and the newcomers in town, he’ll soon realize this investigation will redefine his principles of justice. 

 

A Film for Awareness

The end goal of The Shoreline Crime is not only to provide audiences with a thrilling narrative, but also to bring attention to the disturbing rise of catfishing in the United States. 

According to the FBI, $218,000,000 was lost as a result of romance scams in 2017 alone. That number increased nearly three times in 2020, with the FBI reporting a loss of nearly $600,000,000. However, financial loss is not the only casualty in this ever increasing epidemic. Catfishing victims commonly suffer from a variety of emotional turmoil's, including fear, anxiety, depression and a diminished trust in others. Not to mention that 1 in 4 Americans use online dating, making it the most popular method of finding a romantic partner.

 

Our Qualifications

Your donation to this project will help ensure the creation of an essential narrative motion picture, as well as financial support to our talented cast and crew. How talented you may ask?

Our past films have received multiple awards. Pandemic Fix received the Gold Award for Best Comedy at the Hollywood Gold Awards Film Festival, as well as several other nominations and honorable mentions across the nation. Gateway City – Last Chance won several awards, such as Best Director at the New York Movie Awards, Best Producer at Florence Film Awards, Best Sound Design at Hollywood Gold Awards and Best Male Foreign Actor at the CKF International Film Festival, along with several other nominations and honorable mentions for Best Production Design, Best Indie Short and Best Indie Crime Short Film across the International film festival circuit. 

At Mountain V Productions, we live by our production process “Plan Tight - Shoot Right.” It’s pretty much what it sounds like! We put a lot of effort and planning into the preproduction stage to reduce time, costs and headaches when it comes time to actually be on set. We often plan our projects around single set locations for optimal lighting setup as well as have plenty of flexibility for camera movement. We put emphasis on the great relationships we've built with our crew and cast, that together we quickly identify what can and cannot be done, but also preserve agility to pivot when unforeseen challenges occur, as they always  will in production.

Our team together have accomplished an average of filming more than 8 script-pages per day, which is considered above average for film production. The general rule of thumb in film production is to shoot 5 pages of a script per day. Our current level of production flow, gives us the confidence and ability to produce this short in only 5 days of production. 

 

Why We Need Your Help

With a successful campaign completed, the money raised will be used to cover travel, lodging, craft services, crew and cast. In addition to covering the production cost, we will also allocate budget towards our post-production and marketing team, including festival submissions, marketing campaign, media kits and promotional materials. 

Our Go-To-Market strategy is to submit The Shoreline Crime into key international film festivals to gain recognition on the project before entering into a distribution agreement, similar to how we've obtained streaming deals on our previous short films. 

Our initial plan is to collaborate with First Focus International who secured distribution agreements with Amazon Prime and other streaming platforms, on our two short films, Gateway City - Last Chance and Pandemic Fix.

Preliminary budget allocation: 

In addition to supporting a film with an important message behind it, you’ll also be supporting recent film graduates and current film students, that are collaborating with Mountain V Productions. Nearly 80% of our crew/cast is either a recent graduate or currently in college across all aspects of production. This is because Mountain V wholeheartedly supports college students and graduates who want to get exposure in the film industry. Your support will help us give our crew/cast more experience, as well as building their credentials on IMDb to establish themselves in a very competitive industry.

 

Risks & Challenges

In order to keep our cast and crew safe on set, we are following Governor Phil Murphy’s Covid-19 protocols involving:

  • Social distancing being maintained whenever possible
  • Access to hand sanitizer and other disinfectants 
  • Only key-cast-and-crew members on set 
  • Required Covid screeners for cast and crew. 
  • Team members who aren’t required to be on set work from home. 
  • Cast and crew have been fully vaccinated

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word! Share our Indiegogo campaign with friends and family. 

  • Boost our social media presence by following our social media sites, on Instagram, TikTok, Facebook and LinkedIn,  @mountainvproductions.

  • Offer a location(house/office/bar/restaurant/barn/farm) within Monmouth County, New Jersey for filming, or maybe a vehicle. 

 

Meet the Team

story_txt:
Summary
Mountain V Productions presents The Shoreline Crime, a short film with an interlocking narrative that will captivate and shock audiences from beginning to end. 
In a sleepy beach town, college students Jenna and Katie have always admired how Alexis ruled the men she found on dating apps and allegedly ended up leaving the town with a rich guy. The two girls pressure their roommate Katie to try it out and get new experiences, but without realizing it, they have become victims of cybercrime (Catfishing) and lured into a new venture that will change their lives forever. Meanwhile, bereaved former detective John moves to the area and quickly ends up throwing himself into a private investigation of a missing woman. He befriends the well connected local bar owner Leo who helps build up his case. But the more information John uncovers about the missing woman and the newcomers in town, he’ll soon realize this investigation will redefine his principles of justice. 
 

A Film for Awareness
The end goal of The Shoreline Crime is not only to provide audiences with a thrilling narrative, but also to bring attention to the disturbing rise of catfishing in the United States. 
According to the FBI, $218,000,000 was lost as a result of romance scams in 2017 alone. That number increased nearly three times in 2020, with the FBI reporting a loss of nearly $600,000,000. However, financial loss is not the only casualty in this ever increasing epidemic. Catfishing victims commonly suffer from a variety of emotional turmoil's, including fear, anxiety, depression and a diminished trust in others. Not to mention that 1 in 4 Americans use online dating, making it the most popular method of finding a romantic partner.
 

Our Qualifications
Your donation to this project will help ensure the creation of an essential narrative motion picture, as well as financial support to our talented cast and crew. How talented you may ask?
Our past films have received multiple awards. Pandemic Fix received the Gold Award for Best Comedy at the Hollywood Gold Awards Film Festival, as well as several other nominations and honorable mentions across the nation. Gateway City – Last Chance won several awards, such as Best Director at the New York Movie Awards, Best Producer at Florence Film Awards, Best Sound Design at Hollywood Gold Awards and Best Male Foreign Actor at the CKF International Film Festival, along with several other nominations and honorable mentions for Best Production Design, Best Indie Short and Best Indie Crime Short Film across the International film festival circuit. 
At Mountain V Productions, we live by our production process “Plan Tight - Shoot Right.” It’s pretty much what it sounds like! We put a lot of effort and planning into the preproduction stage to reduce time, costs and headaches when it comes time to actually be on set. We often plan our projects around single set locations for optimal lighting setup as well as have plenty of flexibility for camera movement. We put emphasis on the great relationships we've built with our crew and cast, that together we quickly identify what can and cannot be done, but also preserve agility to pivot when unforeseen challenges occur, as they always  will in production.
Our team together have accomplished an average of filming more than 8 script-pages per day, which is considered above average for film production. The general rule of thumb in film production is to shoot 5 pages of a script per day. Our current level of production flow, gives us the confidence and ability to produce this short in only 5 days of production. 
 

Why We Need Your Help
With a successful campaign completed, the money raised will be used to cover travel, lodging, craft services, crew and cast. In addition to covering the production cost, we will also allocate budget towards our post-production and marketing team, including festival submissions, marketing campaign, media kits and promotional materials. 
Our Go-To-Market strategy is to submit The Shoreline Crime into key international film festivals to gain recognition on the project before entering into a distribution agreement, similar to how we've obtained streaming deals on our previous short films. 
Our initial plan is to collaborate with First Focus International who secured distribution agreements with Amazon Prime and other streaming platforms, on our two short films, Gateway City - Last Chance and Pandemic Fix.
Preliminary budget allocation: 

In addition to supporting a film with an important message behind it, you’ll also be supporting recent film graduates and current film students, that are collaborating with Mountain V Productions. Nearly 80% of our crew/cast is either a recent graduate or currently in college across all aspects of production. This is because Mountain V wholeheartedly supports college students and graduates who want to get exposure in the film industry. Your support will help us give our crew/cast more experience, as well as building their credentials on IMDb to establish themselves in a very competitive industry.
 
Risks & Challenges
In order to keep our cast and crew safe on set, we are following Governor Phil Murphy’s Covid-19 protocols involving:

Social distancing being maintained whenever possible
Access to hand sanitizer and other disinfectants 
Only key-cast-and-crew members on set

Team members who aren’t required to be on set work from home. 
Cast and crew have been fully vaccinated

story:
"Violet, the drug-addicted wife of a rising politician, threatens to derail her husband Lucas' gubernatorial campaign. Forced to undergo rehab in seclusion, palpable tensions rise when Lucas takes an interest in Violet's unconventional nurse - tensions that put the couple's marriage, and all of their lives, on the line."

 

'Violet,' the Film. A provocative psychological thriller.

 

Violet is a story about moral boundaries, breaking them, defying them and what happens when you let them define you...

In teaming up with us as contributors you not only will help us make this film, but you will be joining our mission to make waves in this industry by ensuring that as we make space for our film and our voices, we simultaneously create change and make space for others.

We carry a fiery passion about our film Violet, which you'll read more on below, but we are equally passionate about doing crowdfunding differently... As you SELECT your PERK of CHOICE, you will be creating CHANGE. 

  • Create a ripple effect with your Contribution - we will pay it forward.
  • Invest in a film but even more so in vital voices in our industry.
  • Make a difference in a fellow artist's life.

From our Director

Violet... The Story

Psychological thrillers continue to be met by both critical acclaim and received by a devoted audience.

What's next?

Filming for Violet will take place over 15 days at our gorgeous location in Santa Rosa Valley on our Arri Alexa Mini. Collectively we have pulled together resources, with the exception of a few areas, which this cash budget of $25K will go towards.

Your investment will go towards items such as;

  • Labour fees. Including Camera department support, Production support, Wardrobe & HMU.
  • Equipment. Including Camera Rigs and Lenses.
  • Production Design.
  • Location fees.
  • Covid Safety precautions.
  • Catering.
  • Unit resources for our Cast and Crew.
  • Crowdfunding fees. Indiegogo processing fees.

 

WHEN WE REACH OVER $25K - Additional funds raised over the $25K will further go towards labour fees, production design and prepping for post production. This funding round will get our film shot and in the can!

What we have in place:

  • Key team.
  • Locations, House and exterior surrounding Property.
  • Insurance.
  • Arri Alexa Mini.
  • Base Grip and Camera supplies.

 

Our Filming Location

Our Team...

As you create anything in life, what's important is who you make it with. 

We have each a richness of experience which we are bringing to this project with great intensity. Some of us you know well, others we are thrilled to introduce to you. Please enjoy reading more about our team.

Meet the rest of our team...

Ryan Palmer is a co-founder along side Annalea Fiachi of Hoovaloo Films, producers of high-quality, creative media that specialize in making promotional content for businesses. Hoovaloo Films is comprised of a group of experienced filmmakers based in Ventura County.

For over 18 years, Matt Luber has worked as a talent agent and producer in Hollywood for the film and television industry. As the co-owner and manager of Luber Roklin Entertainment in Los Angeles, Matt Luber represents a long list of actors, screenwriters, and industry professionals

Other Ways You Can Contribute

We hope as you join our journey it in turn inspires you to do something you've been waiting for. Though every dollar will be put to good use we also encourage you to share this project with those who you know it will interest.

  • Share the link with your friends, family and colleagues.
  • Look for the Share icons on this page.
  • Go old school and email someone with this link.

Thank you for being a part of Violet and welcome to the team!

"Don't wait for permission to create something" Ava DuVernay

story:
Thunder Knock Studios, Sky Nine Productions, Badabing Pixtures, and Hand Cannon Productions are thrilled and excited to welcome you to the Indiegogo fundraising campaign for our Halloween fan film: Halloween Night!

 

Check out the official teaser trailer here:

 

Halloween Night is a fan film set in the Halloween universe that focuses on John Loomis (JP DeStefano), the grandson of Dr. Sam Loomis (Donald Pleasence). Along with his wife Samantha (Ainura DeStefano), John and the fellow citizens of Haddonfield are unknowingly about to come face to face with the Shape himself: Michael Myers (John Schilling), who has returned after a long absence.

 

 

 

Our goal with this campaign is to raise $10,000 in order to afford the cost of our remaining Principal Photography and Post-Production for the film. This funding will allow our production crew to finish our film with the proper Camera and Lighting Equipment, Special-FX Make-Up, Costumes, Props, Food, and several other Post-Production costs such as Editing, Sound Design, Sound and Music Mixing, Color Grading, Marketing, and of course, great Perks for our backers!

Being such die-hard fans of the Halloween franchise has helped us shape this film into the most entertaining experience we possibly can, while paying homage to the classic history and lore we love so much about the Halloween franchise. If successfully funded, our team will work day and night to ensure our backers that we deliver a high-quality film that will leave Halloween fans wanting more in October 2019.

 

We have compiled awesome Halloween Night perks available for our backers that include: Social Media Shoutout, Special Thanks In the Credits, Pins, T-Shirts, Movie Posters, Digital Media Pack, Set Visits, Become an Executive Producer, Get a Walk-On Speaking Role, and Get Killed On-Screen By Michael Myers!

 

 

Thunder Knock Studios is the production company spear-heading this film. Launched by founder/owner JP DeStefano, Thunder Knock specializes in all aspects of media, ranging from films, photography, commercials, headshots, auditions, and much more.

Collaborating with Thunder Knock on this film is Sky Nine Productions, a production company led by founder/owner Zach Salazar, who specialize in producing short films, feature films, web-series, promotional videos, music videos, commercials and more.

Combined with Michael Tula and his production company Badabing Pixtures, John Schilling, and Victor Gelsomino and Hand Cannon Productions, our team not only shares a love for the art of filmmaking, but a deep bond and devotion to the Halloween franchise. Halloween Night is our way of showing appreciation to the franchise many of us have grown up with since 1978.

 

JP DeStefano - Creator/Director/Producer/Co-Writer
JP began acting professionally in 2010, taking on a variety of background roles. When JP is not filming, he enjoys discovering new talents and abilities he can bring to use in front of the camera. Never satisfied, JP continues to take acting classes and finds the environment enriching: a place, he says, "where you can both lose yourself and find yourself, and a place where you will conjure up something inside you that you never thought possible." JP resides in Houston, Texas and is making his directorial debut with Halloween Night.

Zach Salazar - Producer/Writer
Zach first got into film in 2014, releasing a short film right out of the gate. He's since gone on to write, direct and produce nine short films, including his most recent "Confession: The Unfortunate, Tragic, Grave Revelation of One Daniel Gomez" and a two-episode web-series. This fall, he will begin production on his directorial debut and first full-length film "Silent Night". Zach has brought his vast knowledge of horror and the Halloween franchise to help craft a compelling story and screenplay for Halloween Night.

Michael Tula - Producer/Co-Writer
Michael has been a film/theater actor since 2013. He has performed twice at the Match Theater in Houston with Director Tarriance Anderson's "Saved With Secrets" & "Fade to Black" series. He also participated in Mildred's Umbrella's "Museum of Dysfunction VII" and portrayed Floyd Knowles in Houston Theater Company's "Grapes of Wrath." He's currently a player with Keith & Margo's Murder Mystery Theater. Mike is a lifelong horror fan and is thrilled to be part of the Halloween Night creative team.

John Schilling - Producer/The Shape
John is an environmental broker currently living in Houston but born in Georgetown, D.C. Growing up in Burbank, California, John would often watch his uncle on the set of a sitcom at Warner Bros., and has always had a love for the cinematic arts and horror films. In his spare time, he is also a local pop up fanatic and works with various products ranging from comics to BBQ. John has been a pioneer in this production, lending his tremendous talents as a producer and also as the role of the Shape himself!

Mario Almanza - Director of Photography
Mario is a director of photography and photographer based in Houston. His compelling work always stands out and has a gloomy, dark feel with a nice dramatic touch. He is always experimenting with new methods and isn't afraid to take risks. He previously served as the director of photography for "The Bat", another fan film being produced in Houston from director Marcus Vasquez. Mario is no doubt an extraordinary talent to have on our production team.

 

We hope to welcome you as a part of this campaign and can't express how much we appreciate any support you can give us. After making your contribution, we also ask that you please share this campaign with any friends or family you believe will enjoy this film.

Thank you again for your continued support of independent films.

 

"This production is the effort of Thunder Knock Studios, Sky Nine Productions, Badabing Pixtures and its volunteer associates. It is in no way affiliated with, or representative of Present Compass International Pictures, Trancus International Films, Blumhouse Productions, or Universal Studios, the Halloween film property, or its characters.

This project was created by fans for the fans to show our appreciation for the Halloween franchise. When completed, this project will be released for free. A portion of the funding raised to produce this film will also be donated to the Texas Children's Hospital in Houston, Texas.

Thank you to everyone who assisted in bringing this project to life. Thunder Knock, Sky Nine, and Badabing are forever grateful for your time and dedication to the project. Thank you all for checking out our campaign and Happy Halloween!"

 

On the subject of the rights to the Halloween franchise, if any of the property owners takes issue with what we are trying to accomplish, we will happily comply with whatever is asked of us by said parties.

That being said, we know that studios love fan films and most often support them. That is why there are so many Friday the 13th, Star Wars, Halloween, Star Trek, Nightmare on Elm Street, Batman, and countless other property fan films currently floating around the web. As long as one does not try to profit or compete, studios usually see them as a free marketing tool.

However, in a case like with Axanar: A Star Trek Fan Film, which you may have read about, it was only when the filmmakers raised 1.13 million dollars on Kickstarter before Paramount stepped in and shut the production down.

The budget for this campaign is astronomically lower and is only meant to cover the unavoidable expenses of independent film production. 

In other words, our team is partnering with our fans to share in the cost of the film so we can all enjoy new and original Halloween stories created by the fans for the fans. 

We hope this clears up any questions in regards to this campaign. If you have any other questions, please contact us at skynineproductions@gmail.com

story:
Short Summary

A student made short film about the horrors a child stolen from the world faces raised by murderers in an underground bunker. 

  • My name is Stephen Donley and I'm a Senior at Huntington University!
  • I'm very excited to get to work on this film. I'm incredibly excited to work on this project because it's the first real set I'm building and have grand visions for my script.
  • My contributors will help me and my close hard-working peers create our dream film which we will be able to submit to festivals to show our talent off to its fullest ability.

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have received money from our executive producers to get us off the ground but we are striving for another thousand. 
  • Perks donators receive are credits at the end and our short film. You'll receive the film in its entirety once it's finished and after festivals have judged it. I don't have much more to offer other than our best!
  • Funds are going to go to many things. Specifically and the majority will go to props. Our set is going to be rich with flavor and life telling an entire story on its own visually. The build is already taking place and its intention is to create what looks like a cargo box buried underground. Inside are going to be wooden paneling for walls, various objects plastered on the walls, carpets and crushed cans littering the floor, Christmas lights illuminating the long thin home, and a large eery deer head mounted on the wall. Apart from the set, we have various props as well including three custom-made environmental safety suits used for when they go outside the bunker, a woodcutter's ax, and a closet of newspapers for a big reveal near the end.
  • Outside the actually set we'll have 30 hungry mouths to feed for our three-day shoot and professional actors to house. All and all it's going to add up to a hefty budget, but I have confidence it will all be worth the cost. 

The Impact

  • Our project is imperative for today's viewers. It represents a child's fight for truth and their own freedom and it creates a genuine narrative of someone trapped inside the same room for many years of their youth. 
  • I've gathered the best of the best from our grade and we have full confidence in our abilities to show off the school's and more so our capabilities.

Risks & Challenges

I'm worried about the amount of time we have before we have to shoot. My film has to come together and be ready to hit the ground running on October 8th. After that, we have until October 10th to finish shooting.

  • Other than the rapidly approaching deadline I have no reason to doubt my team. Funding from our generous donators would only help in securing our production concretely.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate no worries! You would be doing us a colossal favor if you would spread the word and post our project on social media or send it to any people you think would be interested.

Even if you can only offer us yourself as an audience member, we would be forever grateful. Thank you.
story_txt:
Short Summary
A student made short film about the horrors a child stolen from the world faces raised by murderers in an underground bunker. 

My name is Stephen Donley and I'm a Senior at Huntington University!
I'm very excited to get to work on this film. I'm incredibly excited to work on this project because it's the first real set I'm building and have grand visions for my script.
My contributors will help me and my close hard-working peers create our dream film which we will be able to submit to festivals to show our talent off to its fullest ability.


What We Need & What You Get

We have received money from our executive producers to get us off the ground but we are striving for another thousand. 
Perks donators receive are credits at the end and our short film. You'll receive the film in its entirety once it's finished and after festivals have judged it. I don't have much more to offer other than our best!
Funds are going to go to many things. Specifically and the majority will go to props. Our set is going to be rich with flavor and life telling an entire story on its own visually. The build is already taking place and its intention is to create what looks like a cargo box buried underground. Inside are going to be wooden paneling for walls, various objects plastered on the walls, carpets and crushed cans littering the floor, Christmas lights illuminating the long thin home, and a large eery deer head mounted on the wall. Apart from the set, we have various props as well including three custom-made environmental safety suits used for when they go outside the bunker, a woodcutter's ax, and a closet of newspapers for a big reveal near the end.
Outside the actually set we'll have 30 hungry mouths to feed for our three-day shoot and professional actors to house. All and all it's going to add up to a hefty budget, but I have confidence it will all be worth the cost. 


The Impact

Our project is imperative for today's viewers. It represents a child's fight for truth and their own freedom and it creates a genuine narrative of someone trapped inside the same room for many years of their youth. 
I've gathered the best of the best from our grade and we have full confidence in our abilities to show off the school's and more so our capabilities.


Risks & Challenges
I'm worried about the amount of time we have before we have to shoot. My film has to come together and be ready to hit the ground running on October 8th. After that, we have until October 10th to finish shooting.
Other than the rapidly approaching deadline I have no reason to doubt my team. Funding from our generous donators would only help in securing our production concretely.

Other Ways You Can Help
If you can't donate no worries! You would be doing us a colossal favor if you would spread the word and post our project on social media or send it to any people you think would be interested.
Even if you can only offer us yourself as an audience member, we would be forever grateful. Thank you.

story:
"NIGHT RAIN"

A Dark and Redemptive Love Letter to True Crime, Independent Cinema and Hollywood's Golden Age

STARRING (left to right): Adam Lesar as EZRA, Mattia Chicco as VITTORIO, Clarissa Thibeaux as NEFRERI, Thessa M'loe as THOMASINA and Jeanne Marie Spicuzza as AVA  

 

"Night Rain" is complete! We're preparing for release!

 

The script. The story. The staccato dialogue. 

 

THE DARK SIDE OF HOLLYWOOD

An actress-producer and her company of young indie filmmakers are unwittingly hired by their stalker to make a low budget period movie about a famous unsolved Los Angeles murder, but soon discover themselves to be the real subjects of the terror. 

Filmed on location, "NIGHT RAIN" is based on actual events, and carries a labyrinthian plot with edge-of-the-seat suspense plus an ending so surprising, the finer details must remain TOP SECRET– as private as our noir boudoir!

In addition to its plot, what makes "NIGHT RAIN" unique is that, for the very first time in cinema history, we are working with those connected with the victim of this disturbing L.A. murder. She is portrayed authentically, empathetically, from the feminine perspective, without exploitation. We work to humanize, uplift and inspire through art. We uphold gender fair income without exception.

"The movie medium will eventually take its place as art because there is no other medium of interest to so many people." 
– Irving Thalberg

 

THE FLOW OF THE DOUGH

Check out our fab perks! See ACTION! The Hitchcock, DEEP FOCUS! The Orson Welles, CLOSE-UP! The Gloria Swanson and more! Great fun, exciting opportunities!

Your beautiful contributions to The "NIGHT RAIN" Campaign are applied to complete everything from pre-production all the way through to post-production and exhibition. 

It takes a'lotta lettuce! But, hey, you need the green to hit the BIG screen! 

A sawbuck? Sure! Heck, we'll even accept a C-note, Gs and other scratch! #letsmakeamovie

 

OUR SNAZZY FILMMAKERS 

JEANNE MARIE SPICUZZA • award winning filmmaker and performance poet as screenwriter, executive producer, actress, director

SYNTHIAN SHARP • Goth rock star as best director/editor in the biz

JAY LOPEZ • moving pictures artist as fab director of photography

LESLIE LAPAGE • iconic film festival maven as fearless line producer

JESSAMYN PRINCE • amazing artist as gem production coordinator

GUY HOFFMAN • legendary drummer of Violent Femmes and BoDeans as actor, music director, composer

ASH LIGHTFOOT • punk musician and music video magician as assistant editor  

... and more! Visit IMDb for details!

 

IT'S CRIMINAL!

We share the humor, trials and tribulations of independent filmmaking in the context of Hollywood glamour and a captivating unsolved true crime that continues to mesmerize. "NIGHT RAIN" strives to empathize with victims and survivors of violence, and their families. We aim to bring imagination and dignity to the subject.   

 

THE KNOW-HOW OF "HOW-TO"

Seasons & a Muse Productions, who brought you provocative short films like "Naked" and "Field Day," and the award-winning cult hit "The Scarapist,"™ are dedicated to making "NIGHT RAIN" and releasing it into festivals, theatres, on VOD and other platforms! We do not make any guarantees about results or timing. We can say that every film we've shot has been completed and accepted to festivals! Each one has been distributed internationally! We work with top sales agents, publicists and social media experts to create and market the best motion pictures that we can!  

 

UNRAVELING THE MYSTERY...

It IS already happening! We'll keep you updated with new video clips and production photos as we go! And, we'll provide you with footage clues that help unravel the mystery of "NIGHT RAIN"!  

 

BRINGIN' BACK THE GOLDEN AGE

"NIGHT RAIN" was shot on sophisticated sites all around Tinseltown! We're soaring through post-production, with release anticipated in 2021!

 

JOIN US, BABYFACE!

We adore your involvement! Dreams do come true! We appreciate every one of you magnificent moguls and cinephiles! Above all, we love sharing movies with you, friends and family, to partake in and devour like popcorn at a Saturday night serial! 

We're a talented bunch on a mission to continue making quality motion pictures. Thank you for joining us on the journey! 

Psst. Hey. Yeah, you, pals. Want more? We've created special SECRET PERKS. Shhh. For private eyes only. Contact us on the QT for all the dirt.

Bring back the sophistication of storytelling to cinema! Become "NIGHT RAIN" nocturnes!

story:
Few horror characters have continued to haunt the big screen like this hockey-masked killer.   His name alone incites fear.  He has died (a lot), come back (a lot), fought a psychic girl, taken Manhattan, been to space, fought Freddy, and been rebooted (and rebooted.. and rebooted!). Though he has been solidified as a  horror icon for nearly forty years, none of his films have been more controversial than Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday.

Twenty five years later, we want to shed some light on this incredibly polarizing installment.  Love it or hate it, we are setting out to get some answers for YOU, the fans! Why were some of those creative choices made?  Why was Jason a non-character in his own franchise film? Why on earth would a huge studio like New Line Cinema choose to put this legendary, blockbuster horror fan-favorite in the hands of a 23-year old Writer/Director Adam Marcus, who had NEVER written or directed a studio film in his young career?!

Well fans, you are in for a fun ride!  We've brought together an awesome team with much of the original cast and crew from the film, including Writer/Director Adam Marcus!  We (the team) aim to give fans and haters alike some raw insight into this controversial installment, as well as offer YOU the opportunity to ask your most burning questions to the cast and crew of Jason Goes to Hell: The Final Friday! 

Did you absolutely LOVE the film? Thought it was a super creative and unique addition to the franchise? Great! We are going to deliver some fantastic behind-the-scenes info on a film that you hold dear to your horror-fan heart!

Absolutely HATE it? Thought it was the epitome of cinematic garbage? Great! Consider our So Many Questions perk and ask Adam Marcus ANYTHING. YOU. WANT. (!!) 

Either way, we are ripping off the mask and hoping to offer a fresh perspective, some fan feedback, and a closer understanding of this iconic film and how it came to be. 

PLUS a few surprise fan-favorite cast members to be revealed along the way in our behind the scenes updates!

 

  • We are looking for $50,000 in funding to make this film a reality. These funds will go towards filming the many amazing cast and crew interviews we have set up as well as our post production which will deliver a must-have documentary for fans of the franchise!

  • To help get our film funded, we are offering a slew (13, to be exact!) of AMAZING perks! Not only are we offering behind-the-scenes updates, DVD's, Blu Ray's, signed posters, ball caps and T-Shirts, but we have limited edition props, exclusively handmade hockey masks created just for you from one of the industry's leading SFX designers, producer credits and exclusive invitations to the film's premiere! 
  • Our biggest perk: YOU get the chance to be IN the movie!  That's right, you'll have the exclusive opportunity to ask your most burning questions directly to the cast/crew ON CAMERA!
  • If we don't reach our goal the first time around, the funds will go towards beginning production as we work to continue to raise the remaining funds.

**Note: We have SO many perks, we didn't even have the space to list everything in each perk section.  Just know that each level of generosity adds a fresh perk to the packages that come before, so be sure to check out all of our packages! Of course, don't hesitate to check out our FAQ's if you have any questions, or reach us directly if you can't find it here.

 

Spread the word!  Tell your friends, share our posts, and like our page to stay updated! Your support in raising awareness about our project goes a long way towards making this project a reality. Every set of new eyes you put on the campaign is another chance to help! THANK YOU!!

story:
Hello there. I’m Rebekah Erb, Festival Director for Midwest Action Fest and Midwest Horror Fest. Soon to be Sarga Nexus.  I’m from a small rural town in Indiana. About 45 minutes East of Logansport. No, I didn’t make it far, but I couldn’t be more proud to reside in Logansport; home to our beloved festivals. I have been contributing to the festivals since the day they began. My most dear friends, Daniel Murphy and Tony Walters, birthed this crazy idea back in 2017. Being the spirited person that I am, I jumped on the opportunity to help however I can! Life occurrence after life occurrence I am blessed to be titled Festival Director. My heart and soul are poured into these festivals.

This campaign is for our film festival’s journey and the new path we are trotting down. We have immense attractions and cosmic aspirations to share and offer to our fellow artists. This is important to me because I know first hand how terrible artists get treated and how expensive it can be to try to find helpful workshops and how toxic it can be to try to network. That’s where Sarga Nexus comes in. We are here to build your spirit and guide your craft!  

  • Start a Scholarship Program 
  • Host informative workshops 
  • Host auditions for agencies and/or studios 
  • Book inspiring artists & celebrities for guest spots, panels & workshops
  • Hire artist to create custom festival logos & artwork 
  • Hire artist to create custom trophies
  • Youth Summer Film Camp
  • 5 year Anniversary Celebration - Midwest Horror Fest: IN SPACE! 

To reach our goals, we are looking to raise $15,000.

Our perks include:

  • Social Media Shoutout
  • Thank You on the BIG SCREEN
  • Special Edition T-Shirt (Gray or Black)
  • In House 2022 Season Pass
  • Virtual 2022 Season Pass
  • In House Midwest Horror Fest... In Spaaaace! VIP Admission
  • Lifetime Season Pass

You have the chance to make a huge impact on artists & filmmakers worldwide! 

Sarga Nexus is valuable for our fellow filmmakers, artists, community & world! We run things differently around here. We include all, invite all & love all. We could use a little more comradery in this world. We bring artists around the world a little bit closer together. 

The way stories are created is always changing. The further into the future we go the more technology changes, sociology changes and even how media is digested changes. There are so many challenges that arise with a forever shifting industry. Sarga Nexus’ Board of Directors each have 5+ years of experience in the filmmaking industry. Our collective knowledge and intuitiveness equips us with the necessary tools to overcome challenges and to gracefully shift with the times.

Sarga Nexus is for filmmakers and artists, by filmmakers and artists. We are creatives down to our core so we completely understand the struggles and needs. Collectively we have 10 years of festivals under our belt; 2 of which was at the beginning and end of the pandemic. 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

BIRD, BIRD, BIRD.. BIRD IS THE WORD! Spread it like wildfire! There are also other ways to get involved. You can become a Member and/or Volunteer at www.sarganexus.com

story:
I am a Constant Reader who has acquired the rights to turn my favorite Stephen King                   short story, I Know What You Need (from 1978's Night Shift) into a short film 

 This is part of Stephen King's Dollar Baby Program

 The film will take place in the year the story was originally published in                                                 Cosmopolitan Magazine - 1976 

 The film will be shot in the exact locations mentioned in the story, on the                                   beautiful University of Maine campus, in the Summer of 2021 

 Stephen King requires every Dollar Baby short to send a copy of the finished film for him             to view - so you can be a part of a film that Stephen King will see!

 

 

 

                                      

 

Hi! My name is Julia Marchese and I am a filmmaker living in Los Angeles.

 

My first film, 2016's Out of Print, is a documentary about the importance of revival cinema and 35mm exhibition and preservation to culture. It features interviews with filmmakers such as Rian Johnson, Edgar Wright, Kevin Smith, Joe Dante, Mark Romanek, John Landis, Stuart Gordon, Joe Carnahan, Tom Holland and many more. I was able to fund the film via Kickstarter and learned how to make a film by making a film -  from pre-production to  post-production, screenings, festivals, press and distribution, I went through every single step with passion for cinema and joy of learning.

 

 

Out of Print was shot half on film and half on digital, and I was so thrilled to have a 35mm print of the film made. The film won the Programmers Award at the Sidewalk Film Festival and has played at art house cinemas, universities and film archives all over the world. The film is available on DVD, Amazon Prime and streaming & the 35mm print is still touring the world, having just played the Film Archive in Austria earlier this year. The film print lives now at The Academy Film Archive in Hollywood between screenings.

 

I am also a Constant Reader. 

 

                                                     

 

I've loved Stephen King obsessively since I was about 11 years old, the girl on the bus furiously reading It and Carrie and Pet Sematary over and over. In junior high I enthusiastically made all my friends watch Pet Sematary and even dressed like Post-Micmac-Burial-Ground Gage Creed for Halloween one year as a kid. I'm hardcore.

 

I realized two and half years ago that I had never tackled his master work, The Dark Tower series. This needed to be remedied immediately. So I devoured the books, loving each one more and more and starting to panic as I neared the end of the series. I didn't want the story to end!! I got to the 11th stanza in book 7 - The Song of Susannah (Constant Readers will know where I mean) where the reveal was going to be so good and I was so excited, that I needed to prolong that feeling as long as possible. 

 

                                 

 

So I decided to pause my reading there and read every Stephen King novel and short story related to the The Dark Tower (there are A LOT, over 40 short stories and novels combined!) before re-reading the Tower series (and then continue on to the Marvel comic series omnibuses and The Dark Tower companions after that). It's taken me two and a half years so far and I am still working on it. It's the most incredibly brilliant literary multiverse puzzle that I have ever undertaken, and I am enjoying putting the pieces into place more than I can say.

 

I truly know and love Stephen King's work from a real, cherished place in my heart that has been in my life every day for a very long time. 

 

Stephen King has an incredible program called the Dollar Baby Program, which allows the rights of certain stories of his to be bought for one dollar (and you really do send him a dollar bill in the mail)! The contract states that the rights are good for one year, and the resulting film must be 45 minutes or under, plus the film must be non-profit, non-broadcast - which means the film cannot be sold, but it can be shown at film festivals and in private screenings. 

 

That means the only way you are guaranteed to see this film is to contribute to this campaign and get a private live stream link sent to you when the film is finished. 

 

Perhaps the most exciting aspect of the contract is that Stephen King asks that all finished Dollar Baby films be sent to him to view - so dig this - he sells the rights to the stories for $1, basically because he's curious to see how other people view and interpret his work - how cool is that?

 

Knowing that Stephen King himself will watch a film that you can be a part of is a pretty awesome and unique opportunity! 

 

                                               

 

I Know What You Need is a short story that was first featured in the September 1976 issue of Cosmopolitan Magazine, and then compiled into the short story collection Night Shift in 1978. The story centers on Elizabeth, a popular college junior who is approached one night by Edward, an unkempt outcast whose first words to her are "I Know What You Need" - and she is shocked to discover that he does. 

 

                                                     

 

I fell in love with Edward's character within sentences and was completely drawn in and so curious about him - just as the main character, Elizabeth, is in the story. It's a love story - but it's a Stephen King love story - so you know everything isn't always as it seems to be. The story is quite contained, with only three main characters. In addition to the characters mentioned above, there is also Elizabeth's roommate, Alice, who wants to protect her friend. 

 

I think it is imperative, for narrative reasons, to keep the story to the year it is set, 1976 - the story takes place in a different time, in a different kind of world (one that doesn't include the internet, for one). Double that with my love for vintage aesthetics, especially of the 60's & 70's, and that means I'm very excited to take on a period piece! Because it is such an intimate piece, I think this can be done cheaply and efficiently. 

 

Naturally, as a woman, my vision for the story is probably very different from Stephen King's, but that's why I am so interested to see it come to life - the writer of the story is male, but the protagonist is female - and now will be adapted & directed by a female filmmaker. That being said, I feel very strongly as a Constant Reader that the dialogue and feel of any film based on King's work should stay as close to the original story as possible, and I've definitely kept that in mind when adapting the screenplay. Most of the dialogue is taken word for word from the story. 

 

 

I'm also so incredibly thrilled that the The University of Maine - where Stephen King attended and where the story is set - will be allowing us to shoot this short film on their beautiful campus!

 

So that means this movie will be shot in the exact same locations that Stephen King wrote about in the story!

 

I am beyond excited to be able to shoot this film in the gorgeous state of Maine. Last November I took a Stephen King pilgrimage to see the towns I read so much about all of these years - the names had taken on a kind of magical quality to them - Pownal, Portland, Bangor, Ludlow - such a beautiful state, with gorgeous scenery and lovely people. I took an amazing Stephen King tour of Bangor and was in absolute heaven walking around "Derry" and seeing the canals, the storm pipe, the bird baths, Paul Bunyan, Pennywise's drain, and even Stephen King's house itself. It was like walking through one of his novels. Pure bliss. I can't wait to show the beauty of this incredible state. 

 

 

I am very serious about making films that people are paid fairly on. Having made a feature film, I know how everything always takes longer and costs more than you think it will, so I am budgeting in for that (plus the added cost of transportation, doing a period piece, Indiegogo's fees, etc) I have laid out below where the money will be going. Of course, if we exceed this goal we will be able to shoot in more locations on more days, with lusher art direction and I would really love to be able to shoot on film as well!  Thrilled that my cinematographer from Out of Print, Alex Simon, will be returning to shoot the film and my brother, Peter Marchese, who did the amazing score for Out of Print will be returning to score this film as well!

 

After the film is finished and goes through post production, I will start a festival run, as well as letting our backers see the film via private streaming links. 

 

So what exactly will this money be used for? 

 

 

Cast & Crew - We want everyone to be paid fairly on this film. It doesn't mean actors and crew will make a ton of money, but it does mean that they won't be volunteering their time. They'll be compensated for the hard work they put in. 

 

Equipment - We want to be able to use equipment that will allow the film to be up to today's high standards, yet look completely vintage. Equipment also includes all lighting and sound on  set. If we surpass our original goal, our first stretch goal is to be able to shoot this film on 16mm film as well, which would be my preference, of course! 

 

Locations - In addition to filming on the University of Maine campus, we will also need some other locations, including an apartment and a few restaurants which we plan to source from local Maine establishments, and pay the owners for the use of their business and time.  

 

Transportation - Core crew will be flying from California to Maine, other crew and actors will likely be driven in from NYC, so gas money and car rentals as well as airplane tickets. 

 

Art & Production Design - the film is a period piece and will take place in 1976, and that means a whole lotta vintage. The film is very contained, but we will still need to buy set dressing for a dorm room plus two apartments and guarantee the film looks genuinely 1970's. We also will need two vintage cars to be rented for the shoot. 

 

Wardrobe/Props - Although the film only has three main characters, there are several different outfit changes, plus sourcing genuine 1970's props, including textbooks, suitcases, and photographs. 

 

Post Production - including score composition, editing, sound mixing and color correction. This is a very important part of the process and we want to be sure that the film looks as good as possible, has an incredible soundtrack, and that all of the people contributing to post get paid fairly. 

 

Taxes & Fees - This is to cover not only the fees that Indiegogo takes from the campaign, but also to cover the charges for taxes on the film. 

 

Legal & Insurance - All films come with a tremendous amount of paperwork, most insuring the safety of the cast, crew and filming locations, which is of course, great! We want everyone working on this film to be as safe as possible, of course. 

 

Craft Services - All of the cast and crew will need to be fed, of course! Snacks are a must on long shoot days, and while pizza is delicious, it's not something you want to be eating for every meal on a shoot! We will make sure no one goes hungry, and everyone gets some actual nutrition on set as well. 

 

Festival  Run - We want to submit the film to festivals and that means entrance fees! The more we make, the more festivals we can submit to! 

 

Health & Safety - in these global pandemic times, we will go above and beyond to be sure that our set is clean, sterilized and healthy, and that everyone has plenty of face masks, gloves and feels safe and comfortable. 

 

Thank you so much for reading and hope I have convinced you to help out this super cool project. I know that we are living in a strange time, with a pandemic, high unemployment and the future uncertain, but I've decided to try and push forward with this project - the contract has a year long time frame - so I can only do this now, plus it gives me something exciting to hope and strive for when everything can tend to seem grim.

 

This is my dream project, and I have to at least try my hardest to make this happen. 

 

If you can't or don't want to donate,  spread the word and I'll be just as pleased. Seriously. Word of mouth, Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, Tiktok, Snapchat - I'll take anything! The way things get funded is by people telling their friends. So please do. And as one Constant Reader to another, I hope you will let all of the King fans in your life know about this campaign as well. 

 

I will bring 100% to this film and hope to make Stephen King proud. 

                                      

                                     

 

You can contact me via iknowwhatyouneedfilm at yahoo dot com. 

I Know What You Need Twitter

I Know What You Need Instagram 

 

*Music in campaign video by Ketsa

** Poster design by Mike Baird
story_txt: I am a Constant Reader who has acquired the rights to turn my favorite Stephen King                   short story, I Know What You Need (from 1978's Night Shift) into a short film  This is part of Stephen King's Dollar Baby Program The film will take place in the year the story was originally published in                                                 Cosmopolitan Magazine - 1976  The film will be shot in the exact locations mentioned in the story, on the                                   beautiful University of Maine campus, in the Summer of 2021  Stephen King requires every Dollar Baby short to send a copy of the finished film for him             to view - so you can be a part of a film that Stephen King will see!                                          Hi! My name is Julia Marchese and I am a filmmaker living in Los Angeles. My first film, 2016's Out of Print, is a documentary about the importance of revival cinema and 35mm exhibition and preservation to culture. It features interviews with filmmakers such as Rian Johnson, Edgar Wright, Kevin Smith, Joe Dante, Mark Romanek, John Landis, Stuart Gordon, Joe Carnahan, Tom Holland and many more. I was able to fund the film via Kickstarter and learned how to make a film by making a film -  from pre-production to  post-production, screenings, festivals, press and distribution, I went through every single step with passion for cinema and joy of learning.  Out of Print was shot half on film and half on digital, and I was so thrilled to have a 35mm print of the film made. The film won the Programmers Award at the Sidewalk Film Festival and has played at art house cinemas, universities and film archives all over the world. The film is available on DVD, Amazon Prime and streaming & the 35mm print is still touring the world, having just played the Film Archive in Austria earlier this year. The film print lives now at The Academy Film Archive in Hollywood between screenings. I am also a Constant Reader.                                                        I've loved Stephen King obsessively since I was about 11 years old, the girl on the bus furiously reading It and Carrie and Pet Sematary over and over. In junior high I enthusiastically made all my friends watch Pet Sematary and even dressed like Post-Micmac-Burial-Ground Gage Creed for Halloween one year as a kid. I'm hardcore. I realized two and half years ago that I had never tackled his master work, The Dark Tower series. This needed to be remedied immediately. So I devoured the books, loving each one more and more and starting to panic as I neared the end of the series. I didn't want the story to end!! I got to the 11th stanza in book 7 - The Song of Susannah (Constant Readers will know where I mean) where the reveal was going to be so good and I was so excited, that I needed to prolong that feeling as long as possible.                                    So I decided to pause my reading there and read every Stephen King novel and short story related to the The Dark Tower (there are A LOT, over 40 short stories and novels combined!) before re-reading the Tower series (and then continue on to the Marvel comic series omnibuses and The Dark Tower companions after that). It's taken me two and a half years so far and I am still working on it.
