story:
Bishop's Cove is a Horror Film That Does Not Compromise

Bishop's Cove is a dark and disturbing horror film, in the vein of Hellraiser, with aspects of Silent Hill and Requiem for a Dream mixed in. Written and directed by Charles D. Lincoln, it is a tale of Heather, played in 2020 by Emily McKinley Hill, and in 2001 by Willow Lautenberg, a successful architect with a loving fiancee, Kristen, played by Sarah Schoofs, and a happy life. A happy life she has built upon the ashes of her past, where she was a homeless squatter punk, living on streets of NYC, addicted to heroin, and in love with Catalonia, played by Anna Paulette. One day, Heather's bliss is shattered at the news that Cat, whom she hadn't heard from in over 15 years, has passed away. Heather is then asked to travel to the small upstate New York town Cat grew up in, Bishop's Cove, to deliver the ashes. While there, Heather will be confronted by demons both personal and, in the form of The Nameless, played by Chelsea LeSage, very very literal. Now, more than Heather's perfect life is in danger. Her soul is too. 

Two years ago, we tried to get the project off the ground with the help of some investors. It appeared everything would be progressing smoothly until, right before shooting was to begin, they started asking for changes. Changes that we were not comfortable making because they would have changed the very nature of what we were trying to do. Can we make Catalonia a man? Can we take out the grittiness? Can we tone down the gore?

So many compromises were asked of us that it no longer felt like we'd be telling the same story, so we waited until we could afford to start it up on our own and in 2019, the time felt right. We have shot probably 30% of the film, out of pocket and with the help of friends and family. And most importantly, we've been doing it our way!

Here is the NSFW Hellscape scene we've been able to film along with a trailer of some of the "real world" scenes we've done. Keep in mind the score is temporary. But the scene will give you an idea of where we will go and what to expect in the completed film. 

 


BUT MOVIES ARE EXPENSIVE AND TO DO THIS RIGHT, WE NEED YOUR HELP!!

We are asking for $20,000 to help pay for practical effects in several hellish scenes. We have been working with makeup artists Shannon Rae Mulligan and Leona Ross, as well as the SFX prop house Design to Deceive. We want to create a visually stunning yet upsetting hellscapes for Heather to find herself in. Upon entering Bishop's Cove, Heather is in danger both body and soul. Scenes filled with filth and gore, where hapless souls are stripped of their humanity and confronted by their worst fears. We have four to shoot, including a scene of Heather having to run naked across a hallway of broken glass while pursued by The Ceaseless, one of the Nameless' "associates," who drags a corpse behind it that it uses as a bludgeoning tool. Another involves Heather being wheeled through a derelict hospital surrounded by souls upon whom involuntary surgeries are being performed by another of the Nameless' "associates," The Heartless. Another involves Heather being confronted by a very macabre puppet show, where the corpses of her loved ones figure prominently.

Sketch of The Ceaseless, one of the demonic associates of The Nameless, played by Robert House

Sketch of The Heartless, played by Caitlin Ross-Poteet

But creating scenes like this won't be cheap for us. We are work quickly and we've made some great deals with Joshua Turi and the people at Design to Deceive, but to do these scenes properly, it will take more money than we can pay out of pocket. A typical day of shooting costs us $1,350 for our four person crew alone, and to do these effects, which we estimate will take place over several days of shooting, will require roughly $20,000. 

  • We want to be able to pay for props and prosthetics. Things like enough sugar glass to fill a hallway, prosthetic body parts, occasional studio rentals, latex injuries, gallons of fake blood all cost money. Sometimes, makeup is such a big job that an assistant needs to be hired. For the hospital set piece, we anticipate having to hire two assistants and devote Shannon and her assistant to the makeup of The Nameless, the Heartless, and their minions, while Leona and her assistant to makeup of Heather and the assembled suffering souls. Besides that, things like a proper gurney can cost around $520, not counting the additional fees required to make it look old and rusted.
  • Besides makeup, we want to be able pay cast and crew their regular rate. While Charles, as producer and director is not receiving any payment for his work on this until a distribution deal is made, camera, gaffer, sound, and PA all need to be paid. Actors are also paid for each day they work for us.  
  • We want to be able to be able to feed cast and crew. It is important that everybody be fed. In this age of Covid, extra precautions must also be taken to keep everyone safe. These can tack on additional fees. 

Practical effects are the key to making this film look the way we want it to look. It is very important to us that it not look cheesy or cheap and that parts that are supposed to terrify people do not cause them to laugh instead. As Indie filmmakers, we are used to doing a lot with a little and trust me, for some of the things we have in mind, $20,000 is very little.  If we don't get all of it, we'll still make things work to the best of our abilities, but cutting down some of our ideas may be very painful.

 

WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?

Besides being able to see a kickass horror film when it is done, we are offering a number of perks to those of you generous enough to contribute to our campaign.

  • Those of you who contribute up to $10 will be able to know that you've made something of a difference in the lives of a scrappy family of indie filmmakers, intent on doing something awesome. While one $10 contribution won't set the world on fire, it is a start and you can feel good about yourself for making it.
  • For $20, we will put your name in a special thanks section of the credits, letting the world know you support indie horror.
  • For $35, not only will we put your name in the credits, we'll also send you a digital download of the film when we have finished the festival circuit. We estimate this to be around September 2022, but if it's later, you'll still receive it.
  • Those who contribute $50 will receive a physical edition of the film, in their choice of DVD or Blu-Ray, as well as thanks in the credits. As with the digital download, this will only come after the film is done with the festival circuit.
  • Those that contribute $75 will get that DVD or Blu-Ray signed by Charles  D. Lincoln, Chelsea LeSage, Emily McKinley Hill, and Anna Paulette. Possibly some bigger stars, but no promises... Of course, these contributors will be on the credits thanks list.
  • Now, at $100, things start to get interesting. Those that contribute at $100 will not only receive a signed DVD or Blu-Ray and a place in the credits, but they will be able to play, at a time and date of our choosing, an online session of the asymmetrical horror game Dead by Daylight, being hunted by The Nameless herself, Chelsea LeSage. You must own the game already but due to the game's crossplay nature, it will not matter if you own it on Playstation, Xbox, PC, or Switch. She will hunt you and three other contributors down in a session. 
  • If you'd like to have the tables turned, at $200, you will not only receive the signed DVD or Blu-Ray, the place in the credits, but you'll be able to play a session of Dead by Daylight where you will be the killer and director/writer Charles D. Lincoln, and cast members Chelsea LeSage, Emily McKinley Hill, and Anna Paulette will all be survivors. You will get one chance to stop us from running the generators and escaping. Can you be a better hunter than The Nameless?
  • If you're feeling a bit adventurous, you can contribute $500, where the bad news is we won't be putting you in that special thanks list anymore.  The good news is that you will now be listed as an Associate Producer with full IMDB credit. On top of that, if you are able to travel to New York City (and pass a rapid Covid test after the proper waiting period), we will make you one of the tortured souls in one of our hell sequences. You too can be mutilated and mangled by the Nameless as part of our film! On top of that, you will receive the signed DVD or Blu-Ray!
  • At $750, you'll receive the same perks as those who contribute $500, but you'll also be allowed to keep one of the props from your scene! What will it be? Well, obviously, we won't know until you're here. But you will be able to keep one that'll go with your shiny new Associate Producer Credit and signed DVD or Blu Ray.
  • Finally, those who contribute at $1,000 will get the big one, if you're looking to be on the other side of the camera. Executive Producer credit. Not only will you greatly help us towards getting this thing done, you'll also have something you can use when getting involved in your own projects. Of course, you'll also get the signed DVD and Blu-Ray. Hell, you've earned it, at that point.

 

Risks & Challenges

Independent film is not easy. It's putting out fire after fire, but we have a great cast and we have a reliable crew that are battle tested in dealing with the challenges that we are faced with. Our budget is very small, compared to some of the stuff you'd see coming out of Hollywood. We are passionate about what we're doing and we've had years of experience to help us get past any hurdles that may come in our way. Our only hurdle right now is funding.

If we don't receive it, we have to cut down on the effects, we have to cut down on the scale of some of our ideas, and the people who ultimately suffer are you, the independent horror fan who gets deprived of the experience we want to provide for you. We want to give you the same feelings we got when we saw Hellraiser or Martyrs for the first time. We want to bring you something where you'll care about the characters as much as you will be horrified by the ordeals they go through. We want to give you a vision of hell that mainstream cinema would find too disturbing to show you. We know what we're doing and we know how to do it. All we need it you to give us the means to do so. With so many of the cast and crew out of work during these past few months of Covid, being able to move ahead with funding and with drive will be exactly what we need and what we put together will be exactly what you need: an uncompromising piece of horror cinema, the likes of which you haven't seen in years! 

But we can only do it with your help! Won't you help keep independent horror alive?

Meet the Cast and Crew

CREW

Charles D. Lincoln: Director, Writer, Producer, "J" - Charles D. Lincoln is an award-winning director, writer, producer, actor, writer, activist, novelist, musician, and co-founder of C. L. Squared Productions. Born in the infamous area of Manhattan known as Hell's Kitchen and raised in the sleepy suburban wastes of Long Island, the son of grindhouse and adult film legend, Fred J. Lincoln (Last House on the Left), he showed an affinity for the darker aspects of life from an early age, counting among his first movies horror classics like Alien, The Omen and Rosemary's Baby and his first novel read, Stephen King's Pet Sematary. 

He spent 12 years as a touring musician, doing vocals in the underground bands Dark Eden and Nemesis Imperium, sharing the stage with bands like Hanzel und Gretyl, the Genitorturers, Carnivore, Combichrist, and death rock luminaries, 45 Grave. He wrote a syndicated advice column called Ask the Reverend; hosted a MNN public access variety show called Denied Heaven: The TV Show; modeled for several dark-erotica/fetish websites, including pulp author, Christa Faust's long defunct necromantic dot com; and was responsible for many pieces of performance art in the more conservative corners of America.

In 2009, after losing half of his hearing, he changed his focus to the worlds of both writing and film, co-authoring the autobiography of 1990's porn star Houston and completing his first novel, in the form of 21st Century Demon Hunter, which spawned a similarly titled webseries, now on Amazon Prime Video, which he both writes and directs. He wrote, produced, and played the character of Tony in the extreme vampire film Theresa & Allison (directed by prolific indie director Jeremiah Kipp), winner of Best Feature at Days of the Dead Atlanta 2019 and NJ Horror Con Spring 2019, as well as serving as assistant director, 2nd unit director, wardrobe, script supervisor, and casting director. 

Bishop's Cove will mark his feature film directorial debut.

Christopher Bye: Director of Photography - Christopher Bye is a NYC based cinematographer, photographer, and producer. His work has been featured in galleries nationwide, and he has completed projects for Mercedes-Benz, Makerbot, Nike, Express, The Guggenheim Museum, NBC, Bravo, Lifetime, AMC, Ikea, Chase Bank, and many more over the years. Christopher has acted as director of photography on 6 feature films. Bye always strives to progress his work behind the camera, to make elevated imagery dynamic in every aspect. Christopher attended college at Temple University in Philadelphia, and Imperial College in London, UK.

 

Shannon Rae Mulligan: SFX makeup - After switching majors each year in college over 3 years at two different schools, Shannon decided to make a change.  She has a background of Business, Chemistry, and Fine Arts - which makes up her career path today.  She enrolled in Make-Up Designory in NYC, marking the start of her evolving passions.  Growing up watching horror and sci-if films, it was the making of creatures and gore effects that always intrigued her.  Now, Shannon is an IATSE Local 798 Makeup Artist working on top rated TV shows/Films and creating special makeup effects in her private FX Studio - making her dreams her reality.

 

Leona Ross: Hair, Makeup, SFX -  Having an interest in movies since a child, Leona always knew she wanted to be part of the magic. She attended school to learn SFX makeup so she can do just that! Jumping right into the industry, her favorite part of being a makeup artist is the details that her job requires that tie together the character. Without those details to keep you in the story, there is no magic.

Madison Humes: Assistant Director/Second Unit Director - Madison Humes grew up in Kentucky and was always into acting since age 3. She received her BA at Murray State University and continued her acting education, first at Stella Adler, then American Academy of Dramatic Arts (AADA) and on to graduating at The Neighborhood Playhouse in 2016. After graduating, she continued the grind. First meeting Charles Lincoln through an audition for the part of Desiree in 21st Century Demon Hunter. Since then, she has received a role in Even the Score, a feature coming out this summer, as well as making appearances on the Investigation Discover Channel shows Diabolical and The Deadliest Decade: 80's. Currently finishing up 21st Century Demon Hunter's Season 1.5. 

CAST

Emily McKinley Hill as "Heather" - With a strong foundation forged from theatre training at Savannah College of Art & Design and film training at New York Film Academy, Emily McKinley Hill has spent the past few years proving herself to be a force in indie film - including co-writing/producing/starring in coming-of-age mumblecore dramedy In Passing, working with controversial filmmaker Shane Ryan on gritty horror flick Ted Bundy Had A Son, and most recently making a dramatic turn in the award-winning Delaware Shore.

Anna Paulette as "Catalonia/Sabelia" - Anna Paulette was born in Calexico, CA, in a bordertown near Mexico, She grew up, raised by her single mother and her grandparents. She started her modeling career at the age of 15 and got discovered in Mexico at the age of 18 through a campaign for Sears Mexico. She started working as a model for nine years in LA, Mexico City, and New York City. She now lives in New York City fulfilling her acting career. You may recognize her through appearances on TV shows, including 21st Century Demon Hunter, where she first met director Charles D. Lincoln and co-star Chelsea LeSage. She’s excited for her latest film to release soon.

Nana Gouvea as "Marquesa Silva"

Nana Gouvea is a Brazilian beauty whose career spans television, film, modeling, and production, through her company, Black Wave Enterprises. Born in Jatai, a small town in Midwest Brazil, to a civil lawyer father and homemaker mother, she was discovered, at the age of 10 by a modeling agency scout, beginning a successful career in modeling for some of Brazil's most well-known brands. By the age of 17 she appeared in commercials for top products such as Ellus, Forum, Sao Paulo Alpargatas, De Millus, Zoomp, among others.

 

By the age of 19, considered one of Rio's top models, she was determined to transition into acting, attending the prestigious university, Faculdade da Cidade. Before long she was landing principal roles in a slew of well-known TV shows.

 

After college her acting career really took off: highlights include starring as Pantera do Faustao in "Domingao do Faustao" in TV Globo (1996); she was the host of "Domingo Milionario" on TV Manchete (1997), where she was a regular star on "Banheira do Gugu" on SBT (1998-99); starring in many of TV Globo's network series such as "Amigos,"(2000), "Megaton"(2000), in the telenovella "Porto dos Milagres" as Lindinha in 2001; in the comedic TV Series "A Turma do Didi" as a regular role (2001 to 2007); in 2004 she did "Sob Nova Direcao" for TV Globo; in 2006 she did "JK", a TV Globo Mini-series as "Ninon Vesuvio" and "Bicho do Mato" for TV Record (2006); in 2007 as a series regular in TV Series "Amazonia: De Galvez a Chico Mendez" for TV Globo; in 2008, she did "Faca a sua Historia" (TV Globo) and "Lendas Urbanas," on SBT; More recently, in April 2011, Nana starred in the popular soap, "Araguaia" for TV Glo as the charismatic "Jamila". In addition "SOS Emergencia (2010)."

 

In 2010, Conspiracao Filmes produced the TV special "True Stories" about beautiful women, which starred Nana as one of the main women featured. Made for E Entertainment Television, it was broadcast internationally and in the USA. That year, Nana also starred in a popular sitcom "Vendemos Cadeiras" and was a judge in the reality show "Casa Bonita" on the Multishow Network. And in March 2011 Nana made her theatrical debut in Rio in a new musical version of the classic Greek comedy "Lysistrata," , demonstrating talents not only in acting but in singing and dancing as well.

 

In the fall of 2011, Nana's life and career pivoted to New York City. In 2016, Nana became the lead actress and producer in the Sci-fi/horror feature film "Black Wake," also starring Tom Sizemore and Eric Roberts; in 2017, she landed a series regular role on the Japanese TV series "Otona no Kiso Eigo" as the beautiful Isabella; and in 2019, she released the feature film Linea de Sangre, from the director Garfield Boston.

 

With this substantial body of work, it's no surprise that Nana has become one of Brazil's most recognized personalities. She was named Carnival Queen 13 times in Rio, a record. A model, mother, and entrepreneur, she has also graced the cover and pages of countless Brazilian and Portuguese magazines including tabloids, beauty, health and style magazines and even Playboy.

Chelsea LeSage as "The Nameless" - A Massachusetts native, Chelsea LeSage is co-founder of C. L. Squared Productions, as well as the star of 21st Century Demon Hunter, where she plays the character of Julie . Appearing in countless commercials, her other television credits include The Following, The Egos, TV Land Live, The Holidays, and Swipe. Her film credits include Zombie with a Shotgun, Yield, Nick and Nicky, Sometimes Why, and Laid, as well as serving as co-producer on Theresa and Allison. She is thrilled to at last let her demon form show.

 

Willow Lautenberg as "2001 Heather" - Willow is an avid traveler & graduate of Emerson College (B.F.A Theatre & Performance, Writing minor). Bishop’s Cove marks her first lead role in a feature film! Willow has acted in films & commercials, though her roots are in the theatre. Her favorite theatrical credits include: Animal Farm (Clover); A Midsummer Night's Dream (Puck/Philostrate); Shrek, The Musical (Shoemaker's Elf); Tartuffe (Elmire). Film credits include: Clementine (April). Commercial projects include: Bank of America; Kiwi Botanicals; Staples. Last fall, she performed her one-woman show What It Means to Be Free at United Solo Theatre Festival, in NYC. She is also a professional singer & model. She sends hugs of gratitude to the cast & crew of Bishop’s Cove & love to her parents always.

Julie Anne Prescott as "Deputy McNulty" - Julie Anne was born and raised in the St. Petersburg, Florida area. She was inspired to pursue a career in the entertainment business at an early age. Her mother was a stay at home mom, and children's book / screenplay writer, who encouraged Julie to write and perform throughout her childhood and early teens. By the age of 20, Julie Anne had established herself as a spokesmodel (working with companies such as Troma Studios and Sony PlayStation), as well as a widely published alternative model appearing in such nationally distributed publications as Gothic Beauty Magazine. Soon after, she began performing small variety shows, as a way to have more action in her art. But stage performance was not enough for Julie Anne, she wanted to go even further and pursue full creative expression as an actress. Since accepting her first role, Julie Anne has been working non stop, both in front of the camera as well as behind the scenes. Presently she has an impressive film resume, ranging from feature length films, award winning shorts, to nationally televised programs. As far as future goals, she is actively pursuing projects that will allow her to grow and strengthen her skills, and expand her resume into yet uncharted territory. With a strong work ethic, unlimited energy, and unequalled passion for the business, she is poised and determined to conquer her vision as well as simply enjoying the lifelong journey.

Sarah Schoofs as "Kristen" - Sarah Schoofs is an actor in NYC who loves to find the dark corners in film.  You can find her in Gut (Official selection of 20+ international film festivals;) Phobia, Ayla, Meme, Infernum & Theresa & Allison. Sarah Schoofs Official Website:  http://www.sarahschoofs.com/
Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/sarahtheactor

Rebecca Lauren as "2004 Barb" - Born and raised in a small town in New Hampshire, Rebecca discovered her passion for performing and the arts very young, and by the age of 9 already aspired to a life as an actor in NYC. She followed this dream participating in community theatre and then graduating with a BA in theatre and music from Drew University in 2014. Currently, Rebecca lives in Brooklyn and has enjoyed working all over the NYC area in different types of film productions from music videos, web series, commercials, shorts and indies including C. L. Squared Production’s 21st Century Demon Hunter. She is beyond excited and grateful for the opportunity to be a part of Bishop’s Cove.

Rebecca Rinehart as "2021 Barb" - Rebecca Rinehart is an emerging actress who has rapidly become a staple in the independent horror scene with her video and written coverage of the genre through her YouTube channel and various other horror news outlets. She can be seen in the upcoming films Cannibal Call Girls from Hell, Slumber Party Slaughter Party 2, and Sharkago (2020). She is also the co-writer, producer, and director of the The Embalmers.

Piyali Syam as Devi - Piyali Syam is an NYC based actress and writer. In addition to writing her own comedy sketches, she has appeared on the Oxygen Network, Animal Planet, Upworthy, and several projects on Amazon Prime. She is also a borderline obsessive cat mother.
Website www.piyalisyam.com

Linnea Gregg as "Rose" - Linnea Gregg was born and raised in Hawaii and graduated from the NYU Tisch School of the Arts. For her first feature, The God Inside My Ear, Linnea won Best Actress at the West Coast Horror and Shawna Shea Film Festivals. The film went on to secure a distribution contract with Gravitas Ventures, and can now be viewed on Amazon Prime.
Linnea’s second feature The Night They Knocked premiered at the NJ Horror Con, last Fall. Her third film, Sister Tempest, is set to be released this spring.

Brian Clayton as "Greg" - Brian Clayton is an actor, producer, singer songwriter, musician and original country artist that has been recording and touring since 2001. Over the past 10 years, he has released 2 CD’s and received extensive nationwide radio airplay. In 2017 his placement of original song 'She Let Me Go' was featured in the Amazon Studios/Lionsgate feature film The Big Sick starring Kumail Nanjiani, Ray Romano and Holly Hunter. Brian Clayton and his band the Green River Band was a regular performer with over 45 shows at the Opry City Stage (NYC). In 2009, BC and GRB had the pleasure of performing with, and backing, the late great country legend Little Jimmy Dickens.


In addition, Brian can be seen acting on such shows as Blue Bloods, Madam Secretary, New Amsterdam, FX's Fosse-Verdon story and Showtime’s Loudest Voice starring Russell Crowe. His most recent work was starring in an episode of On the Case with Paula Zahn where he performs and re-creates a murder in Arizona, circa 1992
​
Website: http://www.brianclayton.com/
Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/brianclaytonandthegree...
Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbPVyAMDqbT-zM...
Original song in the feature film The Big Sick (2017)
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R5_78OSie8k

Filia Luna as "Abbie" - Filia is an Actor, Model, Dancer, Musician and Bartender born and raised in New York. She started Acting 2 years ago. Filia dances for events, parties and festivals.
She also plays Bass, Guitar and vocals.

Jesslyn Blue as "Zahra" - As an artist, Jesslyn Blue is multi-talented: writer, poet, actor, model, and tarot reader. She was born in Neptune, NJ, and has a B.A. in English from Rutgers University. She is the author of C’est La Vie: The 2nd Ed., an eclectic collection of poems available on Amazon. Previous films include the short film One Take Poet Series (2018) Dir. Yuri Alves, that highlighted her original poem and reimagined it as a heart-wrenching monologue; followed by Phosphene (2019) Dir. Byran Riberio, about the strange, connected occurrences surrounding artists, drugs, and the nine-five. She recently wrapped the short film Thrupple (TBA) Dir. Damion Lee, among other projects to be announced. Currently, she resides in New York City, counting her blessings, flipping tarot cards, and watching reruns of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

McKylin Rowe as "William" - McKylin Rowe is a young New York based actor,  trained in various acting theories such as Meisner, animal, Strasberg and improvisation. Having  played roles ranging from Benedick in Much Ado About Nothing to Doug in Gruesome Playground Injuries, McKylin believes storytelling is one of our most ubiquitous art forms and one that he loves dearly

Caitlin Ross-Poteet as "The Heartless"

Rob House as "The Ceaseless" - Robert played college football at Delaware State University, where his career was ended due to a horrific shoulder injury. After college and some strenuous rehabilitation, he returned to football and went on to play semi-professional football for the Brooklyn Mariners. He earned a starting position at defensive end and played there for two seasons. After football life, Robert worked as personal security for Sean "Puffy" Combs, The LOX, Lil Kim and various other artists and performers. After a brief stint in stand-up comedy, Robert tripped and fell into acting. His first co-starring role was playing Lil' Unkle, a played out and disgruntle rapper in the short film Young Flaccid Gonna Die, which won the creative excellence award in The Tribeca Film Festival.

MORE CAST TO BE ANNOUNCED IN 2021!!

There are a couple name actors, in the realm of indie horror, we are looking to get into the film, but we can't announce them yet. BUT if this campaign is successful, their announcement will be the bloody icing on the very fleshy cake that is Bishop's Cove! 
 

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way you can help is by making a contribution. But if you can't, share this campaign with others. Spread the word, tell your friends, subscribe to our Instagram at @bishops_cove, visit our Facebook at @bishopscove. The more people know about us, the better a chance we will have of reaching our funding goal.
story_txt:
Bishop's Cove is a Horror Film That Does Not Compromise
Bishop's Cove is a dark and disturbing horror film, in the vein of Hellraiser, with aspects of Silent Hill and Requiem for a Dream mixed in. Written and directed by Charles D. Lincoln, it is a tale of Heather, played in 2020 by Emily McKinley Hill, and in 2001 by Willow Lautenberg, a successful architect with a loving fiancee, Kristen, played by Sarah Schoofs, and a happy life. A happy life she has built upon the ashes of her past, where she was a homeless squatter punk, living on streets of NYC, addicted to heroin, and in love with Catalonia, played by Anna Paulette. One day, Heather's bliss is shattered at the news that Cat, whom she hadn't heard from in over 15 years, has passed away. Heather is then asked to travel to the small upstate New York town Cat grew up in, Bishop's Cove, to deliver the ashes. While there, Heather will be confronted by demons both personal and, in the form of The Nameless, played by Chelsea LeSage, very very literal. Now, more than Heather's perfect life is in danger. Her soul is too. 
Two years ago, we tried to get the project off the ground with the help of some investors. It appeared everything would be progressing smoothly until, right before shooting was to begin, they started asking for changes. Changes that we were not comfortable making because they would have changed the very nature of what we were trying to do. Can we make Catalonia a man? Can we take out the grittiness? Can we tone down the gore?
So many compromises were asked of us that it no longer felt like we'd be telling the same story, so we waited until we could afford to start it up on our own and in 2019, the time felt right. We have shot probably 30% of the film, out of pocket and with the help of friends and family. And most importantly, we've been doing it our way!
Here is the NSFW Hellscape scene we've been able to film along with a trailer of some of the "real world" scenes we've done. Keep in mind the score is temporary. But the scene will give you an idea of where we will go and what to expect in the completed film. 

 

BUT MOVIES ARE EXPENSIVE AND TO DO THIS RIGHT, WE NEED YOUR HELP!!

We are asking for $20,000 to help pay for practical effects in several hellish scenes. We have been working with makeup artists Shannon Rae Mulligan and Leona Ross, as well as the SFX prop house Design to Deceive. We want to create a visually stunning yet upsetting hellscapes for Heather to find herself in. Upon entering Bishop's Cove, Heather is in danger both body and soul. Scenes filled with filth and gore, where hapless souls are stripped of their humanity and confronted by their worst fears. We have four to shoot, including a scene of Heather having to run naked across a hallway of broken glass while pursued by The Ceaseless, one of the Nameless' "associates," who drags a corpse behind it that it uses as a bludgeoning tool. Another involves Heather being wheeled through a derelict hospital surrounded by souls upon whom involuntary surgeries are being performed by another of the Nameless' "associates," The Heartless. Another involves Heather being confronted by a very macabre puppet show, where the corpses of her loved ones figure prominently.

Sketch of The Ceaseless, one of the demonic associates of The Nameless, played by Robert House

Sketch of The Heartless, played by Caitlin Ross-Poteet
But creating scenes like this won't be cheap for us. We are work quickly and we've made some great deals with Joshua Turi and the people at Design to Deceive, but to do these scenes properly, it will take more money than we can pay out of pocket. A typical day of shooting costs us $1,350 for our four person crew alone, and to do these effects, which we estimate will take place over several days of shooting, will require roughly $20,000. 

We want to be able to pay for props and prosthetics. Things like enough sugar glass to fill a hallway, prosthetic body parts, occasional studio rentals, latex injuries, gallons of fake blood all cost money. Sometimes, makeup is such a big job that an assistant needs to be hired. For the hospital set piece, we anticipate having to hire two assistants and devote Shannon and her assistant to the makeup of The Nameless, the Heartless, and their minions, while Leona and her assistant to makeup of Heather and the assembled suffering souls. Besides that, things like a proper gurney can cost around $520, not counting the additional fees required to make it look old and rusted.
Besides makeup, we want to be able pay cast and crew their regular rate. While Charles, as producer and director is not receiving any payment for his work on this until a distribution deal is made, camera, gaffer, sound, and PA all need to be paid. Actors are also paid for each day they work for us.  
We want to be able to be able to feed cast and crew. It is important that everybody be fed. In this age of Covid, extra precautions must also be taken to keep everyone safe. These can tack on additional fees. 

Practical effects are the key to making this film look the way we want it to look. It is very important to us that it not look cheesy or cheap and that parts that are supposed to terrify people do not cause them to laugh instead. As Indie filmmakers, we are used to doing a lot with a little and trust me, for some of the things we have in mind, $20,000 is very little.  If we don't get all of it, we'll still make things work to the best of our abilities, but cutting down some of our ideas may be very painful.
 
WHAT'S IN IT FOR YOU?
Besides being able to see a kickass horror film when it is done, we are offering a number of perks to those of you generous enough to contribute to our campaign.

Those of you who contribute up to $10 will be able to know that you've made something of a difference in the lives of a scrappy family of indie filmmakers, intent on doing something awesome. While one $10 contribution won't set the world on fire, it is a start and you can feel good about yourself for making it.
For $20, we will put your name in a special thanks section of the credits, letting the world know you support indie horror.
For $35, not only will we put your name in the credits, we'll also send you a digital download of the film when we have finished the festival circuit. We estimate this to be around September 2022, but if it's later, you'll still receive it.
Those who contribute $50 will receive a physical edition of the film, in their choice of DVD or Blu-Ray, as well as thanks in the credits. As with the digital download, this will only come after the film is done with the festival circuit.
Those that contribute $75 will get that DVD or Blu-Ray signed by Charles  D. Lincoln, Chelsea LeSage, Emily McKinley Hill, and Anna Paulette. Possibly some bigger stars, but no promises... Of course, these contributors will be on the credits thanks list.
Now, at $100, things start to get interesting. Those that contribute at $100 will not only receive a signed DVD or Blu-Ray and a place in the credits, but they will be able to play, at a time and date of our choosing, an online session of the asymmetrical horror game Dead by Daylight, being hunted by The Nameless herself, Chelsea LeSage. You must own the game already but due to the game's crossplay nature, it will not matter if you own it on Playstation, Xbox, PC, or Switch. She will hunt you and three other contributors down in a session. 
If you'd like to have the tables turned, at $200, you will not only receive the signed DVD or Blu-Ray, the place in the credits, but you'll be able to play a session of Dead by Daylight where you will be the killer and director/writer Charles D. Lincoln, and cast members Chelsea LeSage, Emily McKinley Hill, and Anna Paulette will all be survivors. You will get one chance to stop us from running the generators and escaping. Can you be a better hunter than The Nameless?
If you're feeling a bit adventurous, you can contribute $500, where the bad news is we won't be putting you in that special thanks list anymore.  The good news is that you will now be listed as an Associate Producer with full IMDB credit. On top of that, if you are able to travel to New York City (and pass a rapid Covid test after the proper waiting period), we will make you one of the tortured souls in one of our hell sequences. You too can be mutilated and mangled by the Nameless as part of our film! On top of that, you will receive the signed DVD or Blu-Ray!
At $750, you'll receive the same perks as those who contribute $500, but you'll also be allowed to keep one of the props from your scene! What will it be? Well, obviously, we won't know until you're here. But you will be able to keep one that'll go with your shiny new Associate Producer Credit and signed DVD or Blu Ray.
Finally, those who contribute at $1,000 will get the big one, if you're looking to be on the other side of the camera. Executive Producer credit. Not only will you greatly help us towards getting this thing done, you'll also have something you can use when getting involved in your own projects. Of course, you'll also get the signed DVD and Blu-Ray. Hell, you've earned it, at that point.


 
Risks & Challenges
Independent film is not easy. It's putting out fire after fire, but we have a great cast and we have a reliable crew that are battle tested in dealing with the challenges that we are faced with. Our budget is very small, compared to some of the stuff you'd see coming out of Hollywood. We are passionate about what we're doing and we've had years of experience to help us get past any hurdles that may come in our way. Our only hurdle right now is funding.
If we don't receive it, we have to cut down on the effects, we have to cut down on the scale of some of our ideas, and the people who ultimately suffer are you, the independent horror fan who gets deprived of the experience we want to provide for you. We want to give you the same feelings we got when we saw Hellraiser or Martyrs for the first time. We want to bring you something where you'll care about the characters as much as you will be horrified by the ordeals they go through. We want to give you a vision of hell that mainstream cinema would find too disturbing to show you. We know what we're doing and we know how to do it. All we need it you to give us the means to do so. With so many of the cast and crew out of work during these past few months of Covid, being able to move ahead with funding and with drive will be exactly what we need and what we put together will be exactly what you need: an uncompromising piece of horror cinema, the likes of which you haven't seen in years! But we can only do it with your help! Won't you help keep independent horror alive?

Meet the Cast and Crew
CREW

Charles D. Lincoln: Director, Writer, Producer, "J" - Charles D. Lincoln is an award-winning director, writer, producer, actor, writer, activist, novelist, musician, and co-founder of C. L. Squared Productions. Born in the infamous area of Manhattan known as Hell's Kitchen and raised in the sleepy suburban wastes of Long Island, the son of grindhouse and adult film legend, Fred J. Lincoln (Last House on the Left), he showed an affinity for the darker aspects of life from an early age, counting among his first movies horror classics like Alien, The Omen and Rosemary's Baby and his first novel read, Stephen King's Pet Sematary. He spent 12 years as a touring musician, doing vocals in the underground bands Dark Eden and Nemesis Imperium, sharing the stage with bands like Hanzel und Gretyl, the Genitorturers, Carnivore, Combichrist, and death rock luminaries, 45 Grave. He wrote a syndicated advice column called Ask the Reverend; hosted a MNN public access variety show called Denied Heaven: The TV Show; modeled for several dark-erotica/fetish websites, including pulp author, Christa Faust's long defunct necromantic dot com; and was responsible for many pieces of performance art in the more conservative corners of America.In 2009, after losing half of his hearing, he changed his focus to the worlds of both writing and film, co-authoring the autobiography of 1990's porn star Houston and completing his first novel, in the form of 21st Century Demon Hunter, which spawned a similarly titled webseries, now on Amazon Prime Video, which he both writes and directs. He wrote, produced, and played the character of Tony in the extreme vampire film Theresa & Allison (directed by prolific indie director Jeremiah Kipp), winner of Best Feature at Days of the Dead Atlanta 2019 and NJ Horror Con Spring 2019, as well as serving as assistant director, 2nd unit director, wardrobe, script supervisor, and casting director. Bishop's Cove will mark his feature film directorial debut.

Christopher Bye: Director of Photography - Christopher Bye is a NYC based cinematographer, photographer, and producer. His work has been featured in galleries nationwide, and he has completed projects for Mercedes-Benz, Makerbot, Nike, Express, The Guggenheim Museum, NBC, Bravo, Lifetime, AMC, Ikea, Chase Bank, and many more over the years. Christopher has acted as director of photography on 6 feature films. Bye always strives to progress his work behind the camera, to make elevated imagery dynamic in every aspect. Christopher attended college at Temple University in Philadelphia, and Imperial College in London, UK.
 
Shannon Rae Mulligan: SFX makeup - After switching majors each year in college over 3 years at two different schools, Shannon decided to make a change.  She has a background of Business, Chemistry, and Fine Arts - which makes up her career path today.  She enrolled in Make-Up Designory in NYC, marking the start of her evolving passions.  Growing up watching horror and sci-if films, it was the making of creatures and gore effects that always intrigued her.  Now, Shannon is an IATSE Local 798 Makeup Artist working on top rated TV shows/Films and creating special makeup effects in her private FX Studio - making her dreams her reality.
 

Leona Ross: Hair, Makeup, SFX -  Having an interest in movies since a child, Leona always knew she wanted to be part of the magic. She attended school to learn SFX makeup so she can do just that! Jumping right into the industry, her favorite part of being a makeup artist is the details that her job requires that tie together the character. Without those details to keep you in the story, there is no magic.

Madison Humes: Assistant Director/Second Unit Director - Madison Humes grew up in Kentucky and was always into acting since age 3. She received her BA at Murray State University and continued her acting education, first at Stella Adler, then American Academy of Dramatic Arts (AADA) and on to graduating at The Neighborhood Playhouse in 2016. After graduating, she continued the grind. First meeting Charles Lincoln through an audition for the part of Desiree in 21st Century Demon Hunter. Since then, she has received a role in Even the Score, a feature coming out this summer, as well as making appearances on the Investigation Discover Channel shows Diabolical and The Deadliest Decade: 80's. Currently finishing up 21st Century Demon Hunter's Season 1.5. 
CAST

Emily McKinley Hill as "Heather" - With a strong foundation forged from theatre training at Savannah College of Art & Design and film training at New York Film Academy, Emily McKinley Hill has spent the past few years proving herself to be a force in indie film - including co-writing/producing/starring in coming-of-age mumblecore dramedy In Passing, working with controversial filmmaker Shane Ryan on gritty horror flick Ted Bundy Had A Son, and most recently making a dramatic turn in the award-winning Delaware Shore.

Anna Paulette as "Catalonia/Sabelia" - Anna Paulette was born in Calexico, CA, in a bordertown near Mexico, She grew up, raised by her single mother and her grandparents. She started her modeling career at the age of 15 and got discovered in Mexico at the age of 18 through a campaign for Sears Mexico. She started working as a model for nine years in LA, Mexico City, and New York City. She now lives in New York City fulfilling her acting career. You may recognize her through appearances on TV shows, including 21st Century Demon Hunter, where she first met director Charles D. Lincoln and co-star Chelsea LeSage. She’s excited for her latest film to release soon.

Nana Gouvea as "Marquesa Silva"
Nana Gouvea is a Brazilian beauty whose career spans television, film, modeling, and production, through her company, Black Wave Enterprises. Born in Jatai, a small town in Midwest Brazil, to a civil lawyer father and homemaker mother, she was discovered, at the age of 10 by a modeling agency scout, beginning a successful career in modeling for some of Brazil's most well-known brands. By the age of 17 she appeared in commercials for top products such as Ellus, Forum, Sao Paulo Alpargatas, De Millus, Zoomp, among others.
 
By the age of 19, considered one of Rio's top models, she was determined to transition into acting, attending the prestigious university, Faculdade da Cidade. Before long she was landing principal roles in a slew of well-known TV shows.
 
After college her acting career really took off: highlights include starring as Pantera do Faustao in "Domingao do Faustao" in TV Globo (1996); she was the host of "Domingo Milionario" on TV Manchete (1997), where she was a regular star on "Banheira do Gugu" on SBT (1998-99); starring in many of TV Globo's network series such as "Amigos,"(2000), "Megaton"(2000), in the telenovella "Porto dos Milagres" as Lindinha in 2001; in the comedic TV Series "A Turma do Didi" as a regular role (2001 to 2007); in 2004 she did "Sob Nova Direcao" for TV Globo; in 2006 she did "JK", a TV Globo Mini-series as "Ninon Vesuvio" and "Bicho do Mato" for TV Record (2006); in 2007 as a series regular in TV Series "Amazonia: De Galvez a Chico Mendez" for TV Globo; in 2008, she did "Faca a sua Historia" (TV Globo) and "Lendas Urbanas," on SBT; More recently, in April 2011, Nana starred in the popular soap, "Araguaia" for TV Glo as the charismatic "Jamila". In addition "SOS Emergencia (2010)."
 
In 2010, Conspiracao Filmes produced the TV special "True Stories" about beautiful women, which starred Nana as one of the main women featured. Made for E Entertainment Television, it was broadcast internationally and in the USA. That year, Nana also starred in a popular sitcom "Vendemos Cadeiras" and was a judge in the reality show "Casa Bonita" on the Multishow Network. And in March 2011 Nana made her theatrical debut in Rio in a new musical version of the classic Greek comedy "Lysistrata," , demonstrating talents not only in acting but in singing and dancing as well.
 
In the fall of 2011, Nana's life and career pivoted to New York City. In 2016, Nana became the lead actress and producer in the Sci-fi/horror feature film "Black Wake," also starring Tom Sizemore and Eric Roberts; in 2017, she landed a series regular role on the Japanese TV series "Otona no Kiso Eigo" as the beautiful Isabella; and in 2019, she released the feature film Linea de Sangre, from the director Garfield Boston.
 
With this substantial body of work, it's no surprise that Nana has become one of Brazil's most recognized personalities. She was named Carnival Queen 13 times in Rio, a record. A model, mother, and entrepreneur, she has also graced the cover and pages of countless Brazilian and Portuguese magazines including tabloids, beauty, health and style magazines and even Playboy.

Chelsea LeSage as "The Nameless" - A Massachusetts native, Chelsea LeSage is co-founder of C. L. Squared Productions, as well as the star of 21st Century Demon Hunter, where she plays the character of Julie . Appearing in countless commercials, her other television credits include The Following, The Egos, TV Land Live, The Holidays, and Swipe. Her film credits include Zombie with a Shotgun, Yield, Nick and Nicky, Sometimes Why, and Laid, as well as serving as co-producer on Theresa and Allison. She is thrilled to at last let her demon form show.
 

Willow Lautenberg as "2001 Heather" - Willow is an avid traveler & graduate of Emerson College (B.F.A Theatre & Performance, Writing minor). Bishop’s Cove marks her first lead role in a feature film! Willow has acted in films & commercials, though her roots are in the theatre. Her favorite theatrical credits include: Animal Farm (Clover); A Midsummer Night's Dream (Puck/Philostrate); Shrek, The Musical (Shoemaker's Elf); Tartuffe (Elmire). Film credits include: Clementine (April). Commercial projects include: Bank of America; Kiwi Botanicals; Staples. Last fall, she performed her one-woman show What It Means to Be Free at United Solo Theatre Festival, in NYC. She is also a professional singer & model. She sends hugs of gratitude to the cast & crew of Bishop’s Cove & love to her parents always.

Julie Anne Prescott as "Deputy McNulty" - Julie Anne was born and raised in the St. Petersburg, Florida area. She was inspired to pursue a career in the entertainment business at an early age. Her mother was a stay at home mom, and children's book / screenplay writer, who encouraged Julie to write and perform throughout her childhood and early teens. By the age of 20, Julie Anne had established herself as a spokesmodel (working with companies such as Troma Studios and Sony PlayStation), as well as a widely published alternative model appearing in such nationally distributed publications as Gothic Beauty Magazine. Soon after, she began performing small variety shows, as a way to have more action in her art. But stage performance was not enough for Julie Anne, she wanted to go even further and pursue full creative expression as an actress. Since accepting her first role, Julie Anne has been working non stop, both in front of the camera as well as behind the scenes. Presently she has an impressive film resume, ranging from feature length films, award winning shorts, to nationally televised programs. As far as future goals, she is actively pursuing projects that will allow her to grow and strengthen her skills, and expand her resume into yet uncharted territory. With a strong work ethic, unlimited energy, and unequalled passion for the business, she is poised and determined to conquer her vision as well as simply enjoying the lifelong journey.

Sarah Schoofs as "Kristen" - Sarah Schoofs is an actor in NYC who loves to find the dark corners in film.  You can find her in Gut (Official selection of 20+ international film festivals;) Phobia, Ayla, Meme, Infernum & Theresa & Allison. Sarah Schoofs Official Website:  http://www.sarahschoofs.com/Facebook:  https://www.facebook.com/sarahtheactor

Rebecca Lauren as "2004 Barb" - Born and raised in a small town in New Hampshire, Rebecca discovered her passion for performing and the arts very young, and by the age of 9 already aspired to a life as an actor in NYC. She followed this dream participating in community theatre and then graduating with a BA in theatre and music from Drew University in 2014. Currently, Rebecca lives in Brooklyn and has enjoyed working all over the NYC area in different types of film productions from music videos, web series, commercials, shorts and indies including C. L. Squared Production’s 21st Century Demon Hunter. She is beyond excited and grateful for the opportunity to be a part of Bishop’s Cove.

Rebecca Rinehart as "2021 Barb" - Rebecca Rinehart is an emerging actress who has rapidly become a staple in the independent horror scene with her video and written coverage of the genre through her YouTube channel and various other horror news outlets. She can be seen in the upcoming films Cannibal Call Girls from Hell, Slumber Party Slaughter Party 2, and Sharkago (2020). She is also the co-writer, producer, and director of the The Embalmers.

Piyali Syam as Devi - Piyali Syam is an NYC based actress and writer. In addition to writing her own comedy sketches, she has appeared on the Oxygen Network, Animal Planet, Upworthy, and several projects on Amazon Prime. She is also a borderline obsessive cat mother.Website www.piyalisyam.com

Linnea Gregg as "Rose" - Linnea Gregg was born and raised in Hawaii and graduated from the NYU Tisch School of the Arts. For her first feature, The God Inside My Ear, Linnea won Best Actress at the West Coast Horror and Shawna Shea Film Festivals. The film went on to secure a distribution contract with Gravitas Ventures, and can now be viewed on Amazon Prime.Linnea’s second feature The Night They Knocked premiered at the NJ Horror Con, last Fall. Her third film, Sister Tempest, is set to be released this spring.

Brian Clayton as "Greg" - Brian Clayton is an actor, producer, singer songwriter, musician and original country artist that has been recording and touring since 2001. Over the past 10 years, he has released 2 CD’s and received extensive nationwide radio airplay. In 2017 his placement of original song 'She Let Me Go' was featured in the Amazon Studios/Lionsgate feature film The Big Sick starring Kumail Nanjiani, Ray Romano and Holly Hunter. Brian Clayton and his band the Green River Band was a regular performer with over 45 shows at the Opry City Stage (NYC). In 2009, BC and GRB had the pleasure of performing with, and backing, the late great country legend Little Jimmy Dickens.
In addition, Brian can be seen acting on such shows as Blue Bloods, Madam Secretary, New Amsterdam, FX's Fosse-Verdon story and Showtime’s Loudest Voice starring Russell Crowe. His most recent work was starring in an episode of On the Case with Paula Zahn where he performs and re-creates a murder in Arizona, circa 1992​Website: http://www.brianclayton.com/Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/brianclaytonandthegree...Youtube Channel: https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCbPVyAMDqbT-zM...Original song in the feature film The Big Sick (2017)https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R5_78OSie8k

Filia Luna as "Abbie" - Filia is an Actor, Model, Dancer, Musician and Bartender born and raised in New York. She started Acting 2 years ago. Filia dances for events, parties and festivals.She also plays Bass, Guitar and vocals.

Jesslyn Blue as "Zahra" - As an artist, Jesslyn Blue is multi-talented: writer, poet, actor, model, and tarot reader. She was born in Neptune, NJ, and has a B.A. in English from Rutgers University. She is the author of C’est La Vie: The 2nd Ed., an eclectic collection of poems available on Amazon. Previous films include the short film One Take Poet Series (2018) Dir. Yuri Alves, that highlighted her original poem and reimagined it as a heart-wrenching monologue; followed by Phosphene (2019) Dir. Byran Riberio, about the strange, connected occurrences surrounding artists, drugs, and the nine-five. She recently wrapped the short film Thrupple (TBA) Dir. Damion Lee, among other projects to be announced. Currently, she resides in New York City, counting her blessings, flipping tarot cards, and watching reruns of Buffy the Vampire Slayer.

McKylin Rowe as "William" - McKylin Rowe is a young New York based actor,  trained in various acting theories such as Meisner, animal, Strasberg and improvisation. Having  played roles ranging from Benedick in Much Ado About Nothing to Doug in Gruesome Playground Injuries, McKylin believes storytelling is one of our most ubiquitous art forms and one that he loves dearly

Caitlin Ross-Poteet as "The Heartless"

Rob House as "The Ceaseless" - Robert played college football at Delaware State University, where his career was ended due to a horrific shoulder injury. After college and some strenuous rehabilitation, he returned to football and went on to play semi-professional football for the Brooklyn Mariners. He earned a starting position at defensive end and played there for two seasons. After football life, Robert worked as personal security for Sean "Puffy" Combs, The LOX, Lil Kim and various other artists and performers. After a brief stint in stand-up comedy, Robert tripped and fell into acting. His first co-starring role was playing Lil' Unkle, a played out and disgruntle rapper in the short film Young Flaccid Gonna Die, which won the creative excellence award in The Tribeca Film Festival.
MORE CAST TO BE ANNOUNCED IN 2021!!
There are a couple name actors, in the realm of indie horror, we are looking to get into the film, but we can't announce them yet. BUT if this campaign is successful, their announcement will be the bloody icing on the very fleshy cake that is Bishop's Cove!  
Other Ways You Can Help
The best way you can help is by making a contribution. But if you can't, share this campaign with others. Spread the word, tell your friends, subscribe to our Instagram at @bishops_cove, visit our Facebook at @bishopscove. The more people know about us, the better a chance we will have of reaching our funding goal.

story:
Short Summary

This film project  addresses PTSD, Poverty, Gang Crime, Infidelity, and Single Parenthood.

This isn't just a film, for entertainment sake. This is a film that is thought provoking and handles real issues that are around us. This film is about understanding the choices we make, and the consequences we face after.

This film has already won Best Script (unrealized), Award Nominated, Semi-Finalist, and Official Selection at mainstream Film Festivals.

The plot:

Max, mid-30's just got back from his tour in Iraq. He returns to his unfaithful wife, Sarah, early 30's. Sarah is an unsatisfied wife, who took comfort in Max's best friend Daniel, mid 30's. Daniel, is a guy trying to make his way to the top which leaves him having to fire Harry, mid 50's. Harry, was about to reach the top of the corporate ladder before he was let go. He lost his home, and had to get used to a park bench being his humble abode. He is only wish is to see his daughter again after a lifetime of being apart. Laura, early 20's, pregnant, no job, living in a dump, she is in love with her troublesome boyfriend, Jake, and is eager for him to leave a gang. Jake, sees no way out, and at such a young age of 22, only sees a life of crime as a solution.

This film is about life, love, survival,  tragic circumstances, and accepting how it is...

 

What We Need & What You Get

The ideal funding is to make 100% of what is needed to make the production. Our goal is £2,500.

This will go to the following:

Venue/studio hire

Payment to cast and crew members

Catering/expenses

Post-production work

The intention is to also donate some of the money to charities that will help rebuild communities that face these issues.

Anyone who donates a minimum of £20.00 will receive a copy of the original script.

Anything beyond £30.00 will receive the script and a digital copy of the film.

Anything beyond £40.00, will receive, the script, digital copy of the film, and a copy of the soundtrack which includes tracks by J.Worm Rockwell and others.

Want to be an Executive producer - donate £800.00 and get your name attached to this movie!

!!EVERY SINGLE DONATION FROM £1.00 RECEIVES A "THANK YOU" IN THE CREDITS!!

If we do not reach the entire goal, it will go to cover expenses, but we will still honor the perks for each person who donates and a "thank you" is still included.

Risks & Challenges

Obstacles we may face not achieving this production would really only be due to COVID-19 issues, however we have alternative plans for this and the production dates (August) were planned so that restrictions would not be in place to ensure a smooth running.

Other risks could be that an actor gets sick on the day and we cannot shoot, or the venue shuts down. These are all very drastic risks, but highly unlikely.

To avoid issues say like COVID-19 - we have stipulated that all actors take a rapid flow test at least 24hours before production takes place. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot donate - please do share the link to this crowdfunding campaign. We really appreciate everyone's involvement.

story:
The Film

Set during the COVID-19 pandemic, Wuhan Driver is a narrative short film that offers a subtle yet unflinching glance at a night in the life of a Chinese man driving Uber in New York.

Our protagonist, Zhang, is all by himself but still powers through: he has no other choice. He crisscrosses the barren landscape of a city in lockdown, picking up various passengers, coming into contact with paranoia and prejudice, entangled in life during this era of anxiety.

This film aims to shed light on this reality in order to better understand the hardships that essential workers go through during the pandemic. Through this, we can have more compassion for those different from ourselves.

Here's a few words from our executive producer, Jonathan Sanger.


 

Our Team

Tiger Ji
Writer / Director

Tiger is a film and theatre director from Hong Kong. At age sixteen he wrote, directed, and co-produced his first feature film, Pluto, which went on to screen at over 30 film festivals worldwide and won 18 awards and nominations. Tiger has studied under acclaimed filmmaker Lucrecia Martel, worked for trailblazer theatre director Elizabeth LeCompte. This film will be his most technically elaborate and ambitious to date.

See his work here.
 

Jonathan Sanger
Executive Producer



Renowned for his work with legendary filmmaker David Lynch in The Elephant Man, Jonathan is an Academy Award winning producer and director of major films, television series, and theatrical productions. Other names he's collaborated with include Tom Cruise, Mel Brooks, and Chadwick Boseman.

You can find his long list of credits here.
 

Alena Svyatova
Producer

Alena's films have premiered at Tribeca FF, New York Film Festival, Cinequest, Seattle FF, and Outfest; screened theatrically in multiple cities, and went on to broadcast and streaming platforms. Her focus is on finding unique stories told in captivating ways, as she diligently guides filmmakers from conception through sales. Alena currently has four narrative films in development, and a series under a shopping contract. 

See her work here.
 

Britney Ngaw
Associate Producer

Britney Ngaw is a New York-based filmmaker from Toronto, Canada. Her works have been showcased worldwide at the Victoria Film Festival, the Toronto International Film Festival, the Festival de Cinema Escolar de Alvorada, the Berlin Flash Film Festival, and more. Inspired by Film4 Productions, she aspires to create long form dark comedic content. She currently studies at NYU Tisch School for the Arts.

See her work here.
 

What's In It For You?

Aside from the perks and rewards that come from your support, you will be a part of telling an important and relevant story.

During this era, we all find ourselves stuck inside our homes in avoiding a fatal virus. But what about those who don't have the afforded privilege to work from home? What about those people have no choice but to venture outside and risk everything?

As said by this particular Chinese Uber driver: "You risk your life to make money, but you might not live to spend it."


This movie aims to touch upon this very issue, by telling a deeply human story. And with your help, we can hopefully shed a little more light on the darkness that seems to have enveloped all of us during this era.

 

Director's Statement

In order to tell the most honest and relevant story, the film must be a realistic depiction of our current times. There is no rose-tinted window through which many filmmakers depict our world. It's not a film that tries to distract you through excessive violence and fast paced action sequences — it aims to tell us the truth, raw and unfiltered.

It’s about something very simple: a man and his everyday struggles. 

I believe it's only through adopting the approach of Neorealist cinema —  telling it as it is, then allowing the audience the liberty to draw their own conclusions — that we can truly empathize with the experiences of a person totally different from ourselves. 

Ultimately, I think making this short film will be, for me, a journey toward understanding each other better: a journey we're all taking.
 

Our Budget

Your funds will become a portion of our total production budget.

Our team has a very precise vision for Wuhan Driver that includes many expensive elements that are integral to the story. We're therefore asking for your support!

On top of normal productions expenses for a street shoot in New York City, extra precautions will be taken to ensure the safety of our cast and crew during the pandemic. This means that extra funding will be needed to orchestrate every moving part of our production.

Here is a breakdown of our production expenses, and where your money will go:

 

 

 

Production & Safety

Our shoot is set to take place early November 2020. In spite of our ambition for making this short film, our team fully acknowledges the prevalence of the pandemic and sees it as an utmost importance to keep our cast and crew safe at all times.

Our production will strictly follow COVID-19 guidelines.

According to New York State's Interim Guidance for media production, testing will be required before entering and leaving the set on all shoot days.

Face covering will be mandatory for our crew and cast.

Our crew will practice social distancing at all times.

 

/////////

 

For further interest in becoming a financier of this film, or inquiries about seeing more of our work, email us here: wuhandriver@gmail.com

Our crew will practice social distancing at all times.
