story:
Short Summary

About Us

My name is Reece Lipman and I am a writer, director and filmmaker. Along with my producers Max Marlow and Niccolò Cioni, I have been working for 2 years to get our short film Ice Cream and Doughnuts made. The film stars Jamael Westman (Hamilton - West End) and Anita Joy Uwajeh (Cyrano De Bergerac - West End). With the film shot, we are now at the final hurdle and just need your help to get us over the line!

The money raised from this campaign will go towards post production costs and future festival entries, as well as re-paying some of our production costs. We will also be donating 20% of the funding we receive to the Theatre Arts Fund, providing short-term relief for hundreds of theatre workers and freelancers across the UK, and particularly those from underrepresented groups disproportionately affected by the Coronavirus crisis.

 

Plot

It’s a sunny afternoon in a small British coastal town and Robbie (29) and Emily (27) are at the apex of that magical first 6 months of a relationship where every moment is an adventure and they know they’re on the cusp of something special. But as talk turns to the future and the excitement of planning what comes next, the first cracks start to appear. For Robbie the future means building a life and a family with Emily. But Emily dreams of leaving that town and of ‘being more’. She has struggled, fighting tragedy and society’s expectations with the goal of one day achieving everything she wants to in life, and she is determined to get there. 

Life is more fun when they’re together, they know that for a fact. But are these dreams ultimately compatible. Is being in love enough to hold a relationship together?

 

Cast

Jamael Westman - Robbie

Jamael is best known for playing Alexander Hamilton in Lin-Manuel Miranda's multi-award winning show ‘Hamilton’ in its original West End cast. He was nominated for Best Actor at the 2018 Olivier Awards for this role. He is due to appear as Hamilton again at The Pantages Theatre in LA.

 

Anita Joy Uwajeh - Emily

Anita is an incredibly experienced theatre actor, having appeared in multiple West End productions, including most recently ‘Cyrano De Bergerac’, alongside James McAvoy and ‘King Lear’ alongside Sir Ian McKellen. An incredible talent, Anita-Joy is set for big things in the future.

 

 

Where are we / Project History

Principal Photography for Ice Cream and Doughnuts took place in Worthing over the weekend of 18-20th September 2020. With a cast and crew of 15 people, and against the backdrop of COVID-19 we undertook probably one of the most logistically challenging shoots any of us have been a part of. 

A completely united crew, we were excited and happy to be able to get back to work again after a particularly difficult year for us all. And what we came back with was some beautiful shots and the makings of a very special film.

We are now entering the post production phase as our baby finally nears completion.

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Due to COVID-19 the funding that we had been hoping to receive prior to filming fell through. This left us in a daunting position but it felt wrong to let the incredible cast and crew we had assembled go at a time when there was no other work going. So we decided to push on and try to create something beautiful in a year that has been anything but. 

And so now, with the shoot all complete and with just post ahead of us we need that final push across the line. As well as raising some funds to hopefully cover some of the production outlays, the funding we are looking for will be put towards editing, grading, post-production sound and, ultimately, advertising and festival applications. 

In return, aside from the warm fuzzy feeling of helping us to create this film, we are offering a number of excellent perks including:

  • Exclusive Thank You Video from those involved in making the film.
  • Exclusive download of the original song "Ice Cream and Doughnuts" performed live by Jamael Westman in the film.
  • Private viewing link of the film (available to watch online for a limited time when completed)
  • A digital copy of the script with further detailed information and directors notes from Writer/Director Reece Lipman
  • Executive Producer credits.
  • And more!
 

Help Us, Help Others

So many people across film, theatre, music and the creative arts have struggled this year due to lockdowns, lack of government help and the lack of any work. This industry is more than a job for most of us. It’s how we put food on the table, but also how we breath, how we live and how we interact with the world around us.

So, from whatever you donate to help us complete and distribute our film, 20% will be donated to the Theatre Artist’s Fund which has been set up to provide emergency support for theatre workers and freelancers across the UK. Their ambition for the fund is to provide short-term relief for hundreds of theatre workers and freelancers across the UK, and particularly those from underrepresented groups disproportionately affected by the crisis. 

 

How the Money will be Spent

Contributions will go towards -

Re-Paying Production costs

  • Kit hire - camera, lenses, grip
  • Location Costs
  • Crew costs - food, travel & wages
  • Hard drives for file storage and editing
  • COVID safety costs (including PPE)

Post-Production

  • Editing
  • Colour Grading
  • Music and Sound Design
  • Creating files for festival distribution

Festival Submission

  • Most festivals can cost up to £60 to enter (with no guarantee your film will be chosen) so the costs can rack up fast. But they are the best way to garner industry recognition and to get the film out there and seen so are a vital part of the process. The more we raise, the more festivals we can get in to!

Charity donation

  • 20% of our funding will be donated to the Theatre Artist’s Fund which has been set up to provide emergency support for theatre workers and freelancers across the UK. 

 

 

The Team

 

Lead Crew / Creatives

 

Reece Lipman - Director & Writer

Working in the film industry full time for 10 years, as a storyteller Reece is interested in people, relationships and life. He has worked across short films, music videos and documentaries over his career. His work is often eye catching but always designed to be something to which you can emotionally connect. It is stories of love, of growing up and of finding your place in the world which interest him most.  In 2017 Ingenious Media awarded Reece a development grant for a feature film proposal We Fell In Love Whilst the World Fell Apart, a film about 2 people trapped together in the highly unlikely situation of a massive national lockdown occurs. Go figure. 

 

Niccolò Cioni - Producer

Niccolò is a production professional with over 15 years of experience working across the Film, TV and Advertising industries. During this time his work has included evaluating scripts, budgets and financial plans as well as developing production and financing strategies for a large range of both TV and film productions. 

Since 2014 Niccolò has been producing commercials and corporate films, supporting the development of films for companies such as Scott Free, Ingenious Media and Red Arrow International as well as working in art projects and events.

Niccolò and writer/director Reece Lipman have known each other for 10yrs, first meeting when Reece was a Production Assistant. Ice Creams and Doughnuts is their second collaboration, the first being short film Heartburst (2017)

 

Max Marlow - Producer

Max is a London-based writer and producer of short films, who, after several years of industry experience with the likes of StudioCanal and Paramount Pictures, now works primarily as an industry freelancer. Max’s most recent credits include Assets Assistant on Star Wars: The Rise of Skywalker (2019), and Visual Effects Production Assistant on the upcoming Matthew Vaughn prequel, The King’s Man (2020). 

Max has written and produced several short film projects. One of which, ‘The Face of Chance’ (2015), was successful in receiving a win and six official selections at festivals internationally, including Los Angeles CineFest and Miami Independent Film Festival. During COVID-19, Max completed his first 3D-animated short with a team of animators from the Savannah College of Art and Design (USA), as well as producing the first project filmed in Hertfordshire since the beginning of lockdown - Vincent (2020).

 

Angela Zoe Neil - Director of Photography

Angela Neil is a London based DOP working in Fiction, Commercial and Documentary. She is a 2018 graduate from the NFTS where she received a dual scholarship from BAFTA and was one of the three Prince William Warner Bros scholars. She has a background in commercial photography and online content prior to working in Fiction. 

Recently Angela has completed a feature film with Sony and worked on new TV Drama series Queens of Mystery. Several of her films from 2018 have won at Academy Award entry level festivals. Her documentary film Abrazame was also nominated for an IDA award.

 

Risks & Challenges

With the film already shot, we have made it through the hardest and most expensive part of production and so we expect the risks of completing it to be minimal. We are already talking to people about post production and are looking to start as soon as possible with the aim of having the film completed and ready to go in the new year. We have budgeted accordingly and the money raised in this campaign will help push us forward smoothly. 

The biggest risk is that we fail to get into film festivals. This is always an unknown when producing a film, but if that route does fail we always have other options for distribution. However, we truly believe that we have a really special film on our hands, with an incredible cast and we are determined to get it seen as far and wide as we can do.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Any little helps but of course we understand that times are hard and for some a donation just isn't possible. But that doesn't mean you can't help.

  • We would massively appreciate any social media publicity or noise that you can make about this film and campaign.
  • Please share this page so that others might see it and get involved.
  • Watch out for future news and perhaps come along to a screening further down the line!

Follow us at:

Facebook - @IcecreamDoughnutsFilm

Twitter - @ICAD_film

Instagram - IcecreamDoughnutsFilm
story_txt:
Short Summary
About Us
My name is Reece Lipman and I am a writer, director and filmmaker. Along with my producers Max Marlow and Niccolò Cioni, I have been working for 2 years to get our short film Ice Cream and Doughnuts made. The film stars Jamael Westman (Hamilton - West End) and Anita Joy Uwajeh (Cyrano De Bergerac - West End). With the film shot, we are now at the final hurdle and just need your help to get us over the line!
The money raised from this campaign will go towards post production costs and future festival entries, as well as re-paying some of our production costs. We will also be donating 20% of the funding we receive to the Theatre Arts Fund, providing short-term relief for hundreds of theatre workers and freelancers across the UK, and particularly those from underrepresented groups disproportionately affected by the Coronavirus crisis.

 
Plot
It’s a sunny afternoon in a small British coastal town and Robbie (29) and Emily (27) are at the apex of that magical first 6 months of a relationship where every moment is an adventure and they know they’re on the cusp of something special. But as talk turns to the future and the excitement of planning what comes next, the first cracks start to appear. For Robbie the future means building a life and a family with Emily. But Emily dreams of leaving that town and of ‘being more’. She has struggled, fighting tragedy and society’s expectations with the goal of one day achieving everything she wants to in life, and she is determined to get there. 
Life is more fun when they’re together, they know that for a fact. But are these dreams ultimately compatible. Is being in love enough to hold a relationship together?
 
Cast
Jamael Westman - Robbie
Jamael is best known for playing Alexander Hamilton in Lin-Manuel Miranda's multi-award winning show ‘Hamilton’ in its original West End cast. He was nominated for Best Actor at the 2018 Olivier Awards for this role. He is due to appear as Hamilton again at The Pantages Theatre in LA. Anita Joy Uwajeh - Emily
Anita is an incredibly experienced theatre actor, having appeared in multiple West End productions, including most recently ‘Cyrano De Bergerac’, alongside James McAvoy and ‘King Lear’ alongside Sir Ian McKellen. An incredible talent, Anita-Joy is set for big things in the future.
 

 
Where are we / Project History
Principal Photography for Ice Cream and Doughnuts took place in Worthing over the weekend of 18-20th September 2020. With a cast and crew of 15 people, and against the backdrop of COVID-19 we undertook probably one of the most logistically challenging shoots any of us have been a part of. 
A completely united crew, we were excited and happy to be able to get back to work again after a particularly difficult year for us all. And what we came back with was some beautiful shots and the makings of a very special film.
We are now entering the post production phase as our baby finally nears completion.
 

 

What We Need & What You Get
Due to COVID-19 the funding that we had been hoping to receive prior to filming fell through. This left us in a daunting position but it felt wrong to let the incredible cast and crew we had assembled go at a time when there was no other work going. So we decided to push on and try to create something beautiful in a year that has been anything but. 
And so now, with the shoot all complete and with just post ahead of us we need that final push across the line. As well as raising some funds to hopefully cover some of the production outlays, the funding we are looking for will be put towards editing, grading, post-production sound and, ultimately, advertising and festival applications. 
In return, aside from the warm fuzzy feeling of helping us to create this film, we are offering a number of excellent perks including:

Exclusive Thank You Video from those involved in making the film.
Exclusive download of the original song "Ice Cream and Doughnuts" performed live by Jamael Westman in the film.
Private viewing link of the film (available to watch online for a limited time when completed)
A digital copy of the script with further detailed information and directors notes from Writer/Director Reece Lipman
Executive Producer credits.
And more!
 Help Us, Help Others
So many people across film, theatre, music and the creative arts have struggled this year due to lockdowns, lack of government help and the lack of any work. This industry is more than a job for most of us. It’s how we put food on the table, but also how we breath, how we live and how we interact with the world around us.
So, from whatever you donate to help us complete and distribute our film, 20% will be donated to the Theatre Artist’s Fund which has been set up to provide emergency support for theatre workers and freelancers across the UK. Their ambition for the fund is to provide short-term relief for hundreds of theatre workers and freelancers across the UK, and particularly those from underrepresented groups disproportionately affected by the crisis.  How the Money will be Spent
Contributions will go towards -
Re-Paying Production costs

Kit hire - camera, lenses, grip
Location Costs
Crew costs - food, travel & wages
Hard drives for file storage and editing
COVID safety costs (including PPE)

Post-Production

Editing
Colour Grading
Music and Sound Design
Creating files for festival distribution

Most festivals can cost up to £60 to enter (with no guarantee your film will be chosen) so the costs can rack up fast. But they are the best way to garner industry recognition and to get the film out there and seen so are a vital part of the process. The more we raise, the more festivals we can get in to!

story:
What happens to a person when they run 150 miles through one of hottest and most remote regions in the United States in the middle of summer? More importantly, why would anyone do it?

The DESERT RATS film aims to find out, following numerous racers as they tackle the notorious 6-day Desert RATS race along the challenging Kokopeli Trail in Utah, documenting all the blow-ups, epiphanies, lost toe nails, heat exhaustion, and hallucinations of the participants as they seek the finish line.  

To support financially you can select a Perk from the menu on the right or you can share this campaign with your friends, family or community!

What is Desert RATS?  

Desert RATS is a small stage race, with a field of anywhere between 10-30 runners, spanning 140 miles and 6 days along the beautiful and remote Kokopelli Trail from Fruita, Colorado to Moab, Utah.

The nearly 20 year-old race, modeled on the legendary Marathon des Sables in Morocco, and the first race of its kind to take place on North American soil, takes place each year in June, in an effort to maximize the hardship on runners. Not only must participants run stages of 43, 38, and 26 miles along the way, they must do so in temperatures that regularly surpass a hundred degrees.

RATS is a small race with an intimacy which regularly creates deep and lifelong bonds between both those who run and crew the crushing endurance event. 

 

Themes the Film Will Explore

  • What does hardship do for a person? 
  • How does one make meaning of suffering?
  • How in the crucible of extreme endurance events, in that exceeding discomfort and pain, do we sometimes find an answer? 

This edition of Desert RATS, coming after so many people have suffered during the COVID epidemic, and are freighted with so much pent-up hardship, may be the most ideal one yet in which to pursue answers to this question.

 

Who are we?

Paul Scheuring (Director)

Paul has over twenty years of professional experience working as a writer, producer, and director, with credits such as the FOX smash TV hit Prison Break, which he created, and the Discovery miniseries Klondike, produced in winter high-country Banff.  Paul has filmed all over the world, in locations such as Croatia, India, and the Canadian Arctic. He is a two-time RATS finisher and has completed the venerable Marathon des Sables in Africa. In the 2018 edition of RATS, having run out of water in the middle of the hottest and longest day, he was surprised to find that sometimes epiphany visits itself upon those when they are suffering most. It is this theme he wants to explore in this film. 

James Adamson (Director of Photography)

James is a filmmaker based out of Breckenridge, Colorado, and is both the creator of Drop Media and an experienced, fully outfitted, outdoor filmmaker and adventure athlete. He is a highly trained mountaineer and has filmed in extreme environments all around the world for the likes of PBS, Google, Cisco, and Patron. James is an FAA certified Drone Pilot and has won the award for Best Film/ Director at Sacramento 10x10 Film Festival and Best Director of Photography, San Jose Film Race. He is a frequent visitor to the Kokopelli and has previously done documentary work on its challenging trails.

Chris Ward (Producer)

Chris is a two time Desert RATS finisher and winner of the 2019 edition of the race. Over the past four and a half years, he has produced over 244 episodes of his adventure sports podcast Like a Bigfoot, interviewing a wide variety of adventure athletes--including ten episodes with various crew members and racers that have survived Desert RATS. As it has for many of its racers, the race opened his eyes to his own potential, and its hardships have allowed him to access and process major grief in his life. It is also where Chris learned that sometimes perseverance in the desert is not only about mental toughness, but where one puts the ice cubes.   

Chris Cornejo (Production Assistant)

For almost 25 years Chris has spent his days in classrooms, museums, and the outdoors teaching and educating young minds, challenging them to be creative thinkers and to utilize their talents to express their ideas and learning.  Most days you can find him exploring and enjoying the natural world aboard a bike, snowboard, or his own 2 feet.  As a former video store employee in the mid and late 90s Chris has developed a life long love and passion for movies. When asked to be a part of this project he jumped at the opportunity and is excited for the challenges and adventures ahead.

 

An Ideal Collaboration

All filmmakers are accustomed to the hardships of difficult terrain and the unpredictable problems such terrain presents, and have gained a hard-fought understanding of the constant problem-solving and flexibility required in such environments. Their familiarity with the Kokopelli Trail will allow them to stake out the most majestic and brutal locations along the course, the places where racers will face their most trying moments--moments unfailingly ripe with the poignancy of personal illumination, catharsis, or ruin. In the end it is that human element that the filmmakers are after: what it is to face the impossible, and what this brings out in both a person and the small dust-beaten community of runner/seekers supporting them.

Previously established relationships with the race directors, crewmembers and a significant amount of the racers competing in 2021 promises a shorthand between runner and filmmaker that will yield a more authentic and available interface, and as such a deeper, more vulnerable, and more profound story to tell.

 

How can you support the film?

By contributing to this project you are helping us tell the very human story of the lessons learned when we push through the hard moments and joyfully soldier on despite the adversity. You are also highlighting the importance that adventure plays in our lives. 

All funds raised through this campaign will go directly towards the filming of the documentary, ensuring the quality of footage this adventure deserves.

You can be a part of the journey and help us reach our goal by selecting one of the perks on this page.

If you can't make a contribution, no worries at all! You can still help us out in many ways:

  • Emailing this campaign link to friends or family who you think would be interested in our film.
  • Sharing the project with your running buddies (the ultrarunning community is so incredibly gracious and we would love to grassroots this project with the people who appreciate these adventures the most).
  • Posting about this on your social media.
  • Do you have connections with an adventure sports company (local or national)? We'd love to get in contact with business who may be interested in this project! Send an email to likeabigfoot@gmail.com. 

Thank you so much to everyone who has checked out this page and to everyone who has supported us through the years!! We are exceedingly grateful for all of your support in any form and truly cannot wait for you to see this film!

story:
Short Summary

Pleasure to meet you.  We are the founders of The Secret Cup, Daniel de Sailles and Jeremy Norrie.  In a time when it was still mostly illegal, The Secret Cup was the only cannabis competition that decided an international champion of making concentrate commonly known as hash. We traveled the world going to different places and learning about the local cultures of cannabis. It was about showcasing the finest authentic achievements, forming a family and living an incredible adventure all while avoiding the long arm of the law.

During that time we filmed at many of the events and this began Jeremy's journey to become a Director/Producer of many documentary films.  Now  we finally have completed the documentary film about The Secret Cup that will be getting released soon to Amazon, FOX and CBS streaming platforms among others.

This campaign is for raising money to do advertising, marketing and promotion for the film.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise at least $5K to fund various marketing and advertising programs such as The Arsonist and October Sky as well as fund the fees to enter film festivals around the world.  This will help the film get the most exposure as possible at the start of the digital release and will help to generate more views and support from the platforms it is on.

As such we have created a few limited edition and one of a kind items that our supporters will be familiar with, especially if they have already been collecting merchandise from the events.  Some of our items have sold for hundreds of dollars to collectors since the end of the competitions.  Please help us by purchasing one or more of our items we have made available. 

The Impact

There are various companies that specialize in marketing independent films and documentaries.  We have used a few of them in the past but never all of them for one project, and the largest companies we have been saving up to work with.

This film has a huge amount of underground support because of the events authentic story and the family it formed all around the world.  We think with our combined efforts that this film can become one of the most popular films about the culture of cannabis ever to have been made. 

Risks

Normally we fund these campaigns entirely ourselves but for this effort we plan to match whatever is raised and really put together a professional marketing strategy for the film.

Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help the film succeed is to do any or all of these things as well once it is released

1) RATE THE FILM ON IMDB.COM

2) SHARE LINKS TO THE FILM WITH EVERYONE YOU KNOW, REPEATEDLY

3) WATCH THE FILM TO THE VERY END MULTIPLE TIMES

*You can help all of our films this way, visit TheSkyIsland.com to find them all.
story_txt:
Short Summary
Pleasure to meet you.  We are the founders of The Secret Cup, Daniel de Sailles and Jeremy Norrie.  In a time when it was still mostly illegal, The Secret Cup was the only cannabis competition that decided an international champion of making concentrate commonly known as hash. We traveled the world going to different places and learning about the local cultures of cannabis. It was about showcasing the finest authentic achievements, forming a family and living an incredible adventure all while avoiding the long arm of the law.
During that time we filmed at many of the events and this began Jeremy's journey to become a Director/Producer of many documentary films.  Now  we finally have completed the documentary film about The Secret Cup that will be getting released soon to Amazon, FOX and CBS streaming platforms among others.
This campaign is for raising money to do advertising, marketing and promotion for the film.

What We Need & What You Get
Our goal is to raise at least $5K to fund various marketing and advertising programs such as The Arsonist and October Sky as well as fund the fees to enter film festivals around the world.  This will help the film get the most exposure as possible at the start of the digital release and will help to generate more views and support from the platforms it is on.
As such we have created a few limited edition and one of a kind items that our supporters will be familiar with, especially if they have already been collecting merchandise from the events.  Some of our items have sold for hundreds of dollars to collectors since the end of the competitions.  Please help us by purchasing one or more of our items we have made available. 

The Impact
There are various companies that specialize in marketing independent films and documentaries.  We have used a few of them in the past but never all of them for one project, and the largest companies we have been saving up to work with.
This film has a huge amount of underground support because of the events authentic story and the family it formed all around the world.  We think with our combined efforts that this film can become one of the most popular films about the culture of cannabis ever to have been made. 
Risks
Normally we fund these campaigns entirely ourselves but for this effort we plan to match whatever is raised and really put together a professional marketing strategy for the film.
Other Ways You Can Help

The best way to help the film succeed is to do any or all of these things as well once it is released
1) RATE THE FILM ON IMDB.COM
2) SHARE LINKS TO THE FILM WITH EVERYONE YOU KNOW, REPEATEDLY
3) WATCH THE FILM TO THE VERY END MULTIPLE TIMES
*You can help all of our films this way, visit TheSkyIsland.com to find them all.

story:
Based on a true story:

Josh, an aspiring Chinese-American photographer, struggles to find peace in the wake of his mother's death. Roger, his elderly father, wants Josh to succeed, but because Josh struggles to make money off his photography, he often questions his son's career choice.

In an attempt to repair their strained relationship, Roger takes Josh on a camping trip. Events take a turn for the stranger when the two accidentally eat magic mushrooms. In their psychedelic state, father and son journey through the forest, discovering new emotional connections and healing old wounds.

I am One Pine, and the film One Pine symbolizes the growth of both me and my parents from independence to thriving independently. It is a story of the beginning of a fruitful partnership between me and my dad sparked by the realization that we have more in common than we may think.

This is not a story about what magic mushrooms can reveal, but rather this is a story about a commitment to love and legacy which is hidden behind the trauma of loss and isolation. It is a story which points to a breakdown in connection common in many immigrant families where parents who unknowingly experience loss of power in America encourage their children to pursue their dreams by themselves.

One Pine should be watched by both immigrant parents and their children to gain insight on their common family values, notice where communication may be ineffective, and be inspired to be in partnership. 

 

As many of us know and have experienced, the intergenerational divide in AAPI immigrant families is especially apparent when it comes to expressing love and affection. This truth is illustrated in the relationship between Roger and Josh, especially with relation to Josh’s career as a photographer. Though with good intention, Roger urges Josh to do something more “stable,” inevitably pushing Josh away in the process. 

Though not based on my life, there are several aspects of One Pine that are inextricably linked to my own experiences as a first generation Asian-American. As an aspiring artist who has yet to find financial stability on her own, I empathize with Josh’s shame at not being able to make a living off his art (a big “no no” in Asian culture). His desire for his father’s approval is what drives him, and his repressed anger at not living up to his father’s expectations is what I believe makes him a compelling protagonist.

In writing and directing this story, I hope not only to bring a chapter in Henry’s life--well--to life, but to infuse a bit of hope into this aspect of the AAPI experience. One Pine is the story of a father and son reconnecting over their shared grief--with a little help from magic mushrooms. Though psychedelics may or may not be involved in every attempt to bridge the AAPI parent/child divide, my wish is that open, honest communication, empathy, and genuine love are a good place to start working through intergenerational trauma in our community.

As children of immigrants and POC creatives, we aspire to see our stories represented on the big screen. We are looking to raise $15,000 to help us towards production. Your contribution, big or small, makes a huge impact on helping us making it to production. With your help, together we can: 

  • Amplify AAPI Voices - support the team of diverse filmmakers and the stories that represent us 
  • Fairly pay our crew and cast - artists who deserve to be paid 
  • Secure Equipment - in order to make this top of the line film, we need your help getting top of the line camera and lighting equipment. 
  • Catering and Crafty - Happy crew = Amazing Movie. Help us feed our amazing creatives during our weekend-long shoot. 
  • SAFETY - Help us keep our crew/cast safe on set with proper PPE and COVID protocol 
  • Other production costs: Travel costs, Props, insurance, and any surprises that might arise.

Every contribution helps us get a bit closer to our dream of making this film a reality. With your help, we’ll be able to film in LA by the end of October!

 

The shifts in Josh & Rogers’ relationship will be represented by the juxtaposition of color, framing and composition. It combines cinematic elements from film and television shows with a naturalistic style, like the films of Lulu Wang (The Farewell, Posthumous).

The colors begin monotone, but become more vibrant and saturated as the film progresses to reflect the changes in their relationship as father and son. Handheld movements during the beginning of the film will show the turbulence in Josh and Rogers’ relationship, while tripod and dolly movements show calmness. Since the film involves a psychedelic experience, I will also use a SnorriCam to visually show Josh & Rogers POV during their mushroom trip. The purpose is to draw the viewer into Josh’s world and to show Josh’s initial state of isolation and his eventual reconnection with Roger.

story:
Short Summary

One year after Mark tragically loses his wife, he spends a night with an old friend to distract himself. Through music and memories, Mark finds his closure. 

-Our lead actor, Phil Kadet is an established pianist in New York City. East End Productions wanted to create a short film that focuses on the beauty of music while touching on the hardships of coping with the death of a loved one. 

-East End Productions is an award-winning production company. Their recent pilot, Grinding Doubt, premiered at the New York City Independent Theatre Film Festival sponsored by the New Ohio Theatre, which was featured in the New York Times. It also won Best Series Pilot at the New York International Film Awards. Their second short film, Retract, premiered at the Big Apple Film Festival in Chelsea and had appeared on BricTV, an Emmy award-winning public access channel in Brooklyn. East End's first short film Dosed, won the audience award for Best Dramatic Short Film at the Manhattan Film Festival in 2019. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need $9,000 to make this film become a reality. Here is where the money goes.

  • High definition lenses, lights, camera equipment and production design. 
  • Post-production expenses include editing, sound design, composition, live musical recordings and color correction. 
  • We will also set aside money for COVID-19 precautions so our cast and crew are safe and healthy on set. 
  • Money raised will also be allocated for film festival submissions.

The Impact

Music can be healing for many people coping with death, depression or anxiety. With this film, we want to show how music can be a way to honor and remember the one's we have lost. 

Risks & Challenges

Producing a film is not easy, especially during a global pandemic. We shot our most recent pilot, Grinding Doubt, during COVID-19, and we are confident that are team is again capable of following the proper protocols to keep everyone safe. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, please share on social media, or with your friends and family! Every dollar counts to help this dream become a reality.

story:
Inspired by the films of David Lynch, this is a strange and symbolic tale of the horrors of family  inheritance, set amidst the backdrop of rural Montana. As a group of seniors at Montana State University, This Be The Verse is our senior thesis project. This film represents the culmination of our skills as filmmakers and will give us the opportunity to share our skills with future employers. But, since we’re still students, we need a little financial assistance to get us off the ground!

 

Budget Breakdown

TOTAL BUDGET - $5000

EQUIPMENT - $2000

While MSU provides a large variety of equipment for students to use, we still need to rent specific lenses to pair with the Arri Alexa. Arri Master Prime lenses will provide the particular look that defines This Be The Verse. The lens rental is the most expensive aspect of our budget, but also one of the most important, because it will define how the film looks. 

 LOCATION FEES - $500

This Be The Verse takes place in a ramshackle house. Since the Bozeman marketplace is booming out of control, a necessary part of our budget must cover a small deposit we pay to the location of our film. Paying this deposit ensures that we will be able to use the location while giving the owners an assurance that we will take good care of their home. 

PROPS - $500

Production design is an essential component of any film because props help create the world of the film. By finding or creating specific props for each character, the world of the film slowly comes to life. 

HAIR & MAKEUP - $350

Because this is a horror film, grotesque makeup is key. Our makeup artist - Jack Hueser - has been hard at work creating a grotesque look specifically for this film. But, he’s in need of additional supplies. Making sure Jack has all of the necessary makeup will ensure that the horror element of the film comes through. 

FOOD - $850

Food is essential to keep our cast and crew working at their peak potential. Because of COVID-19 regulations, serving snacks and meals on set has become more complicated. All of our snacks and meals must be individually packaged, which adds on an additional cost. 

COSTUMES - $200

Costumes are a smaller but important section of this film. By utilizing thrift stores and creating costumes from scratch, our crew is working to limit the expense of outfitting the cast. 

COVID SUPPLIES - $200

With COVID still prevalent in society, our crew will take all the necessary precautions to ensure that no one on our set gets sick. By providing the necessary PPE, consistent sanitization, and temperature checks, our crew will make safety our top priority. 

Perks & Rewards

In exchange for your financial support, we’ve created a list of unique perks that will give you a glimpse behind the scenes of This Be The Verse. We’re offering up exclusive Behind the Scenes videos, custom stickers or posters, signed photos of the cast & crew, early access to the finished film, and even an Executive Producer credit. 

Director’s Statement

"As many people can attest, the Covid-19 pandemic had me spending a lot of time with my family, and had me in a state of serious introspection. One question that continually racked my brain was the role that my own family inheritance had played in my life. In terms of both good and bad, I found myself pondering how my inherited traits and the values instilled in me were affecting my own personal growth. This script was written while isolated in quarantine and with that introspective question in mind. Through This be the Verse, I hope that viewers can attain catharsis in their own introspective exploration of inheritance, and hopefully can assist them in answering a very important question: ‘how much of myself can I truly change?’ " - Noah Hense (Writer & Director)

Risks & Challenges

COVID - 19: This Be The Verse was inspired by the hard times that COVID-19 caused, but the creation of the film is still impacted by the effect of COVID-19. Although all of the cast & crew members are fully vaccinated, the Delta variant has caused MSU to keep the COVID protocols in place. These include temperature taking, consistent sanitation, social distancing, individually packaged food, and masks. While these safety measures are important, the small needs add up into large costs. 

Makeup: One of our biggest concerns is that the grotesque makeup will not work effectively. To mitigate that concern, our makeup artist (Jack Hueser) and director (Noah Hense) have been practicing different techniques all summer. By the time production rolls around, we know they’ll be prepared!

Other ways you can help:

Even if you can’t contribute monetarily, please spread the word about our film! We’d love it if you shared our Indiegogo page, our website, or tag us on social media. We’re incredibly excited about creating This Be The Verse but we can’t do it without your help!

Instagram: @this_be_the_verse_film

TikTok: @thisbetheversefilm

story:
Joe's Journey

Joe's Journey will be a short film based on a cartoon by award winning cartoonist Tony Husband. In recent years Tony has been very active in promoting dementia awareness through his cartoons and the book 'Take Care Son.'

 

We don't require a large budget for the film, just enough to pay our actors and crew a basic rate.

 

By supporting this film you are not only bringing a touching story to life, but also helping to raise awareness of a condition that affects any people and families.

 

Thank you from Tony & Jase

story:
Who is Moon Knight? How did Marc Spector become the Knight of Vengeance for Khonshu, Egyptian god of the moon? This is the main story that Origins explores. Jumping between modern day and the past, the story explores the brutal vigilante that Moon Knight is now and how Marc Spector became Moon Knight after Raul Bushman left him for dead in the desert. 

In this particular story, we are getting an opportunity to explore 3 of the character's personalities including Marc Spector (the mercenary before Moon Knight), Jake Lockley (the ride share driver/ear on the street), and the vigilante Moon Knight. Although focused on Marc Spector's backstory, there is also a strong focus on action.

Official Social Media:

www.facebook.com/moonknightorigins    -----      www.instagram.com/moonknightorigins

We are a group of incredibly passionate filmmakers and Moon Knight fans determined to bring this story to life while also doing it justice on a shoe string budget. The last thing we want is to do disservice to who this character is and what the heart of these comics are. Everyone involved in this project works in the film industry in some capacity and have been working hard for the past few months on bringing this project to life.

No matter what happens, we're determined to find a way to finish this project (before the new Disney show is released) and with your help we can build an even better fan film for all of you to enjoy! We're shooting the entire project on the Blackmagic Pocket 4k Cinema Camera and are bringing all of our expertise to make this as good as possible.

 


 

Steven Huff as

Moon Knight (and Marc Spector/Jake Lockley)

Steve is most well known for his fight performance, fight choreography, and weapons skills. With a lifetime of training in weapons and martial arts, he brings the fight scenes for Origins to the next level. He is also an avid Moon Knight fan and excellent at building costumes and modifying props. 

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5329328/?ref_=nv_sr...

Kelcey Watson as

Raul Bushman

Kelcey Watson will be bringing Raul Bushman to life. Kelcey has been in numerous productions over the years. You can check out more of his work on his IMDB and Instagram page.

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2921081/
Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kelcivious1



Misty Easler as

Gena Landers

Misty

Misty will be bringing life to the role of Gena Landers. She's been in many productions acting and working hair and makeup over the years. She'll bring a toughness with love to the character that we really believe fans will love! Check out more of her work below.

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3563215/?ref_=nv_sr...

Website: www.mistyeasler.com

James Pitt as

Dr. Peter Alraune

James is an American actor and producer most known for his work on James Cameron's Avatar ("I really love his spirit."-James Cameron). He received a nomination for Best Actor at the 2013 Idyllwild Cinemafest. He's a former Coast Guardsman, loving husband and proud father.

IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1827420/?ref_=nv_sr...

Genevieve Marie Nylen as

Marlene Alraune

Genevieve is most well known for her impressive cosplay builds. She has over 200k followers on instagram and is also known on B-Movie Scream Queen Films. She's going to bring a great Marlene onto camera!

Isabella Cohen as

Young Crawley

Isabella is definitely the wild card in our production. In a decision, largely based on circumstances we were facing, we decided to approach the character of Crawly from the idea of a young street rat, and with Isabella we were given an almost Selena Kyle type vibe. Still keeping the heart of Crawley as a street information for Jake Lockley, Isabella is great in this role! 

Check out more of her credits as well her instagram with her twin sister!

https://www.instagram.com/the_cohen_twins/

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4643333/?ref_=fn_al...

 

We understand how much we're asking so we want to ensure we can give some cool rewards in return! On top of our initial rewards, we're working on some cool special awards to be added a little later! 

There will be some Behind the Scenes videos coming out for all BUT every backer from the $20 and above tiers will receive special Behind The Scenes videos made specifically for backers to follow our journey in completing the film.

Signed Photo Print Options:

Moon Knight Photos Coming.

11x17 Mini-Poster Options:

Rewards:

$5: A thank you shout out on social media.

$10: Special Thanks in the end credits of the film.

$20: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening to the movie a month before release.

$25: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Digital High Resolution Download of one set of Mini Posters of your choice

$30: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Digital Copy of the Script

$40: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed 8x10 Moon Knight or Marc Spector photo print signed by lead actor Steve Huff

$50: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed Phyiscal copy of the shooting script

$50: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed Mini Poster

         - Two Different Sets of Mini Posters: Set 1 (Vertical) and Set 2 (Horizontal)

         - $25 Add-on for each additional poster in each set

$60: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A signed 8x10 photo print of Genevieve Marie Nylen as Marlene

$100: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A Personalized Thank You video from the director

$150: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A Personalized Thank You video from Moon Knight

$300: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A one on one coffee meet up with the director

$300: Hour long 1 on 1 Private Session with Fight Choreographer Steve Huff + Special Thanks + Early Access Screening

Includes an hour of instruction in a few various weapons styles and unarmed techniques with second half of session applying learned techniques to building a fight sequence for film. (Must be in Los Angeles or willing to travel to location to redeem).

$500: Associate Producer Credit + Early Access Screening + Digital Copy of the Script

$600: Ancient Weapon Prop + Signed Photo of Weapons Prop w/ Certificate of Authenticity + Associate Producer Credit + Early Access Screening + Digital Copy of the Script 

(3 different weapons, all used in production: Ankh & Knife, Wood Truncheon, and Full Staff)

$1000: Producer Credit + Early Access Screening + Digital Copy of the Script + A signed 8x10 Moon Knight photo print

$2000: Executive Producer Credit + Early Access Screening + A chance to visit the set + A signed 8x10 Moon Knight photo print + a digital download of poster sets

We're very excited to be bringing Moon Knight to life in Origins. However, one thing we haven't had as much opportunity to explore is his psychosis with his multiple personalities. So we have some stretch goals that if we can reach will allow us to explore that aspect of Moon Knight as well as the character of Midnight Man. And we make our stretch goals for the next fan film, all VARIOUS PRODUCER CREDITS will be honored for both fan films.

Check out our stretch goals below!

$10,000 - We'll be able to create larger and more dynamic action sequences for Origins and a couple of expanded scenes with Jake Lockley and Steven Grant.

$15,000 – We can make a PROOF OF CONCEPT for a fan film with Morpheus as the antagonist and exploring more of Moon Knight's psychosis.

$20,000 – We can make the Morpheus focused Moon Knight fan film on a smaller scale.

$30,000 – We’ll have everything we need to properly bring the second Morpheus fan film to life, including delivering larger and more dynamic action sequences. After the goal is reached, anything after the $10,000 mark will go into making the second fan film with Morpheus, focused more on Moon Knight's psychosis.

Our initial budget has been allocated for being able to pay for food & gas on set days, extra props, costumes, and any rentals, as well as being able to pay cast, crew, and post production crew. This will all allow us to be more flexible, have more personnel to not be stretched too thin on set, and make sure those working on the project can put food on their table! This film is not impossible without a higher budget but what we'll be able to pull off will be even more amazing if we can put more funds into it.

Ian Adema (Writer/Director/Producer)

Ian has written and directed numerous short films and a feature. He's immersed himself in all aspects of filmmaking to be able to better understand every department. If he's not making movies he's probably thinking about making more movies or visiting a bunch of castles.

https://imdb.me/ianadema

www.ianadema.com

Jon Debiase (Director of Photography)

Jon is fully immersed into every facet of filmmaking. From editing and directing to visual effects and camera operation. You can bet he's probably staring at a glowing rectangle of some sort right now.

You can check out more of his Director of Photography work here: 

https://vimeo.com/269949431

Olivia Wyrick (Editor)

Olivia has cut together numerous short films for Ian over the years. Outside of that, she's worked on shows including The Walking Dead, Fear The Walking Dead, Foundation, and The 100. She also brought the Teaser Trailer to life!

Check out her list of credits on her imdb:

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm6582522/?ref_=fn_al...

Joel David Reed (Makeup Artist)

Joel has worked on numerous projects, including lots of prosthetics. He'll be bringing the Bushman makeup to life for Origins! Check out Joel's makeup work and credits below!

https://www.facebook.com/Joel-David-Reed-302463...

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4120350/

As with most films, there is always a possibility that something might fall through and the project never quite gets finished. However, we're determined to make sure that isn't the case, no matter how much we raise. This is a passion project that we are more than determined to see through to the end.

Unfortunately, the greater risk for us on the financial side is having to put too much into this since, as a fan film with an IP we don't have the official rights to, we're unable to ever make any profit off of it. But with you're help we can minimize the risk, deliver you an awesome origin story, and deliver some fun rewards to you for helping us out!

Are you unable to assist us with a donation to the campaign? Then the next best thing is to share it with those you know and across your social media, especially with other fans of Moon Knight! This is absolutely the next best thing you can do to help us out!
story_txt:
Who is Moon Knight? How did Marc Spector become the Knight of Vengeance for Khonshu, Egyptian god of the moon? This is the main story that Origins explores. Jumping between modern day and the past, the story explores the brutal vigilante that Moon Knight is now and how Marc Spector became Moon Knight after Raul Bushman left him for dead in the desert. 
In this particular story, we are getting an opportunity to explore 3 of the character's personalities including Marc Spector (the mercenary before Moon Knight), Jake Lockley (the ride share driver/ear on the street), and the vigilante Moon Knight. Although focused on Marc Spector's backstory, there is also a strong focus on action.
Official Social Media:
www.facebook.com/moonknightorigins    -----      www.instagram.com/moonknightorigins


We are a group of incredibly passionate filmmakers and Moon Knight fans determined to bring this story to life while also doing it justice on a shoe string budget. The last thing we want is to do disservice to who this character is and what the heart of these comics are. Everyone involved in this project works in the film industry in some capacity and have been working hard for the past few months on bringing this project to life.
No matter what happens, we're determined to find a way to finish this project (before the new Disney show is released) and with your help we can build an even better fan film for all of you to enjoy! We're shooting the entire project on the Blackmagic Pocket 4k Cinema Camera and are bringing all of our expertise to make this as good as possible.

 

 
Steven Huff as 
Moon Knight (and Marc Spector/Jake Lockley)

Steve is most well known for his fight performance, fight choreography, and weapons skills. With a lifetime of training in weapons and martial arts, he brings the fight scenes for Origins to the next level. He is also an avid Moon Knight fan and excellent at building costumes and modifying props. 
IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm5329328/?ref_=nv_sr...
Kelcey Watson as
Raul Bushman

Kelcey Watson will be bringing Raul Bushman to life. Kelcey has been in numerous productions over the years. You can check out more of his work on his IMDB and Instagram page.
IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2921081/Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/kelcivious1

Misty Easler as
Gena Landers
Misty
Misty will be bringing life to the role of Gena Landers. She's been in many productions acting and working hair and makeup over the years. She'll bring a toughness with love to the character that we really believe fans will love! Check out more of her work below.IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3563215/?ref_=nv_sr...
Website: www.mistyeasler.com
James Pitt as
Dr. Peter Alraune

James is an American actor and producer most known for his work on James Cameron's Avatar ("I really love his spirit."-James Cameron). He received a nomination for Best Actor at the 2013 Idyllwild Cinemafest. He's a former Coast Guardsman, loving husband and proud father.
IMDB: https://www.imdb.com/name/nm1827420/?ref_=nv_sr...
Genevieve Marie Nylen as
Marlene Alraune
Genevieve is most well known for her impressive cosplay builds. She has over 200k followers on instagram and is also known on B-Movie Scream Queen Films. She's going to bring a great Marlene onto camera!
Isabella Cohen as
Young Crawley

Isabella is definitely the wild card in our production. In a decision, largely based on circumstances we were facing, we decided to approach the character of Crawly from the idea of a young street rat, and with Isabella we were given an almost Selena Kyle type vibe. Still keeping the heart of Crawley as a street information for Jake Lockley, Isabella is great in this role! Check out more of her credits as well her instagram with her twin sister!
https://www.instagram.com/the_cohen_twins/https://www.imdb.com/name/nm4643333/?ref_=fn_al...
 

We understand how much we're asking so we want to ensure we can give some cool rewards in return! On top of our initial rewards, we're working on some cool special awards to be added a little later! 
There will be some Behind the Scenes videos coming out for all BUT every backer from the $20 and above tiers will receive special Behind The Scenes videos made specifically for backers to follow our journey in completing the film.
Signed Photo Print Options:


Moon Knight Photos Coming.
11x17 Mini-Poster Options:


Rewards:
$5: A thank you shout out on social media.
$10: Special Thanks in the end credits of the film.
$20: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening to the movie a month before release.
$25: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Digital High Resolution Download of one set of Mini Posters of your choice
$30: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Digital Copy of the Script
$40: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed 8x10 Moon Knight or Marc Spector photo print signed by lead actor Steve Huff
$50: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed Phyiscal copy of the shooting script
$50: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + Signed Mini Poster
         - Two Different Sets of Mini Posters: Set 1 (Vertical) and Set 2 (Horizontal)
         - $25 Add-on for each additional poster in each set
$60: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A signed 8x10 photo print of Genevieve Marie Nylen as Marlene
$100: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A Personalized Thank You video from the director
$150: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A Personalized Thank You video from Moon Knight
$300: Special Thanks + Early Access Screening + A one on one coffee meet up with the director
$300: Hour long 1 on 1 Private Session with Fight Choreographer Steve Huff + Special Thanks + Early Access Screening
Includes an hour of instruction in a few various weapons styles and unarmed techniques with second half of session applying learned techniques to building a fight sequence for film. (Must be in Los Angeles or willing to travel to location to redeem).

story:
Year of the Woman? 

Who cares about a Black  single mother running for local city council? Why should it matter that a Queer Black woman is running for the Denver Transit Board?  Why should people pay attention to a Latinx woman born in one of the most polluted neighborhoods in the United States who is running for office? 

These are not just their stories, they are our stories.  Stories that have been left out of the conversation around feminism and leadership and politics.  

In 1992 American voters elected more new women to Congress than any previous decade.  This started what some thought would be "The Year of the Woman" and although there were gains made, all one has to do is turn on the news to recognize that we still have far to go and that there are still too many races women must run  and too many battles we must fight before our work is done.

I want to capture these battles. I want to share stories that are infrequently told (if they are told at all).  I want to show the world that big things can happen in small cities. I want to  document women of color running for office in a city that has aptly been called "Wakanda for White People". 

Who Cares About Local Elections? 

Voter turn out is typically lower during mid-term elections. A stunning number of people don't vote in their municipal and local elections at all.  WThe saying,  "All Politics is Local" is attributed to Tip O'Neill; Yes, our national elections are incredibly important but equally important are the local elections that shape our day to day life and impact our livelihood, our families and our communities.

Women of color are consistently left out of these narratives. 

Running with My Girls will have a local focus in Denver, which is a primarily white city.  However, the themes will be universal; representation, struggle, dismantling racism and uplifting the voices of women of color in politics.  

What We Need 

Professional videographers and editors are very expensive. On average it costs about $1,500 per day for an 8 hour shoot. As we will be following multiple subjects we will need at least two camera operators per shoot. Plus expenses and  editing which typically runs about $85.00 per hour. $25,000 will get us started on the project.

As a full time working mother I know this is an ambitious "side" project but as evidenced by my previous films, I can make it happen, especially with my incredible passion for supporting "my girls" and raising up the voices and profiles of women of color. 

 If we don't reach our initial 25K goal we will still be able to start filming with the funds we raise and produce content which will generate more interest  and in turn more funding. 

 

The Impact

This project will be multifaceted. We will be highlighting the courage and strength of women as well as the importance of voting and being an active and engaged member of your community. This film will show women of all ages and backgrounds what is possible, even against incredible odds. It will explore the barriers that have traditionally kept women out of political office and will inform and excite viewers to be more active and involved. It will be a film that women will reference when they are writing their memoirs and being interviewed about what was the spark that made them run for office and how their careers in politics began and flourished in spite of the deck being stacked against them. 

Risks & Challenges

Any documentary project runs a risk of not being completed however,  this project will be completed after the elections in May 2019.  I am hopeful that all of the women that are running win. Regardless of the outcomes; sharing these stories will be illuminating and will help pave the way for a future that is female, truly diverse and inclusive. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If your money is acting funny and you cannot contribute financially please share this project far and wide. If you can contribute skills such as filming, music or photography please do!  And if you are local to Denver, get involved in campaigns you support.

We can run alone but we'll get so much farther together.

story:
On the heels of who they believe to be a child kidnapper with stolen Tamaranean tech, Jason Todd, Roy Harper, and Koriand’r have finally managed to corner their suspect in one of Blüdhaven’s derelict buildings. As the gang plans to spring into action, they must steel themselves for what may very well be a fight for the lives of Blüdhaven’s numerous missing children. But with an unseen and seemingly omnipotent quarry, are these three heroes truly prepared to face the horrors that await them when they are drawn into the shadows and confronted by him?

Brock Markham is an actor and stuntman from Banks, Oregon. He has an athletic background, having participated in football, wrestling, track and field, and rugby throughout high school and college, and is currently a professional bodybuilder. His career includes doubling Saints quarterback Drew Brees, as well as performing in Disneyland's Nighttime Spectacular Fantasmic!, Pirates Dinner Adventure in Buena Park, CA, and Universal Studios Hollywood's Special Effects Show, where he was trained by the Action Horizons stunt department. Brock most recently played Diesel in 5-Star Theatricals’ professional production of West Side Story.

Robert Tovani is an actor and writer. In 2005 he wrote, directed, and starred in the short film Robin: Punchline, where he played Robin. This led to many years of collaboration with Bat in The Sun Productions, where he is known for Patient J (2005) as Robin, Batman Legends (2006) as Robin, and Super Power Beat Down: Boba Fett vs Star Lord (2017) as Star Lord. He’s been an actor since the age of 8 and has been writing for over 20 years.

Claire Juliana Lanay was born in Honolulu, Hawaii. After leaving Hawaii at an early age, she resided in several different locales, among them Hesston, KS, Eugene, OR, Chicago, IL, Los Angeles, CA, and Atlanta, GA. As is the case for many actors, artists, and nomads, Claire has worked a ton of paycheck jobs including (though not limited to) hotel auditor, graveyard shift security & medical alarm dispatching, call center concierge, property management admin, law firm receptionist, talent agency intern, Directors Guild of America residuals processor, strip club cashier, and auto parts delivery driver. Claire has had recurring roles on TV shows such as The Resident (FOX) and Sistas (BET). She recently worked on the pilot for Naomi (CW), which has been picked up for mid-season early 2022.  Currently, Claire is working on the new mini-series DMZ (HBO Max) as an intriguing, badass character.

Ian S. Talbot is a Theatre Director and educator with over 25 years experience.

He has directed over 100 productions and taught hundreds of students in the US and the UK. He is the first American to win 3 gold medals in the British Arts Festival in its 57th year and holds certificates from LAMDA.

Evan Salce discovered his passion for filmmaking at an early age, shooting YouTube shorts while growing up in Pasadena, and starting and running a film club through middle school and high school. Upon graduating from college, Evan coordinated production at Machinima, Inc. for several popular web shows, among them: Inside Gaming, ETC, Machinima Prime, and Machinima LIVE. During his time there, he would go on to write credited content for the Machinima Prime comedy show, DR. 1-UP. He has since gone on to produce a string of successful narrative & documentary projects, most recently including two award-winning documentary shorts, Scout’s Oath and Charon, and works as an audio engineer in Sherman Oaks.

Anthony Clementi has over a decade and a half of experience working, from script to screen, in television and film production. The very trenches that are Hollywood have allowed this member of the DGA & PGA to acquire over 13 acknowledgements for various films, television, and online series, with 31 titles under his belt. He has expertise in production management, working with production crews of over 200 people, scheduling and budgeting productions of all ranges, and working with all unions and guilds with a full understanding of state labor laws, payroll, sales, distribution, and marketing. Anthony thrives on the chaos that is the unexpected, ever-changing film market. It has allowed him to sharpen his producing abilities and to always make sure that the projects he is on come in on time, under budget, and easily available to all.

Ian Lang has been writing, producing, acting, and producing films and videos since the age of 12. His passion for film was awakened after working with a friend on a video project for their 7th Grade Foreign Language class. Since that time, Ian has produced films and videos for numerous corporate, private, church, online, and traditional media outlets. In 2017, Ian and a few friends started CD828 Studios and released their first feature film, OK.

Emmy Award-winning Director/Producer Evan Zissimopulos was introduced to filmmaking at a very young age, when he borrowed his parents Sony Digital 8 video camera and began making short films. In his late teens, he founded his own production company, EGZ Productions. While completing numerous works for his business, he also became certified in Digital Media Production from Saint Petersburg College. Immediately after graduating, Evan went on to direct his first guerrilla feature film, Trap House. This film gained him enough credibility to land other directing and producing jobs, by showcasing his outstanding creativity and aptitude for creating impactful visuals on a relatively low budget. Since his directorial debut, Evan has directed, produced, and shot numerous television shows, web series, TV commercials, features, and music videos.

Ryan Rambach is a 5-time Emmy nominated filmmaker and editor based in Los Angeles, CA. Ryan’s television editing credits include the award winning documentary series I Am Cait on E! (2016 GLAAD Media Award winner), Born This Way on A&E (winner of 3 Primetime Emmys and a Television Academy Honor in 2016), and the 2019 Emmy nominated documentary series Surviving R. Kelly on Lifetime. Ryan also edited the 2013 fantasy short film Bottled Up, which won a gold medal at the 40th Annual Student Academy Awards. Ryan Rambach is a member of the Picture Editor’s Peer Group of the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences.
