Anthony thrives on the chaos that is the unexpected, ever-changing film market. It has allowed him to sharpen his producing abilities and to always make sure that the projects he is on come in on time, under budget, and easily available to all.Ian Lang has been writing, producing, acting, and producing films and videos since the age of 12. His passion for film was awakened after working with a friend on a video project for their 7th Grade Foreign Language class. Since that time, Ian has produced films and videos for numerous corporate, private, church, online, and traditional media outlets. In 2017, Ian and a few friends started CD828 Studios and released their first feature film, OK.Emmy Award-winning Director/Producer Evan Zissimopulos was introduced to filmmaking at a very young age, when he borrowed his parents Sony Digital 8 video camera and began making short films. In his late teens, he founded his own production company, EGZ Productions. While completing numerous works for his business, he also became certified in Digital Media Production from Saint Petersburg College. Immediately after graduating, Evan went on to direct his first guerrilla feature film, Trap House. This film gained him enough credibility to land other directing and producing jobs, by showcasing his outstanding creativity and aptitude for creating impactful visuals on a relatively low budget. Since his directorial debut, Evan has directed, produced, and shot numerous television shows, web series, TV commercials, features, and music videos.Ryan Rambach is a 5-time Emmy nominated filmmaker and editor based in Los Angeles, CA. Ryan’s television editing credits include the award winning documentary series I Am Cait on E! (2016 GLAAD Media Award winner), Born This Way on A&E (winner of 3 Primetime Emmys and a Television Academy Honor in 2016), and the 2019 Emmy nominated documentary series Surviving R. Kelly on Lifetime. Ryan also edited the 2013 fantasy short film Bottled Up, which won a gold medal at the 40th Annual Student Academy Awards. Ryan Rambach is a member of the Picture Editor’s Peer Group of the Academy of Television Arts & Sciences.

story:
The Horror Show Channel is happy to welcome you to the second Dylan's New Nightmare fan film crowdfunding campaign! We're here to complete the production funding needed in order to make your nightmares come true!

Yes, we're back! After raising just over 75% of our projected budget with our first campaign, our production was halted due to the year long Covid-19 Lockdown in both United States and Canada. Instead of forcing the production to work in a dangerous environment, or incur the additional costs of Covid-safe productions, we instead decided to put the project on hold until restrictions were lifted. 

Now that restrictions are finally loosening and our cast and crew can return to set safely, we are ready to get back to work! We are currently preparing our schedule for a fall production date, which will ultimately depend on when the Canada/U.S. border travel restrictions are finally lifted. We have heard that it may be as soon as July and will keep backers informed as the situation progresses.

Meanwhile while we pick back up with pre-production, we are also utilizing this time to launch a new campaign as an attempt to close the gap on the remaining 25% of our budget and more!
Not only will this campaign give fans new and old a second opportunity to join our team, but raising the remainder of our original budget (or more!) will be vital for our visual effects and post-production costs. 

Dylan's New Nightmare acts as an unofficial sequel to Wes Craven's New Nightmare, one of the most unique and high concept installments to the Nightmare on Elm Street franchise. 

This short film picks up 25 years after the events of New Nightmare and follows our lead Dylan Porter (Miko Hughes), the young son of Heather Langenkamp, now a grown man trying to make his way in the world his parents raised him in—Hollywood. Little does he know that the evil entity known as Freddy Krueger is back, and eager to once again break into our world through the son of his favorite victim!

This project was conceived by Cecil Laird, who has loved the horror genre ever since he was a child. Freddy Krueger has always been his favorite slasher, so when he was deciding what The Horror Show's next huge project should be, a sequel to Wes Craven's New Nightmare clawed its way into his head and just wouldn't leave! So the project began.

Luckily, to ensure that this fan film is of the highest quality, we have enlisted the incredible help of Producer, Vincente DiSanti, the creative force behind Womp Stomp Films and the widely successful Friday the 13th fan film and its prequel, Never Hike Alone and Never Hike in the Snow.  We've also brought in Rene Rivas, the man behind that excellent Halloween fan film The Spirit of Haddonfield,  as both Producer and Director of Photography.  Additionally, we are lucky enough to have Nora Hewitt, the winner of season 9 of FaceOff, to head up our Special Make-Up Department and be FX Supervisor for the film!

But even as cool as this whole project is up to this point, it would be nothing without the involvement of MIKO HUGHES himself, who will be reprising his role as Dylan Porter, the son of Heather Langenkamp from the original Wes Craven's New Nightmare! That's right! Miko is back!

So obviously, with all of these talented individuals, plus original costuming and props being designed for the flick by people very close to the franchise, this project is sure to be a film that belongs on every horror fan's shelf, right next to the rest of their Nightmare collection!

Being that the short film is not-for-profit, our goal is really just to put out a film that not only makes the fans and creators of the Nightmare on Elm Street series proud. We'd also love it if this fan film ended up being one that they want to add to their collection so much, that they contribute to this campaign, because that’s the ONLY way they’ll be able to!

Now, in order to make this the biggest and best Freddy fan film we can, we need your help! As stated, we have already raised 75% of our budget in the first campaign, so we are looking to raise the remaining 25% in this campaign! And if we can raise funds beyond that, we can try and cover our stretch goals as well! 

Our financial goal is to raise at least $10,000, which will complete the original main budget to cover following items:

Permits & Insurance

Gear & Vehicle Rentals

Stunts

Cast & Crew Costs

Location Costs

Production Costs

Special Makeup & Gore FX

Original Score Creation Costs

Perk Costs

 

We do have plenty of stretch goals, which would fund numerous ways we could bolster the production, including:

Higher-quality overall production

Extra practical special effects

Extra location time

Story Expansion

More in-depth post-production process

So even if we've already achieved our goal, don't hesitate to still contribute! The perks are worth it!  Speaking of...

We are offering some AMAZING perks for you Nightmare fans who can't wait for another, if unofficial, entry into the Freddy canon! Check them out and choose what looks best for you!

Your Name in the End Credits as a special "Thank You"

A Digital Download Pack, including the film, the score, & more

FOUR Original Posters of the film - both signed and unsigned options

A Signed Still Image of Miko from on set

A VHS copy of Dylan's New Nightmare (limited #)

A Blu-Ray copy of Dylan's New Nightmare

A T-Shirt with the Dylan's New Nightmare logo

A Full Set of Original Dylan's New Nightmare Pins

A Message from Freddy himself

A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Rex Stuffed Animal (Damaged & Undamaged)

A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Sweater (Damaged & Undamaged)

A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Original Glove (Signed & Unsigned - limited #)

An Associate Producer Credit (limited #)

A Co-Producer Credit (limited #)

An Executive Producer Credit (limited #)

New perks will be dropped along the way so keep checking back to make sure you don't miss out on something really cool! Our high-end tiers give you a chance to join the Nightmare as an actual Producer, which allows you exclusive access to an inside look into the project, along with behind the scenes material nobody else will see for a very long time, if ever! Additionally, YOUR NAME will appear in the opening credits of the film.

All Producers will all have a direct line of communication with our team, and Co-Producers and Executive Producers are also permitted to visit the set during production, or even help out as part of the crew. But they must behave themselves...or Freddy will see them out!

 

The role of Dylan will be reprised by none other than Miko Hughes himself, who originated the character 25 years ago in the original Wes Craven's New Nightmare! Miko has had a life-long career in film and TV, both in front of and behind the camera, since all the way back in 1989 when he played little Gage Creed in the original Pet Sematary. Miko is excited to face off against Freddy once again, and can't wait to show you how the last 25 years have treated Dylan!

The role of Freddy will be played by Dave McRae, a full time professional voice actor and independent filmmaker. Dave is a four-time (2015, 2016, 2018 & 2019) Voice Arts Award Nominee. Three times for Outstanding National TV Promo, and once for Outstanding Body of Work. His voice has been heard on thousands of radio and television commercials, network promos, movie and game trailers, narration, and animation across North America and around the world. Alongside his career as a voice actor, Dave has a passion for film and filmmaking. Dave is probably best known online for his YouTube channel where he can be seen giving his thoughts, opinions, and insights on everything horror movies and Halloween. He has also just completed his own Black Christmas fan film called It's Me, Billy!

Cecil has been producing horror content on YouTube for over 5 years now via the program he created called The Horror Show Channel. The program is a horror-themed variety show with over 3,000 episodes available at this point, including horror-themed shorts, both scary and comedic. He has made one previous fan film, Sweet (inspired by the American Vampire comic book series co-created by Stephen King), but Dylan’s New Nightmare is Cecil’s largest project to date! Since it involves not only one of horror’s “Big 3”, but also Cecil’s personal favorite horror icon, he is determined to do both the franchise, and the franchise’s original creator, justice!

Vincente DiSanti moved to Los Angeles in 2008 and has since worked in several aspects of the film industry including live-action, feature animation, story development, voice acting, visual FX, commercials, and much more. A jack of all trades, Vincente is best known for his directorial work on Never Hike in the Snow (2020), Disappear (2019), Never Hike Alone (2017), Imagine (2018), The Red Room (2015), and starring as Michael Myers in The Spirit of Haddonfield (2018).                

                                         

Rene Rivas has been a film aficionado for as far back as he can remember. Building his Arizona based production company since 2015, Rene Rivas Productions LLC, Rene has completed the feature noir Northern, 2018's short Halloween fan film The Spirit of Haddonfield, and more recently the upcoming horror short, Judy, and the recently released The TENT. Writing and Directing are Rene‘s main focus, but his skills range from cinematography, to producing, to editing & sound design--the whole gambit.

David has been Cecil’s film partner for his whole career. He has done every project a person can do on set, having worked on numerous independent horror films featuring actors like Kane Hodder and Tiffany Shepis! He may be camera-shy, but there’s no stronger all-around force behind the scenes of a film set than this man. While he can do any job behind the camera, having him in place as Assistant Director will ensure his skills are utilized to the fullest on the set of Dylan’s New Nightmare!

For as long as she can remember, Nora Hewitt has had a love of the movies with horror resonating more than any other genre. This passion and a life-long knack for artistic flair caused her to follower her passions at Tom Savini's Special Makeup Effects Program, from which she graduated in January of 2015. She then went on to not only join the cast of the ninth season of Syfy’s long-running Makeup FX show Face/Off, but she actually won the entire thing! Currently, she is happily pursuing her dreams freelancing in the special effects makeup industry.

The Whole Gang:

We would like to state that The Horror Show, Cecil Laird Productions, Womp Stomp Films & Rene Rivas Productions formally acknowledge that Dylan’s New Nightmare is a not-for-profit fan film and in no way associated or affiliated with New Line Cinema, Warner Bros Pictures or any other company that owns the rights to the character of Freddy Krueger and/or A Nightmare on Elm Street.

The budget for this campaign is being raised to help cover the unavoidable expenses that come with making any production. Every dollar we receive from our campaigns is spent directly on the film along with the production, packaging, and shipping of the campaign perks.

Ultimately, we are partnering with fans to bring Freddy back in a very cool way that returns him to a much-beloved continuity! Any funds left un-spent on the production will be donated to the National Audubon Society. For those that don't know, Wes Craven had a massive love of birds and even served on the Board of Directors for the California Chapter of the organization, so any excess funds will be donated to this cause in his memory.

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a few things you can do to still assist the production:

Share this page and help spread the word that FREDDY IS COMING BACK!

Join, follow and share the Dylan's New Nightmare Facebook, Twitter & Instagram pages for updates and discussion with the filmmakers.

Subscribe to The Horror Show Channel on YouTube for regular video updates as the production moves along.

Thank you for visiting the page! If you are so inclined, choose a perk and help us bring this vision to life to help celebrate the 25th anniversary of the original Wes Craven’s New Nightmare! The whole idea is to pay tribute to the people that created the original series we all love so much, and especially the late, great Wes Craven, without whom horror wouldn’t be what it is today.

If you have any other questions, please email us at TheHorrorShow666@yahoo.com, or message us on our Facebook, Twitter or Instagram pages!

THANK YOU!

story:
UPDATE

We didn't raise enough money in our previous campaigns to cover the cost of the film. In reality, the film will cost over $150k, so we're actually only trying to raise enough to cover half. We're currently at $45k after crowdfunding fees total. Please help us raise these additional funds on this follow-up campaign so we can finish post-production. Thanks!

 

Hi Everyone,

I’m Brian Sanders, and I’m making a feature length documentary called Food Lies. It's the sordid history of our dietary guidelines, the epidemic of chronic disease and obesity that followed, what the new science is telling us humans should actually be eating, and how to eat that food sustainably.

“What should we eat?” There’s so much conflicting information out there, you can even find a website espousing the miracles of an all-twinkie diet. You spend money and willpower trying to make healthy decisions, but you just gain more weight. It seems hopeless

Misinformation and bad science has led us astray over the past 60 years. It wasn’t malicious; it wasn't a government conspiracy; we just got some things wrong. 'Eating fat makes you fat' seemed logical. Cholesterol in food and cholesterol in clogged arteries seemed like an obvious connection. 'Heart healthy grains' was repeated so many times by so many reputable organizations, we just accepted it as fact. The problem is, none of it’s true.

I’ve been a filmmaker since middle school. I’ve also built and sold a tech company, worked as a mechanical engineer, and now, I’ve quit my job to devote the rest of my life to this cause. I’ve researched every conflicting dietary approach and it’s all finally starting to make sense—even some of the vegan arguments. I’ve put this research into practice, and now, at age 35, I’m in the best shape of my life. My vitals and blood work are flawless and I haven’t been sick in 3 years. The same goes for countless family, friends, and millions around the world.

We’re so close to finishing this film, but we need your support. With your contributions, we can shoot the remainder of the documentary, complete post-production, and inform the public about this crucial issue. Please pre-order a copy of the film and check out our great rewards. Thank you for your support.

-Brian

 

Now accepting crypto!

Bitcoin: 3HhqZd1FDfji42YkoyisHnT1taG1SeGGXX

Ethereum: 0x6bc01250BD8a0B8Db2A8cE94414364aD1c243878

 

The Story

This film will cover much more than what's depicted in the trailer. Highlights will include:

  • How we misunderstood nutrition and spread the wrong information
  • The resulting epidemic of chronic disease and obesity
  • Lies, myths, and propaganda
  • What humans are supposed to eat
  • The unifying theory of nutrition
  • Tons of graphics to explain things easily
  • How to source these foods both ethically and sustainably
  • Multiple narrative storylines 
  • And a lot more!

 

This film will be handy for:

  • Someone who’s confused by continuously conflicting headlines on what’s supposedly healthy.
  • Your vegan coworker who not-so-subtly accuses you of killing yourself and the planet every time you have meat for lunch.
  • Someone with chronic disease or family history of one and wants to learn how diet can help treat, prevent, or reverse it.
  • Your aunt who doesn't know anything about nutrition and wants a tight 90-minute audio-visual presentation of all the info.
  • You to send to someone as a recap of everything you’ve been trying to tell them for the past 3 years.
  • Someone who lost their roommate—and their roommate’s Netflix subscription—so they have nothing to watch.
  • Sharp people who already know this stuff, eat this way, and want to expand their knowledge base.

 

Find out more about the film at FoodLies.org  <-----

 

Our Status

We've already shot most of the film!

We won't accept money from any outside interests, food companies, or organizations. We aren't even accepting money from traditional production companies. We know they will take some creative control and influence the final product.

In other words, we're doing this all on our own—and with the help of generous contributors like you!

We still need your support to finish post-production and shoot the remaining little pieces.

 

We filmed with Gary Taubes when he was visiting Santa Monica. We also shot with Dr. Ted Naiman and Denise Minger in Seattle. Everyone has been so amazingly generous with their time and resources!

 

Above is the "Meeting of the Minds" with Gary Taubes, Prof. Tim Noakes, Nina Teicholz, and Dom D'Agostino.

 

The simple answer is - this is my life.

I've truly gone all-in on this "movement." I've left the world of well-paying, stable jobs behind, and jumped into this fully. I'm excited where it's going to take me.

I also live by these principles and have achieved optimum health. I recently got a full physical and cholesterol panel and am (in the doctor's words) "in perfect health." My cholesterol and other markers show I am totally free of all indicators of heart disease, diabetes, or any metabolic disease.

I also am the host of the Peak Human Podcast which initially is a 13-part free course on nutrition. I've interviewed 12 of the top experts in their field to explain (much of) this confusing and conflicting information in one series.

To me, this is more than just a film, this is my life's work. I've committed to continue on after the film is completed to contribute to the health of our world in areas such as:

- working with doctors to create health plans that prevent and reverse chronic disease instead of just masking the symptoms

- reduce our reliance on industrial agriculture

- continuing to research, promote, and support accurate, unbiased information on health

 

Our Team

 

Brian Sanders

Director/Producer

You’ve heard enough about me by now.

 

Jay Hanamura

Director of Photography

Jay is a Director/Writer/DP/Editor living in Honolulu. Having recently been awarded with Hawaii’s Young Ad Person of the Year Award, Jay’s mother feels compelled more than ever to tell strangers that her son is a prodigy.

When not referring to himself in the third person or impressing people with his humbling humility, he can be found surfing, hiking, cooking meat/veggies, traveling, and pulling all-nighters to make brands come to life.

 

Peter Estermann

Writer

Peter is a Screenwriter and Copywriter who has worked for some of the most prestigious advertising agencies in Los Angeles, New York, and Seattle. In his spare time, he reads books on nutrition, evolution, and psychology and attempts to engage in civil online debates, which he always regrets.

Although Peter loves espousing the benefits of ancestral diets, his wallet loves the low demand for organ meats, and he's felt conflicted about this project from the start.

 

Joe Monte

Editor/Cinematographer

Joe is too young and too fit to be concerned with nutrition, but is down for the cause nonetheless. His editing skills are wise beyond their years.

 

We couldn't have a more dedicated team - each one of us is so passionate about spreading the correct information about nutrition. We live and breath this daily!

Above we see Brian, Jay, and Peter in Hawaii where they grew up together and on a recent trip to Tokyo. Side note: instead of encountering a bunch of rice and noodles in Japan, we found a huge focus on fatty meat, seafood, and vegetables.

 

We need you to finish the film! So far we've squeezed by on our personal dime. I've basically gone broke making this film. I believe in it so much, I'm ok with this. We do need your help to finish it, however. We still have to:

  • Travel and shoot 1 more expert interview
  • Shoot multiple narrative storylines 
  • Editing & graphics - we want this to look great
  • Sound & color
  • All other post production
  • Legal costs
  • It's getting boring to list all this...

 

We have so many great rewards we're offering in exchange for your support!

 

Copy of the Film

Pre-ordering a copy of the film is the easiest way to support it's creation. You'll be the first to receive a digital download in high quality 4K.

 

Copy of the Film w/ Extra Features

You'll get the film along with the bonus and behind the scenes content. We have so much content already, there's no way it can all make the final cut. This exclusive content will not be available elsewhere.

 

Private Slack Group

Anyone contributing $50 or more will receive an invite to the private Food Lies Slack group where you can interact with fellow supporters and the filmmakers. Special content will be released there as the film is being made. 

What is Slack?

 

Signed Movie Poster

Receive a high quality print of the official movie poster signed by Brian. Printed on semi-gloss paper at 18" x 24". 

 

Real Foods Limited Edition Coin

This coin symbolizes your commitment to a "Sapien Diet" - one which focuses on nutrient density, embraces healthy fats, and is free of sugar, refined grains, and vegetable/seed oils.

Sapien Victus- Human Nourishment. What Homo Sapiens are meant to eat. Victus means sustenance, nourishment, means of living, food.

Cibus Est Medicina- Food is Medicine. Our ancestors new this - it's sad that we ever forgot this.

Personalize this with your name and month/year you began eating this way. You can also upgrade to a velvet case to display this special coin.

This unique coin will never be sold outside of this crowdfunding campaign. Get this limited edition collector’s item today!

 

Butcher Box

The kind people at Butcher Box are supporting us in creating this film. They are offering discounts on their grass-fed meat delivery service. It’s one of the best and most affordable ways for anyone to get the healthiest meat possible. Now that we know meat is good for our health, let’s get the good stuff!

Bonus: Get $10 off and FREE bacon for life (on any order) by using the code FOODLIES at checkout at ButcherBox.com

 

Give Input on the Film’s Direction

I want to hear from people who are knowledgeable and passionate about this topic. I’ll be available for a 45-minute phone call where we can discuss your ideas for what the film should cover.

 

Lunch with the Filmmaker

This goes a step beyond just a phone call - let’s meet in person! Let’s schedule an extended lunch in the LA area and discuss anything and everything to do with nutrition and the film. I can’t wait to meet and hear from you!

 

If you are unable to contribute monetarily, you still can help! Please help us spread the word. Post about us on social media. Email your family and friends. Text your cousin. Talk about it with your barista. Do whatever you can to let people know they can be part of a very important film that changes the way we think about health and nutrition.

Follow our journey and get a bunch of super fun info along the way:

Instagram

Twitter

Youtube

Facebook
story_txt:
UPDATEWe didn't raise enough money in our previous campaigns to cover the cost of the film. In reality, the film will cost over $150k, so we're actually only trying to raise enough to cover half. We're currently at $45k after crowdfunding fees total. Please help us raise these additional funds on this follow-up campaign so we can finish post-production. Thanks! Hi Everyone,I’m Brian Sanders, and I’m making a feature length documentary called Food Lies. It's the sordid history of our dietary guidelines, the epidemic of chronic disease and obesity that followed, what the new science is telling us humans should actually be eating, and how to eat that food sustainably.“What should we eat?” There’s so much conflicting information out there, you can even find a website espousing the miracles of an all-twinkie diet. You spend money and willpower trying to make healthy decisions, but you just gain more weight. It seems hopelessMisinformation and bad science has led us astray over the past 60 years. It wasn’t malicious; it wasn't a government conspiracy; we just got some things wrong. 'Eating fat makes you fat' seemed logical. Cholesterol in food and cholesterol in clogged arteries seemed like an obvious connection. 'Heart healthy grains' was repeated so many times by so many reputable organizations, we just accepted it as fact. The problem is, none of it’s true.I’ve been a filmmaker since middle school. I’ve also built and sold a tech company, worked as a mechanical engineer, and now, I’ve quit my job to devote the rest of my life to this cause. I’ve researched every conflicting dietary approach and it’s all finally starting to make sense—even some of the vegan arguments. I’ve put this research into practice, and now, at age 35, I’m in the best shape of my life. My vitals and blood work are flawless and I haven’t been sick in 3 years. The same goes for countless family, friends, and millions around the world.We’re so close to finishing this film, but we need your support. With your contributions, we can shoot the remainder of the documentary, complete post-production, and inform the public about this crucial issue. Please pre-order a copy of the film and check out our great rewards. Thank you for your support.-Brian Now accepting crypto!Bitcoin: 3HhqZd1FDfji42YkoyisHnT1taG1SeGGXXEthereum: 0x6bc01250BD8a0B8Db2A8cE94414364aD1c243878 The StoryThis film will cover much more than what's depicted in the trailer. Highlights will include:
How we misunderstood nutrition and spread the wrong information
The resulting epidemic of chronic disease and obesity
Lies, myths, and propaganda
What humans are supposed to eat
The unifying theory of nutrition
Tons of graphics to explain things easily
How to source these foods both ethically and sustainably
Multiple narrative storylines 
And a lot more!
 This film will be handy for:
Someone who’s confused by continuously conflicting headlines on what’s supposedly healthy.
Your vegan coworker who not-so-subtly accuses you of killing yourself and the planet every time you have meat for lunch.
Someone with chronic disease or family history of one and wants to learn how diet can help treat, prevent, or reverse it.
Your aunt who doesn't know anything about nutrition and wants a tight 90-minute audio-visual presentation of all the info.
You to send to someone as a recap of everything you’ve been trying to tell them for the past 3 years.
Someone who lost their roommate—and their roommate’s Netflix subscription—so they have nothing to watch.
Sharp people who already know this stuff, eat this way, and want to expand their knowledge base.
 Find out more about the film at FoodLies.org  <----- Our StatusWe've already shot most of the film!We won't accept money from any outside interests, food companies, or organizations. We aren't even accepting money from traditional production companies. We know they will take some creative control and influence the final product.In other words, we're doing this all on our own—and with the help of generous contributors like you!We still need your support to finish post-production and shoot the remaining little pieces. We filmed with Gary Taubes when he was visiting Santa Monica. We also shot with Dr. Ted Naiman and Denise Minger in Seattle. Everyone has been so amazingly generous with their time and resources! Above is the "Meeting of the Minds" with Gary Taubes, Prof. Tim Noakes, Nina Teicholz, and Dom D'Agostino. The simple answer is - this is my life.I've truly gone all-in on this "movement." I've left the world of well-paying, stable jobs behind, and jumped into this fully. I'm excited where it's going to take me.I also live by these principles and have achieved optimum health. story:
What is "Serious Profession" about??

Mr. Kite and Mr. Winn are two sides of the same coin. Seasoned professional Mr. Kite has spent his entire life working for Polish mob boss Mr. Korek. His partner, Mr. Winn, is a former gang-banger with a dark past.

What starts as a typical day of "collections" becomes a series of strange encounters with corrupt cops, a family of loan sharks, a woman from Kite's past, and three bloodthirsty hit-women.

Things are about to get very serious.

What is the history behind this film?

"Serious Profession" was created over 20 years ago to become a TV series. Over the years, the story has evolved from a TV show to a short film, to what we have now, a three-time award-winning script.  We have assembled an amazing cast, an outstanding film crew, a fantastic composer, and a serious team of professionals ready to make this film a reality. Your support will be instrumental in creating what we know will be a great film.  This is our first full-length feature at Key 13 Film Partners, and everyone involved knows this is something special.

How will my contribution help?

Your support will cover the last days of filming and expenses. This involves paying the cast and crew, money for additional storage space for editing, paying the composer, and the editor. If we go over what we need, the money will go to production/advertising costs for the DVD and Blu-ray releases and submissions to the major film festivals. The more we raise, the more we can do!

Who are Key 13 Film Partners?

On November 13th, 2019, Craig Rosenthal and Matt Anderson created Key 13 Film Partners. Our goal was to make films that were not only entertaining but done on a micro-budget. In the last year, we have produced and released:

  • the award-winning short film "Hoodie"
  • the award-winning short film "Paralyzed"
  • short film "Phobias"- Project R
  • eco-fiction short 2021 AC
  • Terribly Awful and Rewind (YouTube Series)
  • the award-winning "Nova Purity" Music Video
  • a commercial for the Pasadena Toy Fair featuring cosplayer Dayners 666

In addition, we provided support to the local film community. We worked on the films "Remnants" and "Brazen Impact" by Absurd Production Pictures. We also filmed a proof of concept trailer for "Heavy Duty Man", a grindhouse-style film for Cinephoto.

What else can I do to help?

As with anything different, there are risks, and we know that we have a lot of work ahead of us. We have a great script and an awesome cast and crew.

Money helps, but so does love!

The cast and crew of "Serious Profession" need your help and support. We have a page that shows every aspect of the production. We encourage you to interact; ask questions, share posts, and even send us fan art! https://www.facebook.com/SeriousProMovie

We know times are tough, so money isn't the only thing you can help us with. Share this campaign on your Facebook personal page. You can contact us at Key 13 Film Partners https://www.facebook.com/key13film and volunteer your time, talent, or even food. You can support us simply by giving us an encouraging word. That can be just as important as $5.

Here is the link to the Serious Profession IMDb page as well https://www.imdb.com/title/tt13819330/

On behalf of all of us, we thank you for your time and support of Key 13 Film Partners and "Serious Profession"

Break a leg!

Matthew Lee Anderson, Craig M. Rosenthal, Rick Jermain, Thomas Touhey, and Matt Burns.

story:
What is ‘1805’? 

“1805” is a 30-minute short film that follows Bassamer and Marfay as they flee bondage in Virginia in search of the Mason-Dixon line, juxtaposing the moral quandaries they face along the way against those of their oppressors, and shining a light on the multitude of intersecting and conflicting moral systems that often occupy the same place and time.

A historical drama, “1805” was shot in eight days over a two-week period stretching from August 10-24, 2020, in-and-around Lancaster, PA. The production was conceived as a 100% outdoor shoot due to the COVID-19 pandemic. 

“1805” aims, in its own small way, to explore the continuum of an oppressive system that disfigures the morality of the oppressed by pitting them against each other. This is not a film about a hero beating the odds, this is a film about the odds preventing a hero’s rise in the first place. 

Ultimately, “1805” is a story for the thousands of others like it, forever lost to history.

Who's in it?

Nathaniel J. Ryan as Basammer - IMDB/Website

Basammer, a  slave recently purchased by Mr. Jared Corey, escapes a Virginia plantation with his secret wife, Marfay. Basammer is principled yet naive. Deeply devoted to Marfay, he will do anything to ensure they make it across the Mason-Dixon line.

Michelle Kariuki as Marfay - IMDB

Marfay is a young slave who escapes the Corey plantation with her husband, Basammer. She is compassionate yet pragmatic. She loves Basammer, and will do anything to ensure they make it across the Mason-Dixon line. 

Ross Denyer as Mr. Jared Corey - IMDB

The scion of a slave owning Virginia family, Jared Corey struggles to maintain a grasp on the power he recently inherited. 

Frank Sean Johnson as Joshua - IMDB

An older freedman who risks his life crossing back over the Mason-Dixon line to broker a deal. Joshua is under no illusions about the realities of "freedom" for a black man. 

Laurence James Sargent (C) as The Bounty Hunter - IMDB

Hired by Mr. Jared Corey to bring in Basammer and Marfay. A dispassionate man who takes pride in his work, the Bounty Hunter won't tolerate bravado and considers himself fair and reasonable. 

Marian Edmiston as Mrs. Tilley - IMDB

Brian Rock as the Deer Hunter - IMDB

Adrienne Alexa Nicole Smith as the Mother - IMDB

Sydney Rushing as the Daughter - IMDB

Norma Jean Vargus (L) as the Guide - IMDB

Michael Arrington III as Woodman - IMDB

Bradley "Bing" Ingersoll as the Overseer - IMDB

Jaimee Friend as Sisyphus - IMDB

Melania Zalipsky as the Frontier Girl - IMDB

Jackie McClain (L) as the Aunt - IMDB

Mike Fish (L) and John Carl Jr. (R) as Bounty Hunters - IMDB/IMDB

Dan Griffin (C) as the Guard - IMDB

Dyrrell Williams (L), Magician Rex (C), and Muzwakhe Sithole (R) - IMDB/IMDB/IMDB

Keith Diahn (back left) and Marlene Usdin (riding) - IMDB/IMDB

Who is behind "1805"?

Daniel H. Jacobson - Producer, Screenwriter, Director, Editor - IMDB

Dan is an American-Israeli filmmaker. Born and raised in Lancaster, PA, he earned a B.A. in International Relations from Clark University in 2008. That summer, he moved to Tel Aviv, interning for a counter-terrorism think tank before being drafted into the IDF, where he served in a combat infantry brigade.

Dan spent the next few years travelling, working odd jobs, and reevaluating his goals; ultimately choosing to attend film school (Minshar) in Tel Aviv where he studied under Israeli director Erez Tadmor, whom he credits for teaching him the basic rules of filmmaking.

At Minshar, he turned an incomplete second-year assignment into the award-winning independent short film “Down the River”.

"Down the River" on IMDB

i24 English interviewing Dan about “Down the River”

“Down the River” premiered in a string of festivals in Mexico and the United States in late 2019. With a string of festivals set to screen “Down the River” on the West Coast, Dan decided to move back to the states in March 2020, after 12 years living in Israel.

Then COVID hit.

One after another, the festivals moved online. But a funny thing happened. “Down the River” started getting recognized. In May 2020, they received four nominations from the New York Independent Film Festival; Best Short, Best Actress (Heli Amaresh Sanka), Best Actor (Khameis El-Sheikh), and Best Screenplay. 

They won two; for ‘Best Actress’ and ‘Best Screenplay’. 

Watch the Awards Show

It was at just this time that Dan began developing "1805", but only if he could get Raz Birger to shoot it. 

Raz Birger - Producer, Director of Photography - IMDB

Raz Birger is an Israeli-Hungarian cinematographer based in Budapest. A longtime collaborator with Dan Jacobson, Raz shot “Down the River”. 

Raz spent weeks quarantining on both ends of his first trip to America, committing more than six weeks to the project. Together with Dan and gaffer George Winchell, they carefully planned each shot around their unique choice to shoot the film on an Angenieux 25-250mm zoom lens, notably used by Stanley Kubrick in “Barry Lyndon'' and a favorite of American auteur Robert Altman. 

Ross Denyer - Producer, Actor (“Mr. Jared Corey”) - IMDB/Website

Ross Denyer is a writer, director, actor, and producer based in Los Angeles. Ross and Dan met at the 2019 Oaxaca Film Festival and began collaborating soon after. Ross’ award-winning film, “Tell No Tales” screened at the festival - you can check it out yourself on Amazon via this link.

From the start, Ross has been an integral piece of the “1805” team. He edited the screenplay. He scouted and cast the actors. Hell, he even designed the damn poster! Ross has been there every step of the way and shouldered a great deal of the burden, without which the film could never have been made. 

Ray Hungria - Producer - IMDB

Ray Hungria is a New York-based screenwriter, director, and producer. Ray, Ross Denyer, and Dan Jacobson met at the 2019 Oaxaca Film Festival where Ray’s film, “Jenni” was awarded “Best Short Film” in its category. 

Above:  L-R; Mahmoud Salimi, Daniel H. Jacobson, Ross Denyer, and Ray Hungria in Oaxaca, Mexico. 

A veteran of the industry, Ray helped shepherd the production through some of the challenging aspects of the pre-production process and organized the cast and crew on the initial shooting day.

Lyndsey Hinkle - Associate Producer, Production Designer - IMDB/Website

Lyndsey Hinkle is a designer based in Reading, PA. One of the first hires on “1805”, it was Lyndsey’s responsibility to believably create period-accurate sets, props, and art on a minuscule budget. Needless to say, where the film achieves its lofty aims at authenticity, it is a direct credit to Lyndsey’s talent and dedication. 

Lyndsey was also integral in finding and securing one of the principal locations. 

Jerry Kilduff - Associate Producer, Sound Mixer - IMDB

Based in Walpole, MA, Jerry Kilduff is an old college friend who Dan recruited to join the “1805” team. Jerry quickly rose to become one of the core leaders of the crew, assisting Dan and Raz in executing their producer duties while occupied on set. Somehow, he also found time to mic the actors, hold the boom, and record sound.

George Winchell - Associate Producer, Gaffer - IMDB/Website

George Winchell is the first person Dan hired when he decided to make “1805”. Having moved back to Lancaster only weeks before, Dan needed to find a local professional who could help build the crew and source the equipment required to shoot the film. 

Creatively, George worked alongside director of photography Raz Birger as gaffer, which was a unique position given the fully outdoor production. Almost the entire film was shot using natural light, so George carefully scheduled the shots to correspond with the sun’s position in the sky as per the needs of any given scene. 

7th Floor Composer Group - Original Musical Score - IMDB/Website

7th Floor Composer Group is a team of four composers based in the United States consisting of George Hutson Warren, Fadi Khoury, Pierce Constanti, and Pano Fountas. The group combines contrasting musical backgrounds to create standout scores for film, television, video games and advertisements.  7th Floor joins deep insight into symphonic and piano tradition with experimental technology-driven music techniques including synthesizer programming and extended electric guitar techniques.  Members have composed for award-winning films including student Oscar and student BAFTA-winning documentary "Making Waves", student BAFTA-shortlisted documentary "Use Your Words", Los Angeles Film Awards and New York Film Awards-winning film "Nowhere Man", and Gold and Special Jury Remi Award-winning independent feature film "Lone Star Deception".

7th Floor’s musical backgrounds include a B.M. with distinction from the Gnesin Academy of Music in Moscow, a B.M. in piano performance from Eastman School of Music in New York, a B.A. in music with a focus in Classical Guitar & composition from University of North Texas, and a B.A. in Music cum laude from Washington University in St. Louis.  Individual members have performed at Carnegie Hall and the St. Louis Enterprise Stadium, among other concert venues around the globe.

The four composers met in a 7th floor walk-up apartment in New York City while earning master’s degrees in screen scoring at NYU Steinhardt, hence the name ‘7th Floor Composer Group.’  This humble setting transformed into a powerhouse of music creation.  What started as sharing ideas, writing music together and project assisting, led to team building and the formation of a mutual goal: to write film scores of the highest quality with efficiency for all collaborators.

The Crew:

Assistant Directors:

Nick Hess (1st) - IMDB

Keara Kobzowicz (1st) - IMDB

Cameron Frassetta (2nd) - IMDB

Victoria Waring (2nd) - IMDB

Wulfar Ramsey (3rd) - IMDB

Assistant Camera:

Gregory Ressetar - IMDB

Grip:

Bill Stoms - IMDB

Costume, Wardrobe, and Stunts:

Hanna Weiss - IMDB

Makeup:

Maleeva Epperson - IMDB

Production Assistants:

Andrew Adams - IMDB

Andrei Saylor - IMDB

Horse Riders:

Danee Rudy - IMDB/Website

Davin Rudy - IMDB/Website

Lita Savage - IMDB

Jess Wolfskill - IMDB

Locations

"1805" was shot on location in Central Pennsylvania.  Shooting locations included historic sites like Historic Rock Ford (Website) and the Hans Herr House (Website). The rest of the film was shot across two horse farms, one in Lancaster and one in Robesonia. 

In Lancaster, Glenn and Marlene Usdin generously donated use of their gorgeous, sprawling property "Cherry Hollow Farm" (Website) to the production, free of charge. Marlene Usdin appears in "1805" riding their horse Archie in a brief cameo. Additionally, their late horse Diva (R.I.P.) makes her film debut in "1805".

What are we funding?

To date, we’ve spent $30,368.75 on production costs. We’ll need at least another $5,000 to cover our post-production expenses including sound design, color grading, and more.  

Beyond that there are lesser costs like festival submission fees and promotion. 


Here is a breakdown of how we spent our funds to date:

Equipment: $11,008.78

Crew: $5,300.00

Travel/Accommodation: $2,377.60

Cast: $2,350.00

Costumes: $2,076.80

Legal Fees/Insurance: $1,961.27

Craft Services: $1,631.72

Locations: $1,600.00

Post-Production (to date): $1,500.00

Props: $504.04

Miscellaneous: $58.54

Total: $30,368.75

What is the ultimate goal for ‘1805’?

To be seen by as many people as many times as possible.

Like any short film, "1805" dreams of growing into a more expanded project; be it a feature film or television series. 

And like any short, it is a vehicle for the creative and professional ambitions of the cast and crew. 

But we hope "1805" is much more than that. This film offers a serious attempt at introspection on intersecting levels, and we hope it moves and motivates the audience in the same way it has the people who generated it. 

Where can we find more information on ‘1805’?

I’m so glad you asked! We’ve spent months preparing for this moment and we are so excited to share everything we’ve been working on with you! 

Through these links you will find videos featuring our dedicated cast and crew speaking about "1805", their experience on the project, and what it means to them.

Website

Facebook

Instagram

IMDB

YouTube
story_txt: What is ‘1805’? “1805” is a 30-minute short film that follows Bassamer and Marfay as they flee bondage in Virginia in search of the Mason-Dixon line, juxtaposing the moral quandaries they face along the way against those of their oppressors, and shining a light on the multitude of intersecting and conflicting moral systems that often occupy the same place and time.A historical drama, “1805” was shot in eight days over a two-week period stretching from August 10-24, 2020, in-and-around Lancaster, PA. The production was conceived as a 100% outdoor shoot due to the COVID-19 pandemic. “1805” aims, in its own small way, to explore the continuum of an oppressive system that disfigures the morality of the oppressed by pitting them against each other. This is not a film about a hero beating the odds, this is a film about the odds preventing a hero’s rise in the first place. Ultimately, “1805” is a story for the thousands of others like it, forever lost to history.Who's in it?Nathaniel J. Ryan as Basammer - IMDB/WebsiteBasammer, a  slave recently purchased by Mr. Jared Corey, escapes a Virginia plantation with his secret wife, Marfay. Basammer is principled yet naive. Deeply devoted to Marfay, he will do anything to ensure they make it across the Mason-Dixon line.Michelle Kariuki as Marfay - IMDBMarfay is a young slave who escapes the Corey plantation with her husband, Basammer. She is compassionate yet pragmatic. She loves Basammer, and will do anything to ensure they make it across the Mason-Dixon line. Ross Denyer as Mr. Jared Corey - IMDBThe scion of a slave owning Virginia family, Jared Corey struggles to maintain a grasp on the power he recently inherited. Frank Sean Johnson as Joshua - IMDBAn older freedman who risks his life crossing back over the Mason-Dixon line to broker a deal. Joshua is under no illusions about the realities of "freedom" for a black man. Laurence James Sargent (C) as The Bounty Hunter - IMDBHired by Mr. Jared Corey to bring in Basammer and Marfay. A dispassionate man who takes pride in his work, the Bounty Hunter won't tolerate bravado and considers himself fair and reasonable. Marian Edmiston as Mrs. Tilley - IMDBBrian Rock as the Deer Hunter - IMDBAdrienne Alexa Nicole Smith as the Mother - IMDBSydney Rushing as the Daughter - IMDBNorma Jean Vargus (L) as the Guide - IMDBMichael Arrington III as Woodman - IMDBBradley "Bing" Ingersoll as the Overseer - IMDBJaimee Friend as Sisyphus - IMDBMelania Zalipsky as the Frontier Girl - IMDBJackie McClain (L) as the Aunt - IMDBMike Fish (L) and John Carl Jr. (R) as Bounty Hunters - IMDB/IMDBDan Griffin (C) as the Guard - IMDBDyrrell Williams (L), Magician Rex (C), and Muzwakhe Sithole (R) - IMDB/IMDB/IMDBKeith Diahn (back left) and Marlene Usdin (riding) - IMDB/IMDBWho is behind "1805"?Daniel H. Jacobson - Producer, Screenwriter, Director, Editor - IMDBDan is an American-Israeli filmmaker. Born and raised in Lancaster, PA, he earned a B.A. in International Relations from Clark University in 2008. That summer, he moved to Tel Aviv, interning for a counter-terrorism think tank before being drafted into the IDF, where he served in a combat infantry brigade.Dan spent the next few years travelling, working odd jobs, and reevaluating his goals; ultimately choosing to attend film school (Minshar) in Tel Aviv where he studied under Israeli director Erez Tadmor, whom he credits for teaching him the basic rules of filmmaking.At Minshar, he turned an incomplete second-year assignment into the award-winning independent short film “Down the River”."Down the River" on IMDBi24 English interviewing Dan about “Down the River”“Down the River” premiered in a string of festivals in Mexico and the United States in late 2019. With a string of festivals set to screen “Down the River” on the West Coast, Dan decided to move back to the states in March 2020, after 12 years living in Israel.Then COVID hit.One after another, the festivals moved online. But a funny thing happened. “Down the River” started getting recognized. In May 2020, they received four nominations from the New York Independent Film Festival; Best Short, Best Actress (Heli Amaresh Sanka), Best Actor (Khameis El-Sheikh), and Best Screenplay. They won two; for ‘Best Actress’ and ‘Best Screenplay’. Watch the Awards ShowIt was at just this time that Dan began developing "1805", but only if he could get Raz Birger to shoot it. Raz Birger - Producer, Director of Photography - IMDBRaz Birger is an Israeli-Hungarian cinematographer based in Budapest. A longtime collaborator with Dan Jacobson, Raz shot “Down the River”. Raz spent weeks quarantining on both ends of his first trip to America, committing more than six weeks to the project. Together with Dan and gaffer George Winchell, they carefully planned each shot around their unique choice to shoot the film on an Angenieux 25-250mm zoom lens, notably used by Stanley Kubrick in “Barry Lyndon'' and a favorite of American auteur Robert Altman. Ross Denyer - Producer, Actor (“Mr. Jared Corey”) - IMDB/WebsiteRoss Denyer is a writer, director, actor, and producer based in Los Angeles. Ross and Dan met at the 2019 Oaxaca Film Festival and began collaborating soon after. Ross’ award-winning film, “Tell No Tales” screened at the festival - you can check it out yourself on Amazon via this link.From the start, Ross has been an integral piece of the “1805” team. He edited the screenplay. He scouted and cast the actors. Hell, he even designed the damn poster! Ross has been there every step of the way and shouldered a great deal of the burden, without which the film could never have been made. Ray Hungria - Producer - IMDBRay Hungria is a New York-based screenwriter, director, and producer. Ray, Ross Denyer, and Dan Jacobson met at the 2019 Oaxaca Film Festival where Ray’s film, “Jenni” was awarded “Best Short Film” in its category. Above:  L-R; Mahmoud Salimi, Daniel H. Jacobson, Ross Denyer, and Ray Hungria in Oaxaca, Mexico. A veteran of the industry, Ray helped shepherd the production through some of the challenging aspects of the pre-production process and organized the cast and crew on the initial shooting day.Lyndsey Hinkle - Associate Producer, Production Designer - IMDB/WebsiteLyndsey Hinkle is a designer based in Reading, PA. One of the first hires on “1805”, it was Lyndsey’s responsibility to believably create period-accurate sets, props, and art on a minuscule budget. Needless to say, where the film achieves its lofty aims at authenticity, it is a direct credit to Lyndsey’s talent and dedication. Lyndsey was also integral in finding and securing one of the principal locations. Jerry Kilduff - Associate Producer, Sound Mixer - IMDBBased in Walpole, MA, Jerry Kilduff is an old college friend who Dan recruited to join the “1805” team. Jerry quickly rose to become one of the core leaders of the crew, assisting Dan and Raz in executing their producer duties while occupied on set. Somehow, he also found time to mic the actors, hold the boom, and record sound.George Winchell - Associate Producer, Gaffer - IMDB/WebsiteGeorge Winchell is the first person Dan hired when he decided to make “1805”. Having moved back to Lancaster only weeks before, Dan needed to find a local professional who could help build the crew and source the equipment required to shoot the film. Creatively, George worked alongside director of photography Raz Birger as gaffer, which was a unique position given the fully outdoor production. Almost the entire film was shot using natural light, so George carefully scheduled the shots to correspond with the sun’s position in the sky as per the needs of any given scene. 7th Floor Composer Group - Original Musical Score - IMDB/Website7th Floor Composer Group is a team of four composers based in the United States consisting of George Hutson Warren, Fadi Khoury, Pierce Constanti, and Pano Fountas. The group combines contrasting musical backgrounds to create standout scores for film, television, video games and advertisements.  7th Floor joins deep insight into symphonic and piano tradition with experimental technology-driven music techniques including synthesizer programming and extended electric guitar techniques.  Members have composed for award-winning films including student Oscar and student BAFTA-winning documentary "Making Waves", student BAFTA-shortlisted documentary "Use Your Words", Los Angeles Film Awards and New York Film Awards-winning film "Nowhere Man", and Gold and Special Jury Remi Award-winning independent feature film "Lone Star Deception".7th Floor’s musical backgrounds include a B.M. with distinction from the Gnesin Academy of Music in Moscow, a B.M. in piano performance from Eastman School of Music in New York, a B.A. in music with a focus in Classical Guitar & composition from University of North Texas, and a B.A. in Music cum laude from Washington University in St. Louis.  Individual members have performed at Carnegie Hall and the St. Louis Enterprise Stadium, among other concert venues around the globe.The four composers met in a 7th floor walk-up apartment in New York City while earning master’s degrees in screen scoring at NYU Steinhardt, hence the name ‘7th Floor Composer Group.’  This humble setting transformed into a powerhouse of music creation.  What started as sharing ideas, writing music together and project assisting, led to team building and the formation of a mutual goal: to write film scores of the highest quality with efficiency for all collaborators.The Crew:Assistant Directors:Nick Hess (1st) - Marlene Usdin appears in "1805" riding their horse Archie in a brief cameo. story:
Short Summary

Hi folks, my name is Oscar De Leon, writer-director of the visual album adaptation of “Trip 27” by rapper/producer Huck. You might know me better by my artist moniker, guero. Huck and I have been collaborating on music videos for almost 2 years now and it’s been the collaboration of a lifetime. For our next collaboration, we are swinging for the fences and attempting a 5-part music video-short film hybrid that will take us cross country on a road trip. 

When we first met, we bonded over cinematic videos as a form of visual expression. We both knew that we could create something great when we combined our talents. After having worked on 4 music videos so far, we’ve decided to push even further and create a piece of visual art that will be shared for years to come. 

Your help will enable us to realize our dream. For this project, we are planning on filming music videos along a road trip to create something visually dazzling while also telling a concise story. Not only will your contributions help create the project, but they will also allow us to help pay the team of talented filmmakers committed to making this project a reality. 

What We Need & What You Get

 

With over half our budget already raised, we need help covering operational costs for the trip. Your contributions will help us secure proper lodging, food, and, god forbid, extra padding for any worst-case scenario on the long and winding road. 

 

Your contribution makes you part of the team! You will get you a thank you in the credits alongside some cool goodies like pins, t-shirts, and posters. You’ll also get updates on the filmmaking process and unprecedented access to the talents behind the camera with behind the scene footage and more!

Any funds raised here will go directly into the project. It will help compensate the team for their travel, equipment and hours worked. Independent filmmaking is a labor of love, and oftentimes we go broke trying to make stuff happen. We won’t have to worry about that with your support. 

 

The Impact

 

With Trip 27, we hope to have a piece of work that we can share with people virtually and in public. The visual album will be released side by side with the full length LP. That means that you can expect public showings of the short film paired with live performances. 

 

As an established filmmaker, I’ve relied on the community's support to help create events for my films. In the past, I’ve held successful showings for 4 films and have enjoyed screenings in America & Canada for my film work. For Trip 27, we aim to do the same. 

 

As part of the unveiling of the finished film, I also hope to use this as an opportunity to support North Dakota’s small repertory theatres and showcase our film in a place where we can have a tangible impact in the wake of COVID-19.

Risks & Challenges

 

With a project this big, there are always hurdles. Luckily, we’ve been planning this project for over 8 months and are in the middle of production which has kept us fluid in our approach. The biggest challenge is yet to come: the road trip to Arizona. 

 

Without spoiling the ending, we are planning on making a road trip from Fargo, ND to Arizona over a week span in May. We’ve gone through our checklist, crossed our T’s and dotted our I’s but the great unknown is still out there. In order to avoid being bogged down by any unforeseen problems, we need financial padding. 

 

You can never be too prepared! 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share with your friends and family! We are a ragtag group of dudes looking to make art in the face of a global pandemic. It’s not because we want to, it’s because we need to. You can help us out by checking out our previous work together, following us on social media, and chipping in whenever you can. Anything helps!

story:
Hello Indie Horror Friends and Fans!

My name is Justin M. Seaman and I am the Co- Producer along with Zane Hershberger. We are the team that brought you the retro throwback horror film 'The Barn' and currently in production 'The Barn Part II'. Also just recently completed is 'Force to Fear' an 80s' action flick in the vein of 'Savage Streets' meets 'The Collector'. We have been working together since 2013 on various other projects with other films including '10/31', '10/31 Part 2' and 'Volumes of Blood: Horror Stories'.

What is 'CRYPTIDS'?

'Cryptids' is a creature feature horror anthology that takes place in a radio station on a show called "The Truth Serum" hosted by Major Harlan Dean. On tonight's episode Harlan decides to tackle the topic of cryptozoology but as the phone lines light up and the calls come in, each caller's stories become increasingly more bizarre and Harlan starts to question if real dangers are lurking outside the station.

The film is meant to bring back our favorite days of films and television shows like Creepshow, Monsters, Tales from the Darkside and Tales from the Crypt. Using as much practical FX with the monsters as we can and keeping the CGI to a minimum. You can expect to see such legends as Bigfoot, Loveland Frogman, Chupacubras, Beast of Bladenboro, Dover Demon and more!

The Origins

The idea of Cryptids began because Zane bought a book as a child at a school book fair called "Monsters You Never Heard Of" by Daniel Coen and it sparked a love of monster stories ever since. Growing up listening to Art Bell's Coast to Coast he thought it seemed like a no brainer to tell a story about callers who call in to a radio show with their monster encounters and thus 'Cryptids' was born. In 2013, Zane started the project but his original team jumped ship after he shot his segment "Melon Heads". After becoming friends with Zane on the set of 'The Barn' in 2016 I decided I would help him resurrect his project and help him take it to the finish line, we just didn't realize it would be such a long line haha.

Staying true to Zane's vision, we met and brought on board various indie filmmakers to direct segments in the film including: Brett DeJager of 'Bonejangles', Max Groah of 'Bong of the Living Dead', Johnny William Holt of 'The Dooms Chapel Horror' and Billy Pon of 'Circus of the Dead' plus our long time FX artist Robert Kuhn.

We still had 2 main segments left to film plus the wraparound radio show called "The Truth Serum with Major Harlan Dean". We spent about 2 years looking for the perfect person to play Harlan Dean and luckily while working the convention circuit I met just the person I was looking for while in Lexington Kentucky at Scarefest 2018. After quite some time working out the details I was finally able to land Mr. Monster Vision/ The Last Drive-In himself...Joe Bob Briggs!

I'm not gonna lie, a big chunk of the funding was for this scene and we needed it before we could shoot so we had everything ready to film for April 2020. The campaign was ready to launch first week of March and then the pandemic hit. We just couldn't in good conscious make the campaign live, so we decided to postpone the shoot and wait. In fact if you have a copy of the May issue of SCREAM magazine you'll see our ad in there that we prepaid to coincide with the ending of our original campaign.

Then we rescheduled our shoot for July 2020, we took what savings we had left and we built the sets, hired the actors, booked the flights, accommodations etc and we shot the segment. Joe Bob nailed it!

The campaign means a lot to us because we need your help to finish this film, we've been self funding this project since 2013 and now with the additional blow of the pandemic we don't have the capital to complete the remainder of the film anytime soon.

INTRODUCING SOME OF THE CAST MEMBERS!!!

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • How much are you raising and why? We are looking to raise $23,000.00 - Why that much? Well because we still have 2 more segments to shoot and we've spent roughly 70% of that overall over the years so far and we still have to spend a minimum of another $10k to complete the film and cover the manufacturing of the perks as well as the shipping/fees for Indiegogo. We know that the total amount we are asking will not cover the cost of the overall film nor the additional expenses that are sure to arise in the future but this will at least get us to a place were the film can be completed.

 

  • Can we see the film before the Indiegogo perks are shipped? It's still undecided if the film will be submitted into film fests or not due to the pandemic, it is something we will decide once the film is completed and we see how the world is at that time. We would love to enter the film into film fests if possible so we may have the opportunity to reconnect with our filmmakers, friends and fans in person one day again. Otherwise we have discussed at minimum a tour of the film even if its only at drive-in theaters or smaller theaters to help with additional funds before the physical release.

 

  • What do you get in return for supporting us? Well all kinds of great perks from posters to T-shirts, DVDs, Blurays that are signed from the directors and even Joe Bob Briggs himself!

 

     

    Risks & Challenges and FAQ

    • What is the biggest challenge?  Our biggest challenge outside of not having the remaining funds to complete the film at the moment is COVID-19 limiting when we can film and when our segment directors can film safely. We will continue to work on the project as long as everyone involved feels comfortable and safe on set.

     

    • What if you don't reach your goal? This isn't an ALL or NOTHING campaign so if we don't reach our total we will receive what we raise minus larger platform fees. However, if we don't reach our goal the film will still get made, it will just take even longer to finish.

     

    • What about stretch goals? We'll discuss those if we get close to the goal haha

     

    • If you have self funded it this far, why not just continue it by yourself?  The goal was to always start out self funding and then continue and finish with crowdfunding, but the project became so on going that we never had a chance to do the crowdfunding portion. Normally we make most of our funds going to conventions and selling our other films but this year has killed that for us and we have no idea what next year will bring so we are truly hoping that this campaign can help us complete this project while allowing all of you to finally be a part of something we have been working on behind the scenes secretly for a very long time.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand times are tough, tougher than normal. So if you can't donate please share, share in collector groups, horror groups that might have interest in cryptids, creature feature or even Joe Bob Briggs! Any help is greatly appreciated.
