'Cryptids' is a creature feature horror anthology that takes place in a radio station on a show called "The Truth Serum" hosted by Major Harlan Dean. On tonight's episode Harlan decides to tackle the topic of cryptozoology but as the phone lines light up and the calls come in, each caller's stories become increasingly more bizarre and Harlan starts to question if real dangers are lurking outside the station.
The film is meant to bring back our favorite days of films and television shows like Creepshow, Monsters, Tales from the Darkside and Tales from the Crypt. Using as much practical FX with the monsters as we can and keeping the CGI to a minimum. You can expect to see such legends as Bigfoot, Loveland Frogman, Chupacubras, Beast of Bladenboro, Dover Demon and more!
The Origins
The idea of Cryptids began because Zane bought a book as a child at a school book fair called "Monsters You Never Heard Of" by Daniel Coen and it sparked a love of monster stories ever since. Growing up listening to Art Bell's Coast to Coast he thought it seemed like a no brainer to tell a story about callers who call in to a radio show with their monster encounters and thus 'Cryptids' was born. In 2013, Zane started the project but his original team jumped ship after he shot his segment "Melon Heads". After becoming friends with Zane on the set of 'The Barn' in 2016 I decided I would help him resurrect his project and help him take it to the finish line, we just didn't realize it would be such a long line haha.

Staying true to Zane's vision, we met and brought on board various indie filmmakers to direct segments in the film including: Brett DeJager of 'Bonejangles', Max Groah of 'Bong of the Living Dead', Johnny William Holt of 'The Dooms Chapel Horror' and Billy Pon of 'Circus of the Dead' plus our long time FX artist Robert Kuhn.
We still had 2 main segments left to film plus the wraparound radio show called "The Truth Serum with Major Harlan Dean". We spent about 2 years looking for the perfect person to play Harlan Dean and luckily while working the convention circuit I met just the person I was looking for while in Lexington Kentucky at Scarefest 2018. After quite some time working out the details I was finally able to land Mr. Monster Vision/ The Last Drive-In himself...Joe Bob Briggs! 
I'm not gonna lie, a big chunk of the funding was for this scene and we needed it before we could shoot so we had everything ready to film for April 2020. The campaign was ready to launch first week of March and then the pandemic hit. We just couldn't in good conscious make the campaign live, so we decided to postpone the shoot and wait. In fact if you have a copy of the May issue of SCREAM magazine you'll see our ad in there that we prepaid to coincide with the ending of our original campaign.

Then we rescheduled our shoot for July 2020, we took what savings we had left and we built the sets, hired the actors, booked the flights, accommodations etc and we shot the segment. Joe Bob nailed it!

The campaign means a lot to us because we need your help to finish this film, we've been self funding this project since 2013 and now with the additional blow of the pandemic we don't have the capital to complete the remainder of the film anytime soon.
INTRODUCING SOME OF THE CAST MEMBERS!!!




What We Need & What You Get
 

How much are you raising and why? We are looking to raise $23,000.00 - Why that much? Well because we still have 2 more segments to shoot and we've spent roughly 70% of that overall over the years so far and we still have to spend a minimum of another $10k to complete the film and cover the manufacturing of the perks as well as the shipping/fees for Indiegogo. We know that the total amount we are asking will not cover the cost of the overall film nor the additional expenses that are sure to arise in the future but this will at least get us to a place were the film can be completed.
 

Can we see the film before the Indiegogo perks are shipped? It's still undecided if the film will be submitted into film fests or not due to the pandemic, it is something we will decide once the film is completed and we see how the world is at that time. We would love to enter the film into film fests if possible so we may have the opportunity to reconnect with our filmmakers, friends and fans in person one day again. Otherwise we have discussed at minimum a tour of the film even if its only at drive-in theaters or smaller theaters to help with additional funds before the physical release.
 

What do you get in return for supporting us? Well all kinds of great perks from posters to T-shirts, DVDs, Blurays that are signed from the directors and even Joe Bob Briggs himself!
 

 

Risks & Challenges and FAQ

What is the biggest challenge?  Our biggest challenge outside of not having the remaining funds to complete the film at the moment is COVID-19 limiting when we can film and when our segment directors can film safely. We will continue to work on the project as long as everyone involved feels comfortable and safe on set.
 

What if you don't reach your goal? This isn't an ALL or NOTHING campaign so if we don't reach our total we will receive what we raise minus larger platform fees. However, if we don't reach our goal the film will still get made, it will just take even longer to finish.
 

What about stretch goals? We'll discuss those if we get close to the goal haha
 

If you have self funded it this far, why not just continue it by yourself?  The goal was to always start out self funding and then continue and finish with crowdfunding, but the project became so on going that we never had a chance to do the crowdfunding portion. Normally we make most of our funds going to conventions and selling our other films but this year has killed that for us and we have no idea what next year will bring so we are truly hoping that this campaign can help us complete this project while allowing all of you to finally be a part of something we have been working on behind the scenes secretly for a very long time.


Other Ways You Can Help
We understand times are tough, tougher than normal. So if you can't donate please share, share in collector groups, horror groups that might have interest in cryptids, creature feature or even Joe Bob Briggs! Any help is greatly appreciated.

story:
Artwork by Joe Meredith

It Lives!!!

We're just a bunch of horror nerds trying to live out our dream by entertaining an audience making horror films.  

The impetus of this project was simple ... I saw that director Sebastien Godin was out there doing it. Making micro-budget film after film: Slimoids, Ouija Mummy, Blood Rites of the Vampyre etc.  I admired his tenacious filmmaking as well as his passion for the horror genre.  I was making documentaries, feature length and shorts, as well as producing a couple of short horror projects but the end goal was always feature length horror films.  

Seb invited me up to North Bay to do some work on his latest film, The Abominations of Frankenstein ... I agreed.  Then I had an idea.  What if I produced Seb's next film?  What if we married up our resources, worked together and attempted to elevate the quality, size and overall scope of the films we were both making? But how? By upping the budget, bringing in some of my crew connections and resources, shooting on better more professional equipment and really ultimately making a real film with an experienced (at least partially) cast and crew and creating a true film experience by creating a story with relevance, honest characters, multiple locations, props, special effects and bringing it all to life by whatever means possible.   

November 2020 we went to work.  It started quite simply with me asking Seb two questions, what do you want to do ... what do you really want to make next?  His answer ... Dracula.  Cue my response ... oh no!  Dracula?  Dracula doesn't translate at all to 2020.  It's all about castles, costumes, bats, horse and carriages etc.  Which led to my second question, do you write?  Do you have a writer? No.  Well maybe I'll write it then.  

I decided that whatever form our film took it had to have a solid script to lay the bedrock of the production.  A weak script sets an early tone for disaster.  What I wanted was something smart, somewhat unique for a low budget film, socially relevant without hitting our audience over the head with it and at the end day ... something that we all wanted to see on the screen.

Here we are entering the Summer of 2021 and The Damnation of Dracula is happening.  It's been cast.  A talented dedicated crew has been assembled.  FX are being designed.  Musical compositions are being created and compiled.  Locations are being scouted.  Shot lists and storyboards are being developed.  Costumes.  Props.  You name it ... it's all happening. 

We're busy.  We're a small team shouldering an entire film production.  That's the reality of the nature of this type of film BUT ultimately to make it happen we need your help. Financial help.

We can't do it without you. 

Plotting the Undead - The Dawning of a Very Canadian Horror Experience

    The small northern Canadian communities of Creek and Buffalo Mines are weak and nearly beaten.  Since the closing of the mines a number of years ago the area is a shell of its once thriving past.  The area is mostly made up of seniors and Indigenous people who have inhabited the area for hundreds of years.  To further complicate matters developers have starting clearcutting the land and helping un-earth an evil that begins not only destroying the environment but feeding on the blood of the locals.  

    Eighteen year old Sarah Blackice is forced into taking action when her cousin Jimi is killed and his blood drained.  Sarah , along with her cousin Birdie and their friend Wes approach a local talk radio host on a show about Myths, Monsters and Urban Legends for his expertise in helping combat the evil that has risen.  Together this unlikely team must band together to overcome the dark malevolence they're confronted with. 

    The horror they uncover is far more insidious than local legends and myths of Wendigo spirits.  Digging beneath the surface past the frozen earth, through the pine needles and muskeg is a darkness in the form of a hideous creature named Dracula.  Organically rising out the sins of the past and present, years of broken treaties, stolen land and missing and murdered Indigenous women SHE rises, regaining strength to become whole once again.  

    Fortunately for this community they have a sentinel … a guardian in the form of powerful fearless young girl who’s journey and refusal to give up leads her into battle of wits with the Princess of Darkness herself … for the soul of her people and their land.

We Live in Canada - That's Why We Crowdfund!!! 

The average cost of a Hollywood film is approximately $100 million.  A low budget film is usually in the $3 million dollar range.  Micro-budget films are made in North America for a maximum of $400,000 approximately.  

I've budgeted The Damnation of Dracula out at approximately $27,000.  

Seems laughable but we can make it happen for under $30,000.  What does that pay for?  It covers the bare necessities of a small film production: transportation, make-up FX, insurance, food, accommodations, costumes, rental space and of course paying our cast and crew a little something for the time they're involved in shooting the project. 

It's spread thin, corners are cut, extravagances are forgotten but that's the formula for making it happen.  

Your contributions will make this film a reality and I think it's going to be a good one.  This is a special screenplay, at once socially topical and horrifying.  A very Canadian tight wire balancing act for filmmaking.  It's big, not your typical low budget slasher type fare ... this is ambitious to say the least; more than 15 speaking parts and multiple locations around the Niagara Region. 

The perks we've created are designed to be delivered promptly and to make contributors feel they're part of something special.  Often on campaigns deliverables fall to the wayside in the hustle and bustle of making a project happen.  We want you to not only help us out but also to feel as though you're part of our community in making this film come to life.  A few of the very special perks we're offering include: playing the role of a creature in the film in full make-up, a signed Vampirella comic from actress/model Ali Chappell, Executive and Associate Producer opportunities, props used in the film etc. 

There is no studio system in Canada, tax breaks are tough to come by, funding comes in the form very often of government grants BUT not so often for horror films.  

Wait!!! How?!?  For That Kind of Budget!!!

A reality of the industry is that the "cash hose" can put out a lot of fires.  It's easy for a Hollywood production to see an area of concern and wash away that issue was a million dollar solution.  On a production like we're working on $200 feeds a crew for a day.  $1500 covers insurance on costly equipment for a week. $50 pays for a much need costume or two.  

This is meat and potatoes filmmaking.  Very down and dirty blue collar in nature.  I was raised into a hard working family of men that worked the rails.  My mom's family were Indigenous trappers, hunters and fishermen from Northern Ontario who worked the land to survive.  That work ethic was instilled in me from and early age and I've used it to make films.  It's how I made two feature length film documentaries on my own, lighting, directing, producing, writing, shooting and hauling all my own equipment from Fort Erie to Toronto, Buffalo to Texas.  

Seb has made micro budget films for $3000 or less.  I've carried documentary productions on my back for not much more.  This time out ... we're raising the stakes.  We're attempting something you don't see too often in Canada, a grassroots production.  A group of filmmakers, writers, musicians, make-up artists etc. getting together, in the Niagara Region no less and creating a very special feature length film project.  

The Tombs of Undead

It's going to be a battle. I've already told Seb that if this doesn't kill all of us just a little we're probably doing something wrong.  

The task at hand is monumental.  Our crew is 12 - 15 members approximately.  An average Hollywood crew is around 575 - 600 people.  A big Hollywood crew like Iron Man III had 3300 members.  We're not Iron Man III.  Everyone has their duties but at the end of the day many hats will be worn by the people involved to make it all happen.  On any given day right now I'm figuring out the logistics of getting prop guns to booking hotels, costumes to food services to feed our cast and crew. 

There's going to be tough times ... bad days ... hurdles we may stumble over, that's the reality of making any film.  But our passion for making films and the family like group we've assembled will survive it all.  It's like Francis Ford Coppala said, "if the stakes are high enough ... you HAVE to succeed."  

We won't have the "cash hose" to throw money at a problem to solve it but what we do have is a relentless pursuit to make a film at any cost.  A tenacious passion to "make it happen!"  To become part of that 1% who are out there living out a dream. 

Bringing It To Life - The Cast

It's an eclectic one to say the least.  We've got experienced actors like the fantastic Anthony DP Mann (The Terror of Dracula,  Phantom of the Opera), Ali Chappell (Necropolis: Legion) and Canada's Scream Queen Debbie Rochon (Slime City Massacre, The Deepening).  Relative new comers like Rocky Burnham and Osawa Muskwa (The World Ends at Camp Z).  And actors new to features but with a wealth of production, commercial and video experience, Norma Sue Hill, Michelle Burnett and Alex Sobschak.  

Anthony DP Mann

Ali Chappell

Debbie Rochon

Norma Sue Hill 

Rocky Burnham 

Osawa Muskwa

Alex Sobschak

Michelle-Elise Burnett 

Steve Kasan 

Ryan Lunn

The Crew

No Cronenberg's or Carpenter's in sight.  BUT we love their films and to a man we've dreamed of the opportunity and the day when we would get the chance to live out our dreams and make horror films like them.  That said we've got some incredible talent behind the camera. 

Sebastien Godin - Director

Chris Darton - Producer/Writer 

Tobias Darton - Director of Photography 

Scott Patterson - Special Make-Up FX

Frank Popp Jr. - Line Producer 

Jim Casson - Composer 

Help

We appreciate your support.  You can help in a numbers of ways.  You can spread the word.  Share the campaign.  Let people know in your community that this is happening ... that a small group of people are making a film and special that is.

story:
T W I N   F L A M E

When the two goddesses of creation and destruction come together in an unrelenting battle, they discover strength in unity. 

THE STORY

Creation and destruction are pulled together by two goddesses at war. Out of their duel comes transformation. Twin Flame is an ode to the death of the Ego, and the realisation that despite their differences; these women cannot exist without each other.

With rich imagery, the film will deconstruct what it means to embrace and/or reject feminine archetypes, focusing on toxic parent/child relationships, and bringing a sense of modernity to an ancient form of storytelling.

The entire story will be told through Indian Classical dance (Kathak), Abhinaya, Physical theatre and contemporary movement. A soundtrack composed by world renowned musicians Parvyn Singh, Josh Bennet and Jay Dabgar will accompany us through the duration of the film. 

 

Our story focuses on two women inspired by the Hindu Goddesses Kali and Parvati. 

 

THE CHARACTERS

 

Parvati (पावती, Pārvatī)

The Hindu goddess of fertility, love, beauty, marriage, children, and
devotion; as well as of divine strength and power. In Hindu belief, she is the recreative energy and power of Shiva, and she is the cause of a bond that connects all beings and a means of their spiritual release. Parvati is also the goddess of love and devotion, or Kamakshi; the
goddess of fertility, abundance and food/nourishment.

 

Kali (का लका, kä′lē)

The dark goddess of destruction.
The Goddess Kali has several origin stories, but it is popularly believed that Kali emerged from the forehead of Goddess Durga, whilst engaged in battle with Mahisa; a buffalo demon. Durga’s anger was so powerful it sprung forth Kali- the epitome of her rage.  The original ‘take no nonsense’ inspiration for strong women everywhere, Kali is headstrong and courageous, and will do anything to gatekeep the balance of order and chaos.

 

These insular, polar opposites are forced together by the birth of Parvati's child, shifting their perceptions and compelling them to see another side to themselves.  

 

ORIGINS

Twin Flame bridges the gap between authentic South-Asian storytelling within a fresh, contemporary landscape. The film is inspired by our heritage, the rich worlds of Hindu mythology, and our own internal battles brought to life with dance and movement. 

Originally conceptualised in the depths of the 2020 lockdown; what started as a small idea for a stage show turned into a 20 minute dance film. As we began to develop the story and discuss our vision, we soon realised that this project was larger than we had ever imagined, and it deserved to reach its full potential. 

 

WHY ?


To put it simply... this has never been done before.

We're not aiming to make a generic 'dance film. If that were the case we're well versed in doing things the starving artist way, and would have begged, borrowed and snuck into an abandoned warehouse to make it! 

We prefer to view this project as a 20 minute visual art film, with dance and original compositions to assist the storytelling.  

 The level of detail and artistry required for this film means being able to fund artisans and experts to help bring this film to life and give it the authenticity it deserves. It sits within the realm of 'Fantasy' but under the surface there is a truth and grit that will resonate with our audiences, regardless of cultural heritage. 

 

The Impact

 

We are passionate about feminist filmmaking, and representation is hugely important to us. As people of colour, and as queer women, we want to create a film that is authentic but uniquely told from our worldview. This can prove difficult when applying for grants, as most funding bodies in Australia are looking for a very specific style of project, and often stories like this one are misinterpreted or hard to conceptualise. But our vision is so clear that we know with the right backing and our talented crew, we'll be able to produce a visually stunning and engaging film that can hopefully be appreciated by film festival audiences and art galleries worldwide. 

Your donation will...

  • Help us pay our crew industry standard wages
  • Help us build our sets and purchase materials
  • Aid with gear hire and rental 
  • Elevate marginalised creatives 
  • Help to produce a high quality film and provide jobs for at least 15 people 
  • Pay for original music and composition
  • Fund post production and editing
  • Feeding our crew and creatives
  • Entering our film in festivals
  • And SO MUCH MORE!

 

THE CREW

 

Shamita Siva is the Co-Creator of Twin Flame and Performer playing the role of Kali. She is a multi-faceted performance artist and theatre maker who specialises in movement and devised work. Experienced in both stage and screen mediums; Shamita is a performer who enjoys a challenge. A trained dancer from an early age; after over 16 years of ballet training and a broad range of other dance styles, she developed an interest in theatrical dance forms such as Butoh alongside her acting. She holds a BA Performing Arts from Monash University, supplemented by training with Film & Television Studios International, Stella Adler AoA Los Angeles, AAFTA, and Meisner Technique. As a performing artist her work has travelled across Australia and overseas, from the tropical islands of Guam and Brunei, to cosmopolitan Singapore. She often incorporates intercultural practices and cross disciplinary elements into her work, inspired by everyday experiences, music and sound, and socio- political issues she is driven by. When not on large scale stages and screens, she is an active performer within Australia's queer cabaret scene, and is passionate about creating high energy performances with her signature style. Behind the scenes, Shamita is also a writer and director, and is popularly consulted for movement direction. 

 

Ida Ghatge is the Co-Creator of Twin Flame and Performer playing the role of Parvati. Ida is a highly specialised dancer and teacher in the Indian dance style; Kathak. With over 20 years of dance experience, she is known for her grace, speed, story telling and rich patterns of footwork and spin sequences. She also has a broad knowledge of various other world dance forms including Indian folk, Classical Fusion, and Bollywood. Ida also has a range of experience in psychology, writing and public speaking as well having completed her honours in Psychology from the University of Melbourne. She volunteers her  time with Griefline- a national australian helpline catered to individuals experiencing the effects of grief,loss, trauma and isolation. She prides her Indian heritage but is passionate about challenging cultural stereotypes, sex based biases and the stigma around mental health in WOC.  Learning from her personal struggles, she wishes to empower other women to take charge, and be unapologetically themselves. She aims to become a clinical psychologist as well as use her art to increase awareness about mental illness through film, stage and the practice of dance therapy.

 

Sunitra is the Producer and Creative Director for Twin Flame. 
She has been working in the film industry for six years. Sunitra was first immersed in the creative industry at three years old where she was classically trained in a variety of dance forms and music for over fourteen years, where her creativity, knowledge, and passion for the arts, theatre and performance was born.  At the age of seventeen, she studied broadcast media in Singapore for three years, working on producing, directing, and editing. After interning at an advertising production house, editing for Netflix campaigns, she decided to move to the UK and study at the Arts University Bournemouth to pursue her love for filmmaking. During her time there she developed her skills through directing, writing and producing several films. She has just finished a film she directed and co-wrote called "Flesh of My Flesh" and is based in Malaysia working as a cinematographer and marketing executive along side producing Twin Flame.

 

Iain Soumitri is our Project Manager. He is a photographer and filmmaker based in Melbourne, Australia. He recently completed a Bachelor’s in Political Science with a specialisation in Foreign Policy and Middle Eastern Affairs. Iain aims to enter the world of photojournalism and documentary filmmaking to weave his interest in politics and international affairs with his passion for photography and filmmaking. Iain’s 2017 visit to the Barefoot College, in Rajasthan, India, fostered his love for working in rural development and international affairs. This college drafts elderly women from remote communities around the world and trains them become solar engineers. Iain spent his time creating unique portfolios for the college’s students (‘Solar Mamas’). These portfolios (‘photo novellas’) consisted of photographs and text documenting their experience, providing the students with something to both show to their families, and use as a certification to work as solar engineers to electrify their communities. Iain enjoys his time outside of work playing competitive basketball, taking photographs, and composing music.

 

 

 

MUSIC

Jay Dabgar comes from a family of Tabla makers in India, and brings with him the legacy of the Benaras Gharaana style of Tabla playing. He was received the taalim (systematic training) of Indian classical tabla in Benaras gharana at the world renowned Saptak institute (Ahmedabad) for more than 18 years and has won several accolades and has performed extensively with many renowned musicians in India and abroad. He is a recipient of All India radio competition, National youth festival and National Yuva Mahaotsav and many more in India. He has also made a remarkable contribution in the Australian music arena since moving here in 2006 and surely, is one of the first choice Tabla players for international touring artists, both Indian and Western music world. He has toured with world renowned artists like Grammy award winner Pt.Vishwamohan Bhatt, Grammy nominee Ustad Shujat Khan, National award winner Pt.Purbayan Chaterjee and many Australian musicians from different genres and background. 

Parvyn is a Punjabi-Australian singer best known for her work in cult psychedelic band The Bombay Royale, and performing globally since childhood with her father Dya Singh. Parvyn’s current solo project synthesies a lifetime of work and represents a new step in her career. Parvyn’s work is informed by electronica and jazz, her background in Sikh devotional music and her training in classical Indian music and dance.
Her debut solo record ‘Sa’ releasing Sep 2021 has influences from Bjork to Anoushka Shankar, and is immersed in a reflective world of different cultures and perspectives.

Josh Bennett is a multi-instrumentalist equally at home on guitar, sitar, dilruba (bowed sitar), fiddle, mandolin and tabla, he's one of Australia's most versatile musicians. His ability to attain such expertise across so many instruments and to blend his music into so many genres is astonishing. He's performed around the world, on guitar at guitar festivals, on mandolin at Bluegrass festivals, and on sitar for Pandit Ravi Shankar at his home in Delhi.
 
Current projects include Golden Guitar Awards nominated band Mustered Courage, Canyon, BluGuru, Sadhana, and accompanying artists such as Liz Frencham, Paddy Montgomery and Parvyn. Past projects include Dya Singh, The Bombay Royale, and Freshly Squeezed.
Josh has composed and performed the music for stage productions such as Independent Theatre's stage rendition of EM Forster's "Passage To India", and Patch Theatre's "The Moon's a Balloon". 

His current creative output is largely based around his youtube channel presenting weekly videos of musical performances and collaborations, as well as a brand new series currently under development, exploring themes of the science in music. 

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP

We understand that in times like this, finances can be tight, and goodness knows as artists ourselves we have been one of the hardest hit groups over the last year and a half.

So that being said, even if $5 is what you can donate, we would appreciate every little contribution no matter how small. It all adds up and you will have our infinite gratitude. 

If you would like other ways to contribute you can also share the campaign, or go give us some love on our instagram page Twin Flame Film. 

We want to thank everyone for their support so far, including the City of Melbourne who provided us with some seed funding to create the incredible poster and promo imagery by Bass Fam creative, Irene Stamatiou for the illustrations and character sketches, and Priyam Desai for our logo.
story_txt:
T W I N   F L A M E
When the two goddesses of creation and destruction come together in an unrelenting battle, they discover strength in unity. 
THE STORY
Creation and destruction are pulled together by two goddesses at war. Out of their duel comes transformation. Twin Flame is an ode to the death of the Ego, and the realisation that despite their differences; these women cannot exist without each other.
With rich imagery, the film will deconstruct what it means to embrace and/or reject feminine archetypes, focusing on toxic parent/child relationships, and bringing a sense of modernity to an ancient form of storytelling.
The entire story will be told through Indian Classical dance (Kathak), Abhinaya, Physical theatre and contemporary movement. A soundtrack composed by world renowned musicians Parvyn Singh, Josh Bennet and Jay Dabgar will accompany us through the duration of the film. 
 
Our story focuses on two women inspired by the Hindu Goddesses Kali and Parvati. 
 
THE CHARACTERS
 
Parvati (पावती, Pārvatī)The Hindu goddess of fertility, love, beauty, marriage, children, anddevotion; as well as of divine strength and power. In Hindu belief, she is the recreative energy and power of Shiva, and she is the cause of a bond that connects all beings and a means of their spiritual release. Parvati is also the goddess of love and devotion, or Kamakshi; thegoddess of fertility, abundance and food/nourishment.

 
Kali (का लका, kä′lē)The dark goddess of destruction.The Goddess Kali has several origin stories, but it is popularly believed that Kali emerged from the forehead of Goddess Durga, whilst engaged in battle with Mahisa; a buffalo demon. Durga’s anger was so powerful it sprung forth Kali- the epitome of her rage.  The original ‘take no nonsense’ inspiration for strong women everywhere, Kali is headstrong and courageous, and will do anything to gatekeep the balance of order and chaos.

 
These insular, polar opposites are forced together by the birth of Parvati's child, shifting their perceptions and compelling them to see another side to themselves.  
 
ORIGINS
Twin Flame bridges the gap between authentic South-Asian storytelling within a fresh, contemporary landscape. The film is inspired by our heritage, the rich worlds of Hindu mythology, and our own internal battles brought to life with dance and movement. 
Originally conceptualised in the depths of the 2020 lockdown; what started as a small idea for a stage show turned into a 20 minute dance film. As we began to develop the story and discuss our vision, we soon realised that this project was larger than we had ever imagined, and it deserved to reach its full potential. 
 
WHY ?
To put it simply... this has never been done before.
We're not aiming to make a generic 'dance film. If that were the case we're well versed in doing things the starving artist way, and would have begged, borrowed and snuck into an abandoned warehouse to make it! 
We prefer to view this project as a 20 minute visual art film, with dance and original compositions to assist the storytelling.  
 The level of detail and artistry required for this film means being able to fund artisans and experts to help bring this film to life and give it the authenticity it deserves. It sits within the realm of 'Fantasy' but under the surface there is a truth and grit that will resonate with our audiences, regardless of cultural heritage. 
 

The Impact
 
We are passionate about feminist filmmaking, and representation is hugely important to us. As people of colour, and as queer women, we want to create a film that is authentic but uniquely told from our worldview. This can prove difficult when applying for grants, as most funding bodies in Australia are looking for a very specific style of project, and often stories like this one are misinterpreted or hard to conceptualise. But our vision is so clear that we know with the right backing and our talented crew, we'll be able to produce a visually stunning and engaging film that can hopefully be appreciated by film festival audiences and art galleries worldwide. 
Your donation will...

Help us pay our crew industry standard wages
Help us build our sets and purchase materials
Aid with gear hire and rental 
Elevate marginalised creatives 
Help to produce a high quality film and provide jobs for at least 15 people 
Pay for original music and composition
Fund post production and editing
Feeding our crew and creatives
Entering our film in festivals
And SO MUCH MORE!


 
THE CREW
 
Shamita Siva is the Co-Creator of Twin Flame and Performer playing the role of Kali. She is a multi-faceted performance artist and theatre maker who specialises in movement and devised work. Experienced in both stage and screen mediums; Shamita is a performer who enjoys a challenge. A trained dancer from an early age; after over 16 years of ballet training and a broad range of other dance styles, she developed an interest in theatrical dance forms such as Butoh alongside her acting. She holds a BA Performing Arts from Monash University, supplemented by training with Film & Television Studios International, Stella Adler AoA Los Angeles, AAFTA, and Meisner Technique. As a performing artist her work has travelled across Australia and overseas, from the tropical islands of Guam and Brunei, to cosmopolitan Singapore. She often incorporates intercultural practices and cross disciplinary elements into her work, inspired by everyday experiences, music and sound, and socio- political issues she is driven by. When not on large scale stages and screens, she is an active performer within Australia's queer cabaret scene, and is passionate about creating high energy performances with her signature style. Behind the scenes, Shamita is also a writer and director, and is popularly consulted for movement direction. 
 
Ida Ghatge is the Co-Creator of Twin Flame and Performer playing the role of Parvati. Ida is a highly specialised dancer and teacher in the Indian dance style; Kathak. With over 20 years of dance experience, she is known for her grace, speed, story telling and rich patterns of footwork and spin sequences. She also has a broad knowledge of various other world dance forms including Indian folk, Classical Fusion, and Bollywood. Ida also has a range of experience in psychology, writing and public speaking as well having completed her honours in Psychology from the University of Melbourne. She volunteers her  time with Griefline- a national australian helpline catered to individuals experiencing the effects of grief,loss, trauma and isolation. She prides her Indian heritage but is passionate about challenging cultural stereotypes, sex based biases and the stigma around mental health in WOC.  Learning from her personal struggles, she wishes to empower other women to take charge, and be unapologetically themselves. She aims to become a clinical psychologist as well as use her art to increase awareness about mental illness through film, stage and the practice of dance therapy.
 
Sunitra is the Producer and Creative Director for Twin Flame. She has been working in the film industry for six years. Sunitra was first immersed in the creative industry at three years old where she was classically trained in a variety of dance forms and music for over fourteen years, where her creativity, knowledge, and passion for the arts, theatre and performance was born.  At the age of seventeen, she studied broadcast media in Singapore for three years, working on producing, directing, and editing. After interning at an advertising production house, editing for Netflix campaigns, she decided to move to the UK and study at the Arts University Bournemouth to pursue her love for filmmaking. During her time there she developed her skills through directing, writing and producing several films. She has just finished a film she directed and co-wrote called "Flesh of My Flesh" and is based in Malaysia working as a cinematographer and marketing executive along side producing Twin Flame.
 
Iain Soumitri is our Project Manager. He is a photographer and filmmaker based in Melbourne, Australia. He recently completed a Bachelor’s in Political Science with a specialisation in Foreign Policy and Middle Eastern Affairs. Iain aims to enter the world of photojournalism and documentary filmmaking to weave his interest in politics and international affairs with his passion for photography and filmmaking. Iain’s 2017 visit to the Barefoot College, in Rajasthan, India, fostered his love for working in rural development and international affairs. This college drafts elderly women from remote communities around the world and trains them become solar engineers. Iain spent his time creating unique portfolios for the college’s students (‘Solar Mamas’). These portfolios (‘photo novellas’) consisted of photographs and text documenting their experience, providing the students with something to both show to their families, and use as a certification to work as solar engineers to electrify their communities. Iain enjoys his time outside of work playing competitive basketball, taking photographs, and composing music.
 
 

 
MUSIC

He is a recipient of All India radio competition, National youth festival and National Yuva Mahaotsav and many more in India. He has also made a remarkable contribution in the Australian music arena since moving here in 2006 and surely, is one of the first choice Tabla players for international touring artists, both Indian and Western music world. He has toured with world renowned artists like Grammy award winner Pt.Vishwamohan Bhatt, Grammy nominee Ustad Shujat Khan, National award winner Pt.Purbayan Chaterjee and many Australian musicians from different genres and background.

His ability to attain such expertise across so many instruments and to blend his music into so many genres is astonishing. He's performed around the world, on guitar at guitar festivals, on mandolin at Bluegrass festivals, and on sitar for Pandit Ravi Shankar at his home in Delhi. Current projects include Golden Guitar Awards nominated band Mustered Courage, Canyon, BluGuru, Sadhana, and accompanying artists such as Liz Frencham, Paddy Montgomery and Parvyn. Past projects include Dya Singh, The Bombay Royale, and Freshly Squeezed.Josh has composed and performed the music for stage productions such as Independent Theatre's stage rendition of EM Forster's "Passage To India", and Patch Theatre's "The Moon's a Balloon". His current creative output is largely based around his youtube channel presenting weekly videos of musical performances and collaborations, as well as a brand new series currently under development, exploring themes of the science in music.

story:
The Pitch

When an up and coming pop star discovers her dad is in a coma, she must enter a virtual world set in the Old West to bring him back to life.

Our team is incredible already, and it's only getting better. More info about our team can be found here: goldminethemovie.com

Lorelai performs shows on a weekly basis, orchestrating her own schedule. When she receives a call during a big show, she rushes to the hospital. Her mom, Jessica, meets her; Lorelai’s dad, Nate, has had a heart attack and is now in a coma. Unable to decide whether to take him off life support, their doctor encourages them to enter virtual reality in a new medical procedure.

Lorelai enters an Old West virtual space. Her dad raised her on Westerns even though she's annoyed by their masculine themes. However, Dr. Ambrazia recommends a familiar and relaxing space for Nate. As Lorelai transforms into a fast gun in the West, she becomes intrigued as she can recreate memories from her past in the virtual West with her dad. Eventually, Lorelai will become stuck in this VR landscape and have to figure out how to navigate back to the real world...

This is a family drama centered around grief. We all undergo hardships, and this movie works through those universal emotions surrounding death. We never get over anything; we only get through it. GOLD MINE is an entertaining sci-fi family drama that works as a genre-fueled hit.

 

How Your Contributions Work

Rest assured, your contributions will go straight to the production of Gold Mine. 

To give you a more concrete sense of how we will use the funds from this campaign:

Cast - With intense scenes and emotionally charged characters, our actors will bring the project to life. We want to respect their hard work most of all since they have to be vulnerable in front of the camera. Actors put in so much time and effort, and we need them to know how much we care! 

Crew/ Labor - People used to say it to me all the time, but it’s true: a film takes a village. We really believe in paying as much as we can to our crew. Given that we have an ambitious shoot, we absolutely cannot lower our crew rates. We respect the hard work these individuals put in, and we’re always humbled by the amazing work we see on set. 

Locations - How do you sell reality? Shoot it. We need an old Western town and a realistic, standing hospital set. To pull this off, we need the big bucks. We’ll also be putting our cast and crew up in lodging for the old Western town since it’s outside of Los Angeles County. To properly accommodate people, we need to pad our Locations budget more. 

Equipment Rentals - These are the technical inventions and innovations that capture reality and transmit it to digital files. From the camera and lenses to lights and c-stands, we’ll be ensuring a proper production. We have good relationships with equipment vendors in L.A., and we’re very excited to capitalize on them for our first feature. 

Production Supplies - If we don’t have extra batteries, do you think the sound person will be able to charge their equipment or will the makeup artist be able to use their devices? Production Supplies are an essential part of any show as walkie talkies and orange cones create active communication and safety. We believe in professional procedures! 

Contingency - When the well runs dry, what do you do? Well… plan for it. Contingency or emergency funds go a long way to ensuring we’ll be able to carry through with our vision even if disasters ensue. We know we’ll be ready by planning for 10% of the preliminary budget to go straight toward contingency. 

Crowdfunding Fees - A service like this is extremely valuable in connecting us directly with you, our initial audience. This comes at a cost of course.

Food - Back in the day, the Egyptians made some pyramids. It’s unclear how much the workers ate. Either way, food is now an integral part of any workforce. We want people to have breakfast, lunch, and dinner. We’ve been on way too many sets where cereal is lunch, and bagels are dinner. We don’t want that for anyone. The best work is based on good meals. 

Post-Production - As directors, we always feel that once we shoot the script, we’re done. Easy, hand it to the post-team. Right? Wrong. We need to have the budget to accommodate sound design, color, composing, visual effects, music licensing, and basic editing. We plan to be our own assistant editors, but we’ll need talented artists to help take this film to completion and inevitably get it into festivals. If we’re lucky, we’ll be able to sell it to Netflix or Amazon!

Writer's Statement

By Matthew Marder

This screenplay is designed to do two things: make you laugh and make you cry. I grew up on Westerns. I loved them as a kid. But as I aged, I noticed many Westerns were plagued with sexist and racist depictions, vilifying certain groups of people (i.e. Native Americans) while celebrating troubled cowboys, mostly misogynistic white men. I always thought it’d be fascinating to explore a Western with a female protagonist who’s disturbed by the ways of the West and must take action under her own moral code. The West has become a myth on its own in American culture, and this project explores that to the hilt. GOLD MINE is an ambivalent love song to Westerns, appreciating their philosophy while noting their shortcomings. 

When my dad died suddenly in the fall of 2017, I was broken. He provided so much guidance in my life, even getting me into movies in the first place. We loved watching High Noon together. I wanted to write a very personal piece that dissected shock and grief in the moment it forms in the hospital. The ICU is such a specific place, and I wanted to capture that feeling like it’s never been captured before: on the crossroads of life and death, not knowing if you’re staying or leaving. But I didn’t want this to be a depressing story so the darkly comedic tone sprinkled throughout the tale is meant for audiences to appreciate that life usually throws everything at you at once. I miss my dad every day, and I hope this project is able to pay his memory forward. GOLD MINE was written for all those who’ve lost a loved one or friend. It’s never an easy process, and we all go through it.

Directors' Statement

by Matthew Marder and Adam Chase Cohen

We’ve been working independently and collaborating on projects in Los Angeles for over five years. With successful festival wins and fun premieres, we’ve enjoyed making our work with an amazing community of diverse and passionate artists. But the grind is real and the hustle is endless; we’ve tried to work all jobs from development through full scale production. As independent producers, directors, and writers, we’ve created projects whose budgets have ranged from small indie to large union scales. 

Now we’re ready to take the huge leap and make our first feature. Only there’s one catch. We’re only partially funded. So we need your help! Why? Because we want to make a movie that entertains audiences and connects to people on a personal level. We hope to provide a fun experience on all levels, but this campaign is the crucial missing piece in our production puzzle to make this movie come to life. Without this campaign, we don’t think we can reach our goal of getting this movie through festivals and eventually onto a platform like Amazon or Netflix! 

We’ve loved the modern takes on Westerns in projects like Westworld, The Rider, and Hostiles. We’re also huge sci-fi fans and think the genre can provide a great arena for thought-provoking questions. We know we can make a unique movie and, specifically, a new entry in the Western genre: Juxtaposing vivid pop performances from the future with visceral duels from the past while combating gender stereotypes -- it’s all going to be a good time. So saddle up and join us on the dusty trail for GOLD MINE!

Risks & Challenges

This is an ambitious first feature as it’s a sci-fi western which usually contains expensive components. Still, we have put in so much legwork already to make our vision achievable. We have collaborated with creative folks, many of whom have already been so inspired by this story that they are offering huge discounts on their services and equipment. We’ve tried to figure out ways to minimize VFX and additional costs while still unravelling a compelling sci-fi narrative. We’ve even figured out a way of shooting around one Western location and even integrating horses in a cost-effective manner. 

Despite the best laid plans, problems can arise. There is always a risk that an actor gets sick, or that a piece of equipment fails. To avoid these disasters and improvise as best as possible, we are bringing on the best technical teams possible and budget for contingency plans. Our production experience is drawing in a team that's already showing up to join our adventure. This makes us confident that we can produce this movie soup to nuts for under $300,000.

We’re most excited about shooting in an old Western town which may present strong weather conditions (windy nights, sandstorms, etc) and no signs of life other than one wee film crew. Like Will Kane, the protagonist in High Noon, we hope to stand strong and carry on our mission of making Gold Mine a reality. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please share our campaign on any social media you use!
  • Share through the social media links above.
  • Tip your hat to a friend and mention this cool movie that's raising money on Indiegogo!

The West has become a myth on its own in American culture, and this project explores that to the hilt. GOLD MINE is an ambivalent love song to Westerns, appreciating their philosophy while noting their shortcomings. 
When my dad died suddenly in the fall of 2017, I was broken. He provided so much guidance in my life, even getting me into movies in the first place. We loved watching High Noon together. I wanted to write a very personal piece that dissected shock and grief in the moment it forms in the hospital. The ICU is such a specific place, and I wanted to capture that feeling like it’s never been captured before: on the crossroads of life and death, not knowing if you’re staying or leaving. But I didn’t want this to be a depressing story so the darkly comedic tone sprinkled throughout the tale is meant for audiences to appreciate that life usually throws everything at you at once. I miss my dad every day, and I hope this project is able to pay his memory forward. GOLD MINE was written for all those who’ve lost a loved one or friend. It’s never an easy process, and we all go through it.
Directors' Statement
by Matthew Marder and Adam Chase Cohen
We’ve been working independently and collaborating on projects in Los Angeles for over five years. With successful festival wins and fun premieres, we’ve enjoyed making our work with an amazing community of diverse and passionate artists. But the grind is real and the hustle is endless; we’ve tried to work all jobs from development through full scale production. As independent producers, directors, and writers, we’ve created projects whose budgets have ranged from small indie to large union scales. 
Now we’re ready to take the huge leap and make our first feature. Only there’s one catch. We’re only partially funded. So we need your help! Why? Because we want to make a movie that entertains audiences and connects to people on a personal level. We hope to provide a fun experience on all levels, but this campaign is the crucial missing piece in our production puzzle to make this movie come to life. Without this campaign, we don’t think we can reach our goal of getting this movie through festivals and eventually onto a platform like Amazon or Netflix! 
We’ve loved the modern takes on Westerns in projects like Westworld, The Rider, and Hostiles. We’re also huge sci-fi fans and think the genre can provide a great arena for thought-provoking questions. We know we can make a unique movie and, specifically, a new entry in the Western genre: Juxtaposing vivid pop performances from the future with visceral duels from the past while combating gender stereotypes -- it’s all going to be a good time. So saddle up and join us on the dusty trail for GOLD MINE!

Risks & Challenges
This is an ambitious first feature as it’s a sci-fi western which usually contains expensive components. Still, we have put in so much legwork already to make our vision achievable. We have collaborated with creative folks, many of whom have already been so inspired by this story that they are offering huge discounts on their services and equipment. We’ve tried to figure out ways to minimize VFX and additional costs while still unravelling a compelling sci-fi narrative. We’ve even figured out a way of shooting around one Western location and even integrating horses in a cost-effective manner. 
Despite the best laid plans, problems can arise. There is always a risk that an actor gets sick, or that a piece of equipment fails. To avoid these disasters and improvise as best as possible, we are bringing on the best technical teams possible and budget for contingency plans. Our production experience is drawing in a team that's already showing up to join our adventure. This makes us confident that we can produce this movie soup to nuts for under $300,000.
We’re most excited about shooting in an old Western town which may present strong weather conditions (windy nights, sandstorms, etc) and no signs of life other than one wee film crew. Like Will Kane, the protagonist in High Noon, we hope to stand strong and carry on our mission of making Gold Mine a reality.  

Other Ways You Can Help
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

Please share our campaign on any social media you use!
Share through the social media links above.
Tip your hat to a friend and mention this cool movie that's raising money on Indiegogo!

story:
Short Summary

Filmmakers, vampires and a loan shark collide in this epic comedy-horror.

  • “The Last Slay Ride” is now in post-production with an expected release date of early 2022. The film written and directed by Jason Hawkins, was picked up and green lit by Executive Producer Angela Joseph and Rokitpig Productions in the Spring of 2021. 

    Jason Hawkins, best known for his work on the Netflix Original Series ‘Haunted’, and feature films such as "The Blair Witch Legacy", “All American Bully,” “15: inside the mind of a serial killer”, and “The Bleeding Dark”, takes us on an insane, exciting journey with the "The Last Slay Ride", a Christmas themed comedy-horror starring Elissa Dowling (The Girl on the 3rd Floor), Eileen Dietz (The Exorcist ) Calvin McCarthy (Jesus I was Evil), and Sanae Loutsis (Beloved Beast).

 

 

What We Need & What You Get

Pre sales for the completed Feature Film The Last Slay Ride.

Distribution pending for release of perks.

Synopsis:

Filmmakers, vampires and a loan shark collide in this epic comedy-horror. 

When a group of student filmmakers have to resort to borrowing money from a loan shark to complete their film, they find themselves quickly in equal amounts of debt and danger! Desperate, they devise a plan to rob their distributor's mansion, but quickly discover nothing is what they expected. 

Think of it as an 'R' rated Scooby-gang adventure! 

Risks & Challenges

The film is complete and this is a preorder presale! Support Indie Film!

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Share on your social media platforms
  • Share from Indiegogo help us #Trend !
  • ** If interested in Post production Producer credits please message us or email Cinemadrifter@gmail.com

And that's all there is to it.

story:
What is Mystery Incorporated?

Mystery Incorporated is a fresh new series designed to tell the story of the characters from Hanna-Barbera's "Scooby-Doo, Where Are You?" with a modern filter for a new generation.

Set in the small town of Coolsville, OH and inspired heavily by shows like “Supernatural”, “Riverdale”, and the original “Scooby-Doo” cartoons. We enter a world where monsters are real, demons guard every crossroad, and spirits lurk in the dark.

Imdb link: Mystery Incorporated

 

 

 

 

The Vision

Our vision is to create a state of the art hour long pilot episode that is just as high quality as anything you may see on television or Netflix. As you can see from our teaser we have an extremely talented cast and crew who were able to create magic on a very small budget, imagine the things we will be able to do with your help! Our hope is that our pilot will immerse you in the world of Mystery Incorporated and lay the foundation to build an entire 10 episode season and bring this story to life in an all new way that we believe audiences have been dying to see.

 

 

 

 

The Cast

 

Fred Jones- Dade Elza

Daphne Blake- Jessica Chancellor

Norville "Shaggy" Rogers- Chris Villain

Velma Dinkley- Dayeanne Hutton

 

Dante Yore

 

 

 

 

The Budget

As you can see from our teaser, we are fully prepared to offer the same quality you would expect of a show like "Riverdale" or "Supernatural", visually and conceptually, for a fraction of the cost. But we still need help to get the funds required!

That's where you come in! 

The money raised from your contributions will go directly towards things like:

  • Camera Equipment
  • Lighting Equipment
  • Sound Equipment
  • Misc Crew
  • Location Rentals
  • Costumes
  • Props
  • SCOOBY-DOO himself
  • SFX Makeup Artist
  • VFX Artist
  • Food on Set
  • SAG Fees
  • Music Licensing
  • Foley Artist
  • Sound Engineering
  • Video Editing
  • Color Grading

and many other things that go into creating a show of the caliber the fans deserve. Undertaking this project is no small task but we are up for the challenge and ready to give you a show that will blow you away.

One thing we will NOT compromise is quality. The budget ensures we are able to achieve everything listed above and deliver you a beautifully executed episode in a reasonable time-frame.

Should we exceed the listed budget that just means BIGGER sets, CRAZIER makeups, AND SO MUCH MORE!

In exchange for your generous donations we are offering many different rewards ranging from EXCLUSIVE digital and physical content, invitations to the premiere, to the set and even Executive Producer credit. No donation is too small, the smallest bit makes you a part of the team!

If full funding is not reached, we pledge that every dollar raised still goes directly to making Mystery Incorporated a reality. Unfortunately, less funding means a much longer time to get there. In order to achieve the quality we expect and the audience deserves, we will have to stretch the dollar even further than we already are. That means, smaller crew, cheaper sets, splitting up production days and ultimately a substantially longer wait for the episode.

 

 

 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate? No problem! There's still a way you can help! Tell your family and friends about Mystery Incorporated! Share the page and the teaser wherever you can! Even this goes such a long way towards helping us reach our goal and bring you the quality content this property demands and deserves. 

No matter how you decide to help or contribute we want to extend our gratitude. We are eternally grateful for all of the kind words and support.

Welcome to Coolsville.

story:
The Horror Show Channel is proud to welcome you to the Dylan's New Nightmare fan film crowdfunding campaign! We're here to make your nightmares come true!

 

Dylan's New Nightmare  acts as an unofficial sequel to Wes Craven's: A New Nightmare, one of the most unique and high concept installments to the Nightmare on Elm Street Franchise. 

This short film picks up 25 years after the events of New Nightmare and follows Dylan Porter (Miko Hughes), the young son of Heather Langenkamp, now a grown man trying to make his way in the world his parents raised him in—Hollywood. Little does he know that the evil entity known as Freddy Krueger is back, and eager to once again break into our  world through the son of his favorite victim!

 

This project was conceived by Cecil Laird, who has loved the horror genre ever since he was a kid. Freddy Krueger has always been his favorite slasher, so when he was deciding what The Horror Show's next huge project should be, a sequel to Wes Craven's New Nightmare clawed its way into his head and just wouldn't leave! So the project began.

Luckily, to ensure that this fan film is of the highest quality, we have enlisted the incredible help of Producer, Vincente DiSanti, the creative force behind Womp Stomp Films and the widely successful Friday the 13th fan film, Never Hike Alone,  as well as  Rene Rivas, the man behind that excellent Halloween fan film, The Spirit of Haddonfield,  as both Producer and Director of Photography! We are also lucky enough to welcome Nora Hewitt, the winner of season 9 of FaceOff, to jump on board do our Special Make-Up and FX Supervisor for the film!

But even as cool as this whole project is up to this point, there's something even cooler! We couldn't be more excited to announce that MIKO HUGHES himself will be reprising his role as Dylan Porter, the son of Heather Langenkamp from the original Wes Craven's New Nightmare! That's right! Miko is back!

So obviously, with all of these talented individuals, plus original costuming and props being designed for the flick by people very close to the franchise, this project is sure to be a film that belongs on every horror fan's shelf, right next to the rest of their Nightmare collection!

 

Being that the short film is not-for-profit, our goal is really just to put out a film that not only makes the fans and creators of the Nightmare on Elm Street series proud. We'd also love it if this fan film ended up being one that they want to add to their collection so much, that they contribute to this campaign, because that’s the ONLY way they’ll be able to!

Now, in order to make this the biggest and best Freddy fan film we can, we need your help! We have enough for a very small-budgeted short piece right now, but with the assistance of real Nightmare fans, we can make this short film everything we know if can be.

Our financial goal is to raise $40,000, which will go towards the following:

  • Permits & Insurance
  • Gear & Vehicle Rentals
  • Stunts
  • Cast & Crew Costs
  • Location Costs
  • Production Costs
  • Special Makeup & Gore FX
  • Original Score Creation Costs
  • Perk Costs

*Note: If we do not reach our goal, we will proceed with the film using the funds we raise, so backers WILL see a project, no matter what!

 

We do have plenty of stretch goals, which would fund numerous ways we could bolster the production, including:

  • Higher-quality overall production
  • More involved practical special effects
  • Extra location time
  • An extra kill or two
  • Extra casting
  • More in-depth post-production process

 

So even if we've already achieved our goal, don't hesitate to still contribute! The perks are worth it!  Speaking of...

 

We are offering some AMAZING perks for you Nightmare fans who can't wait for another, if unofficial, entry into the Freddy canon! Check them out and choose what looks best for you!

  • Your Name in the End Credits as a special "Thank You"
  • A Digital Download Pack, including the film, the score, & more
  • Three Original Posters of the film - both signed and unsigned options
  • A Signed Still Image of Miko from on set
  • A VHS copy of Dylan's New Nightmare (limited #)
  • A Blu-Ray copy of Dylan's New Nightmare
  • A T-Shirt with the Dylan's New Nightmare logo
  • A Full Set of Original Dylan's New Nightmare Pins
  • A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Rex Stuffed Animal (limited #)
  • A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Sweater (limited #)
  • A replica Dylan's New Nightmare Original Glove (limited #)
  • An Associate Producer Credit (limited #)
  • A Co-Producer Credit (limited #)
  • An Executive Producer Credit (limited #)

 

New perks will be dropped along the way so keep checking back to make sure you don't miss out on something really cool! Our high-end tiers give you a chance to join the Nightmare as an actual Producer, which allows you exclusive access to an inside look into the project, along with behind the scenes material nobody else will see for a very long time, if ever! Additionally, YOUR NAME will appear in the opening credits of the film.

Producers will not only have a direct line of communication with our team, but they are also permitted to visit the set during production, or even help out as part of the crew. But they must behave themselves...or Freddy will see them out!

 

 

The role of Dylan will be reprised by none other than Miko Hughes himself, who originated the character 25 years ago in the original Wes Craven's New Nightmare! Miko has had a life-long career in film and TV, both in front of and behind the camera, since all the way back in 1989 when he played little Gage Creed in the original Pet Sematary. Miko is excited to face off against Freddy once again, and can't wait to show you how the last 25 years have treated Dylan!

 

The role of Freddy will be played by Dave McRae, a full time professional voice actor and independent filmmaker. Dave is a four-time (2015, 2016, 2018 & 2019) Voice Arts Award Nominee. Three times for Outstanding National TV Promo, and once for Outstanding Body of Work. His voice has been heard on thousands of radio and television commercials, network promos, movie and game trailers, narration, and animation across North America and around the world. Alongside his career as a voice actor, Dave has a passion for film and filmmaking. Dave is probably best known online for his YouTube channel where he can be seen giving his thoughts, opinions, and insights on everything horror movies and Halloween

 

 

Cecil has been producing horror content on YouTube for over 5 years now via the program he created called The Horror Show Channel. The program is a horror-themed variety show with over 3,000 episodes available at this point, including horror-themed shorts, both scary and comedic. He has made one previous fan film, Sweet (inspired by the American Vampire comic book series), but Dylan’s New Nightmare is Cecil’s largest project to date! Since it involves not only one of horror’s “Big 3”, but also Cecil’s personal favorite horror icon, he is determined to do both the franchise, and the franchise’s original creator, justice!

 

Vincente DiSanti moved to Los Angeles in 2008 and has since worked in several aspects of the film industry including live-action, feature animation, story development, voice acting, visual FX, commercials, and much more. A jack of all trades, Vincente is best known for his directorial work on Disappear (2019), Never Hike Alone (2017), Imagine (2018), The Red Room (2015), and starring as Michael Myers in The Spirit of Haddonfield (2018).                                                          

 

Rene Rivas has been a film aficionado for as far back as he can remember. Building his Arizona based production company since 2015, Rene Rivas Productions LLC, Rene has completed the feature noir Northern, 2018's short Halloween fan film The Spirit of Haddonfield, and more recently the upcoming horror short The TENT. Writing and Directing are Rene‘s main focus, but his skills range from cinematography, to producing, to editing & sound design--the whole gambit.

 

 

David has been Cecil’s film partner for his whole career. He has done every project a person can do on set, having worked on numerous independent horror films featuring actors like Kane Hodder and Tiffany Shepis! He may be camera shy, but there’s no stronger all-around force behind the scenes of a film set than this man. While he can do any job behind the camera, having him in place as Assistant Director will ensure his skills are utilized to the fullest on the set of Dylan’s New Nightmare!

 

For as long as she can remember, Nora Hewitt has had a love of the movies with horror resonating more than any other genre. This passion and a life-long knack for artistic flair caused her to follower her passions at Tom Savini's Special Makeup Effects Program, from which she graduated in January of 2015. She then went on to not only join the cast of the ninth season of Syfy’s long-running Makeup FX show Face/Off, but she actually won the entire thing! Currently, she is happily pursuing her dreams freelancing in the special effects makeup industry.

 

The Whole Gang:

 

 

We would like to state that The Horror Show, Cecil Laird Productions, Womp Stomp Films & Rene Rivas Productions formally acknowledge that Dylan’s New Nightmare is a not-for-profit fan film and in no way associated or affiliated with New Line Cinema, Warner Bros Pictures or any other company that owns the rights to the character of Freddy Krueger and/or A Nightmare on Elm Street.

The budget for this campaign is being raised to help cover the unavoidable expenses that come with making any production. Every dollar we receive from our campaigns is spent directly on the film along with the production, packaging, and shipping of the campaign perks.

Ultimately, we are partnering with fans to bring Freddy back in a cool way that returns him to a continuity we all love! Any funds left un-spent on the production will be donated to the National Audubon Society. For those that don't know, Wes Craven had a massive love of birds and even served on the Board of Directors for the California Chapter of the organization, so any excess funds will be donated to this cause in his memory.

 

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a few things you can do to still assist the production:

  • Share this page and help spread the word that FREDDY IS COMING BACK!
  • Join, follow and share the Dylan's New Nightmare Facebook, Twitter & Instagram pages for updates and discussion with the filmmakers.
  • Subscribe to The Horror Show Channel on youTube for regular video updates as the production moves along.

 

Thank you for visiting the page! If you are so inclined, choose a perk and help us bring this vision to life to help celebrate the 25th anniversary of the original Wes Craven’s New Nightmare! The whole idea is to pay tribute to the people that created the original series we all love so much, and especially the late, great Wes Craven, without whom horror wouldn’t be what it is today.

If you have any other questions, please email us at thehorrorshow666@yahoo.com, or message us on our Facebook, Twitter or Instagram pages!

THANK YOU!
