Three times for Outstanding National TV Promo, and once for Outstanding Body of Work. His voice has been heard on thousands of radio and television commercials, network promos, movie and game trailers, narration, and animation across North America and around the world. Alongside his career as a voice actor, Dave has a passion for film and filmmaking. Dave is probably best known online for his YouTube channel where he can be seen giving his thoughts, opinions, and insights on everything horror movies and Halloween

 


 

Cecil has been producing horror content on YouTube for over 5 years now via the program he created called The Horror Show Channel. The program is a horror-themed variety show with over 3,000 episodes available at this point, including horror-themed shorts, both scary and comedic. He has made one previous fan film, Sweet (inspired by the American Vampire comic book series), but Dylan’s New Nightmare is Cecil’s largest project to date! Since it involves not only one of horror’s “Big 3”, but also Cecil’s personal favorite horror icon, he is determined to do both the franchise, and the franchise’s original creator, justice!

 

Vincente DiSanti moved to Los Angeles in 2008 and has since worked in several aspects of the film industry including live-action, feature animation, story development, voice acting, visual FX, commercials, and much more. A jack of all trades, Vincente is best known for his directorial work on Disappear (2019), Never Hike Alone (2017), Imagine (2018), The Red Room (2015), and starring as Michael Myers in The Spirit of Haddonfield (2018).                                                          
 

Rene Rivas has been a film aficionado for as far back as he can remember. Building his Arizona based production company since 2015, Rene Rivas Productions LLC, Rene has completed the feature noir Northern, 2018's short Halloween fan film The Spirit of Haddonfield, and more recently the upcoming horror short The TENT. Writing and Directing are Rene‘s main focus, but his skills range from cinematography, to producing, to editing & sound design--the whole gambit.
 
 

David has been Cecil’s film partner for his whole career. He has done every project a person can do on set, having worked on numerous independent horror films featuring actors like Kane Hodder and Tiffany Shepis! He may be camera shy, but there’s no stronger all-around force behind the scenes of a film set than this man. While he can do any job behind the camera, having him in place as Assistant Director will ensure his skills are utilized to the fullest on the set of Dylan’s New Nightmare!

 

For as long as she can remember, Nora Hewitt has had a love of the movies with horror resonating more than any other genre. This passion and a life-long knack for artistic flair caused her to follower her passions at Tom Savini's Special Makeup Effects Program, from which she graduated in January of 2015. She then went on to not only join the cast of the ninth season of Syfy’s long-running Makeup FX show Face/Off, but she actually won the entire thing! Currently, she is happily pursuing her dreams freelancing in the special effects makeup industry.

 

The Whole Gang:



 
 

We would like to state that The Horror Show, Cecil Laird Productions, Womp Stomp Films & Rene Rivas Productions formally acknowledge that Dylan’s New Nightmare is a not-for-profit fan film and in no way associated or affiliated with New Line Cinema, Warner Bros Pictures or any other company that owns the rights to the character of Freddy Krueger and/or A Nightmare on Elm Street.
The budget for this campaign is being raised to help cover the unavoidable expenses that come with making any production. Every dollar we receive from our campaigns is spent directly on the film along with the production, packaging, and shipping of the campaign perks.
Ultimately, we are partnering with fans to bring Freddy back in a cool way that returns him to a continuity we all love! Any funds left un-spent on the production will be donated to the National Audubon Society. For those that don't know, Wes Craven had a massive love of birds and even served on the Board of Directors for the California Chapter of the organization, so any excess funds will be donated to this cause in his memory.
 


Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a few things you can do to still assist the production:

Share this page and help spread the word that FREDDY IS COMING BACK!
Join, follow and share the Dylan's New Nightmare Facebook, Twitter & Instagram pages for updates and discussion with the filmmakers.
Subscribe to The Horror Show Channel on youTube for regular video updates as the production moves along.

 
Thank you for visiting the page! If you are so inclined, choose a perk and help us bring this vision to life to help celebrate the 25th anniversary of the original Wes Craven’s New Nightmare! The whole idea is to pay tribute to the people that created the original series we all love so much, and especially the late, great Wes Craven, without whom horror wouldn’t be what it is today.If you have any other questions, please email us at thehorrorshow666@yahoo.com, or message us on our Facebook, Twitter or Instagram pages!THANK YOU!

story:
OVERVIEW

Get ready to put your black suit on, because THE BAND IS BACK!!! Wishing for Joe Iconis' musical "THE BLACK SUITS" to come back, I decided to make my own NON-PROFIT filmed adaptation music videos of some songs from that musical! All videos will be going up on my filmmaking channel, linked below!

https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCxf2hkgFFWN50f1Ezv0WvOQ

 

CAST AND CREW

Our cast is full of extremely talented actors and actresses! Alongside them and behind the camera, I, myself, Ethan Koester am the director, cinematographer, executive producer and editor. Jalen Smith is co-producer and helping make everything come to life.

Helping us with recreating instrumentals we have Adam Doucette on piano, Hyo Kim making the guitar, drums and bass for "The Answer", Joey Carrier on bass for "Amphibian", and a fellow student Jaren on drums for "Amphibian".

JOHN AMOROSO - Chris Trevino

"Pop Tarts, Power Cords + Brotherhood." The main focus of the song "The Answer" is the character John Amoroso, who is being played by the amazing Chris Trevino! Chris has been an actor and singer for a long time, and we know he will do the role justice.

 

CHRISTOPHER THURSER - Chaminda Hangilipola

The leader of the band, Chris Thurser is being played by the awesome Chaminda Hangilipola, a very talented actor/singer! Chris is a pretty complex character, wanting to be the strong-willed leader, while suffering from an anxiety disorder that he really struggles with especially when his band is on the verge of falling apart. We have full faith that Chaminda will absolutely nail this role!

 

BRANDON KEESE - Jalen Smith

Brandon Keese, the brains, the brilliant, the BERKLEE! I knew from the start I wanted Jalen Smith as Brandon! Having years of experience playing drums, (Brandon's iconic role in the band) and having a personality eerily similar to the character's, Jalen is more than ready to step up, being a talented actor, drummer and singer!

 

NATO OBENKRIEGER - Jamal Tanks

Of course, the fan favorite amphibian himself, Nato Obenkrieger is being played by Jamal Tanks! While fairly new to theater as a whole, Jamal is still a great actor FULL of energy and enthusiasm to take on this iconic role! (Almost the same chaotically fun energy as a certain bass player from a certain band?) He can't wait to bring the L.I. Amphibian to life!

 

LISA BRED - Laura Zoog

"Ladies and gentlemen, Lisa Bred!" Lisa is being portrayed by the wonderful, super-fantastic, coolness, remarkable Laura Zoog! Being a very talented singer/songwriter and an amazing actress, Laura is a great pick to play Lisa! I've literally never heard a singing voice quite like hers, and I can't wait to see her blow you away with her performance of "Blue Hair"!

 

BUDGETTING

 

DONATIONS

For anyone who donates, we hope you enjoy our special perks offered for your generosity! As previously stated, this project is completely non-profit, meaning that no one is making any money from this, it's fully a passion project!

Every cent will be going directly into making the project better! Being college students, on our own, we can't fully fund everything ourselves. However NO MATTER WHAT, we WILL follow through with the project, regardless of how much we raise.

If we don't reach our goal, we will still use the funds we do make into making the project is good as we can make it, just having to make some cuts to afford everything.

On the flipside, if we make MORE than our announced goal of $500, we will still be putting every cent into making the project even BIGGER! Even being able to invest in MORE music videos for your viewing pleasure!

 

WISHLIST SONGS

Some songs we wanna consider making if we get past $500 in funding!

  • "Rather Be"
  • "Do You Wanna Go Eat Food/Old Records"
  • "Black Suit On/McFly is Looking for a Drummer"
  • "Bang Bang Bang Bang"
  • "Lisa"
  • "Nato's Song"
  • "It's All Good"

 

OTHER WAYS TO HELP

The other BEST way you can help us is by sharing this around! Social media via Instagram, Facebook, Twitter, Snapchat or even just by word of mouth, sharing to your friends, family, fellow theater-lovers helps us SO MUCH!

Doing this we've already gotten the attention of many of the original actors of the original stage productions of The Black Suits, Jennifer Tepper and even Joe Iconis himself has seen and shared our stuff! All people who are huge inspirations of ours.

Overall, we just wanna say thank you for checking out our stuff, if you donated, you're AMAZING, we can't thank you enough for helping fund this dream project! We can't wait to show you what we have in store. Black Suits Forever!

-EK

 

P.S. Keep scrolling for some fun promo images!

story:
NEW GOAL: $1500, we require a new location which has increased our costs”

 

Mateo

Welcome to the donations page for a Chapman University Student Film: "Mateo," a drama short directed by Wendy Medina Herrera, written by Daniela Muñoz and Elias Aguiar Montani, and produced by Elias Aguiar Montani.

This 8-minute Latinx, Immigrant drama follows the main character Mateo as he navigates school, work, and family. This film feels like a slice of life and a exhilarating story about sacrifice, family, and mental health. This film will be made by a diverse group of young passionate and talented student filmmakers. We hope you enjoy and support!

A message from the director:

Hey! Thank you for checking out the page! I am a first generation college student and daughter of Mexican immigrants making her first ever short! Your support would mean the world to me and help bring this Latinx story to life!

story:
AGW 

Jay Helgerson has lived his life in accordance with his need to run. In the 1948 film The Red Shoes, Moira Shearer plays a dancer who is asked, "Why do you dance?" She replies, "Why do you live?". So it is with Jay. 

My name is Lexie Helgerson. I'm an artist, a teacher and an athlete. In 2015 I began this project, interviewing family and friends of my dad in an effort to understand his life as a marathon runner and father of three. 

At first glance, Jay appears to be an eccentric runner.  Our documentary follows Jay for five years leading to the 2020 Boston Marathon where he aims to again claim the title “Age Group Winner.”  Like Rocky, he doesn't expect to win.  He just wants a shot, a shot to go the distance. 

We discover that he may in fact be the ideal role model for anyone who longs to simplify their life in a quest for inner peace and self-discovery; ideal partially because he would immediately and vehemently dismiss such a notion as really weird.  In his own words, “I’d rather talk about running than all that spiritual stuff…”

Jay doesn’t see himself as anything but a regular guy, although at times he admits to being “out there.”  He runs every day.  But not just one run. Several times in an average day, he goes out for 5 or 6 or 10 miles. He does not stretch. He doesn’t do Pilates or yoga.  He’s an extremely picky eater but he doesn’t chug health drinks.  He eats bananas and ice-cream and pizza and drinks Corona and Coca-Cola. 

You will witness Jay contradict himself in different ways.  He speaks of the need for his daughters to have secure employment and a safety-net.  And yet, he hasn’t had a job in over 40 years.  He says he has gotten by with some “family money” but he lives an extremely spartan lifestyle.  Jay downplays the idea that running has a spiritual benefit.  Considering these facts, it’s remarkable that Jay is known to regularly give clothes away to homeless people in his community.  

My dad is a mercurial person. He doesn't like being interviewed or filmed. I'll pull out the camera, and he'll say, "I don't wanna be in it..." and then, two minutes later jokes that he should have his own YouTube channel.  He agreed to participate because he'd do just about anything for his kids and he lives to run.  Running, that's what my dad wants this film to be about, but when somebody lives an extraordinary life, it's overwhelmingly tempting to draw meaning from it. 

 

What We Need & What You Get:

  • Why we need the money:
    • To hire a professional cinematographer (DP): $8,000
      • This covers the cost for the DP's daily wages, equipment, and travel expenses.
    • To hire a professional sound operator: $3,000
      • We will hire local sound professionals and thus save on travel expenses.
    • Travel expenses: $6,000
      • Filmmakers' travel over 3 years has included trips to Portland, Sacramento, Boston, Wichita and includes trips in 2018 - 2019 to the same cities.
    • Equipment: $3,460
      • Includes items such as: new computer, memory cards, hard drives, an osmo, pro tools software, premier pro software 
    • Music: $12,000
      • We believe it's important to pay artists for their work
      • For example, the song featured in our trailer, "Kansas (Don't Give Up)", took at least 60 hours to record, mix and master. At $100 / hr, that's $6,000 for one song. 
    • Super 8mm film development: $3,000
      • Most documentaries have elements of history to them, and film helps illustrate this. Note great documentaries like Stories We Tell (Polley 2012), I Am Not Your Negro (Peck 2017) and anything by Ken Burns. 
      • VHS + Super 8 transfers to digital add variety and texture to storytelling.
    • See our unique perks for what you get when you make a donation! 
  • This is round one of fundraising. As we will continue to film for the next year and a half, all funds raised will help us get to Boston in 2020. 

Why AGW?

  • AGW offers the world the chance to see a man, at age 65, literally race the clock and push his body to the limit. 
  • AGW offers the world the possibility that we don't have to live conventionally. 
  • AGW offers hope. As Kathrine Switzer, the first woman to run the Boston Marathon with an official number, says, "If you are losing faith in human nature, go out and watch a marathon."
  • AGW offers the world the chance to see a daughter tell the story of her father, who not only was the first person in the world to run 52 marathons in a year, but was also a stay-at-home dad who raised three daughters and has managed to live as a divorcé without a traditional career. 
  • And as James Baldwin says, "People can't, unhappily, invent their mooring posts, their lovers and their friends, anymore than they can invent their parents. Life gives these and also takes them away and the great difficulty is to say Yes to life." 

Track Record:

  • In 2016, I executed a successful Indiegogo campaign. We achieved 103% of our goal. 
  • My short film, Vivien, played at various festivals including the Bend Film Festival, Pasadena International Film Festival, Moonfaze Feminist Film Festival, Palm Springs Shorts. You can watch it here - https://vimeo.com/189475822
  • My husband and I form the music duo Who Can Sleep. Our debut music video "Jean Seberg" played at festivals in the U.S. and in France. It won Best Cinematography at the Moonfaze Feminist Film Festival in 2016. You can watch it here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=46qok8qgbJg 
  • Another short film, Meaningness, shot in London in January 2018, is in review for festival competitions now. See "Sneak Peek" perk!  

Other Ways You Can Help:

If you can't contribute, there are other ways we can use your support! 

  • Spread the word! Talk about AGW with friends, family, co-workers!
  • Go for a run! 
  • Follow @indigolulexlu on instagram, and / or @whocansleep
  • Share our campaign! #AGWthemovie #AGW #runfastjay 

Thank you! 

Lexie

Track Record:

In 2016, I executed a successful Indiegogo campaign. We achieved 103% of our goal. 
My short film, Vivien, played at various festivals including the Bend Film Festival, Pasadena International Film Festival, Moonfaze Feminist Film Festival, Palm Springs Shorts. You can watch it here - https://vimeo.com/189475822

My husband and I form the music duo Who Can Sleep. Our debut music video "Jean Seberg" played at festivals in the U.S. and in France. It won Best Cinematography at the Moonfaze Feminist Film Festival in 2016. You can watch it here - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=46qok8qgbJg 
Another short film, Meaningness, shot in London in January 2018, is in review for festival competitions now. See "Sneak Peek" perk!  


Other Ways You Can Help:
If you can't contribute, there are other ways we can use your support! 

Spread the word! Talk about AGW with friends, family, co-workers!
Go for a run! 
Follow @indigolulexlu on instagram, and / or @whocansleep
Share our campaign! #AGWthemovie #AGW #runfastjay 

Thank you! Lexie

story:
What's This All About?

Vampa Del'Ombra is the alter ego of me, Mara Powell. I am an independent writer/director/actor from St. Clair Shores, MI with a passion for filmmaking, storytelling and style. As Vampa, I've made two short horror-comedy films, "Cannabis Cannibals" and "Murder Pool" and now, I'm looking to complete a third, "An Occasion of Sin" which will round out a trilogy I call "Vampa's Visions". 

"An Occasion of Sin" is adapted from a short I originally wrote 20 years ago. Like it's author, it's undergone many changes over these past two decades, but the heart remains the same. This would be my most ambitious film to date, and having the experience of the last two shorts, I think myself and my crew are ready to give this short the care I think it deserves.

My 3rd short, this is only the springboard to my filmmaking endeavors and your contributions will help me achieve what I know will be my best one yet! 

 

I Don't Want Sumthin' for Nuthin'!

Bluntly, I estimate that I would need about $900. This would pay for essentials to make this specific film, like:

  • car rental
  • props
  • costumes
  • gore FX (this is a horror story!)
  • extra would go towards entering the movie into film festivals

 

For your hard-earned cash, you'll get all sorts of cool exclusives! These, based on your pledge, range from:

  • Special thanks in the credits
  • Access to a special Playlist with music that inspired the script
  • Exclusive BTS footage and stills 
  • Downloads to both "Cannabis Cannibals" & "Murder Pool"
  • First access to viewing "An Occasion of Sin" as soon as it's completed
  • Mini movie posters
  • Exclusive Vampa's Visions tee
  • My eternal gratitude

 

Even if the goal isn't met, any and all funds raised will  go directly to towards funding this project.

 

Risks & Challenges

Making any movie is a risk and a challenge in of itself. Even the best laid plans can sometimes go awry. Anything can go wrong and sometimes the days on set don't go exactly as they were supposed to. Things can end up taking a lot longer than intended. The past two movies I made proved this true. However, that didn't stop us and those movies were still completed.

Of course, this time, the overarching risks and challenges are also due to Covid-19. I don't intend on doing anything unsafe, or taking any unnecessary health risks. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you don't have the cash to give, hey, I get it. But please know that your kind words of support to me, your likes on my social media posts, or your thumbs up and comments on my YouTube videos are legit contributions to this project! Also, sharing this project on social media and letting all of your rich relatives and friends know about it would be awesome, too.
story_txt:
What's This All About?
Vampa Del'Ombra is the alter ego of me, Mara Powell. I am an independent writer/director/actor from St. Clair Shores, MI with a passion for filmmaking, storytelling and style. As Vampa, I've made two short horror-comedy films, "Cannabis Cannibals" and "Murder Pool" and now, I'm looking to complete a third, "An Occasion of Sin" which will round out a trilogy I call "Vampa's Visions". 
"An Occasion of Sin" is adapted from a short I originally wrote 20 years ago. Like it's author, it's undergone many changes over these past two decades, but the heart remains the same. This would be my most ambitious film to date, and having the experience of the last two shorts, I think myself and my crew are ready to give this short the care I think it deserves.
My 3rd short, this is only the springboard to my filmmaking endeavors and your contributions will help me achieve what I know will be my best one yet! 
 

I Don't Want Sumthin' for Nuthin'!
Bluntly, I estimate that I would need about $900. This would pay for essentials to make this specific film, like:

car rental
props
costumes
gore FX (this is a horror story!)
extra would go towards entering the movie into film festivals

 
For your hard-earned cash, you'll get all sorts of cool exclusives! These, based on your pledge, range from:

Special thanks in the credits
Access to a special Playlist with music that inspired the script
Exclusive BTS footage and stills 
Downloads to both "Cannabis Cannibals" & "Murder Pool"
First access to viewing "An Occasion of Sin" as soon as it's completed
Mini movie posters
Exclusive Vampa's Visions tee
My eternal gratitude

 
Even if the goal isn't met, any and all funds raised will  go directly to towards funding this project.
 

Risks & Challenges
Making any movie is a risk and a challenge in of itself. Even the best laid plans can sometimes go awry. Anything can go wrong and sometimes the days on set don't go exactly as they were supposed to. Things can end up taking a lot longer than intended. The past two movies I made proved this true. However, that didn't stop us and those movies were still completed.
Of course, this time, the overarching risks and challenges are also due to Covid-19. I don't intend on doing anything unsafe, or taking any unnecessary health risks. 
 

Other Ways You Can Help
If you don't have the cash to give, hey, I get it. But please know that your kind words of support to me, your likes on my social media posts, or your thumbs up and comments on my YouTube videos are legit contributions to this project! Also, sharing this project on social media and letting all of your rich relatives and friends know about it would be awesome, too.

story:
THEOPHILUS FILMS

 

The Founders and Partners:

 

XIOMARA BERNARD

(Head of Production)

She is mostly known in the independent film community as an actor. Bernard recently had a short film, "Hex Your Ex", directed by Cassie Rubio, which premiered at the Outfest Film Festival. She is getting ready to go to New Mexico this fall to be a part of a feature film, "Firstness", directed by Brielle Brilliant. In creating Theophilus Films, with her producing partners (Allison Chaney and Erin Okamoto), their storytelling links self-empowerment with fantasy, ambience and a touch of Gothic flare. NIGHT (2016) was the first short film Bernard wrote, produced and directed. It received an Audience Choice Award Nomination at the Independent Filmmakers' Showcase Festival (2016) in the short film category.  POISON (2017) was Bernard's second short film, which was the Official Selection for the London Independent Film Awards (2017) in England, the International Vampire Film & Arts Festival (2017) in Romania, and an Online Official Selection at the Lift-Off Global Network in Los Angeles (2017). BLACKOUT will be her third film.

 

 

ALLISON CHANEY

(Head of Development)

A former English teacher with years of story coaching and writing experience and an empathetic understanding of the challenges storytellers face, Allison is excited to partner with Xiomara Bernard and Erin Okamoto to bring their projects to life as a producer at Theophilus Films. As dynamic project leader and champion for diversity in film, Allison believes in stories with heart, humor, and humanity. She currently works as freelance screenwriter, editor, and writing coach when she is not spending time on her partners' projects at Theophilus. She is the author of two young adult novels (Forget Me Not; The Lost Heir) and a poetry chapbook (Queen Me). Allison also has a comic book coming out this fall called "LOVE University (aka LOVE U)". For Theophilus Films, she is currently working on short films adapted from her books.

 

 

ERIN OKAMOTO

(VP of Development)

Erin Okamoto, a world traveler (25 countries and counting), screenwriter, and author who published a novel with her writing partners, worked on two the shorts as script supervisor, as well as wrote her own short film scripts and achieved semi-finalist status in the Screencraft comedy short category in 2015. She also volunteered at the Tomo Neko Maid Café, the Great East Japan Earthquake and Child Play Charity fundraisers. She is currently a producer and partner at Theophilus Films.

 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

SYNOPSIS

BLACKOUT is about a bisexual man, Gabriel, who is at a crossroads between choosing his happiness in life, or holding onto the ghosts of his past.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

The LOVE:

We can all resonate with self-empowerment when it comes to Love, and how important it is to love yourself, despite any obstacles that comes into your life, you can still live your life!

 

YOU:

Not only will your contribution give us the chance to create opportunities, diversity and representation for everyone, especially for women, minorities, and members of the LGBTQ+ communities, but your contribution will also add to our calling card to get investors involved for bigger productions such as feature films and TV series. We want to continue to break down doors for those who want to create as well. All of our cast and crew members have created projects of their own. Those who have worked with us in the past were given opportunities to promote themselves to more work within their own careers. We don't only work with people that work for us and exclude all other dreamers. We work with people and empower them to create their own paths.

 

What We Need & What You Get

 

  • The total costs for permits, insurance, equipment, possible pick up shots tend to round out to a little over 6K. We raised 1200 from our previous campaigns. We just need the remaining  balance to finish the legalities of creating a legal and safe set so that we only focus on the production part of the project.
  • Our campaign gives YOU a movie ticket to our private screening. This will allow contributors a sneak peak before it premieres to film festivals, and then to the public. They will be the first audience to get the first preview. Sponsors get screen credit thank you mentions.
  • For contributors who donate over $100, you will be part of the producing team, get IMDB credit, screen credit, and exclusive behind the scenes look.
  • Every cent will go into production, regardless of whether or not we reach our goal. We still have $1200 from our previous campaigns and fundraising events that is there in the production account, which will be used solely for BLACKOUT. What is lacked in the campaign, production will have to work multiple jobs to pay out of our pockets. We could use your contribution to lift the hefty costs in Los Angeles.
  • Production will still happen, regardless of this outcome. We have and will continue to invest from our end. We pay our cast and crew as well as catering and parking, which costs over $2000, but prefer not to have to worry about extra costs that will create a dent into our already planned budget. We want relief in all areas of locations and equipment that is needed for safety on set, so that cast and crew will be safe.

 

The Impact

 

  • This film belongs to everyone. Diversity, opportunities and representation is key to breaking down the doors that may be a barrier for current and future creators. 
  • Our films have gone to local and international film festivals: 

 

~ Official Selection at the Independent Filmmakers' Showcase Film Festival, Audience Choice Award Nominee (Los Angeles)

~Official Selection at the Lift-Off Global Network (Los Angeles) 

~Official Selection at the International Vampire Film and Arts Festival (Romania)

~ Official Selection at the London Independent Film Awards (England)

 

  • We always keep open communication with everyone regarding delays or obstacles when it comes to production.
  • In between periods of our projects, we  have vignettes on our IGTV (Theophilus Films), for everyone's enjoyment while they wait for us to go into production.

 

Risks & Challenges

 

  • Our priority is to give you a high quality, meaningful and powerful tale.
  • Whatever happens, we will film in October. BLACKOUT has already been delayed due to low funds. We don't want to keep cast, crew and our contributors waiting, so we are locked down for October of this year.
  • Our production company is investing out of our own pockets for the cast and crew. Because of taxes on permits and insurance, those are extra costs, and that tends to be hefty on our pockets, which is why your contribution is vital. We want to give you the highest quality filmmaking.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

  • Get the word out on your Facebook and Instagram stories as well as email and word of mouth! Spreading the word is Golden! We give shoutouts to anyone who spreads the word. Just make sure you tag us when you do so in our social medias!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Theophilus Family

 

NIGHT, POISON and BLACKOUT

We are very proud of every cast and crew members that were involved our projects and they have made miracles happen. We couldn't have done it without them. 

We are warriors of light, and desire to feed strength and relief to anyone who passes us by. This world constantly needs love. We love to create, love what we do, and have created for little to zero budget for many years.  Since times are tough for many people we have encountered, we desire to create jobs for others, especially those in need, sharing whatever we have, which is why we are also contributing to production as well.

 

With your contribution, you will help create a safe and legal space for cast and crew members to work in. There are several locations which will require permits, insurance, and other necessary equipment needed for the shoot. Post production and festival submissions have not been included in the costs (investing on our end) unless we surpass our goal, then it will go towards those needs. BLACKOUT will be on its way to film festivals once production is complete.

 

We will give general announcements when it premieres in festivals, and you may do a massive help by posting this on your social media pages and spreading the word to all your friends and acquaintances. I will be happy to return the favor for your upcoming projects. ART is LIFE.

~+~

 

Much gratitude in your magnificence, and many blessings each moment of your life. Thank you, thank you, thank you. <3 <3 <3

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

BLACKOUT'S AWESOME PRODUCING TEAM:

 

 

JEFF PETERSON

Producer

Jeff has a background in musical theatre, and runs a chapter for the LGBTQ+ community in Orlando, FL.

 

ANGELICA PEREZ

Producer

Director of Marketing Design

Is the gem behind all of our promotional film posters. She is brilliant! She is also  a full time graphic designer.  You may have seen her designs and creations in Target, Walmart, etc... Long time supporter of Theophilus Films

 

MARGARET TUDOR

Co-Producer

Margaret has been an eternal supporter and lifelong family member of Theophilus Films. She is a veteran who served in the U.S. Army as a medic and sniper (honorably discharged), correctional officer, and a security guard. She is a tremendous supporter of the arts, including films, live theatre, literature, history, gymnastics, and figure skating.  

 

 

GINA VIOLA

Co-Producer

Long time supporter of Theophilus Films! Also is an amazing filmmaker!

 

HARRI-PEKKA VIRKKI

Co-Producer

Author, stunt coordinator and stunt performer! He also helped produced other films coming out in festivals.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

JONATHAN LEONG

Associate Producer

Long time supporter of Theophilus Films! He played a supporting role in the short film "Night".

 

OLGA ZAITSEVA

Associate Producer

Supporter of the arts that we welcome into our family in our producing team!

 

KYM ATKINS

Associate Producer

Long time supporter of Theophilus Films! Also is a writer and an educator!

 

COLE LANNUM

Associate Producer

Cole is a long time supporter of Theophilus Films! He is a known actor, producer, and may be seen in films on his IMDB.

 

DAN WUNSCH

Associate Producer

Dan is a jack of all trades. He is a screenwriter, playwright, actor, producer, director and musician. He is also the founder of Nashville Music Guide 1995 and served as its editor before the successful magazine was sold. Dan's recent work was a powerful play called "Romancing Peace". 

 

BARBARA BACH:

Associate Producer

Barbara has been an eternal supporter of Theophilus Films since the time of its conception. She works in politics (you will see her throughout the year, especially at the polls getting people to vote). She is also passionate about the arts such as the old classics of Hollywood, foreign films, fashion and is an avid reader of books and baking.

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

CAST:

 

FRANK DIAZ

Gabriel

Is known in the Theatre community back in Florida, and has done a commercial, plays and a couple of films here in L.A. We welcome to the Theophilus Films family!

 

XIOMARA BERNARD

Jillian

(Bio in the Founders section above) ;)

 

MIGUEL SMITH-VEGA

Travis

Is an actor, producer and promoter. We welcome to the Theophilus Films family

 

TALIA MASON

Sam

Actress, model, singer and dancer. We welcome to the Theophilus Films family!

 

BRIAN FAN

Zack

Long time member of Theophilus Films! Brian is a photographer and has worked with seasoned veterans. 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

DIRECTING/CINEMATOGRAPHY TEAM:

 

NYRI YAGHOOBIAN

Director of Photography/Camera Operator

Nyri is a director, writer and producer. She has worked as a cinematographer on a variety of commercials, films and music videos. Long time member of Theophilus Films!

 

LINNEA JOELSSON

1st Camera/Gaffer

Linnea is a director, writer and a producer. She has worked on a variety of short films which have gone on to local festivals and international festivals. Welcome to the Theophilus Films family!

 

REINALDO TORRES

Reinaldo is a photographer and a filmmaker. He is a new member of the Theophilus Films Family. Welcome to the team, Reinaldo!

 

SEPH DIETLIN

Script Supervisor

Seph is an actor who has worked on films, television and theatre. He joined the Theophilus Films family with "NIGHT" as an AC, and has been long time supporter! You may check out his work on IMDB! 

 

SOUND DEPARTMENT TEAM:

 

MALCOLM COOK

Sound Boom Operator:

Malcolm has been a veteran in the business for several years. He is a filmmaker with a lot of film and television credits under his belt.  He has an important film called "I'm not just the guy in the video" to check out on his website! malcolmcookfilms.com 

 

GRIP TEAM:

 

DYLAN HOLLAND

Key Grip

Is an actor and hip-hop artist. He recently did two plays in Texas. He goes by the name of "D" in music.

 

MAKE-UP DEPARTMENT TEAM:

 

KATE OJA

Makeup Artist

Kate is a well seasoned make-up artist who worked on a variety of films and photo shoots.

 

~

EDITING TEAM:

Post-Production SE:

Hauk Heimdallsman

Hauk is a well known songwriter, composer, and is a sound engineer. You may check out his music on Youtube, Soundcloud and Itunes. He came into the Theophilus Films family with "Night".

 

 

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Our MVP Sponsors from our previous campaign and fundraising events:

Greg Quindel

Barbara Bachorik

Rachael Thompson

Malcolm Carter

Motown Maurice

Erica Allseitz

KJ Smith

Angela Sauer

TavieAnna A. Bee

Kamau Talbott

Julie Tran

Shana Gagnon

Raul "Jay" Suzara II

 

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

 

Previous Fundraising Specialist:

Avenida Productions

 

Caterer at Fundraising Event:

Simply D' Delicious

story:
Overview

Texas AF is a comedy about  two college-age best friends whose relationship is at a crossroads. It is the fourth feature film from X Horn Productions. Their first three features Trippin' to the Altar , My Ranger  and Empty Nester's Handbook were screened at film festivals across the U.S. and have won awards for Best Feature, Best Domestic Comedy, Best Actors and Best of Fest. They are available on Amazon Prime and other online platforms. The goal of this project is to build upon that success while continuing to showcase  Austin, Texas talent.

Why?

The process of making our first feature films were career defining experiences.  We were able to use decades of production and life experiences to chase our passion of filmmaking and collaborate with some amazing Central Texas actors and artists. 

Texas AF is a feature-length  comedy about a two college roommates who’s relationship is at a crossroads.  Flaco and Eddy are best friends and enjoy their freedom and living life to it’s fullest.  Their relationship is strained and tested as each are pulled in opposite directions. 

Your early 20’s are some of the most impactful years of your life. I was drawn to this idea because the friendships that are created at this time are so powerful and lasting.  To this day, some of my best stories that I share around the dinner table begin with, “One time Danny and me …”  Yet as tight as you may believe these relationships to be, they are endangered of being tripped up by their one true nemesis, The Girlfriend.  This is the crossroad Flaco and Eddy find themselves.  Beyond having their time together threatened by outside commitments, the introduction of a girlfriend and the responsibilities of adulthood signal the end of an era for these two best friends.

I’ve had this idea for the story for over a year and began writing the screenplay in early February of 2020, but as I continued my writing the world changed.  Here I am working on a buddy film and the world is faced with a pandemic.  My small story about two friends seemed so insignificant and I debated on whether or not to carry on, but as the events of the day changed all out lives I decided to take those events and hardships and weave them into the story and add them to the challenges that my two characters face. 

Who is X Horn Productions?

David is the writer and director, a graduate of University of Texas at Austin and has over 25 years of filmmaking experience creating commercials, music videos, documentaries and weekly television programs. Texas AF will be his sixth film.

Lisa has been a producer at X Horn Productions for over twenty years and oversees budget, locations, casting and marketing.

 

Our Work

Our first feature film, Trippin' to the Altar, was produced in 2015 for under $8,000 and went on to be screened in 10 film festivals across the U.S.  It won several awards including Best Domestic Comedy, Best Narrative Feature, Best Texas Feature Comedy and Best Actress, and was picked up for distribution by Freakish Films. Our next two films My Ranger and Empty Nester's Handbook  also had very successful film festival runs, winning multiple awards and were self-distributed.

The Cast

The Music

The Crew

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have set a budget of $7,822. The majority of the budget will go to our incredible cast. They are a collection of passionate, hardworking people who have agreed to go on this journey with us. It will also help with catering, location fees, wardrobe, props, the marketing of Texas AF and festival fees. This is an Austin, Texas production and if you would like to support local filmmaking here is your chance.  

Our perks will make you feel like you're part of the Texas AF  team. Your contribution can give you  early access to an online screening, your name in the credits, a DVD copy, or even land you on the big screen!  The more you contribute the more you receive.

We're making deals and calling in favors but this project still costs a lot of money, so every little bit helps and will be forever appreciated.

This project is already in motion and we need your contribution to help make this dream a reality.

We Need You!

Independent filmmaking takes team work and every contribution, share and mention go a long way.  We are dedicated to our craft and this project.  It will get done and if you contribute you will not only be one of the first ones to see it, but you will also know that you had a hand in bringing it to life.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't contribute?  Help us spread the word by sharing this page.

story:
Our aim is to offer a Coming Out story that captures the audience’s imagination, eliciting surprise, empathy and humour at the absurdity and tragedy of Eve’s dilemma, supported by a host of strong characters made up of family and friends whose own reactions, prejudices and fractious encounters offer a wealth of comic and dramatic moments.   


We want to show a young bride that most women could identify with, following a well-trodden path to marriage to her long term boyfriend. Still, we plan to disorient the audience by eliciting their empathy for a woman they soon learn is lesbian, who feels paralysed as to what action to take as she confronts her long term partner with her revelation. 

We believe this LGBTQ+ slant on a runaway bride story using the genre of comedy-drama is original in concept, and can offer surprising and farcical moments that would entertain audiences through the bizarre encounters and heated exchanges between the couple and their friends and families, as well as rendering a compelling emotional drama that explores the plight of a woman now acknowledging her sexuality.

After completing this short film and taking it out to festivals, we plan to pitch it to TV Production companies and online platforms to further develop Eve's story arc into a limited TV series.

 

 

This is a story we naturally feel drawn to and want to tell because of the multiple identities, and the sense of being an outsider. We are interested in representing characters who are not often seen in film and are regularly ignored by the mainstream. Apart from being mixed heritage and not moneyed, Eve’s alienation from Francis and his family is compounded as she recognises she has a strong attraction to women that she has tried to suppress. 

A strong prejudice against lesbian and bisexual women within family units persists and, when featured in films, these women are often exoticised, or stereotyped. Our aim is to challenge this by eliciting the audience’s empathy for a woman who acknowledges her feelings for women, yet remains overwhelmed with anxiety and ridden with guilt over marrying her long term boyfriend. 

Despite the absurd behaviour, actions and dialogue in EVE, the core of the drama questions a woman’s choice to explore and accept her sexual identity, saving both her husband and herself from a life of regret, suffering and deception, or bury her feelings for the sake of others.

 

Here’s how things will go down once we meet (and exceed) our goal!

  • 1 April–22 July 2019 | Pre-production
  • 23–25 July 2019 | Shooting Days!
  • 27 July–30 September 2019 | Post-production – Editing, Sound, Colour grade
  • October 2019–October 2020 | Festivals
  • To be confirmed | Premieres

In indie films (as with many other things in life), unexpected obstacles may present themselves. SO these times are subject to change. 

 

£12,500: Equipment. To make a good film we will need a lot of equipment such as cameras, lights, and microphones. This is one of the largest areas of the budget in any film shoot. Still, we have been awarded one camera and some elements of kit and lighting at a significantly reduced fee from the Genera Film Fund, and our Danish Co-Producers, GotFat Productions, will be sending a gaffer to do our lighting, as well as a second camera and drone operator, with a camera and drone to support the shoot. If we exceed our budget by 10% on equipment, we will be able to hire a mini Alexa  camera, which offers a truly cinematic quality to the film. See link to view quality: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tOPjrJC3nGE

 

The production design and art direction of films like Mamma Mia, Julieta, The Square, The Kids Are Alright, L'Animale, and The End of the World, as well as artist David Hockney's blown-up, printed images of drawings of Yorkshire landscapes made on an iPad, form part of our inspiration for this. 

                                                “No copyright infringement is intended”

£1,500: Food and Beverage. We provide our cast and crew with breakfast, lunch and dinner when they are on set with us. We will be filming for 3 full days during the summer of 2019, with 30 crew and cast. We’ve got a lot of mouths to feed!

£1,000: Cast and Crew Expenses. One of the most amazing features of this project so far is that everybody involved has worked for free in the read-throughs and numerous auditions, with actors, crew and photographers committing time to a project we are all passionate to make. The venue has also offered us very reasonable prices to feed and provide beverages for everyone. If we manage to exceed our target by 25%, we will be able to pay our cast a minimal stipend to show how much we appreciate their hours of hard work.

£3,000: Locations, Costume and Production Design. EVE will be filmed in a beautiful mid-Victorian mansion in North London. As Francis's parents in this story are paying for the wedding, it needs to have a "wow" factor that shows off their wealth. We have secured incredibly cheap daily rates to shoot here with the venue offering us exterior areas, such as the gravel drive, terrace and a private walled garden, for free. The venue manager has offered us an amazing package price to shoot in this beautiful wedding locale in the peak summer period, as they are keen to support us in filming this story. However, to make our location even more sumptuous, we also need an excellent production design, which will need funding. See link to view location: http://www.stephenshouseandgardens.com/venue-hire

Our Costume Designer, Maybelle Laye, has just graduated from the the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art and our Costume Supervisor, Rae Harrison-Doyle has extensive experience working in film and Fashion and Music videos. Our wedding dress was kindly lent to us by the Globe Theatre Costume Department.

£5,000: Insurance, Bank Charges, Indiegogo Fee and Contingency. Insurance is very important. We want to make sure we are covered for any potential problems or challenges we may run into along the way. Indiegogo charge a 5% fee, which we need to cover, and having a contingency budget is imperative for last minute emergencies that can suddenly hit you while shooting, or in post-production, where a little additional funding might be required.

£5,000: Post-Production. Some people say the magic happens in the editing room. It’s true! Post-Production is an essential part of making a good film. We have recruited a phenomenal Editor and Sound team, all either graduated or currently studying at the renowned National Film and Television School near London. This means a lot of the work will be able to be completed for free at NFTS studios. I want to use sound to convey the isolation of Eve, compared with the effervescent atmosphere of the wedding reception. Our sound designers will work on this element, as well as sonically distinguishing the 2 worlds of Eve and Francis. Still, we will need some costs covered, such as deliverables and hiring sound recording equipment for the shoot. These are essential costs that will ensure high-quality sound which is a prerequisite for any well-made film. 

Colour grading, like production design, is hugely important in creating the look and feel of the film. Drawing on 1950s Americana, I'd like to emphasise the veneer and Hollywood image through the use of bright saturated colours in the colour grade with the guests at the reception, moving to darker and cooler shades of blue in encounters with Eve to reflect her disconnect in mood from the wedding bubble. Our Colourist, also a graduate from NFTS, will be working to capture this and has generously agreed to work pro bono. Please see link to an example of Sara's work: https://vimeo.com/184375029

£5,000: last but not least – Marketing. The most important part is getting EVE out into the world. The marketing budget would allow us to cover the cost of submitting EVE to film festivals as well as the cost of attending festivals to promote the film, buying business cards, posters, and other advertising tools to ensure EVE gets maximum exposure to audiences. We plan to submit to mainstream and LGBTQ+ festivals including BAFTA, BFI Flare, Iris Prize, Cannes, Berlin and the Oscars.

 

This film is a passion project. Our team has been recruited through recommendations, interviews, auditions and filmed readings. We feel extremely lucky to have met such a great and talented group of people, who are all committed to telling Eve's story.

As we have explored funding opportunities, we have sometimes come up against the challenges of having an established high profile writer, director, and cast as a barrier to financial support, yet the determination to shoot this film and tell this story will not prevent us from making it. For this reason, we are using crowdfunding to raise the budget we need. And to ensure this film is shot, we have chosen the flexible Indiegogo option and created 2 budgets: one where everyone is paid, and we have our preferred camera and lighting equipment; and a bare-bones budget where everyone works for free and we only have the most essential equipment to shoot the film. The entire team will work with either budget.

We are now working with a Danish film production company, Gotfat Productions, who are equally committed to making EVE, offering us a gaffer for lighting, a second camera operator, a camera and a drone. They'll be flying from Denmark to collaborate with us. The Genera Film Fund, who are actively promoting our project, have also awarded us a second camera, camera lenses, and lighting equipment.

Our venue has actually provided us with reduced rates in the peak summer months for a large reception room/holding area for actors/equipment, which is extraordinarily generous. In addition, they have offered a private walled garden and terrace free of charge as they are an advocate for this project, supporting us wholeheartedly in making this project a reality. 

Regarding funding, we will only commence shooting EVE, once we have sufficient money raised to complete production of the film. 

Your pledge will help make EVE happen. You'll be a part of making a film – you'll be able to see the filmmaking process through our updates; from prep to shoot to post-production.

We have several different Rewards available in return for your contribution, including digital photo albums from the film, a digital copy of the script, tote bags, DVDs, invitations to the premiere, the chance to be in the film and to become a member of the production team. 

 

Sophie Delora Jones playing Eve 

Trained at the Poor School in London, Sophie has played a range of roles from a world tour as Shakespeare’s Juliet, to Charmaine on the popular sitcom Meet the Adebanjos. She has worked both on stage and screen, in both short films and feature films including the award-winning short Lost Souls.

Nicholas Gerard Martin playing Francis

Nick is a professional actor with screen credits including The Theory of Everything and Dirty Work. He has worked extensively for the Royal Shakespeare Company, and also the National Theatre. Following training at London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art (LAMDA), Nick has worked with directors including Simon Godwin, Greg Doran, Lily McLeish, Owen Horsley, James Marsh (The Theory of Everything) and Michael Longhurst. 

Francesca Reid playing Olivia

Francesca is an actor/comedian/singer/facilitator. A graduate of East 15 Acting School, she has clowned across the globe with underserved communities with the clown charity The Flying Seagull Project, and challenged gender norms as Drag King Brent Would. You can also find her doing stand up in a darkened bar or making up musicals on the spot with the acclaimed @DreamweaverQRT. She has appeared in films such as Seen at 8:58 and BBC3's The Only Black Guy to name a few. To find out more info, follow her on Instagram and Twitter @Francescarenee3.

Kevin Fuller playing Ian

Kevin's TV work includes roles in BBC productions Strike – The Cuckoo’s Calling, Luther, Spooks and a recurring role in the drama Doctors. Also, Guerilla (Sky Atlantic) and Knightfall (History). He will next be seen in the award-winning short film Whoever You Are and the feature film Red Joan with Dame Judi Dench, directed by Trevor Nunn.

Robyn Grant playing Josie

Robyn is a professional actor and comedy writer who trained with Youth Music Theatre UK and East 15 Acting School. Screen credits include: Fingertip (TV Series), The Library (Short Film) and The Knife That Killed Me (Film). Robyn worked as a director for Pick Me Up Theatre, York Stage Experience and NUE Music Theatre before setting up Fat Rascal Theatre after graduating from drama school. For Acting, Robyn was awarded the Youth Award by Leeds Civic Arts Guild. 

Miranda Foster playing Margot

Miranda is currently filming The Man (ITV) written by Mike Bartlett and directed by Julia Ford. She has just finished Dance Nation at the Almeida Theatre, directed by Bijan Sheibani. She has played Gertrude in Hamlet for Shakespeare’s Globe, directed by Dominic Dromgoole, and has worked with directors including Rufus Norris (Festen, The People Downstairs), David Hare (Pravda, King Lear), Richard Eyre (The Futurists, The Government Inspector), Peter Hall (Antony and Cleopatra, Animal Farm). TV work includes The Knock, Sharman, Where the Heart Is, Rosemary and Thyme and The Contractor, with directors Jed Mercurio, Jon East, Bob Bierman and Suri Krishnama. 

Jeremy Lloyd Thomas playing Harold

Jeremy trained at the RWCMD. He spent several rep seasons at The Torch Theatre, Milford Haven. He played Dave in the Welsh language film Llygad y Ffynon and The Aircraftsman in Snow for BBC Wales. Jeremy spent 6 years in Sydney where work included the Australian premiere of Twilight Shift and playing Lucio in Measure For Measure at the Australian Shakespeare Festival. Jeremy spends most summers at The Theatre Royal Nottingham with The Classic Thriller Season, playing mostly villains, murderers and womanisers!

Patrick Neyman playing Best Man

Patrick trained at the Drama Centre. Theatre includes: Brackenbury/King Edward in Richard III (Cambridge Shakespeare Festival), Pisanio/Caius Lucius in Cymbeline (Cambridge Shakespeare Festival), Adrien in A Woman of No Importance...Or Somewhat Little Importance Anyhow (Hen and Chickens), Ivan Vasilievich in The Proposal (Platform Theatre). Film includes: Jamie in The New 22 (Manuka Road Productions).

Ian Houghton playing Bearded Man

Ian's theatre credits include: War Horse (New London Theatre), This House (Garrick Theatre and UK Tour), The Audience (Gielgud Theatre), The Best Man (UK Tour), Yes, Prime Minister (Gielgud Theatre), Dent (Arcola Theatre), Unrestless (Old Vic New Voices), What’s Wrong With Angry? (King’s Head), Reserves (Criterion Theatre). TV credits include: EastEnders (BBC), Mr Selfridge (ITV1), Call The Midwife (BBC), Waking The Dead (BBC), MI High (CBBC), Moving Wallpaper (ITV).

Elliot Hadley playing The Photographer

Elliot studied at ALRA and soon after training won the acting competition MonologueSlam UK at Theatre Royal Stratford East. He recently played William and Jürgen in the revival of Kevin Elyot’s critically acclaimed Coming Clean which is transferring to Trafalgar Studios in 2019. Elliot won The Michael McLiamoir award for best male performance at The Dublin International Arts Festival for his role. Other credits include: Alfred Cummins in BBC's Preston Passion, Thomas Kyd in The Dead Shepherd and roles in ITV's The Halcyon and Far From The Madding Crowd. 

 

Joe Solomon – Producer/Director

Joe is a producer/writer/director of drama, having graduated from the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art with a Master’s degree. Whilst working at the BBC, Joe received training in self-shooting, lighting, sound, writing for radio and coordinating productions. Directing radio and short films helped Joe make a short that led him to the Cannes Film Festival. He currently has 2 shorts,  a radio play and a feature film in development.  

Laurence Tratalos – Writer 

Laurence studied Creative Writing at the University of East Anglia. A new talent developed by the BBC Writersroom’s Scriptroom 9 competition, he was selected to take part in a 6 month development scheme with BBC Comedy. He currently has TV pilots and Feature scripts in development with Channel 4 and the BBC.

Thor Hampus Bank – Co-Producer

Thor is a creative producer and founding partner at GotFat Productions. He has a Master’s in Media Science and Economy from Aarhus University in Denmark. Besides working as a producer he’s also directing commercials and documentaries. He used to play drums in a Rage Against The Machine cover band.

Sharon Williams-Thorp – Production Manager

Sharon is a dynamic production manager with a wealth of experience in leading multi-stranded projects. She consistently delivers results in line with budgets, timescales and production requirements, always ensuring accountability, best practice and positivity in her work.

Selena Leoni – Production Assistant

After graduating in New Media in Hong Kong, Selena worked as a multimedia content producer in the Centre for Innovative Applications of Internet and Multimedia Technologies (AIMtech Centre), City University of Hong Kong. She is currently studying on the MFA Producers Program at UCLA. 

Eric Mizrahi – Director of Photography

Eric's was the cinematographer for Ave Maria (2015) which was Cannes and Oscar-nominated. He has also received awards for best cinematography. Now and Forever (2012) appeared in over 60 festivals worldwide, including the opening of the Venice Film Festival. He's recently finished working as the DOP on the first season of a three-season TV drama.

Subhankar Dutta – Production Designer

Shubie is a production designer and director based in London. His keen editorial eye, paired with a strong background in Visual Effects, has enabled him to work with creative agencies in India and London where his clients now include Castrol, Fed Ex, Samsung and Sony Pictures.        

Maybelle Laye – Costume Designer

Maybelle will be graduating from the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in Costume this year. While there, she has design coordinated Intimate Apparel by Lynn Nottage and has had production roles on 3 RADA films. Most recently she worked as a costume designer on the short film The Kindness of Strangers and she is soon to be working as an assistant supervisor for Rutherford and Sons at the National Theatre.

Joshua Bamford – Sound Recordist

Since graduating from the National Film and Television School, Joshua has been working consistently on location across the UK and abroad as a sound assistant and recordist. His film and television experience ranges from short and feature length film productions to TV entertainment, drama, sitcoms, and documentaries.

Rowena Ladbury – Script Supervisor

Rowena is an experienced script supervisor with credits on major independent films over 20 years. She recently worked on Oscar award-winning Bohemian Rhapsody, On Chesil Beach and Brooklyn.

Peter Sø​rgensen – Gaffer

Peter is a young up and coming DOP and a part of GotFat Productions. Peter is both studying at Media College Viborg and at the independent film education Super8 in Aarhus. He likes Paolo Sorrentino’s films and ARRI cameras.

Jacob Gosch – Camera Operator

Jacob is also a young up and coming DOP and a part of GotFat Productions. Besides being an avid camera slinger, he also has a drone certificate and can rig lights, gimbals, etc. on the run. In his spare time, he grabs the company drone and sails to Norway to do epic Instagram posts. 

Ed Coltman – Editor

With over 20 feature credits, Ed has worked on projects for Film 4, Channel 4, BFI, Creative England, Creative Scotland and BBC Comedy principally as an assistant editor. He was Assembly Editor on the BAFTA nominated short film Emotional Fusebox and the award-winning short Passenger.

Ruth Knight – Sound Editor

Ruth has worked both as the Sound Editor and Dubbing Mixer on several short fiction films, documentaries and animations that are currently under festival submission. Her work is also being exhibited at the Barber Institute of Fine Arts. She is in the process of funding a sound installation exploring the effect an increased use of technology is having on us as a society.

Tatiana Sanches – Sound Editor

Tatiana moved to London in 2012 to start her studies in Sound Design and Audio Post-Production. Since then she has worked on projects in film Post-Production, Sound Design for exhibitions, animations and games. Her clients include Adidas, Nike, TruTv, and King's Cross Development to name a few. She is now completing her MA in Sound Design for Film and TV at the renowned National Film and TV School.

Sara Buxton – Colourist

Sara trained at the National Film and TV School. She now works as an assistant colourist at Goldcrest Post, working on Three Billboards Outside Ebbing Missouri, Murder on the Orient Express, Kingsman: The Golden Circle, and The Killing of a Sacred Deer.

Andrá​s Jacobs – Costume Assistant 

András is currently studying at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama in Costume Supervision. He specialises in creating realistic contemporary styling and developing a character's personal sense of style. He has worked for both stage and screen productions in many different roles from designer to costume assistant.

Natalia Clark – Production Assistant

Natalia is a writer, actor and also has experience in film production. She has written and directed several short films and, whilst at drama school, she received training in lighting and sound and worked as a first assistant director and production coordinator on a number of projects. She has worked on several features including Kill Your Friends and Bastille Day.

 

Special Thanks To Our Casting Assistants:

Michele Goldsmith, Anna Østergaard and Lisa Morgan

 

If you want to support us but don't feel that you can contribute financially, you can help tremendously by sharing our campaign with the people around you.

Let others know about EVE and this Indiegogo page!

You can also follow/like us and share our posts on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. 

Our IMDB page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9245214/.
