Still, we have been awarded one camera and some elements of kit and lighting at a significantly reduced fee from the Genera Film Fund, and our Danish Co-Producers, GotFat Productions, will be sending a gaffer to do our lighting, as well as a second camera and drone operator, with a camera and drone to support the shoot. If we exceed our budget by 10% on equipment, we will be able to hire a mini Alexa  camera, which offers a truly cinematic quality to the film. See link to view quality: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=tOPjrJC3nGE
 

The production design and art direction of films like Mamma Mia, Julieta, The Square, The Kids Are Alright, L'Animale, and The End of the World, as well as artist David Hockney's blown-up, printed images of drawings of Yorkshire landscapes made on an iPad, form part of our inspiration for this. 

                                                “No copyright infringement is intended”
£1,500: Food and Beverage. We provide our cast and crew with breakfast, lunch and dinner when they are on set with us. We will be filming for 3 full days during the summer of 2019, with 30 crew and cast. We’ve got a lot of mouths to feed!


£1,000: Cast and Crew Expenses. One of the most amazing features of this project so far is that everybody involved has worked for free in the read-throughs and numerous auditions, with actors, crew and photographers committing time to a project we are all passionate to make. The venue has also offered us very reasonable prices to feed and provide beverages for everyone. If we manage to exceed our target by 25%, we will be able to pay our cast a minimal stipend to show how much we appreciate their hours of hard work.

£3,000: Locations, Costume and Production Design. EVE will be filmed in a beautiful mid-Victorian mansion in North London. As Francis's parents in this story are paying for the wedding, it needs to have a "wow" factor that shows off their wealth. We have secured incredibly cheap daily rates to shoot here with the venue offering us exterior areas, such as the gravel drive, terrace and a private walled garden, for free. The venue manager has offered us an amazing package price to shoot in this beautiful wedding locale in the peak summer period, as they are keen to support us in filming this story. However, to make our location even more sumptuous, we also need an excellent production design, which will need funding. See link to view location: http://www.stephenshouseandgardens.com/venue-hire
Our Costume Designer, Maybelle Laye, has just graduated from the the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art and our Costume Supervisor, Rae Harrison-Doyle has extensive experience working in film and Fashion and Music videos. Our wedding dress was kindly lent to us by the Globe Theatre Costume Department.


£5,000: Insurance, Bank Charges, Indiegogo Fee and Contingency. Insurance is very important. We want to make sure we are covered for any potential problems or challenges we may run into along the way. Indiegogo charge a 5% fee, which we need to cover, and having a contingency budget is imperative for last minute emergencies that can suddenly hit you while shooting, or in post-production, where a little additional funding might be required.
£5,000: Post-Production. Some people say the magic happens in the editing room. It’s true! Post-Production is an essential part of making a good film. We have recruited a phenomenal Editor and Sound team, all either graduated or currently studying at the renowned National Film and Television School near London. This means a lot of the work will be able to be completed for free at NFTS studios. I want to use sound to convey the isolation of Eve, compared with the effervescent atmosphere of the wedding reception. Our sound designers will work on this element, as well as sonically distinguishing the 2 worlds of Eve and Francis. Still, we will need some costs covered, such as deliverables and hiring sound recording equipment for the shoot. These are essential costs that will ensure high-quality sound which is a prerequisite for any well-made film. 
Colour grading, like production design, is hugely important in creating the look and feel of the film. Drawing on 1950s Americana, I'd like to emphasise the veneer and Hollywood image through the use of bright saturated colours in the colour grade with the guests at the reception, moving to darker and cooler shades of blue in encounters with Eve to reflect her disconnect in mood from the wedding bubble. Our Colourist, also a graduate from NFTS, will be working to capture this and has generously agreed to work pro bono. Please see link to an example of Sara's work: https://vimeo.com/184375029

£5,000: last but not least – Marketing. The most important part is getting EVE out into the world. The marketing budget would allow us to cover the cost of submitting EVE to film festivals as well as the cost of attending festivals to promote the film, buying business cards, posters, and other advertising tools to ensure EVE gets maximum exposure to audiences. We plan to submit to mainstream and LGBTQ+ festivals including BAFTA, BFI Flare, Iris Prize, Cannes, Berlin and the Oscars.
 



This film is a passion project. Our team has been recruited through recommendations, interviews, auditions and filmed readings. We feel extremely lucky to have met such a great and talented group of people, who are all committed to telling Eve's story.
As we have explored funding opportunities, we have sometimes come up against the challenges of having an established high profile writer, director, and cast as a barrier to financial support, yet the determination to shoot this film and tell this story will not prevent us from making it. For this reason, we are using crowdfunding to raise the budget we need. And to ensure this film is shot, we have chosen the flexible Indiegogo option and created 2 budgets: one where everyone is paid, and we have our preferred camera and lighting equipment; and a bare-bones budget where everyone works for free and we only have the most essential equipment to shoot the film. The entire team will work with either budget.
We are now working with a Danish film production company, Gotfat Productions, who are equally committed to making EVE, offering us a gaffer for lighting, a second camera operator, a camera and a drone. They'll be flying from Denmark to collaborate with us. The Genera Film Fund, who are actively promoting our project, have also awarded us a second camera, camera lenses, and lighting equipment.
Our venue has actually provided us with reduced rates in the peak summer months for a large reception room/holding area for actors/equipment, which is extraordinarily generous. In addition, they have offered a private walled garden and terrace free of charge as they are an advocate for this project, supporting us wholeheartedly in making this project a reality. 

Regarding funding, we will only commence shooting EVE, once we have sufficient money raised to complete production of the film. 
Your pledge will help make EVE happen. You'll be a part of making a film – you'll be able to see the filmmaking process through our updates; from prep to shoot to post-production.
We have several different Rewards available in return for your contribution, including digital photo albums from the film, a digital copy of the script, tote bags, DVDs, invitations to the premiere, the chance to be in the film and to become a member of the production team. 
 




Sophie Delora Jones playing Eve 
Trained at the Poor School in London, Sophie has played a range of roles from a world tour as Shakespeare’s Juliet, to Charmaine on the popular sitcom Meet the Adebanjos. She has worked both on stage and screen, in both short films and feature films including the award-winning short Lost Souls.
Nicholas Gerard Martin playing Francis
Nick is a professional actor with screen credits including The Theory of Everything and Dirty Work. He has worked extensively for the Royal Shakespeare Company, and also the National Theatre. Following training at London Academy of Music and Dramatic Art (LAMDA), Nick has worked with directors including Simon Godwin, Greg Doran, Lily McLeish, Owen Horsley, James Marsh (The Theory of Everything) and Michael Longhurst. 
Francesca Reid playing Olivia
Francesca is an actor/comedian/singer/facilitator. A graduate of East 15 Acting School, she has clowned across the globe with underserved communities with the clown charity The Flying Seagull Project, and challenged gender norms as Drag King Brent Would. You can also find her doing stand up in a darkened bar or making up musicals on the spot with the acclaimed @DreamweaverQRT. She has appeared in films such as Seen at 8:58 and BBC3's The Only Black Guy to name a few. To find out more info, follow her on Instagram and Twitter @Francescarenee3.
Kevin Fuller playing Ian
Kevin's TV work includes roles in BBC productions Strike – The Cuckoo’s Calling, Luther, Spooks and a recurring role in the drama Doctors. Also, Guerilla (Sky Atlantic) and Knightfall (History). He will next be seen in the award-winning short film Whoever You Are and the feature film Red Joan with Dame Judi Dench, directed by Trevor Nunn.
Robyn Grant playing Josie
Robyn is a professional actor and comedy writer who trained with Youth Music Theatre UK and East 15 Acting School. Screen credits include: Fingertip (TV Series), The Library (Short Film) and The Knife That Killed Me (Film). Robyn worked as a director for Pick Me Up Theatre, York Stage Experience and NUE Music Theatre before setting up Fat Rascal Theatre after graduating from drama school. For Acting, Robyn was awarded the Youth Award by Leeds Civic Arts Guild. 
Miranda Foster playing Margot
Miranda is currently filming The Man (ITV) written by Mike Bartlett and directed by Julia Ford. She has just finished Dance Nation at the Almeida Theatre, directed by Bijan Sheibani. She has played Gertrude in Hamlet for Shakespeare’s Globe, directed by Dominic Dromgoole, and has worked with directors including Rufus Norris (Festen, The People Downstairs), David Hare (Pravda, King Lear), Richard Eyre (The Futurists, The Government Inspector), Peter Hall (Antony and Cleopatra, Animal Farm). TV work includes The Knock, Sharman, Where the Heart Is, Rosemary and Thyme and The Contractor, with directors Jed Mercurio, Jon East, Bob Bierman and Suri Krishnama. 
Jeremy Lloyd Thomas playing Harold
Jeremy trained at the RWCMD. He spent several rep seasons at The Torch Theatre, Milford Haven. He played Dave in the Welsh language film Llygad y Ffynon and The Aircraftsman in Snow for BBC Wales. Jeremy spent 6 years in Sydney where work included the Australian premiere of Twilight Shift and playing Lucio in Measure For Measure at the Australian Shakespeare Festival. Jeremy spends most summers at The Theatre Royal Nottingham with The Classic Thriller Season, playing mostly villains, murderers and womanisers!
Patrick Neyman playing Best Man
Patrick trained at the Drama Centre. Theatre includes: Brackenbury/King Edward in Richard III (Cambridge Shakespeare Festival), Pisanio/Caius Lucius in Cymbeline (Cambridge Shakespeare Festival), Adrien in A Woman of No Importance...Or Somewhat Little Importance Anyhow (Hen and Chickens), Ivan Vasilievich in The Proposal (Platform Theatre). Film includes: Jamie in The New 22 (Manuka Road Productions).
Ian Houghton playing Bearded Man
Ian's theatre credits include: War Horse (New London Theatre), This House (Garrick Theatre and UK Tour), The Audience (Gielgud Theatre), The Best Man (UK Tour), Yes, Prime Minister (Gielgud Theatre), Dent (Arcola Theatre), Unrestless (Old Vic New Voices), What’s Wrong With Angry? (King’s Head), Reserves (Criterion Theatre). TV credits include: EastEnders (BBC), Mr Selfridge (ITV1), Call The Midwife (BBC), Waking The Dead (BBC), MI High (CBBC), Moving Wallpaper (ITV).
Elliot Hadley playing The Photographer
Elliot studied at ALRA and soon after training won the acting competition MonologueSlam UK at Theatre Royal Stratford East. He recently played William and Jürgen in the revival of Kevin Elyot’s critically acclaimed Coming Clean which is transferring to Trafalgar Studios in 2019. Elliot won The Michael McLiamoir award for best male performance at The Dublin International Arts Festival for his role. Other credits include: Alfred Cummins in BBC's Preston Passion, Thomas Kyd in The Dead Shepherd and roles in ITV's The Halcyon and Far From The Madding Crowd. 
 


Joe Solomon – Producer/Director
Joe is a producer/writer/director of drama, having graduated from the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art with a Master’s degree. Whilst working at the BBC, Joe received training in self-shooting, lighting, sound, writing for radio and coordinating productions. Directing radio and short films helped Joe make a short that led him to the Cannes Film Festival. He currently has 2 shorts,  a radio play and a feature film in development.  
Laurence Tratalos – Writer 
Laurence studied Creative Writing at the University of East Anglia. A new talent developed by the BBC Writersroom’s Scriptroom 9 competition, he was selected to take part in a 6 month development scheme with BBC Comedy. He currently has TV pilots and Feature scripts in development with Channel 4 and the BBC.
Thor Hampus Bank – Co-Producer
Thor is a creative producer and founding partner at GotFat Productions. He has a Master’s in Media Science and Economy from Aarhus University in Denmark. Besides working as a producer he’s also directing commercials and documentaries. He used to play drums in a Rage Against The Machine cover band.
Sharon Williams-Thorp – Production Manager
Sharon is a dynamic production manager with a wealth of experience in leading multi-stranded projects. She consistently delivers results in line with budgets, timescales and production requirements, always ensuring accountability, best practice and positivity in her work.

Selena Leoni – Production Assistant
After graduating in New Media in Hong Kong, Selena worked as a multimedia content producer in the Centre for Innovative Applications of Internet and Multimedia Technologies (AIMtech Centre), City University of Hong Kong. She is currently studying on the MFA Producers Program at UCLA. 
Eric Mizrahi – Director of Photography
Eric's was the cinematographer for Ave Maria (2015) which was Cannes and Oscar-nominated. He has also received awards for best cinematography. Now and Forever (2012) appeared in over 60 festivals worldwide, including the opening of the Venice Film Festival. He's recently finished working as the DOP on the first season of a three-season TV drama.
Subhankar Dutta – Production Designer
Shubie is a production designer and director based in London. His keen editorial eye, paired with a strong background in Visual Effects, has enabled him to work with creative agencies in India and London where his clients now include Castrol, Fed Ex, Samsung and Sony Pictures.        
Maybelle Laye – Costume Designer
Maybelle will be graduating from the Royal Academy of Dramatic Art in Costume this year. While there, she has design coordinated Intimate Apparel by Lynn Nottage and has had production roles on 3 RADA films. Most recently she worked as a costume designer on the short film The Kindness of Strangers and she is soon to be working as an assistant supervisor for Rutherford and Sons at the National Theatre.

Joshua Bamford – Sound Recordist
Since graduating from the National Film and Television School, Joshua has been working consistently on location across the UK and abroad as a sound assistant and recordist. His film and television experience ranges from short and feature length film productions to TV entertainment, drama, sitcoms, and documentaries.
Rowena Ladbury – Script Supervisor
Rowena is an experienced script supervisor with credits on major independent films over 20 years. She recently worked on Oscar award-winning Bohemian Rhapsody, On Chesil Beach and Brooklyn.
Peter Sø​rgensen – Gaffer
Peter is a young up and coming DOP and a part of GotFat Productions. Peter is both studying at Media College Viborg and at the independent film education Super8 in Aarhus. He likes Paolo Sorrentino’s films and ARRI cameras.
Jacob Gosch – Camera Operator
Jacob is also a young up and coming DOP and a part of GotFat Productions. Besides being an avid camera slinger, he also has a drone certificate and can rig lights, gimbals, etc. on the run. In his spare time, he grabs the company drone and sails to Norway to do epic Instagram posts. 

Ed Coltman – Editor
With over 20 feature credits, Ed has worked on projects for Film 4, Channel 4, BFI, Creative England, Creative Scotland and BBC Comedy principally as an assistant editor. He was Assembly Editor on the BAFTA nominated short film Emotional Fusebox and the award-winning short Passenger.
Ruth Knight – Sound Editor
Ruth has worked both as the Sound Editor and Dubbing Mixer on several short fiction films, documentaries and animations that are currently under festival submission. Her work is also being exhibited at the Barber Institute of Fine Arts. She is in the process of funding a sound installation exploring the effect an increased use of technology is having on us as a society.
Tatiana Sanches – Sound Editor
Tatiana moved to London in 2012 to start her studies in Sound Design and Audio Post-Production. Since then she has worked on projects in film Post-Production, Sound Design for exhibitions, animations and games. Her clients include Adidas, Nike, TruTv, and King's Cross Development to name a few. She is now completing her MA in Sound Design for Film and TV at the renowned National Film and TV School.
Sara Buxton – Colourist
Sara trained at the National Film and TV School. She now works as an assistant colourist at Goldcrest Post, working on Three Billboards Outside Ebbing Missouri, Murder on the Orient Express, Kingsman: The Golden Circle, and The Killing of a Sacred Deer.

Andrá​s Jacobs – Costume Assistant 
András is currently studying at the Guildhall School of Music and Drama in Costume Supervision. He specialises in creating realistic contemporary styling and developing a character's personal sense of style. He has worked for both stage and screen productions in many different roles from designer to costume assistant.
Natalia Clark – Production Assistant
Natalia is a writer, actor and also has experience in film production. She has written and directed several short films and, whilst at drama school, she received training in lighting and sound and worked as a first assistant director and production coordinator on a number of projects. She has worked on several features including Kill Your Friends and Bastille Day.
 
Special Thanks To Our Casting Assistants:

Michele Goldsmith, Anna Østergaard and Lisa Morgan
 


If you want to support us but don't feel that you can contribute financially, you can help tremendously by sharing our campaign with the people around you.
Let others know about EVE and this Indiegogo page!
You can also follow/like us and share our posts on Instagram, Twitter and Facebook. 
Our IMDB page: https://www.imdb.com/title/tt9245214/.

story:
The Story :

Social worker Norah struggles to balance her demanding workload with caring for her elderly father Horace, an ex-POW who has dementia. On a particularly bad day, as Horace is sinking into a distressing episode, his daycare centre unexpectedly calls to say they are closed and Norah is forced to leave him home alone. In his delusional state, Horace mistakes his kind neighbour Mr. Wong for a Japanese camp guard. As the horrors of his past resurface to haunt his present. Norah's precariously balanced house of cards starts to collapse.

 

 

About Us

Rookie Films is a female led production company founded by Anni Swinburn and Clare Langford. 

Anni is a social worker turned writer based in Sheffield. Her stage plays have been produced at theatre festivals in established London venues, and her short story, Bard of Steel City, is being adapted for film by a final year film director at Manchester Film School.

Clare is an award winning writer, actress and director from Limerick. Since graduating from The Drama Centre (Central St Martins) she has produced for arts festivals in London, Dublin and Toronto. Her first co-writing venture was published by Routledge in 2019.

 

                                         

We are honoured to have as our patron Steve Hawley, Emeritus Professor of Manchester Metropolitan University. Steve describes Mr Wong’s Lullaby as :

"a quirky and moving film that at heart is about remembrance and reconciliation; a serious film that wears itself lightly."

 

The Vision :

In Mr Wong's Lullaby, Anni draws on her professional background to paint a very real picture of the life of a social worker, while Clare’s experience as a dementia carer gives her an understanding of the fragile mental state of the sufferer, as well as the pressures on the caregiver. We both feel strongly about telling the stories of everyday heroes and showing how reliant we all are on empathy, kindness and humour. 

We plan to take this short film onto the UK & international film festival circuit. As well as being a stand alone piece in it's own right, the film is also a taster for a feature film which tackles the subject matter in more depth.

 

 

 

 

What we need

We are partly self funding the film, but we need to raise at least another £14,000 to cover all of the costs. This will help us with :

 

                                          

This film is about the power of kindness - your contribution is an act of kindness in itself!

 

What you get 

We have some really unique perks on offer for you guys in return for your acts of kindness! These include bespoke merchandise, brilliant online workshops, advance access to the film and the original soundtrack, exclusive invitations to our premiere, and many more! 

Plus, local Sheffield business Our Cow Molly  has kindly said that they will donate a 120 ml tub of ice cream to everyone who donates (based in Sheffield only!)  

The Impact

By being a part of this project, you are not merely helping to make a short film. You are a patron of the arts; without you, independent film hasn't got a chance. You are helping to keep the world of indie film alive.

Not only that, but we have also partnered with the charity TIDE (Together In Dementia Everyday) -  https://www.tide.uk.net. If we surpass our target, we have pledged to donate 50% of the excess towards their cause. 

 

Our Ambassadors

We are so lucky to have a brilliant team of ambassadors who have gotten behind this film, and supported the process from the very beginning. Thank you!

 

Risks & Challenges

We started writing Mr. Wong’s Lullaby in 2019 and now, with the help of a brilliant crew and our covid safety officer, we are excited to start filming in April 2021. However, these are uncertain times. Our primary responsibility is the safety of our cast and crew, as well as adhering to government guidance. If we feel that it is necessary to postpone filming, we will do so.

Other Ways You Can Help 

We realise that it has been a difficult year for many people, and you may not be in a position to contribute financially. Don’t worry! The smallest donation is hugely valued, but if you can’t donate, we would love it if you would spread the word about the film, the crowdfunding campaign and the work that TIDE does to support dementia carers.

 

 

Check us out on IMDb : https://www.imdb.com/title/tt14028028/?ref_=ttfc_fc_tt

story:
Overview

Dust Light is a simple but layered story that reflects the complexity of life, inside and out. The film sets out the explore the meaning of life and death, and the existential crisis of adulthood in a lyrical but relatable way. Through the themes of loss, grief and solitude the protagonist embarks on an intimate journey, looking for the pieces of herself that she lost along the way, and carries us away with her in a quietly exhilarating ride. 

We invite you to join us!

 

The Story

Matina is facing pivotal life issues: the end of her marriage, a career that no longer makes her happy, a midlife crisis. She’s also tasked with having to clear out her long-gone mother’s things from the family summer house. After she arrives at the house she begins to unravel, as past and present collide, until she reaches a personal epiphany.

Why This Film

There are moments in life that we all at some point go through, losing a loved one, growing older, being alone again. In this story, I’m interested in exploring the space between closing one life chapter before opening a new one. There are moments of loneliness and reflection that occupy that gap where we have the opportunity to reconnect with our essence. This film is an invitation to take a moment and reflect on moments like these and connect with a story that aims to give you a sense of belonging. 

 

The Cast

Marisha Triantafyllidou - "Matina"                                                        

Marisha Triantafyllidou is a Greek actress with appearances in theatre, cinema and television. She is also a translator, dramaturg, and assistant director in theatre and has collaborated among others with BLITZ, N. Karathanos, N. Labôt, P. Koutras, B. Makridis, A. Papadimitropoulos, S. Tzoumerkas, T. Karanikolas, K. Gavras, F. Tsitos, L. Haritos, P. Dimitrakopoulou, S. Kyriakopoulos.  For her part in the movie "Her Job", by N. Labôt, she was awarded the Best Female Actress Award in the 59th Thessaloniki International Film Festival, and also in the 10th Hellenic Film Academy Awards.

Evangelia Andreandaki - "Mother"   

                                                   

Evangelia Andreadaki was born in Athens. She studied theatre at the State Theater of Northern Greece and at Drama Studio London. In theatre, she has collaborated with: National Theater, Art Theater, New Stage, Spring Theater, Point Theater, directed by D. Mauritius, G. Houvarda, L. Vogiatzi, K. Bakas, A. Voutsina, D. Chronopoulos, N. Mastoraki, Z. Nikoloudis, S. Evangelato and others. She has starred in several short and feature films: The Administrator, 2009, by P. Hoursoglou, Black Field, 2009, by V. Marinakis, Brides, 2004, by P. Voulgaris, Testosterone, 2000, and M Agapas, by G. Panousopoulos, Rodin 'Akrogialia, 1997, by E. Hatzis and many more.

For her performance in P. Hoursoglou's “Eyes From Night” (2003), she was awarded the Best Female Actress Award at Thessaloniki International Film Festival and at Rabat Festival (Morocco). For her performance in short film "Kim and Lucy" by E. Bountri (2007) and Anna Goulis' s "Smile" (1997), she was awarded the Best Female Performance Award at Drama Short Film Festival. She has performed roles in the TV series Karyotakis, Apostolos and Alone, I Have a Secret, Wild Children, The Showcase Cap, 7 Deadly Fathers. In March 2013 she participated in the film "Little England" by Pantelis Voulgaris.

 

The Crew

Chryssanthi Kouri - Director, Writer   

                                                            

Chryssanthi was born and raised in Athens and currently lives and works in London. She studied media production, popular culture and acting and trained in filmmaking by working as a crew member on many productions and by then picking up a camera of her own. So far, she has written, directed and produced 5 short films, as well as many music videos. She also directs theatre, with over 15 plays under her belt, specialising in new writing. Chryssanthi has a passion for character-driven stories that explore human nature and likes to put women and misfits at the centre of her writing. With a unique talent in working complex emotions and ideas into a narrative, she creates truthful and relatable stories. Some of her previous films explored unrequited love in Unrequited, relationship baggage in The Loft, and the trials of female friendship and adulthood in feature film Running from Reality  (as screenwriter only). She’s beyond excited to be filming her first-ever film in her native language and country after being away for 15 years. www.chryssanthikouri.com

 

Nikoleta Geladari - Producer                     

Born and raised in Athens, Nikoleta studied Informatics and Mass Media in the Higher Technological Educational Institution of Patra. During her studies, she got involved in theatre and film production. For her dissertation, she completed a short documentary about “Homophobia in Greece and how it affects work". In 2015  Nikoleta decided to pursue a professional career in the film industry and studied at Sae Institute of Athens receiving a Diploma in Digital Film Making. In September 2017, her thesis short film “Profiterole” won the award for Best Student Film in the International Drama Short Film Festival and in October 2018 received the SAE award for Best TV and Film Production. The film was selected and screened in many national and international film festivals. Currently, Nikoleta works as a production coordinator at Shampoo Films and produces independent short films.

 

Chrysa Koutrakou - Assistant Director       

    

Chrysa Koutrakou was born and raised in Athens, Greece. She studied History and Philosophy of Science in the University of Athens and took several seminars in direction and scriptwriting. In 2018 she graduated by SAE Technology Group Athens with a Diploma in Digital Filmmaking and wrote the script for the short film thesis '' In high school I was in love with Anna'', that was an official selection in the 41st Drama Short Film Festival and the 24th Athens International Film Festival and international film festivals. She currently works as a script supervisor and assistant director in short films and directs and edits music videos.

Dimitris Lambridis - Director of Photography

Dimitris Lambridis is a Greek Cinematographer and Photographer and currently works in the film industry in Athens and London - where he has been based since 2013. Coming up through the lighting department, Dimitri gained a lot of experience as an electrician and excelled as a gaffer at a young age. He worked in films that had great festival runs, such as Academy Award nominee for Best Short Documentary - “Blacksheep” Dir. Ed Perkins, and Sundance Best Short film, and BAFTA Best British Short film “Wren Boys” by Dir. Harry Lighton. After 6 years in the lighting department, Dimitri now works as a Cinematographer, across all formats, Digital and Celluloid. As a photographer, Dimitri focuses on ethnographic and anthropological narratives across the globe, exploring the concept of preserving culture. He has documented Native American tribes in Taos New Mexico, rapidly expanding villages in Iceland, ghost towns and isolated hermits in Italy, Portugal and Greece. 

 

Evelyna Darzenta - Art Director

Evelyna was born and raised in Athens. She studied graphic design (BA), costume and set design in Vakalo Art & Design College (University of Derby UK). She has worked for theatrical plays, movies, tv commercials, video clips, short films and performances. She has worked for National Theater of Greece, Athens and Epidaurus Festival, Onassis Cultural Center, Greek participation in Biennale of Venice, Pallas theater etc. and with directors T. Boulmetis, D. Lignadis, M. Marmarinos, G. Kakleas, N. Mastorakis, R. Pateraki, T. Antheridis, G.Drivas, N. Chryssos etc.

 

Julia Lima  - Composer

Julia started her musical career as a Jazz musician, from an early stage focusing on original compositions and arrangements. She combines her Brazilian heritage with her European education. Writing mostly from script Julia’s film scores help shape characters and places, not telling the audience what to think, but revealing who they are. Intertwined with the story her music betrays empathy towards the characters and their surroundings, writing from within them, in and around their nature, expressing an unobserved face that is not seen and can only be felt. www.julia-lima.com

 

Dimitra Margaritidou - Sound Designer

Dimitra has been working in films for the last 7 years, having graduated with a Bachelor of Arts in Film from Aristotle University of Thessaloniki and with a master's degree in Sound Design for Film and Television at Bournemouth University, UK. Dimitra will be the sound designer of Dust Light. She believes that the sound dimension truly breathes life into the moving image, transforming and infusing it with all the substance it needs to become an experience to actually live through rather than just watch, something that we also aim to achieve through our film.

 

Gavin Dobson - Poster Image Artist 

Originally from the North East of England, Gavin graduated in Fine Art in 2000 and has been building his profile as an artist specialising in painting and screen printing - often combining the two to communicate his chosen narrative. His recent abstract series ‘Landscapes of the Mind’ uses the fluidity and movement of the paint to convey how an environment can affect one's state of thinking. Gavin is a member of London's Print Club and has exhibited in numerous group shows, as well as a solo artist. His illustrations have featured in many publications, including editorial artwork for Gay Times and book cover designs for Bloomsbury.  www.gavindobson.com

 

Where Is Your Money Going?

Reaching our goal will help us raise the quality bar and deliver you the best film possible. Your contribution will go towards the production of the film: equipment hire, cast and crew fees, travel and accommodation (we’re shooting on location on the beautiful island of Paros in Greece), catering, and post-production, including original score and sound design.

Contribute Your Way

We’ve prepared a fine array of perks at different levels of contribution. However, if you don’t want a perk but still want to join in the project, or if you’d like to contribute with an amount of your choice, please click on the pink BACK IT button underneath our campaign goal and input the amount of your choice (every penny counts). You’ll receive a heartfelt thanks and oodles of gratitude!

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can donate, BUT you can still help support the film by spreading the word. Please share the campaign far and wide and help us reach a wider audience and create momentum. Who knows, you could help bring our project in front of the eyes of our future Executive Producer!

Please use #DustLightFilm when sharing the campaign on social media.

 

Are you in the Film Industry?

Do you connect with our project and want to participate in a more industry-related way? We’re looking for partnerships with Equipment Rentals (Greece), Post-Production Houses (Greece or UK), Marketing and PR and Festival Strategy services.

 

Mental States: The Anthology

Dust Light is part of a bigger project and it’s the first film of the Mental States anthology to go into production. Mental States is an anthology of three short films exploring the beauty and pain of being human. The ideas for the three films were born out of the need to be more creative, bouts of existential crisis, and considering how the modern world affects our mental state. Therefore, their themes are anchored in existentialism, mental health issues and the link between thought and emotion - bringing the inward outward and the outward inward. The two other shorts that complete the anthology, The Lump In Her Throat, a lyrical tale about depression, and  Bugs In Amber,  an existential relationship drama, will be produced later in 2020. Chryssanthi is the writer and director of all three films. 

 

Executive Producer Perk T&Cs

We're absolutely thrilled that you're considering backing us as an Executive Producer by getting the Ultimate Realisation: Executive Producer & Location Stay perk. There aren’t many “visit the location of the film” opportunities like this! Please read carefully these Terms & Conditions before contributing:

You and up to 7 guests will get to spend one week in the film’s house location on Paros island in Greece. A week-long stay means seven nights. This is a self-catered stay for up to 8 people in total. The house offers 3 double rooms (with double bed) and 1 twin room (with two single beds). Flights, boat travel or any other transport are not included. Amenities include air-conditioning, hot water, washing machine, dishwasher, fully equipped kitchen, parking. Linen and towels will be provided for all guests. Due to the location’s availability, this perk can only be redeemed during one the following months: October 2020 or May 2021. Please contact us to book and confirm your chosen dates, as well as the number of guests, before booking any travel!
story_txt:
Overview
Dust Light is a simple but layered story that reflects the complexity of life, inside and out. The film sets out the explore the meaning of life and death, and the existential crisis of adulthood in a lyrical but relatable way. Through the themes of loss, grief and solitude the protagonist embarks on an intimate journey, looking for the pieces of herself that she lost along the way, and carries us away with her in a quietly exhilarating ride. 
We invite you to join us!
 
The Story
Matina is facing pivotal life issues: the end of her marriage, a career that no longer makes her happy, a midlife crisis. She’s also tasked with having to clear out her long-gone mother’s things from the family summer house. After she arrives at the house she begins to unravel, as past and present collide, until she reaches a personal epiphany.

Why This Film
There are moments in life that we all at some point go through, losing a loved one, growing older, being alone again. In this story, I’m interested in exploring the space between closing one life chapter before opening a new one. There are moments of loneliness and reflection that occupy that gap where we have the opportunity to reconnect with our essence. This film is an invitation to take a moment and reflect on moments like these and connect with a story that aims to give you a sense of belonging. 
 
The Cast
Marisha Triantafyllidou - "Matina"                                                        
Marisha Triantafyllidou is a Greek actress with appearances in theatre, cinema and television. She is also a translator, dramaturg, and assistant director in theatre and has collaborated among others with BLITZ, N. Karathanos, N. Labôt, P. Koutras, B. Makridis, A. Papadimitropoulos, S. Tzoumerkas, T. Karanikolas, K. Gavras, F. Tsitos, L. Haritos, P. Dimitrakopoulou, S. Kyriakopoulos.  For her part in the movie "Her Job", by N. Labôt, she was awarded the Best Female Actress Award in the 59th Thessaloniki International Film Festival, and also in the 10th Hellenic Film Academy Awards.
Evangelia Andreandaki - "Mother"    
                                                   
Evangelia Andreadaki was born in Athens. She studied theatre at the State Theater of Northern Greece and at Drama Studio London. In theatre, she has collaborated with: National Theater, Art Theater, New Stage, Spring Theater, Point Theater, directed by D. Mauritius, G. Houvarda, L. Vogiatzi, K. Bakas, A. Voutsina, D. Chronopoulos, N. Mastoraki, Z. Nikoloudis, S. Evangelato and others. She has starred in several short and feature films: The Administrator, 2009, by P. Hoursoglou, Black Field, 2009, by V. Marinakis, Brides, 2004, by P. Voulgaris, Testosterone, 2000, and M Agapas, by G. Panousopoulos, Rodin 'Akrogialia, 1997, by E. Hatzis and many more.
For her performance in P. Hoursoglou's “Eyes From Night” (2003), she was awarded the Best Female Actress Award at Thessaloniki International Film Festival and at Rabat Festival (Morocco). For her performance in short film "Kim and Lucy" by E. Bountri (2007) and Anna Goulis' s "Smile" (1997), she was awarded the Best Female Performance Award at Drama Short Film Festival. She has performed roles in the TV series Karyotakis, Apostolos and Alone, I Have a Secret, Wild Children, The Showcase Cap, 7 Deadly Fathers. In March 2013 she participated in the film "Little England" by Pantelis Voulgaris. The Crew
Chryssanthi Kouri - Director, Writer   
                                                             
Chryssanthi was born and raised in Athens and currently lives and works in London. She studied media production, popular culture and acting and trained in filmmaking by working as a crew member on many productions and by then picking up a camera of her own. So far, she has written, directed and produced 5 short films, as well as many music videos. She also directs theatre, with over 15 plays under her belt, specialising in new writing. Chryssanthi has a passion for character-driven stories that explore human nature and likes to put women and misfits at the centre of her writing. story:
The Basics

Stateless Productions (Stateless) is requesting funding for its second documentary, “America’s Police Crisis.”  As we witnessed the recent protests of the injustices perpetrated by police against American Citizens, we realized this was a subject that needed a deeper exploration than the superficial responses being offered.  This film will explore the short history of the police force in America and how it has progressed to its current state in an effort to find solutions to the abuses that affect many in this country. 

 

I am Chris Cofer, the film’s Director and Producer.  My partners, Peter R. Quinones (host of Free Man Beyond the Wall podcast) and Robert Beeler, as well as an entire support team, have been developing this new documentary since completing our first documentary, “The Monopoly on Violence” in June 2020.  We want to make a film that sparks a national dialogue about what is wrong with the way police operate in this country and how the systematic abuses have become increasingly prevalent.  If we can convey the problem and potential solutions in a meaningful and engaging way, not only will we make more people aware of this problem, we may help prevent further police abuse, as well as the riots and violence that follow those abuses. And we are just the team to explore this difficult issue.  We are dedicated to finding and sharing the truth.

 

What We Need & What You Get

The budget for this documentary is $60,000.  While this may seem high, in the world of film production it is a reasonable cost for a feature length documentary.  As independent filmmakers, we've learned to make every dollar count. We know the importance of investing in the right tools, the right crew members, and the right strategies in order to remain within budget while making successful films. By participating in the production of this film, you will receive the satisfaction of being part of a truly meaningful documentary as well as being able to tell friends you had an integral part in making movies that are seen worldwide. When you review the perks of funding this project, you'll see you will earn even more.

 

The Impact

This film is intended to bring awareness to those who do not understand the concerns of individuals who believe the police force in America has too much power, too little accountability, and does not provide the expected security services to those that pay them.

 

Stateless’ first project, the documentary, “The Monopoly on Violence,” almost doubled its goal in Crowdfund and we continue to receive accolades from donors and audiences stating they loved our work.  The film is currently streaming on Amazon and receiving 5-star ratings.  It has also received high ratings on the Internet Movie Database (IMDb), with some of those ratings more positive than many studio produced films.  We make films about ideas ignored by many and succeed in spreading those ideas to a broader audience.

 

This film deals with a less obscure subject matter than “The Monopoly on Violence,” which is why we believe a larger audience will be able to relate to it.  We've all seen corporate media-produced videos that are sensationalized and lacking nuance. We've seen how Hollywood mythologizes law enforcement in our culture. We intend to tell the full story without pulling punches.

 

Risks & Challenges

Making a film is not without risks. These risks can include falling short of funding goals and being forced to create with less resources, or creating a film that does not connect with audiences in the way we anticipated. To reduce the risk of running over budget, we have taken the lessons learned in producing "The Monopoly on Violence" and retooled our approach to production. A professional Director of Photography has been hired in order to achieve the best shot each time, thereby reducing the need for multiple shots and/or reshoots. Instead of spending money on plane tickets and hotels, we are scheduling interviews within days of each other and traveling by RV to maximize efficiency and stay within budget. We've budgeted additional money for marketing to attract a larger audience.  We have also hired a crew. The last film was a labor of love assembled by people who were just happy to make a film about a subject they were passionate about to share with others. This time, we are using paid professionals.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to be part of making this film happen, but are unable to afford the $50 tier, we have developed additional ways for you to help. You can donate a lesser amount to us on Paypal, as well as send cryptocurrency donations. If financial assistance is not a viable option, your donation of time and effort is just as valuable to us. You can help create awareness of this project by sharing this Crowdfund and our posts on social media. When the film is complete, we ask you to rate and review it on IMDb, Amazon, YouTube and anywhere else we have a presence. Our films are Creative Commons so they can be shared on file sharing networks or uploaded to video hosting sites. Spread the word by hosting a screening of the movie for friends or social organizations to which you belong. We will continue to make films as long as you are here to support us. Thank you from everyone at Stateless Productions!

 

paypal.me/statelessproductions 

BTC - 18ZBDseLuYs8PDpPncKh5DwrsvFHoiEEmA

 

BCH - qpvtrvu0dxuk42la8242vgf93nfn2wwmwcsl5l5pfn

 

ETH - 0xc2306ddb30a4e0227b7ff2be632565d97bf11c96

 

LTC - MWJ7YWC31LpE9JuHgvvCgZdxPG9je9sAXB

story:
A short film by Future Boyfriends.

 

What Is The Meaning Of This?!

If you're wondering what we've been up to, we're making a short film about love and time travel— but we need your help!

 

What's It About?

Somewhere In Between is an action packed sci-fi rom com following Jack and Emily, two will-they-won’t-they friends who are keeping it simple this New Years — until their house is crashed by a man from the future who tells them that the fate of the universe rests in their hands.

 

Who's Responsible For This?

 

JOHN HORAN - Writer/Producer/Actor

John Horan is a comedy writer, producer, and performer, with diverse creative experience
ranging from internet-based shorts and sketches to TV shows like Adam Ruins Everything and a feature produced by Red Hour Films. John writes and performs comedy that has been featured on Vulture, HuffPo, CollegeHumor, Break, Bustle, and more, while as a standup comedian, he has opened for names like Dane Cook, Bill Burr, Amy Schumer, Marc Maron, and more at the Comedy Store.

 

KYLE VORBACH - Writer/Producer/Director

Kyle Vorbach is a comedy writer, director, and content creator, with a portfolio ranging from
writing original series for IMDB to making videos for Nick Jonas. Kyle’s comedy work has been
featured on websites such as Vulture, Huffington Post, Kotaku, and CollegeHumor, while Kyle’s
varied creative skillset has helped him make videos with big brands like Demi Lovato, Logic,
and DNCE. Most recently, Kyle has worked writing and directing comedic music videos and
shorts, as well as creating content for the Jonas Brothers reunion.

 

Together, as FUTURE BOYFRIENDS, we have written multiple pilots, shorts, a feature, and recently, a plot driven sketch comedy show, for which we got a pilot presentation produced. We’re currently in pre production on this short!

 

Where's The Money Going? 

Production is unfortunately very expensive, from gear rentals to location fees. Even with pulling in every favor we possibly can, we're still looking at a budget of at least $10,000. Our goal is to crowdfund at least $5,000 on this Indiegogo, and will self-fund at least $5,000 to cover the rest. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share our campaign with anybody you believe would be interested! Help spread the word however you can! Thank you so much!
story_txt:
A short film by Future Boyfriends.
 
What Is The Meaning Of This?!
If you're wondering what we've been up to, we're making a short film about love and time travel— but we need your help!
 
What's It About?
Somewhere In Between is an action packed sci-fi rom com following Jack and Emily, two will-they-won’t-they friends who are keeping it simple this New Years — until their house is crashed by a man from the future who tells them that the fate of the universe rests in their hands.
 

Who's Responsible For This?

 
JOHN HORAN - Writer/Producer/Actor
John Horan is a comedy writer, producer, and performer, with diverse creative experienceranging from internet-based shorts and sketches to TV shows like Adam Ruins Everything and a feature produced by Red Hour Films. story:
From Dead Mouse Productions Ltd and Cult Screenings UK Ltd, makers of Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II, You're so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night and RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop and Paul Maslansky, producer of all seven Police Academy movies comes this brand-new documentary What an Institution! The Story of Police Academy. A fully independent retrospective into the making of Police Academy and its impact over the last 30 years. Supported by dozens of the original cast and crew including What an Institution! is made by fans of the Police Academy for fans of Police Academy. The crew have already received support from a number of the cast and crew and there is no doubt that by the time of production many more key players will be attached to share their amazing stories about one of the most hilarious, well-loved comedies ever-made. 

The documentary is made as a labour of love by a team of Police Academy fans and this is YOUR unique opportunity to get on board and not only be part of this amazing project BUT make it a reality.

GARY SMART (WRITER/DIRECTOR)

In 2010 Gary co-authored the book The Complete History of the Return of the Living Dead along with Christian Sellers. The following year Gary and Christian were asked by documentary maestro Thommy Hutson to pen the documentary MORE BRAINS! A Return to the Living Dead. In 2013 Gary set up his production companies Cult Screenings UK Ltd and Dead Mouse Productions and commenced work as Producer and Writer of the epic 9-hour documentary Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II. Then in 2015 Gary produced the documentary You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night along with original Fright Night director Tom Holland. In 2016 Gary produced the brand-new documentary RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop. Finally in 2017 Gary along with the Cult Screenings team produced the brand-new documentary Pennywise: The Story of IT slated for a 2018 release. Recently Gary has produced two five retrospective books 245 Trioxin: The Story of The Return of the Living Dead, Beware the Moon: The Story of An American Werewolf in London, You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night, Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II and Lost in the Shadows: The Story of The Lost Boys.

CHRISTOPHER GRIFFITHS (CO-DIRECTOR)

A movie aficionado and skilled editor, Chris made his directorial debut withYou’re So Cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night after associate producing Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II as well as being chief editor on all 9 bonus documentaries. Chris is also a videographer for a large UK company. In 2016 Chris directed the brand-new documentary RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop followed by Pennywise: The Story of IT in 2017.

ADAM EVANS (PRODUCER)

Adam honed his skills as Line Producer on Leviathan: The Story of Hellraiser and Hellbound: Hellraiser II and ensured the smooth and efficient running of the production both in the UK and USA. These skills were mastered further with You’re so cool, Brewster! The Story of Fright Night. Adam is also the co-director of Cult Screenings UK Ltd and Dead Mouse Productions Ltd along with Gary and Chris. In 2016 Adam line-managed the brand-new documentary RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop as well as Pennywise: The Story of IT in 2017.

MICHAEL PEREZ (PRODUCTION MANAGER/PRODUCER)

Michael Perez grew up in the mid-west in the state of Michigan with dreams of working in the entertainment industry. After graduating college at Arizona State University he moved to Los Angeles where his first gig was doing Publicity on the hit shows Veronica Mars and The Girls Next Door. Also, providing backing vocals to artists like: Ashlee Simpson, Patrick Muldoon, Melanie C. and Rob Thomas. While he continues his solo career in music he produces documentaries and "Making of's" on many of cinemas most well-known cult classics. He continues to run his PR Firm, Management Company, Sing and do freelance entertainment work in the industry. Other titles he has under his belt include: MORE BRAINS! A Return to the Living Dead, Never Sleep Again, Inside Story: SCREAM, I Am Nancy and Crystal Lake Memories. In 2016 Mike production managed the brand-new documentary RoboDoc: The Creation of RoboCop followed by Pennywise: The Story of IT in 2017.

We have already amassed an array of confirmed interviewees. Throughout this campaign and production this list will grow and grow...

Rewards and Incentives are key to a campaigns success, check out some samples below and more details on the right-hand-side. Your support is key to making this project a reality so every incentive helps. If you want to ensure that this project is made and is a success then please support today! More amazing perks will be added if we meet our goal and can expand further!

PLEASE NOTE: Blu-rays/DVDs are NTSC region all

Pre-production is already well underway, with a dedicated team of Police Academy aficionados working in securing interviewees, production information, behind the scenes photos, effects, music and much more.  

Full production will commence in late July and early August with shooting taking place in LA and New York. What an Institution! aims to be the most comprehensive look into both the making and impact of Police Academy and YOUR help is needed more than ever. 

Projects like this rely on the fans; this project is a labour of love and a love letter to the countless Police Academy fans around the world. Without your support this project may not be completed.

Pledgees must take into consideration the logistics of producing a 2.5-hour documentary, our aim is release by Summer 2019. However, as we have already undertaken a large scale project like this with Leviathan, Brewster, RoboDoc, Pennywise - We are only too aware of production delays - for all sorts of reasons.

If there are any delays YOU would be informed straight away and kept up-to-date on the projects production.

The biggest reason for production delays is quite simply that the entire crew have day jobs and other projects, however we have factored that into our delivery estimates.

Please note that international deliveries may take longer due to customs and postage regulations.

We have a dedicated team behind this project and are supported by endless members of the cast and crew. 

PLEASE NOTE: This is an 'all or nothing' campaign - it just wont be possible without the minimum funding total required.

story:
Reejekt Productions was born just a few short weeks ago after we finished filming our first short film and we decided we love what we do and thought, why not?  We are small and family run production company.  Kianna Grace, Director & Producer of our first short is usually on the other side of the camera as an actor and has a wealth of experience in film and theatre.  Owen Evans, Grip & Runner of our first short has some extra experience and is very keen to learn.  Me, I was ‘officially’ Executive Producer and basically was Mum to everyone on set.

Everyone has experienced grief at some time of their life, be it a parent, a friend or a treasured pet.  Grief can hit hard and at unexpected times, it eases, but never truly leaves us.   

Halloween is a poignant story that centres around how children within the same family cope with grief very differently, and how coping with their own grief and that of their children weighs heavily on the parent left behind. 

Your contribution will help us to bring this haunting tale of a young girl missing her Mum on one of her favourite days of the year to life.  It would help us pay for locations, crew, equipment… even food for our actors on set.

We are hoping to raise £1,500

We would like to offer donations to the people that have offered us their premises as locations for our shoot, one of which is a small locally based charity.

We would like to pay our crew and offer an honorarium payment to our actors.

We gained a lot of experience from a first film and will need to hire some additional equipment for this one

We would like to at least be able to pay to replace the make-up used by our MUA’s

We also need to feed everyone and provide drinks and snacks

We understand that not everyone is able to make a financial contribution, but any help you can give would be greatly appreciated.  Perhaps you are able to share on your social media?  Perhaps you can spread the word for us in a different way? Help us to promote the film and the campaign? Do you have film experience, maybe you could help us as crew?

Thank you :)

story:
The makers of Positive and A Tiny House Christmas present a new 90-minute feature film!

We’re a small group of independent filmmakers and actors in Tucson, Arizona telling entertaining stories with the resources available to us. We’re incredibly proud of what we’re creating together right here in our own city. After months of preparation and work, we're ready to tackle our most ambitious production yet, but we need your help. 

 

 

Bryn Booth is an actor skilled in dancing, singing, and stage combat. She is a member of the resident acting ensemble of the Rogue Theatre where she has built her resume with powerful and versatile roles.

Fermin Poncecastillo is an actor in Tucson. This is his first full-length feature film. He's enjoying training with Alan and Bryn.  

Austin Buchanan, actor and stuntman, is known for his roles in westerns. Working with Avai, he's had opportunities to show more character work — from an estranged Conspiracy Theorist in The Tiny House Movie to a rude Lemaze Instructor in Positive.

 

Our director, Alan Williams, has been in the Arizona film scene since 1993. He directed the award-winning short “El Patron” and was a producer on the award-winning film Dustwun.

 

Camera operators Charles Hess and Avai d'Amico have been shooting together since 2016, and are excited to showcase how their skills have grown. 

 

 

Our goal of $12,500 will go toward production design expenses such as props, set, wardrobe; post-production expenses to guarantee our movie gets finished and put in front of audiences; and pay for our writers, cast, and crew. Funds raised beyond our goal will continue to pay our team, and increase our marketing budget. 

 

 

We appreciate your help getting our next movie made, so we want to share something extra with you in return — including special credits, a physical copy of the movie on DVD or Bluray, and VIP seating at our first screening!

story:
The Film

Death in a Diner  follows the story of Sarah, a young woman working at her mom’s old diner, and Death, a frequent customer. When Death comes into the diner on the eve of Sarah’s 24th birthday, they both look back and consider where they are in life as they ponder the question: “Would you be happy with your life if you died tonight?”

Meet the Crew!

Hi, my name is Meghan AmRhein and I am the Writer/Director of Death in a Diner.  As a Junior in the Montana State University Film Program, I am excited to be directing my first short film. This script is all about remembering to live life the way you want to and not the way someone else wants you to live it. Especially now, since COVID-19 has disrupted so many aspects of our lives, it’s important to remember not to be scared of living and to remember that life is a fickle, fickle thing.

We have a talented group of juniors leading this project. Our producer is Ashley Moore, our Director of Photography is Sam Pfeiffer, and our Gaffer is Jasper Poore. Along with that, we have a talented group of students who will be helping us bring this project to life.

However, we cannot do that without your help!

How You Can Help

Funding is vital to any film, and as a student film we work on a very small production budget. Thanks to the generosity of the School of Film and Photography Checkout Team, all of our equipment expenses are covered. As a result, our biggest and most important expense is food so that we can provide meals, snacks, and drinks to all of our cast and crew members. Here is an inside look at some of our estimated expenses:

  • Food: $700
  • Costumes/Set Design: $300
  • COVID-19 Supplies: $50
  • Location Costs: $100
  • Miscellaneous Equipment: $100
  • Cast: $100
  • Post-Production: $70
  • Film Festivals: $100
  • Wiggle-Room Expenses (i.e. transportation, production office supplies, campaign fees, and any other unforeseen circumstances): $480 

Be sure to check out our unique perks for donating!

The Impact

Your contributions will help a group of young, student filmmakers gain more experience in the work force as they prepare to enter the film industry.

Risks & Challenges

The biggest risk our production faces is COVID-19. To ensure every member on our set is kept safe, here are some of the precautions we will be taking:

  • A COVID Compliance Officer will be present on set at all times.
  • Temperatures will be checked three times a day.
  • Masks will be worn at all times. Actors will be allowed to un-mask when cameras are rolling, but will re-mask in between takes.
  • Hand sanitizer and sanitation wipes will be available on set to keep our hands and surfaces clean.
  • We will follow CDC guidelines and the standards that are being used in the professional film industry.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't donate to our film, no worries! Spreading the word and sharing our campaign and social media helps us just as much. 

Follow our Instagram: @deathinadinerfilm

Thank you for helping us make this film!

story:
*Make sure you scroll down ALL the way down for our THA UPDATES!*

THE PITCH

A demon hunter, a fortune teller, a creepy intruder, an insane asylum, a coin that grants three wishes, and a “lust” potion... all with a twist!  Does this sound like something you’d watch?

Then help us bring you the stuff that late night thriller anthologies are made of.  We’re talking about The Hunter’s Anthology, an exciting new web series we want to make for you, the fans!  Please join us and help make it happen.

Here’s what it’s all about: Six strangers find themselves trapped in a New York City subway with Mac, a mysterious man who claims to be a demon hunter.  Insisting one of them is a demon, he peeks into their souls to solve the mystery, discovering five eerie, supernatural tales.

Sound cool?  We think so, and we want to share it with you!  The Hunter’s Anthology is for everyone, especially fans of thriller, horror, mystery, and short stories with twisty endings.  It's a mix between the Twilight Zone and Tales from the Crypt: fun, creepy, entertaining, unpredictable short stories you’d watch late with the lights down on a Saturday night!

THE PROLOGUE

The tales in The Hunter's Anthology are very different, each with a twist on a very familiar supernatural theme.  And the running, wraparound mystery of trying to figure out who the demon is will keep you guessing throughout.  We’ve already shot a special prologue that focuses on the mysterious demon hunter himself, Mac, starring David Lee McInnis.   Instead of explaining this ourselves, we thought it would be better if Mac personally introduced himself to you:


THE TEAM

But why should you put your trust in us?  We are filmmakers who have vast experience in the industry.  We have connections to a great, talented cast and crew, many of whom are already on board.  We have a script that is strong.  You won't be disappointed.  Meet our filmmakers:

Robert Smithline (Writer/Director)

Robert Smithline wrote and directed “Escape from the Night” (Short Film Winner at the Telluride Indiefest) and “Get the Hell Out of Heaven.”  He most recently directed the short film version of “Trust Us,” his award winning play, which is now in development to be a full feature.  His experience touches upon almost 15 years of experience in all phases of filmmaking from writing to directing to editing.

Arezu "Nicky" Akmal (Producer)
Producer Arezu "Nicky" Akmal is an award-winning producer who has produced and line produced over 30 films to date, including "August the First" (which traveled to over 25 International Film Festivals, winning several awards, and was nominated for a 2007 IFP Gotham Award.)  Her other notable works include: HBO's "A Shot in the Dark," a documentary about Adrian Grenier's (Entourage) search for his father, and "The Understudy," starring Richard Kind, Assif Mandvi, Kelli Giddish, and Marin Ireland.  She is a member of the Prodcuers Guild of America.

THE WEB SERIES/FEATURE FILM

Ep. 1: The Demon Hunter Part 1 - A mysterious man traps six people on the subway with the knowledge that one of them is a demon.
Ep. 2 & 3: The Fortune Maker - A woman knocks on a fortune teller's door after hours in desperate need of a Tarot reading.
Ep. 4 & 5: Channel 14 - When newlyweds discover that channel 14 broadcasts the surveillance camera outside their new apartment, they can see a creepy creature lurks out there, trying to break inside.
Ep. 6 & 7: A Visit to the Asylum - A young man visiting his grandmother at an asylum gets the shock of his life.
Ep. 8 & 9: You Can't Unwish a Wish - Conjoined twins, bullied at school, come across an ancient coin that grants them three wishes.
Ep. 10 & 11: Lust Potion Number Who Cares - A man falls for his co-worker and learns of an exclusive, secret magic potion shop that might just carry the love potion he needs.
Ep. 12: The Demon Hunter Part 2 - Now with all the information he needs about his captives, Mac must reveal and destroy the demon amongst him.

With the success of anthology shows like American Horror Story and the soon to return Tales from the Darkside, the supernatural anthology series is making a comeback.  This is something people want to see.  We’re fans too, so we're going to do this right and give the anthology series format the treatment it deserves, and we're passionate about sharing it with you!

THE BUDGET

As you probably know, filmmaking isn't cheap.  We have to pay for equipment, sets, crew, locations, cast, and yes, even food for everyone.  It all adds up.  So now we're looking to you to help us raise enough money to at least get us up and running.  Here's a breakdown of our budget:

Our immediate goal is to raise enough money to make three 10 minute episodes, but if we exceed our goal, more episodes can be added until all 12 episodes are funded (a budget of $200,000 or more.)  Also The Hunter's Anthology is written as a full-length feature film, so if we raise enough, that's exactly what it can be.

THE PERKS

We have great perks to choose from: a shout out on social media and exclusive email updates, DVDs of the series with behind the scenes extras, a chance to win a prop from set, be in the credits, visit the  set, or even be IN the movie.  Some of you might just find yourself decked out in special effects makeup, but I’ll stop there.  We don’t want to give it away!

JOIN THE HUNT!

They say it takes a village to raise a child...well for independent film, it takes the world!!!  If you can't donate,  please share with others who can.  You can still contribute by helping us build the momentum we need for a successful campaign.

Social media and email are the keys to this.  Send those email chains about our project.  Like and share us as much as possible on Facebook at www.facebook.com/thehuntersanthology  Ask everyone you know to do the same; help spread the word.  Follow us and retweet us on Twitter @hunteranthology.  Direct people to this site: http://igg.me/at/huntersanthology

Remember, every donation will help us get a step closer to solving the mystery.  Who is the demon?  We can’t wait to show you.  We believe in this so believe in us!  Help The Hunter's Anthology  get made, and JOIN THE HUNT!!!


Updated: Thursday, May 21st at 2:50pm

It's day 3 of our crowdfunding campaign and the THA team wants to thank everyone who has donated thus far!  We plan to provide frequent updates, starting with this: David Lee McInnis tells us about his role as Mac, the hero of The Hunter's Anthology.  Thanks again to everyone and don't forget to tell everyone to JOIN THE HUNT!!!


Updated: Tuesday, May 26th at 2:30pm

We're almost a week in, so thanks everyone for donating!  Our latest update consists of a message from Eric Colton.  He plays Rod, a man searching for a love potion in The Hunter's Anthology story, "Lust Potion Number Who Cares!"


Updated: Monday, June 1st at 12:25pm

Hey, everyone!  We have another video update, this time from Marilyn Oran.  She will be portraying Madame Renee, a fortune teller with a 100% guarantee in the tale, "The Fortune Maker."  Here's what she had to say:


Updated Saturday, June 6th at 5:00pm

We are almost halfway through our campaign with 21 days left!  It's been an exciting last few days as we are suddenly 50% of the way to reaching our goal!  Thanks to everyone who has donated!!!  Here's another video update, this time from Sara and Pricila Lopez, who play Jennifer & Jessica in the tale, "You Can't Unwish a Wish."

Updated Wednesday, June 10th at 1:45pm

Hey All!  Another update here as we pass the halfway mark of our crowdfunding campaign.  Today's video is a reel of "The Hunter's Anthology" star David Lee McInnis' other work.  Pretty cool stuff!!!


Updated Tuesday, June 16th at 12:30pm

It's time for another update!  There's 12 days left to spread the word to others to JOIN THE HUNT!  In the meantime, here's a new video where director Robert Smithline interviews David Lee McInnis about his role as Mac and his experience shooting the prologue:


Updated Thursday, June 18th at 2:00pm

10 days left to Join the Hunt!  It's finally time to meet The Hunter's Anthology producer, Nicky Akmal, in this new video update!

Updated Saturday, June 20th at 7:20pm

Only one week left in our campaign, and there's still no shortage of video updates!  This one is from producer Nicky Akmal and writer/director Robert Smithline:

Updated Tuesday, June 23th at 10:50am

ONLY 5 DAYS LEFT!!!  We're getting close to the end of the campaign and we've already raised over $21,000!

Still, there's more to go, and the more people that Join the Hunt, the more stories we can give you.  For those who haven't, please raise awareness of The Hunter's Anthology by sharing on social media, through email, and the old fashioned way... word-of-mouth!

Here's our latest video update, and it's a good one!  It's a 2 minute behind the scenes video of shooting The Hunter's Anthology: Prologue.  Did I mention it was freeeezing that night... in mid January... in one of the coldest winters ever... in New York City...?


Updated Thursday, June 25th at 12:15pm

It's crunch time!  There's less than 3 days left and we have our final video update (for now) with director Robert Smithline and actor David Lee McInnis.  If you want to see juuuust a little more of what happens after the prologue, don't miss the end!

story:
THE STORY

Synopsis: Five adults attempt to save their beloved summer camp after it is threatened with permanent closure after a series of unfortunate events.  However, they find out the camp might be best left closed.

Actor/writer Rob Mello (Happy Death Day, The Magnificent Seven) has teamed with producer/director/actor Rebecca Rinehart (The Embalmers, CarousHELL the 2nd) on a brand new slasher film that takes fear back to the woods.  Their upcoming camp slasherTin Roof will begin filming in Monticello, Indiana in September of 2021.


Rob and Rebecca location scouting in Monticello, Indiana

Special FX Master Joe Castro (Terror Toons, Exorcism at 60,000 Feet, Blood Feast 2) will bring his skills to the project designing some of the most brutal kill-scenes ever seen on film.


Joe creating a creature for Todd Sheets' Bonehill Road.

Joining the team as the Director of Photography is Laura Duval (The Marked).  Laura received an MBA in Film Production from the University of New Orleans and is now a producer/director at Tiny Pup Productions.

Laura is currently working on John Schneider's latest film, Poker Run.

Of the project, Rinehart says: “After directing The Embalmers, I wanted to make a film in the subgenre that is my true passion: camp slashers. Rob was eager to write the screenplay, incorporating aspects of the movies I love such as Friday the 13th and Sleepaway Camp.  However, our protagonists are complex, relatable middle-aged people as opposed to one-dimensional teen caricatures that are seen in so many modern slashers.”

FUNDRAISING

We are trying a different approach to financing for Tin Roof.  We will be using this IGG to raise money for particular aspects of the budget with perks that cater to interests of the backers.  We are starting by raising the $4500 to rent Camp Buffalo in Monticello, Indiana for the two weeks of filming in September.  The camp will not only be our shooting location, but will also be where all cast and crew will be calling home for the entire shoot.   In this tier of fundraising, we will offer only one perk: a chance to be an Executive Producer and interact with our cast and crew on set for a day AND stay the night at wonderful Camp Buffalo.  NOTE:  this will be the ONLY opportunity for EP credit and is limited to 6 spots.

Camp Buffalo is an operating Boy Scout camp in Northern Indiana.

As we add goals, the perks will be changing, so if this isn't the perk for you, stay tuned!!!  We will have other fundraising goals based around special effects, cast, food, travel, and post-production.

OUR  CAST

Also featuring local Indiana talent Rebekah Erb (Idle Girl), Joshua Scantland (Judas and the Black Mesiah), Michael Taylor (The Embalmers), Makenna Rhode (Vampire Santa), Raymond Kester (Pitfire of Hell), and Joey Jessup (Purgatorio), 

PRESS COVERAGE:
Monticello Herald: https://www.newsbug.info/monticello_herald_jour...
iHorror: https://www.ihorror.com/rob-mello-rebecca-rineh...
PopHorror: https://www.pophorror.com/summer-camp-horror-ti...
Vocal Media: https://vocal.media/horror/rebecca-rinehart
Darkmovies: https://darkmovies.be/lhorreur-au-camp-dete-rev...
Cinema Blend:  https://www.cinemablend.com/news/2560476/what-t...
Horror Fix:  https://www.horror-fix.com/tiiiiiin-roof-bloody...
Tennesee Horror: https://tnhorror.com/tag/tin-roof/
 

Follow us on Facebook or email us at tinroofmovie@gmail.com for information or other investment opportunities.
