story:
Hello and welcome to our crowdfunding page for ‘Halloween Evil Lives’, a Halloween fan movie for the fans, made by fans! This movie is being made in the loving memory of Jarrod L. Washington who passed away earlier this year. He was the co-writer and co-creator of ‘Halloween Evil Lives’ and we are compelled to continue his legacy. Please help us to fulfil his dreams of creating an awesome fan movie!

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The campaign for Halloween Evil Lives has met it's goal successfully and is now indemand , we have some stretch goals to meet ,in order to deliver a top notch feature length fan film, one such stretch goal is 10k. This goal met will help us get more better equipment and more top notch crew members.

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

SYNOPSIS: 'Halloween Evil Lives' is a high concept/high quality 2022 fan film, which follows the return of evil to Haddonfield after a 44 year ban on Halloween is lifted. This subsequently invites the murderous shape Myers, to return after being shot by Loomis off a balcony in '78...

 

HOW MUCH DO WE NEED?

A ‘fan movie’, is a project that no profit can be made from, with the entire cast and crew volunteering their time and equipment for us. Saying this, we still need a base amount in order for our film to be up to the standard that we know and love the Halloween movies to be. The minimum which we need is $8,000. Now that may seem like a lot but in actual fact, to make a fantastic feature length movie, it really isn’t a lot at all. Below is a breakdown of where your money will go.

Equipment hire (Camera/Sound/Lighting/Hard Drives)     = $3,975
Software for the CGI effects                    = $1,000
Perks                                                      = $1,000
Catering for the Cast and Crew   = $400
Costumes and Props        = $250
Location Rental             = $200

Total Costs             = $6,825

BUT, you’re asking for $8,000, I hear you ask!! You’re quite right! We have set aside $1,175 for production insurance and for any potential re-shoots or pick ups which may be required. 

IF in the event we do not need to re-shoot or pick up any shots, this money will go directly to the charity ‘Drug Free America Foundation, Inc’. More information on this below.

https://www.dfaf.org/about-us/

 

HOW CAN YOU HELP US?

We would absolutely LOVE for you to come and join the Halloween Evil Lives family!! Firstly, it has been an incredibly difficult couple of years for us all and we do not expect everyone to be able to contribute in the financial sense. ANY shares would be greatly appreciated and could potentially help us reach 100’s, if not 1000’s more people.
If you are in a position to contribute financially, we have some FANTASTIC perks for you including Online Shout Outs, Movie Credits, DVDs and Blu-Rays, Cast Signed Screengrabs and Producer Credits. We will also keep you updated with a message each month! 

Rest assured, every single Cent will be going into creating the most cinematic Halloween fan movie ever made and we can’t wait to take you on this journey with us!

 

 

RISKS & CHALLENGES THAT WE MAY FACE.

The main challenge that we will face is organisation. It must be absolutely spot on with a production like this that has a large number of cast and crew. Especially with room reservations, travel arrangements, call times and ensuring that everything is in place way in advance, so we don't get any nasty surprises when it comes to the shoot.

 

Location: Halloween Evil Lives will be filmed in Green Bay, Wisconsin. The production will start in September of 2021  till November 2021. Then production will continue from May and June of 2022.

 

Director:  Michael Tegagnon 

 

 

Featuring: Laura Ellen Wilson from Friday the 13th Vegeance 

Ken Slate producer of  Friday the 13th  Vegeance , starring in 13 Fan Boy, Fall of Camp Blood and Roseblood

 

Robert Bess from Affairs of State

Danielle Fraser from  Radio Silence

Tiffany Saggio from  War Inside

Sandra Flagstad  from Catching Faith 2

 

Christopher Avant from Journey 

 

Official  Movie IMDB below

https://www.imdb.com/title/tt15047754/

Official Facebook  group

https://m.facebook.com/groups/315172079368860

Official YouTube channel 

https://youtube.com/channel/UCftAtPuol-bu3-DTEf...

Official Podcast

https://anchor.fm/halloween-evil-lives-youtube-...

 

 

 

As mentioned above, any additional funds will be going directly to the charity ‘Drug Free America Foundation, Inc’. Jarrod L. Washington was a victim of drug abuse and we want to help prevent any other individual, their family and their friends from ever going through this.

https://www.dfaf.org/about-us/

Thank you so much for checking out our Indiegogo Campaign for ‘Halloween Evil Lives’, a Halloween Fan Film, In memory of Jarrod L. Washington - May we make the best fan movie that you ever imagined.

Saying this, we still need a base amount in order for our film to be up to the standard that we know and love the Halloween movies to be. The minimum which we need is $8,000. Now that may seem like a lot but in actual fact, to make a fantastic feature length movie, it really isn’t a lot at all. Below is a breakdown of where your money will go.Equipment hire (Camera/Sound/Lighting/Hard Drives)     = $3,975Software for the CGI effects                    = $1,000Perks                                                      = $1,000Catering for the Cast and Crew   = $400Costumes and Props        = $250Location Rental             = $200Total Costs             = $6,825BUT, you’re asking for $8,000, I hear you ask!! You’re quite right! We have set aside $1,175 for production insurance and for any potential re-shoots or pick ups which may be required. IF in the event we do not need to re-shoot or pick up any shots, this money will go directly to the charity ‘Drug Free America Foundation, Inc’. More information on this below.https://www.dfaf.org/about-us/ HOW CAN YOU HELP US?We would absolutely LOVE for you to come and join the Halloween Evil Lives family!! Firstly, it has been an incredibly difficult couple of years for us all and we do not expect everyone to be able to contribute in the financial sense. ANY shares would be greatly appreciated and could potentially help us reach 100’s, if not 1000’s more people.If you are in a position to contribute financially, we have some FANTASTIC perks for you including Online Shout Outs, Movie Credits, DVDs and Blu-Rays, Cast Signed Screengrabs and Producer Credits. We will also keep you updated with a message each month! Rest assured, every single Cent will be going into creating the most cinematic Halloween fan movie ever made and we can’t wait to take you on this journey with us!  RISKS & CHALLENGES THAT WE MAY FACE.The main challenge that we will face is organisation. It must be absolutely spot on with a production like this that has a large number of cast and crew. Especially with room reservations, travel arrangements, call times and ensuring that everything is in place way in advance, so we don't get any nasty surprises when it comes to the shoot. Location: Halloween Evil Lives will be filmed in Green Bay, Wisconsin. The production will start in September of 2021  till November 2021. Then production will continue from May and June of 2022. Director:  Michael Tegagnon   Featuring: Laura Ellen Wilson from Friday the 13th Vegeance Ken Slate producer of  Friday the 13th  Vegeance , starring in 13 Fan Boy, Fall of Camp Blood and Roseblood Robert Bess from Affairs of StateDanielle Fraser from  Radio SilenceTiffany Saggio from  War InsideSandra Flagstad  from Catching Faith 2 Christopher Avant from Journey  Official  Movie IMDB belowhttps://www.imdb.com/title/tt15047754/Official Facebook  grouphttps://m.facebook.com/groups/315172079368860Official YouTube channel https://youtube.com/channel/UCftAtPuol-bu3-DTEf...Official Podcasthttps://anchor.fm/halloween-evil-lives-youtube-...   As mentioned above, any additional funds will be going directly to the charity ‘Drug Free America Foundation, Inc’. Jarrod L. Washington was a victim of drug abuse and we want to help prevent any other individual, their family and their friends from ever going through this.https://www.dfaf.org/about-us/Thank you so much for checking out our Indiegogo Campaign for ‘Halloween Evil Lives’, a Halloween Fan Film, In memory of Jarrod L. Washington - May we make the best fan movie that you ever imagined.

story:
Update: 9/16/21

Thank you for your support! Our campaign remains open "in demand" for funds to help us with post-production.  We appreciate you being on this journey with us. We love you x three!

Update: 8/10/21 - EXCITING NEWS! Birds, Bees, and Threes has hit it's initial goal for pre-production and production in just 2 weeks!! Our entire team is blown away by the support we've received. Any additional funds received during this campaign will go towards post-production costs. (Editing, coloring, festival submission, etc). Thank you for helping us get across the post-production finish line too! 

Story

Artist Statement from Paige Hullett:

Hi there! My name is Paige Hullett, an LA based actress and writer. BIRDS, BEES AND THREES is a short film based on a true story from my childhood growing up as a triplet in the conservative midwest. In the summer of 2019, my writing partner, Gunnar, and I road tripped from Atlanta to Los Angeles. During our time in the car, we were inspired to write this short as our first project together.

BIRDS, BEES, AND THREES is a personal project. It centers around a key moment from my childhood, is filled with humorous and painfully awkward moments, and most importantly, it highlights the need for proper sex education & the different reactions children can have when they find out about sex.

Logline: After a member of Julia's triplet support group is unexpectedly forced to explain sex to her kids, the trusted group leader expresses the importance of teaching children about sex by age eight. BIRDS, BEES, AND THREES comically follows JULIA and ANDY HUDSON and their triplet daughters as they have vastly different reactions to the news and attempt to digest their embarrassment, shock and confusion.

​Thank you for helping us bring our story to life! 

TONE

The tone of the short is funny and unapologetically real. The visual style will be bright and colorful, reflecting the conservative ideals of the classic Midwest family, and the concept of The American Dream (ie: white picket fence, the whole shabang). The triplet support group will feel like we are at an AA meeting.

The cinematography will be fast paced, but allow the audience time to linger and feel the cringey moments, making them feel like they are part of the conversation.

What We Need & What You Get

Our goal is to raise $13,500, which will cover pre-production and production costs. We will have a separate campaign that focuses on post-production, and distribution. If we raise over our goal, funds will go towards post. Our hope is to have this film screen at various festivals, but more importantly, educate new parents with screenings at local schools, hospitals and theaters. If we do not raise all of our funds during this campaign, we will push back our shoot date until we do. We are confident we are going to make this short film come to life. 

The following is a breakdown of our budget. When making an independent production, every bit helps! We would be grateful if you would consider donating to our project, and to show our appreciation, we have an array of perks that you can choose from! Every tier of perks will also include the tier before it. 

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate the minimum perk amount? No matter! You can donate as little as $1. If that's even hard to come by, there's still hope! You can follow us on IG @birdsbeesandthreesfilm, and share this page on your social media sites. Tweet it, Share it, Talk about it!

THE CREW

PAIGE HULLETT (Co-Writer, Co-Director, Producer)

Paige Hullett is an actress, writer and triplet who was born and raised in Indianapolis, Indiana currently living in Los Angeles. Her network recurring and guest star credits include (among others) STAR, Jenna Ban’s GOOD GIRLS, and Tyler Perry’s IF LOVING YOU IS WRONG. Paige also has credits in feature films including the role of ‘Fiona’ in Karen Maine's YES, GOD, YES (SXSW 2019) and a starring role in Blackhall Studio’s, BURNT OFFERING. Paige is currently developing a series for television based on her coming of age memoirs of life as a triplet growing up in the heartland of America titled, BABY A. Paige is a graduate of Elon University and is repped by Stagecoach, CESD & Privilege Talent Southeast.

Sample Work: Acting Reel https://vimeo.com/463545462

MARGAUX SUSI (Co-Director, Producer)

Margaux Susi is a Cuban-Jewish actor & director based in Los Angeles. 

Currently, you can hear Margaux in the English dubs of MONEY HEIST, THE BARRIER, MARIANNE, and AD VITAM all on NETFLIX. You will also see her in the final season of DEAR WHITE PEOPLE on Netflix in late 2021. 

As Associate Artistic Director of the Ovation award-winning IAMA Theatre Company, Margaux has spent over a decade helping shape countless new plays.

Most recently, Margaux directed Sheila Carrasco’s solo show Anyone But Me for IAMA Theatre Company’s virtual season which the LA Times raved was a great success with “stellar direction”. She also Associate Directed Daniel Pearle’s A KID LIKE JAKE with IAMA Theatre Company as a guest production at The Pasadena Playhouse. Margaux’s other recent directing credits include a reading of Madeline Hendrick’s TREMOR and Kait Kerrigan’s FATHER/DAUGHTER. Margaux also directed Stephen Adly Guirgis' IN ARABIA WE'D ALL BE KINGS & Aaron Sorkin’s THE FARNSWORTH INVENTION’ at the Art of Acting Studio.

Margaux holds a BFA in Drama from NYU's Tisch School of the Arts. 

Sample Work: MargauxSusi.com

GUNNAR ANDERSON (Co-Writer, Producer)

Gunnar Anderson is an actor and writer living in Los Angeles California. He received his BA in English focused on screenwriting from the University of North Carolina at Greensboro. Gunnar has written several short stories and screenplays, and two pilots that are gaining momentum; one is a hour long horror comedy, and the other is a half hour coming of age dramedy. Gunnar has also appeared in many titles, including FX’s The Gifted, Freeform’s Cloak and Dagger, and most recently in Netflix’s number one holiday film, A California Christmas. 

Sample Work: https://vimeo.com/527508301

EMILY REAS (Producer, Line Producer)

Originally from Plano, Texas, Emily is passionate about telling stories that pushes more racial, gender, and LGBTQ+ diversity. She has worked with creatives including John Beck (Liv and Maddie, Side Hustle, DisJointed), John D’Aquino (Corey in the House, SeaQuest, Dexter), Jack C. Tomas (The Fairly Odd Parents, The Regular Show, Dreamworks Dragons), Lisa Lew (Daytime Emmy Awards, Judge Judy), and many more. Previously, she worked with the socio-political theater company "The Actors' Gang". With the theater also being a non-profit, Emily worked in the Education Department teaching theater in Promise Neighborhood schools.

Emily is a member of Women in Film LA, and has been a part of their Peer Mentoring Group. Currently, she works as a Production and Operations Coordinator at John D’Aquino’s Young Actor’s Workshop and co-founded the production company Blind Salamander Films. She’s an avid videogamer, ukulele player, and coffee addict. Emily holds a BFA in Acting from Texas State University.

Sample Work: http://www.emilyreas.com/platy-productions

MEGHAN APOSTOLES (Casting)

Meghan Apostoles has worked in casting for seven years. Her credits include the upcoming Paramount + series Star Trek: Strange New Worlds as well as Snowpiercer (TNT), Loving, Yes, God, Yes, House of Cards, and TURN: Washington's Spies. Her work on Focus Features' 2019 film Harriet earned her an Artios Award nomination. 

Sample Work: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=GqoEs4cG6Uw

story:
Hi!

My name is Esteban Bailey and I am obsessed with movies, but more specifically horror movies.  I would often gravitate to those made outside of the United States, in places like Brazil, Japan, and Spain. But that always made me wonder: why aren't there many horror films made about the place I’m from, Puerto Rico? 

Despite being a US territory, only a small number of Americans on the continent have had the pleasant experience of enjoying the magnificent cinema that is produced in Puerto Rico. The world deserves to be exposed to the unique narrative that our island's cinematic history has produced over the last century.

We want to help change that.

My horror short, The Strange Monster at the Rivera House is an alternative horror film set in Puerto Rico, starring Puerto Ricans with a majority Puerto Rican crew.

The film will be a part of a new generation of storytellers emerging from the island of Puerto Rico, telling new stories in wild and imaginative ways that capture global attention. 

Our Puerto Rican New Wave.

We would be tremendously grateful for your support. If you would like to speak with me about our film or our mission to tell Puerto Rican stories, please don’t hesitate to contact me.

I hope to see all of you soon at the Rivera House…

Puerto Rican Crew

We intend to hire mostly Puerto Ricans in our cast and crew. Puerto Rican workers in the industry contribute greatly to this type of project on the island. We believe that with this movie, we can make a real mark on the global cinematic landscape and shine a light on the extreme talent that is located in our community.  

Quick Turnaround:

As the subject of the film makes clear; Hurricanes are a true and unavoidable reality for life in Puerto Rico.  Our timeline is quick in order to get The Strange Monster shot and into the editing suite before Hurricane season begins in earnest in August.  Everything becomes far more complicated once the storms starts rolling in so we are working hard to beat the clock.

Shooting on Film:

We are choosing to shoot on 16mm film stock because we are trying to contribute to the film history of our island.

Shooting during COVID-19:

Of course, there is also a global pandemic to worry about!  Luckily, our highly experienced production team knows how to keep crews safe on set.  It is our full intention to keep the crew as small as possible, with each member providing constant and detailed health updates before, during and after production.  We will have a Covid Safety Officer on set, constantly cleaning and ensuring the health of our people.  No detail will be overlooked as we build a safe and creative environment for our team.

¡Saludos!

Mi nombre es Esteban Bailey y vivo obsesionado con las películas de terror. A menudo he gravitado hacia las que se producen fuera de los Estados Unidos, en lugares como Brasil, Japón y España. Pero siempre me he preguntado: ¿por qué no se realizan películas de terror sobre el lugar de donde vengo, Puerto Rico?

A pesar de ser un territorio estadounidense, solo una pequeña cantidad de americanos del continente ha tenido la grata experiencia de disfrutar del magnífico cine que se produce en Puerto Rico. El mundo se merece estar expuesto a la narrativa única que la historia cinematográfica de nuestra isla ha producido durante el último siglo.

Queremos ayudar a cambiar el curso

Mi corto de terror, El monstruo extraño en la casa de los Rivera, es una película de terror alternativa ambientada en Puerto Rico, protagonizada por puertorriqueños con un equipo mayoritariamente puertorriqueño.

La película será parte de una nueva generación de narradores que emergen de la isla de Puerto Rico, a contar nuevas historias de figuras salvajes e imaginativas que captan la atención mundial.

Nuestra Nueva Ola puertorriqueña

Estaremos inmensamente agradecidos por su apoyo. Si desea hablar conmigo sobre nuestra película o nuestra misión de contar historias puertorriqueñas, por favor no dude en ponerse en contacto conmigo.

Espero verlos pronto en la Casa Rivera…

Premisa

La desafortunada Aida y su precoz hija Aidita están luchando por sobrevivir los estragos de un devastador huracán que ha devastado la isla de Puerto Rico, cuando, de repente, encuentran una extraña criatura viviendo en su patio. La extraña criatura tiene el poder de mostrar a la gente a sus seres queridos muertos. Con todo su pueblo atónito ante el poder de la criatura, el dúo decide cobrar un precio por la experiencia, con el fin de lograr reparar su casa destruida por el huracán. Pero a medida que las ganancias crecen, las tensiones aumentan y tal vez esta criatura no es el milagro que Aida y Aidita estaban buscando.

Nuestro equipo de trabajo

Tenemos la intención de usar un elenco y equipo mayormente puertorriqueños. Deseamos exponer el talento extraordinario que existe en Puerto Rico y contar con profesionales de la industria en la isla. Los trabajadores puertorriqueños de la industria aportan grandemente a este tipo de proyecto en la isla. Creemos que con esta película podemos dejar una huella en el panorama cinematográfico global y resaltar el enorme talento con el que contamos en nuestra comunidad.

Producción inmediata:

Como el tema de la película expone, los huracanes son una verdadera e inevitable realidad en Puerto Rico. Nuestra línea de tiempo es rápida con el fin de rodar The Strange Monster y editar antes de que la temporada de Huracanes comience en agosto. Todo se complica una vez comienzan a llegar las tormentas, por lo tanto, estamos trabajando en contra del reloj.

Rodaje 16mm:

Hemos decidido filmar en material cinematográfico de 16 mm porque deseamos aportar a la historia del cine de nuestra isla.

Rodaje durante COVID-19:

Para completar, ¡también hay una pandemia global por la cual tenemos que preocuparnos! Afortunadamente, nuestro experimentado equipo de producción sabe cómo mantener la seguridad en el set. Nuestra intención es tener un equipo lo más pequeño posible. Cada miembro brindará información detallada acerca de su estado de salud de manera constante, antes, durante y después de la producción. Tendremos un oficial de seguridad de Covid19 en el set, desinfectando las áreas comunes para garantizar la salud de nuestro personal. Nuestra meta es desarrollar un entorno seguro para nuestro equipo.

Creemos que con esta película podemos dejar una huella en el panorama cinematográfico global y resaltar el enorme talento con el que contamos en nuestra comunidad.Producción inmediata:Como el tema de la película expone, los huracanes son una verdadera e inevitable realidad en Puerto Rico. Nuestra línea de tiempo es rápida con el fin de rodar The Strange Monster y editar antes de que la temporada de Huracanes comience en agosto. Todo se complica una vez comienzan a llegar las tormentas, por lo tanto, estamos trabajando en contra del reloj.Rodaje 16mm:Hemos decidido filmar en material cinematográfico de 16 mm porque deseamos aportar a la historia del cine de nuestra isla.Rodaje durante COVID-19:Para completar, ¡también hay una pandemia global por la cual tenemos que preocuparnos! Afortunadamente, nuestro experimentado equipo de producción sabe cómo mantener la seguridad en el set. Nuestra intención es tener un equipo lo más pequeño posible. Cada miembro brindará información detallada acerca de su estado de salud de manera constante, antes, durante y después de la producción. Tendremos un oficial de seguridad de Covid19 en el set, desinfectando las áreas comunes para garantizar la salud de nuestro personal. Nuestra meta es desarrollar un entorno seguro para nuestro equipo.

story:
THE REAL LIFE STORY OF A VICTIM OF BULLYING...WITH SOME TWISTS

  FILMMAKER WILLIAM LEE'S LATEST ACTION FILM HAS A REAL LIFE ORIGIN...

 

Billy Blackwolf (William Lee) is a government agent haunted by the trauma of physical abuse during his school years. When he is assigned to take down a group of international criminals, his assignment becomes vengeance when he discovers his targets are all of his high school bullies. Karma isn't a bitch, it's a wolf.

  • William Lee, an independent film director for three decades,  has known how difficult it is to make a film with little financial backing and huge amounts of unwelcome advice. His passion for what he does has kept him moving forward in the face of staggering challenges.

    After seeing Kung Fu legend, and martial arts movie legend Bruce Lee on screen for the first time in 1974, Lee asked his father to purchase a movie camera so that he might replicate the famous martial artists' exploits--albeit on a smaller scale. Within a year of picking up a movie camera, Lee received his first film award at the Eye Music Festival of San Francisco. Since then, he has directed over 30 film projects.

    Until his first major release Code: Black, in 2007, Lee had been virtually unknown. His films languished in obscure film fests, Midwestern film premieres, and on-line sites like Indieflix.com.
  • Never quirky enough to interest Sundance, too action-filled to be praised in major "refined" film circles, never peopled by major or even sub-major stars, financed totally from Lee's various day jobs, he has spent every year since 1974 chasing that dream. The dream that one day he could be seen for what he is. Not a black filmmaker, but a filmmaker who makes non-stereotypical, well-written action films with a message. Nothing more, nothing less.
  • William has had three films sold to Redbox in the last three years. His film SIX FEET BELOW HELL has been at Redbox for 3 years.
  • In 2020, more than ten of his films will be released on DVD through Bayview entertainment.

 

  • Later this year, his horror film THE GOOCHER will be released on DVD AND ITUNES.
  •  

  • BLACK WOLF already has TWO DISTRIBUTION OFFERS IN PLACE

  • Some notes from William Lee about BLACK WOLF: "My experience with bullying came at a time when there was no social media. Thus, the bullying  I received was experienced upfront and personal. I was abused, harassed, sexually intimidated, Bullies even purposely injured me on the sports field, just to get at me. My bullies were people who wanted to physically and mentally demean me. My salvation was self-determination, and discovery of the martial arts, Asian philosophy,  and Bruce Lee."
  • "I have never made a film this personal. While it goes off into fictional events, the core of the story is my real life. Hateful incidents I experienced, at the hands of people I thought would support me. Being told I WAS NOT BLACK ENOUGH, and being cast off as some kind of traitor to the black race is an experience that has left an indelible mark on my life. There were times I felt alone in this world, yet I somehow overcame the hate I was being given and made it out of that hell."
  • "In a perfect world, things like this-extreme bullying- should not happen. The real world is far from perfect. Today's generation is experiencing bullying on a  different platform. Online bullying is a world of threats and bold stances by people who are for the most part, cowards. It's mind games. Now imagine that instead of some anonymous bastard posting stupid things about you online, you're now face to face with your tormentors beating your ass, every day, all day.  Degrading your humanity, poisoning the minds of your friends and acquaintances, basically making you a leper, a pariah. Someone less than human. I WENT THROUGH THAT.  And you know what? You can't delete a thug punching you in the face. You have to fight back. Or lose."

What We Need & What You Get

  • $3000 will cover the support my cast and crew need to make the film. Food, help with some travel expenses, props, and makeup. It will not cover everything, but that is to be expected. I never expect too much money to come from crowdfunding because times are hard and people don't have lots of cash sitting around for artistic endeavors.  On past films, we've had support from Redbox or investors. This is not the case. Whatever you don't give, I'll cover. And I'll gladly do it to make this film.

The Impact

  • The issue of bullying within the black community is not often addressed. It is seen as washing "dirty laundry" in public. Unfortunately, many black kids are being told they are not hard enough, not ghetto enough. As one who has experienced this, I'd like to tell my story and how I overcame these threats. And my vision of a perfect world solution to violence from bullies. 
  • We've run many campaigns on Indiegogo. Never reached our goal. We have completed all but one film, each going on to distribution worldwide. We like to finish what we start.  
  • Our film SIX FEET BELOW HELL was an Indiegogo campaign. It is now approaching three years as a REDBOX action/ horror selection. Few films remain at the box that long...just sayin'......

  • We like to finish what we start.  

Risks & Challenges

Only one of our previous projects didn't get produced, due to my illness and lack of additional funds. All contributors on that project were offered refunds or free perks from this or any other campaign I have done.

If for some reason this project is not produced (which is highly unlikely) all contributors will get their perks, and in the case of DVDs, we will send you a choice of any of our previous films. please check our website for a list of our voluminous film projects... 

www.cinemalexzikon.com

Or check us out on IMDB......

https://www.imdb.com/name/nm2914215/?ref_=tt_rv_t7

 

YOU CAN ALSO REQUEST A REFUND!

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Spread the word if you can't contribute. PLEASE directly link this page in all your posts!

  • VISIT OUR FACEBOOK PAGE!!!!!         https://www.facebook.com/blackwolfmoviepage/

story:
THE UNSEEN 

A supernatural horror movie in the vein of Hereditary, The Conjuring, and The Invisible Man (2020). 

The Unseen is a supernatural horror movie about a young lawyer who finds himself in a twisted web of murder and deceit brought on by a dark force from his past - an unstoppable supernatural force hell-bent on achieving its horrific goal.

Stretch Goal #2 ACTIVATED!!!!!

Thank you Backers, Producers, Fans and Filmmakers, we are now INDEMAND!!!!

 

 

Stretch Goal #1 CRUSHED!! BIG Thank you to an anonymous backer who brought us to our stretch goal of $30,000!

Hello to all our potential Production Partners! We have a tax-deductible opportunity for you!

I am Jennifer Karum, a writer, director, producer and the creator of The Unseen. We are extremely excited to announce that The Unseen has gotten the attention of talented A-list cast and crew, including

Enrico Colantoni (Westworld, Veronica Mars, GalaxyQuest, Just Shoot Me)

 

and director Jeff Hare (Killer Under the Bed, Ben 10), and we need your help to bring this vision to life!

RJ Mitte and his team love the concept and the Lakefront team is in discussions regarding attaching RJ to the project as Tommy. The Lakefront Team is THRILLED!

UPDATE:

Welcome RJ Mitte!

A HUGE blessing to the Curse, with RJ Mitte from Breaking Bad has joined the cast, as TOMMY, our main character !!

Welcome to #THEUNSEENMOVIE

#ablessing2theunseen

On the surface, The Unseen is a unique take on the supernatural horror genre. But deeper than that, it is a film about guilt, the pressures of family, the pressure to succeed, the fear of failure, and the repercussions of past violence and its ability to haunt the present. We truly believe that this will speak to a broad audience beyond those who are your typical horror movie audience. 

These themes are important to me as a writer and filmmaker on the autism spectrum. Throughout my life I’ve struggled to defy the diagnosis I received from a doctor at 18 months - that I’ll “never live a normal life.” I’ve been told repeatedly that I can’t do this, I won’t be able to do that, and I’m not good enough. Only after fighting and pushing past others’ expectations of me was I able to realize that we can break free of the restraints others put on our lives. I believe that this is something that many people can relate to, and this forms the core of The Unseen. 

Well, this and an absolutely terrifying supernatural force.

While The Unseen has received backing and letters of intent from some major, recognizable filmmakers and talent (see Cast List below), your contributions will help fill out the budget to make this movie all that it can be, and can put your stamp, your footprint, on a piece of cinematic art that will be seen by audiences worldwide. 

We can do this all with your help. Our production team has extraordinary success in the filmmaking business and can bring an incredible level of professional production value to this project, with your help. A recent example of our work is our television show Conrad, co-starring Harry Lennix (Justice League, Man of Steel, The Matrix Reloaded, The Blacklist)

&

Eric Roberts (The Dark Knight, The Expendables, Grey’s Anatomy), which myself and fellow Executive Producer Ryan Atkins wrote, created, produced, and filmed which is currently in negotiations for distribution.  

WHAT WE NEED AND WHAT YOU WILL GET

We are looking to raise $650,000 to help bring this film to life. The funds raised here will help secure filming locations throughout Chicagoland, pay for celebrity actors and production crew, secure the best quality film equipment needed, including cinema grade cameras, lights, and sound equipment, and for use in high quality, realistic practical and special effects to make the horror of The Unseen real for audiences. 

In exchange for your contributions, we are offering some exciting, unique perks which we hope will show you that you are part of The Unseen Production Crew - original signed scripts and posters, prop and wardrobe memorabilia actually used on screen, a spot as a background character on screen, and even a day on set to see the filmmaking process in action. 

Your contributions mean a lot to us, and we want our perks to reflect that.

  • "Am I being followed?" level - $25 - Social Media Shout Out from The Unseen - brag about your involvement in the future of horror
  • "I'm getting goosebumps" level - $50 - The Unseen Pen
  • "Voices in my head" level - $100 - “Special Thank You” credit on The Unseen IMDB page - get credit on the go-to site for filmmakers
  • "Look out! Behind you!" level - $250 - Digital Poster of The Unseen and autographed picture from Celebrity Influencer, Ava Bianchi
  • "Warn Everyone!" level - $500 - Shout Out on Social Media Influencer, Ava Biachi’s Instagram and autographed picture from Celebrity Influencer, Ava Bianchi
  • "Do NOT read the Cursed words" level - $1,000 - Script signed by the Producers, 1 ticket to the Celebrity Red Carpet Screener of The Unseen, and 1 free hour film production consultation from Jennifer Karum
  • "It's all your fault" level - $2,500 - Assistant Producer credit
  • "The nightmare comes home" level - $5,000 - Digital Copy of The Unseen, a prop used in the film, a character named after the donor, and 2 tickets to the Celebrity Red Carpet Screener of The Unseen
  • "Nightmare on Michigan Ave" level - $10,000 and up - Join the cast and crew on set for 1 day of filming of The Unseen

THE LAKEFRONT TEAM HAS A SHORT HORROR/THRILLER, THE NEST, THAT HAS RECEIVED AWARDS AND RECOGNITIONS AT MANY FILM FESTIVALS, AND HAS BEEN MOST  RECENTLY RECOGNIZED BY NBC CHICAGO FIRE IN WHICH CHICAGO FIRE LICENSED OUR FOOTAGE FOR THEIR SHOW.

AND AN ADDITIONAL BONUS TO YOU - The Unseen has recently obtained fiscal sponsorship status from FROM THE HEART PRODUCTIONS, a 501(c)(3) non-profit organization helping indie filmmakers bring their art to life. Due to its non-profit status, any donations made to The Unseen through From The Heart Productions (link here) can be considered tax-deductible charitable contributions. If you want to make a tax-deductible donation, please make charitable donations payable to: From The Heart Productions, and include “The Unseen” in the memo line. Donations can be sent to:

From The Heart Productions - 1013 Harbor Ave #53, Oxnard, CA 93035 

If we are unable to raise our goal, all donations will still go to the production of the film, albeit at a smaller budget. With our skills, we believe we can still bring a high level of terror and production value, although with your help, we believe we can reach this goal.

RISKS AND CHALLENGES

We wouldn’t be honest if we didn’t say there are risks in filmmaking and in investing in a film. Filmmaking is a complicated and difficult process, with obstacles both seen and unseen that can arise at any time, and often films get started but never finish.

However, myself and our team not only have a proven track record of success in completing complex, professional film projects, we also share the same drive to overcome those who say “No you can’t.” I am driven to finish this project and share it with the world, and I am asking you to help.

And, more importantly, it is well known in the film industry that the horror genre is the most lucrative sought after genre - with our team and your help, we can almost guarantee that this project will be incredibly successful and become well known. So this is a chance to get in on what we know will amount to an incredibly successful and popular film.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

Can’t contribute but still want to help bring this film to life? You can still help by:

  • Spreading the word about The Unseen and this campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools and share this on social media.
  • Follow all our pages on social media TheCurseMovie on Instagram and Twitter, The Curse Feature Film on facebook, our production company Lakefront Pictures, and more.

 

This has and will help a great deal.

 

Thank you for your time and support! 

Stretch Goals will be activated when we reach 100% funded!!!!!!

 

 

Jennifer Karum, Creator/Writer/Producer, The Unseen

Ryan Atkins, Producer/Director of Photography, The Unseen

**If you at interested in investing as an Executive Producer or Associate Producer, please send us an email to: thecurse@lakefrontpictures.com**

story:
With the increase in popularity of horror media over the years, we find ourselves reaching for more fantastical, more sensational scares. Not only surface level shocks, but moments that will haunt us, stick with us for years to come. It is in that spirit that Pensive Pictures and Faculty Meeting Films present the terrifying new horror short film: HAHTINU. 

 

Blending Science Fiction elements with an unforgiving frontier setting, HAHTINU tells the tale of a small posse transporting a prisoner through dangerous territory in 19th century East Texas. Their journey takes a horrific turn, and only with the help of a courageous Caddo warrior can they hope to survive the night. 

 

Fresh off of a successful international film festival run with their short drama film JACKALBY, filmmakers Travis Patten and Cameron Hazelwood invite you to participate in helping bring this chilling vision to the screen. Utilizing production techniques that focus on efficiency, quality, and refinement, they’ve assembled a talented crew of filmmakers to help achieve this task. Now all they need is your contribution. With each donation comes special perks, including signed memorabilia, a storyboard and BTS artbook, and more! Recognition will also be made when the film reaches the film festival circuit.

 

SCRIPT, BUDGET, AND STORYBOARDS:

https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1e2I3zVE...

With the increase in popularity of horror media over the years, we find ourselves reaching for more fantastical, more sensational scares. Not only surface level shocks, but moments that will haunt us, stick with us for years to come. It is in that spirit that Pensive Pictures and Faculty Meeting Films present the terrifying new horror short film: HAHTINU. 
 
Blending Science Fiction elements with an unforgiving frontier setting, HAHTINU tells the tale of a small posse transporting a prisoner through dangerous territory in 19th century East Texas. Their journey takes a horrific turn, and only with the help of a courageous Caddo warrior can they hope to survive the night. 
 
Fresh off of a successful international film festival run with their short drama film JACKALBY, filmmakers Travis Patten and Cameron Hazelwood invite you to participate in helping bring this chilling vision to the screen. Utilizing production techniques that focus on efficiency, quality, and refinement, they’ve assembled a talented crew of filmmakers to help achieve this task. Now all they need is your contribution. With each donation comes special perks, including signed memorabilia, a storyboard and BTS artbook, and more! Recognition will also be made when the film reaches the film festival circuit.
 
SCRIPT, BUDGET, AND STORYBOARDS:
https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1e2I3zVE...

story:
PRESS KIT

 

 

Director Jivan Avetisyan meets the cast in Armenia to work with them on their characters. The script is ready, but we continue working on character development, dialogues and costumes. 


Actresses Tatiana Spivakova and Naira Zakaryan came to Armenia specially for that purpose.

 
 

 

1TV's interviews with director Jivan Avetisyan and actresses Tatiana Spivakova and Naira Zakaryan.

story:
"It's out there in the woods!"

 

Support us and be a part of making horror movie magic!

We've shot the above teaser for you to see what we can do. It's not the finished film or clips from what will eventually go into the film but meant as a taster to help you see how far we want to take this thing.
Our team managed to do all this in a single day's filming, so imagine what we could do in three weeks!

 

How far would you go for the one you love?

 

The Story

William has gone into isolated hiding in the countryside after horrifically violent events. Alone, scared and starting to lose his mind, he becomes caught between visions of past, present and fantasy.

Whilst consumed by dreams and nightmares of the woman he loves, Chantelle, he is stalked by mysterious figures in the woods and terrorised by a ferocious creature he has locked inside a nearby barn.

William must come to terms with his situation and face a terrible truth, putting to an end this hellish chain of events before the next full moon.

 

 

"I promised I'd always take care of her."

 

What We Need & What You Get

  • We have raised the necessary funds to get things started and now we need your help to raise another £16k to make the full feature. This money will make such a big difference to our production. We will invest it into more shoot days, with every extra day we have, the more time we have to get the right shots and the right performances. Horror movies rely so much on the visuals and the atmosphere and buying ourselves more time buys us more quality which means more enjoyment for you as the audience. We will also invest more in visual effects. We believe in the less is more approach but when you do actually see something, the pay off has to be worthy of the build up. Like the  shark in Jaws or the alien in Alien.
  • We really believe this is a community project, not just the local community but the horror community who are so passionate and enthusiastic about the genre. We have some really exciting perks which range from special merchandise to  interacting with cast and crew and actually being involved in production.
  • If we don't reach the total required funds, we will still go ahead and make this movie, there is too much passion and determination in our team to not get it over the line. Of course the more we get in the budget, the more we can improve on our special effects and improve the visual storytelling. It takes a lot of money to make a movie happen and with each donation we are a little closer to the high-quality polished finish of a Hollywood movie.

 

"We all suffer because of you!"

 

The Team Behind The Teaser....

We had a very talented and enthusiastic team for the filming of our Wolf Garden teaser. As it was shot in one day it required a lot of planning beforehand to get so many shots and make everything run smoothly. With Wayne David directing/producing, we had the extremely talented director of photography Ariel Artur with his excellent camera team of Steve Fairman and Rob Shannon. Setting the right tone and mood for each of the scenes whilst trying to keep a narrative was so important in making this work. Our 1st assistant director was the ever-enthusiastic Linzy Attenborough helped on the day by the hard work of production manager Wenqian Sun. Working sound we had the great Geoff Pheasant and our fantastic makeup artist was Rebecca Wheeler working very hard to make our creature look the business with the brilliant prosthetics made by David Foxley at Fox Zumbi Dark Arts FX. And last but not least the fine editing of Fabrizio Gammardella who shaped all that effort into what you've just watched.

Special thanks also has to go to our talented cast of actors, Rosina Williams, Nick David, Hazel Halliday and Wayne David (that guy again!).

It was through the work and dedication of all involved that we managed to make this teaser happen and get it to the level we wanted it at to bring to you now.

 

 

A few examples of our prosthetics specialist David Foxley's previous work...

 

Other Ways You Can Help

If none of the perks are appealing to you or you are unable to donate, don't worry, you can still help us by spreading the word and sharing the link. Together we can make this film happen!

story:
Hi my name is Ajax Haldane I'm 12 years old and I'm wanting to start my own small video business.

Right now I can't start my business because I don't have the computer equipment for it.

My dad and I started building a computer for me about a year ago. We got all the components for my build except one of the most important parts, the graphics processing unit. We found a graphics card online, but the day after we ordered it the gpu prices got really expensive. Our order was canceled and we couldn't afford another one because it was so expensive.  luckily my really nice uncle managed to get me an older gpu at the last second before stuff got crazy, but the software I wanted to use was too much for the gpu to handle. It couldn't record or edit video, both of which I wanted to do.  A nice monitor was also not in the budget so I had to use a low resolution monitor instead.  

With this equipment upgraded, I will be able to fuel my interest as a film maker and video editor.  I want to make fun and funny content to entertain people, I would also like to make skateboarding and snowboarding videos for the community.  That's  where I am right now so i ask you to help fund me and my business thanks.

Also, the campaign ends on my 13th Birthday.

story:
About The Creators

Elizabeth and Victoria Serra are a writing, directing and film editing team. After training at the American Conservatory Theatre, British American Drama Academy and the Art Institute of Pittsburgh, the Serra Sisters wrote and directed their dark comedy, SKIN DEEP, an award-winning short film currently selected to screen in festivals through March 2019. To see past film projects click the link below: https://www.youtube.com/user/TheSerraSisters


About Our Project

A MADE BED is a short dark comedy about a young girl who learns the importance of enunciation after escaped convicts hold her family hostage.

  • Your contributions will directly impact the care and feeding of cast and crew.

  • You are supporting a female driven production.

  • Plus, your image can appear on the film! Check out the perks-->-->-->-->-->-->

​Our Team

          Director/Writer

Elizabeth Serra studied at the American Conservatory Theatre and British American Drama Academy in London.  After moving to Los Angeles, she transitioned from directing theatre to directing film, writing and directing True Colors and Hell's Little Angel. She won the Best Woman Filmmaker Award at the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival for her most recent dark comedy, Skin Deep.

 

   Art Director/Editor/VFX 

Victoria Serra graduated from the Art Institute of Pittsburgh in with a B.S. in Visual Effects and Motion Graphics where she won the SLATE AWARD for her short film What You Get. Feature film work includes Last Call At Murray's, Deccani Souls and Lightweight. Other credits include Hell's Little Angel, True Colors, and the web series Carbon Dating. She won the Best Woman Filmmaker Award at the Los Angeles Independent Film Festival for Skin Deep.

 

     Director of Photography

Jennifer Hook is based in Los Angeles and has a major in Film Studies with ten years of experience in narrative, documentary, and live productions. Her favorite projects are those which challenge her to change her personal shooting style to fit the theme of the story being told; therefore, her personal style is always changing. Her favorite sets to work on are those which foster a sense of community among the crew and lead to friendships and working relationships lasting far beyond any one single project.  To see her reel, head over to   www.jenniferhook.com

 

          Producer

Amanda Serra founded Poke In The Eye Productions in 2015 and produces web series, short films and features. Recent credits include the short film Skin Deep and award-winning comedy web series Carbon Dating. https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3664170/

Our Budget

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to contribute financially, but would like to help in other ways, please make some noise about our campaign! Share, share, share with your friends by using Indiegogo share tools!

story:
What is ENOUGH all about?

Logline: After discovering she's pregnant at her own party, Laurie is forced to make decisions regarding her future but her boyfriend has other intentions...

This short story written by our Director of Photography (Kayla Mitchell) and co-written by our Director (Megan Yundt) highlights the issues and challenges of violent/abusive domestic partnerships in this society, specifically the challenges of overcoming such situations and stepping beyond your comfort zone. We are determined to bring this story to life in order to draw in more awareness towards such an ongoing devastating circumstance. 

Developing this story and bringing the awareness to fruition is extremely important for us. As both storytellers and victims of abuse we feel that it is not just a passion, but a mission for us to convey these visual messages.

ENOUGH  has wrapped and is now in POST - we are on schedule to have the pic loc by 6/24/21

 

What We Need & What You Get

Currently, we are seeking funds towards next years film festival circuit. Both big name film festivals and small have application fees and we intend on applying for as many film festivals that will accept our story! Currently, we have a goal of $500 towards these application fees but may relaunch a new campaign to apply for as many film festivals as we can. With that said, we have new and exciting perks in return for supporting our cause!

$20 contribution - A personal thank you card signed by the crew!

$50 contribution - A printed film screenplay signed by the crew AND a personal thank you card signed by the crew!

$100 contribution - A digital print poster signed by the crew, a printed screenplay signed by the crew, and a personal thank you card signed by the crew!

$200 contribution - ALL PERKS! ACCESS TO OUR PRIVATE SCREENING (specific date tbd but will be in close contact with those who wish to attend), A digital print poster signed by the crew, a printed screenplay signed by the crew, and a personal thank you card signed by the crew!

 

Who Are We?

Producer: Faith C. Wells - Faith Carlita Wells is a bright and fresh screen writer, filmmaker, mastering engineer and producer based out of Chicago, Illinois. Originally from Atlanta Georgia, Faith has collaborated on many successful projects with established mastering sound engineers amongst the West Coast. Her art is filled with deep southern roots imagery with an urban flare. Her interests have always been connected with a plethora of artistic expression. Her influences include Stephanie Allan Bray, Ava DuVernay, and Viola Davis. Wells has produced and engineered 13 short films, 4 music videos, 3 mixtapes, 1 live jazz album, and 4 live concerts tours. She has works in live theater sound for the Past Prime Players and has also worked with West Coast musical artists Shawnna and Canibus as a live and in studio engineer. Her vision for her work is to commit to and produce honest, beautiful and meaningful films.

 

 

Director/Co-Writer: Megan Yundt - Megan Yundt is a Chicago filmmaker known for directing short horror films, writing, and doing makeup. Her love for horror and practical effects started at a young age and escalated into her pursuing a career in filmmaking. She takes inspiration from directors like David Cronenberg, and David Lynch. Even when she’s not doing horror, she can be found dissecting and appreciating all manner of media from drama to animation.

 

Director of Photography/Writer: Kayla Mitchell - Kayla Mitchell is a Cinematographer based out of Chicago, Illinois. With a nine-year photography/camera operation background associated with live events such as weddings, concerts, and music festivals located throughout the country Kayla incorporates her own personal experiences and struggles into her aesthetic to form relation and connection amongst others. She takes inspiration from Cinematographers such as Matthew Libatique, and Christopher Rejano. Anticipating graduation with her BFA in film, she is constantly motivated towards the task at hand with a positive mental attitude, willing to break boundaries, and go the extra mile to ensure that her work is executed in a skillful manner.

 

 

Editor: Jack Bernacchi - Jack Bernacchi has a Bachelors in Sales and Digital Promotions from the David Letterman School of Telecommunication at Ball State University. During his time at "The Harvard of Muncie"- David Letterman, Jack honed his skills as a one man crew responsible for shooting and editing football player highlights and coaches tape. Upon Graduation in 2016 he accepted a position as an account executive. However, In his free time, Jack relentlessly pursues his passion for creating, and becoming an expert in 6 different adobe programs. By 2018 he became editor for CMM Productions in Indianapolis, IN where he edited athlete recruitment tapes for student athletes. Jack parlayed his creative skillset by shooting, editing, and creating content for Barstool Sports blogger/internet personality Young Mantis (season 2 champion of Barstool Idol). Currently residing in Chicago IL, Jack has earned his Associates in Fine Arts and Film from Columbia College of Hollywood. As a sought after independent contractor, he balances several positions working as a media specialist creating branded content for businesses, brands, and musicians. Jack also fostered a music media start up, with collaborator Jaylin Scott, called Juiced Uppp Media, LCC. The duo has amassed a lot of early success shooting concert recaps and promotional content for a handful of big name artists.

 

The Impact

The impact of these contributions are limitless. With us as a crew all still being college students and with this being an extremely low budget film, any contribution helps us fund the film the way it properly needs to. With these contributions going directly towards film festival applications/next years film festival circuit, we anticipate to not just have ENOUGH selected into festivals but to bring the impact and convey the importance towards others throughout the country. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not all of you can contribute with money, but that doesn't mean you can't help!

- Give us a like/share/follow on facebook: https://www.facebook.com/enoughthepicture

- Give us a like/share/follow on instagram: https://www.instagram.com/enoughthepicture

- Share THIS campaign! 

Again, from the bottom of our hearts, THANK YOU!

story:
SYNOPSIS: In the haunted October of 1977, people are disappearing. An investigation reveals the dark and disturbing truth… a nightmarish cult of witches is responsible. Now, one family has hired a tracker to find their daughters, and take on the unspeakable horror within the coven

THE CAST

Brinke Stevens (The Slumber Party Massacre)

Tamara Glynn (Halloween 5, Freddy's Nightmares)

 

Jennifer Stone, Todd Jenkins, Auriel Balistreri, Paula Marcenaro Solinger

Now, one family has hired a tracker to find their daughters, and take on the unspeakable horror within the covenTHE CASTBrinke Stevens (The Slumber Party Massacre)Tamara Glynn (Halloween 5, Freddy's Nightmares) Jennifer Stone, Todd Jenkins, Auriel Balistreri, Paula Marcenaro Solinger

story:
Hi, my name is Ashley, and I'm making a web series.



Originally from Ohio, I have been living and working in Harlem as an independent filmmaker since 2009. Along with co-owner (and "Anthology" star) Ricki Lynée, I run a small production company called Nuanse Entertainment. 


The goal of our company is to create and distribute projects that depict multi-dimensional characters across every genre. Over the last few years, Nuanse has produced films, comedy sketches and music videos that have screened at festivals and showcases across the country. 

Our latest project, Anthology, follows six 20-somethings trying to function in NYC. "Anthology" is a unique creation born of a few simple ingredients: an ethnically-diverse cast, improvised dialogue, and gorgeous cinematography.  The intersection of these three elements creates a dynamic experience that has garnered favor amongst various audiences.

Our Goal is to get Anthology on Television!

What we need is to continue our story on a larger platform. While the previous season introduced each character individually through six short episodes, the new season will show how these characters function in the world, and how their lives connect over the course of 8 longer-form episodes. We have constructed the series so that both new and returning viewers will be able to join in without missing a beat. The goal is to get the new season on a highly visible network such as IFC, and to do this, we need to raise the funds to finish!

If you'd like to take a look at our Pilot Season, or just revisit some of your favorite episodes, the full six episodes of Anthology are Available Now!


Our Fundraising Goal Is $4,000. This Will Go To:

HIRING CREW - We can't shoot the show without a great crew! Everyone has an important job and without them, the series won't be the same!
FEEDING CAST & CREW - We have to keep our cast & crew healthy and in good spirits!



CAMERA, SOUND & LIGHTING EQUIPMENT RENTALS - We need great equipment to make our series ready for TV!
LOCATION RENTALS - We need beautiful locations to film our scenes!
MUSIC RIGHTS - Like the music you hear in our promo video? We need great music to make a great show, and the artists need to be paid for their talent!
INSURANCE - Safety First! We need Production Insurance to rent Equipment, Automobiles and to protect our cast & crew under General Liability.

What YOU get for your money:
 We've got some great incentives for your donations, including: 
  • Invitation to the Cast & Crew Premiere of the new season of "Anthology"
  • Dinner with a Cast member
  • Walk-On Role in an episode of the new season
**We are also offering exclusive, themed "Character Packages" which include a special video message from whichever cast member you choose!**
Some highlights from the "Character Packages" include:
  • "Will": 1-year subscription to GQ Magazine so you can "Look Sharp & Live Smart"!
  • "Devina": Manhattan Karaoke Night with Members of the Cast!
  • "Reid": Tickets for YOU & a friend on an NYC City Cruise!
Check out the Rewards section for much, much more!!

What Happens If We Don't Make Our Goal?

The train doesn't stop!
If we don't reach our goal of $4000, the money we DO receive will be that more helpful in allowing the show to continue! It will go to all of the same items we mentioned above (Crew, Rentals, Locations...)! So, jump on board because we're leaving the station!!

What Are Some Challenges We Anticipate?

We are looking for increased publicity and marketing so that we can get this show on TV! Finding the right contacts to spread the word about our show is key, so this is one of the major items we have been working on and will continue to pursue during this process.

Last year, we did not make our fundraising goal and had to shoot 11 days to finish filming all of the scenes involving "Ashley R." since our wonderful actress was leaving the country shortly after. Even in the face of this adversity, the amazing work-ethic, camaraderie and faith amongst the Cast and Crew allowed us to get everything finished without compromising our vision, as you can see from the video and images on this page. We will brace ourselves for any future challenges that come our way, and meet them head on with the knowledge that this project is bigger than just us who are working on it. 



Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that it's not always possible to contribute financially, but this doesn't mean you can't help! Here are a few ways you can join the journey & get the show to the people! 

  • Get the word out by sharing the campaign link via Facebook, Twitter and other social media. IndieGoGo has provided some great share tools to make spreading the word a sinch!
  • Like the show? Subscribe to Nuanse Entertainment's YouTube Channel, Like "Anthology" on Facebook and Tweet! Did you know that Film festivals & Distributors are more likely to accept series with a large fan base? So, the more audience members we can brag about, the better!
  • Tell-A-Friend! Good, old-fashioned word-of-mouth never hurt anybody! We appreciate you and the show does too!
The word "Anthology" is defined as a series of themes or catalogue of ideas that share something in common. A spectrum of vastly different experiences. The black experience is an anthology. Your 20s is an anthology. Life is an anthology. This show is an authentic and heartfelt reflection the strife, joy, pain, and laughter that we experience. Let's show the world what we're about.

Thank you,
Ashley
story_txt:
Hi, my name is Ashley, and I'm making a web series.






Originally from Ohio, I have been living and working in Harlem as an independent filmmaker since 2009. Along with co-owner (and "Anthology" star) Ricki Lynée, I run a small production company called Nuanse Entertainment. 

The goal of our company is to create and distribute projects that depict multi-dimensional characters across every genre. Over the last few years, Nuanse has produced films, comedy sketches and music videos that have screened at festivals and showcases across the country. 
Our latest project, Anthology, follows six 20-somethings trying to function in NYC. "Anthology" is a unique creation born of a few simple ingredients: an ethnically-diverse cast, improvised dialogue, and gorgeous cinematography.  The intersection of these three elements creates a dynamic experience that has garnered favor amongst various audiences.

Our Goal is to get Anthology on Television!

What we need is to continue our story on a larger platform. While the previous season introduced each character individually through six short episodes, the new season will show how these characters function in the world, and how their lives connect over the course of 8 longer-form episodes. We have constructed the series so that both new and returning viewers will be able to join in without missing a beat. The goal is to get the new season on a highly visible network such as IFC, and to do this, we need to raise the funds to finish!

If you'd like to take a look at our Pilot Season, or just revisit some of your favorite episodes, the full six episodes of Anthology are Available Now!

Our Fundraising Goal Is $4,000. This Will Go To:

HIRING CREW - We can't shoot the show without a great crew! Everyone has an important job and without them, the series won't be the same!

story:
A NOTE FROM US

First of all – Thank you for taking the time to have a look at our campaign!

Moritz and I are passionate about challenging the way disabilities are perceived in Film and TV. To this day, most disabled characters on screen fall into the same tropes with no character depth, development or accurate representation (except for example, Isaac from Sex Education – we LOVE YOU). We want to promote the message that people with disabilities are just like everyone else. Both of us are swimmers ourselves and admire the freedom we feel when in the water – which is something we want reflected in the film.

Rather than showcasing a character who has a disability and struggles with it, Take Your Mark aims to present the character as someone who has been disabled/impaired by the barriers of society (social construct of disability). Our main character is not defined by her disability; it is simply a part of her.

Alongside our message within the film, we also aim to employ a crew and core members of the team where at least 15% have a disability. As you’ve seen in the video, the film industry has a lot of catching up to do and we want to help in that much needed change.

We hope to inspire another generation of athletes with disabilities and assist in abolishing the negative stigma behind disabilities.

This project will also be used as a proof of concept for a limited series in order to bring these stories to a larger audience.

#NoFilmAboutUsWithoutUs

#WeThe15

 

THE STORY

Genre: Sports Fiction Drama

Synopsis: After being tasked to start swimming by her doctor, a disabled teenager with Cerebral Palsy tries out for her local swim team and discovers her new dream of becoming a Paralympic swimmer.

Our main character arrives at the training pool with big dreams, only to struggle getting in to the non-accessible front door. She jumps into the pool for tryouts, fully aware that the whole team expects her to drown. During the tryout, her stamina helps her keep up with the rest of the swimmers but her form falters and she fails to qualify for the team. The coach spots our main character staying late to practise her form and gives her some advice. The coach’s usual advice doesn’t seem to work and they must adapt their coaching style to help her improve her stroke. Impressed with her perseverance, the coach invites her on to the team - she is one step closer to her dream.

This short will follow a similar style to Sex Education and How to Sell Drugs Online (fast) by Netflix. These shows portray timeless but modern locations with vibrant blocks of colour on neutral backgrounds. As you can see in our video, our location is modern but neutral – therefore we will be using pops of reds, yellows and pinks to help our characters stand out or blend in, depending on their role.

Man on Fire (2004) is a great example of this.

 

MEET THE TEAM

We are so excited to be working with the team we have so far. Moritz and I were passionate about making sure our core team had a high percentage of people with disabilities in it so that we can represent an authentic character without falling into cheesy tropes and clichés. We want a truthful story.

Andrew Burrell – The Writer

Andrew is a scriptwriter and story editor for live-action and animated telly with Independent Talent Group.  Best known for writing on Matt Groening’s Netflix show ‘Disenchantment’, previously he was Head Writer of ‘Danger Mouse’ and is currently creating a new drama for Netflix Kids and Family, co-creator and story consultant for Disney Spain’s ‘Flipante Noa’ and writing on the ‘Demon Headmaster’ and Season 6 of ‘So Awkward’ at CBBC. With previous experience writing sports dramas, Andrew looks forward to writing his first disabled character in Take Your Mark by using his own personal experience as a man with disabilities.

 

Jon Muschamp - Director of Photography

Jon is a London based Cinematographer working on films, commercials and music videos for artists and brands such as Nick Cave, KSI, Ikea, Noel Gallagher, Madeon and many more. His debut feature film, The Flood, was released through Curzon Cinemas in 2019. The Trap, a short film directed by Lena Headey, premiered at London Film Festival 2019 and was nominated for Best Short Film BAFTA 2020. He trained at the prestigious National Film & Television School in England, where both his graduation projects enjoyed success winning Best Short Animation BAFTA (Poles Apart) and the RTS Cinematography Award for Short Film (Comeback Kid). Jon is passionate about telling a visual story and strives to create a strong and lasting impression with audiences.

 

Carolyn McLeod – Casting Director

Carolyn is a London based Casting Director who has spent the last 15 years of her career making a name for herself in the industry. She casted for feature projects such as, The Woman in Black (2012), Sweetheart (2021), and 2021 short-turned-feature with Stephen Graham, Boiling Point. Carolyn is passionate about casting diversity for the screen and has turned over every stone to make sure we have the perfect cast for Take Your Mark.

 

Moritz Valero - Director

Moritz is a Filmmaker with disabilities from Germany, living in London and is currently studying MA Directing at MetFilm School and has taken part in the Director Series at NFTS. His previous work has been screened at festivals in the UK, US and has been promoted by the German consulate in New York. As someone with disabilities, he is passionate and committed to bringing authentic representation of people with disabilities to the screen. In his spare time he is working on advancing disabled rights and changing perspectives and has been a speaker at events such as the Autism-show and for different NHS events.

Leonie Schmidt - Producer

Leonie is a London based producer passionate about bringing powerful emotion and lasting stories to the screen. She is currently studying an MA in Producing at MetFilm School and strives to make every story she tells pull at the heart strings of her audience. Her debut short film ‘The Brass Elephant in the Room’ has received over 100K views on YouTube distributor ALTER while her short film on Alzheimer’s, ‘In The Morning’, was screened at the BFI in Southbank London.

 

Jordan Quinn – The Lead

Jordan is a Para-swimmer with Cerebral Palsy. Taking a break from swimming, she is currently in her second year studying at Swansea University.

 

WHERE WILL THE MONEY GO?

Unfortunately, while we’d love to make this project happen without needing any money, there are a couple places where we still need financial assistance.

The money you donate will go to the following:

CASTING: As we’ve got some amazing actors on board so far, we want to make sure they’re paid for their time. Everyone will be paid equally for the time they work as everyone is equally valuable to the creation of the project! This will also cover the pay for our amazing casting director Carolyn.

LOCATIONS: We are filming in a pool that belongs to a school. They have been so generous to bring down the price of the hiring of the location but those working there deserve to get paid and the school compensated for their beautiful location and time.

EQUIPMENT: While we’ve got some kit already available, we’re filming in and around a pool which means we need a lot of additional water safety equipment that we need to hire out.

ACCESSIBILITY: As we have a higher percentage of disabled crew and cast, we need to make sure all of their access needs are met!

COSTUME AND HAIR & MAKEUP: Our actors deserve to look beautiful right?

ACCOMODATION: Our amazing lead, Jordan Quinn, lives in Wales and we need to make sure she can stay near set so that she doesn’t have to drive down every day.

TRANSPORT: We have to get everyone to set! We’re filming just outside London so everyone needs to be able to get there on time

POST PRODUCTION: Once we’re done filming we need to cut everything together and make sure those working on the project get paid for the time

ARCHIVE FOOTAGE: We plan on using some copyrighted footage from the paralympics in our film which means we’ll need to pay a fee to the suppliers. We don’t want to steal someone else’s work.

SAFETY: Covid-19 is still looming and we want all of our cast and crew to be safe, especially as we will have some clinically vulnerable people on set. This will cover the costs of tests, hygiene equipment and PPE.

INSURANCE: This is the most boring one but might be the most important. Because we’re filming around water, we need additional insurance to make sure all of our kit, cast and crew are covered in case of an accident.

CONTINGENCY: This amount is calculated so that we can afford any last minute costs should something go wrong last minute. It’s vital in all filmmaking as production unfortunately doesn’t always go to plan.

 

WHAT IF I CAN’T DONATE?

No worries! Covid-19 has thrown us all a curveball and we’re all in different financial places. If you can’t donate here are some other things you can do to help us:

Spread the word about this project – Share this Campaign on your platforms!

Talk to your friends and family about how you view disabilities and have an open conversation. It’s important to discuss where you lie, and don’t be afraid to make mistakes – it’s part of the process of learning.

Watch the Paralympics and other Para-sport competitions – these athletes have worked so hard and deserve recognition!

Just remember, everyone’s disability affects them differently. If you’ve met a person with autism then that’s exactly what you did – met ONE person with autism; they don’t represent the whole community. The same goes for any other disability or condition.

 

SPECIAL THANKS

We wanted to give a special thanks to Grace Harvey who took the time out of her busy schedule to talk to us. Special thanks also goes to British Para-Swimming and Team GB.

story:
Welcome to the Dead Girl crowdfunding page!

We are a group of film students at Montana State University. Dead Girl  is our senior film project, written and directed by Jake Marston. We are so excited to create this film, but we need your help to do so!

The Film:

In 1977, roommates Kristen, Jean, and Shannon are beginning to be taunted by an unseen supernatural force. This begins to highlight the hidden conflict between Jean and Shannon, with Kristen in the middle. But as the entity begins to further target Kristen, personal issues must be put aside in order to save their friend before it is too late. 

 

Director's Statement:

"A familial bond is a powerful thing. Sometimes too powerful. Someone can your best friend, but can turn into your worst enemy upon moving in together. With many of us spending a lot of time at home recently, it’s surely been on everyone’s mind. Dead Girl is a film about good friends and bad roommates, and a film for those of us who have hated someone just as much as they loved them." 

 

The Team:

Jake Marston (Writer/Director)

  • Jake Marston is the writer and director of Dead Girl, who wanted to make a film for good friends who might be bad roommates. Jake directed Verde last fall and is now excited to use  his previous filmmaking experience to make Dead Girl the best film possible.

Jaiden Turner (Producer)

  • Jaiden Turner is a senior in MSU's film program and producer for Dead Girl. She has previously directed a short film Breathe and is a four time recipient of the Taco Bell Live Mas Scholarship for her passion for storytelling. Jaiden can't wait to work with this team, and she is so excited to help bring Dead Girl to life!

Zach Robinson (Director of Photography)

  • Zach is the cinematographer for Dead Girl and is very excited to bring Jake's vision to reality. He's worked on several student films before and is excited to work with this solid crew for this project. He can't wait to show what he and Jake have planned for Dead Girl!

Chandler Pippin (Editor)

  • Currently a senior at Montana State University, Chandler has fasten in love with experimental filmmaking and editing. They take lots of inspiration from films like Nobuhiku Obayashi's House, and plans to take cues from such works when editing Dead Girl. He's thrilled to be working with Jake again, as he has proven to be a capable director who is a pleasure to edit for, and excited to work with a stellar crew.

Sienna Riley (Production Design)

  • Sienna Riley is a senior at Montana State hoping to pursue production design post grad. Her love of film can be traced to shows like That 70s Show so she is so excited to create an exciting 70s aesthetic with sorority inspiration from her own sorority scrapbooks. 

 

Budget Breakdown

Total Budget: $3,500

Production Design - $1000

  • Production design is a huge part of our film; this includes everything from hair and makeup, to costumes, special effects. We also need to give our modern location the look and feel of the 70s vibes of Dead Girl with props and set decorations.

Equipment - $500

  • As film students at Montana State University, we are lucky enough to have access to the film department's equipment from cameras to lights and sound equipment. But, we still need rent additional equipment to help create the world of Dead Girl.

Acting - $500

  • In order to cast the best actors possible, we need to be able to pay them for their time; their time and commitment throughout the pre-production, and production process deserves reward!

Food - $600

  • During this time, we must feed meals, and snacks to our crew to ensure they perform their best on set. With COVID still being prevalent, we also need to take into consideration meals that can be individually packaged for our cast and crew.

COVID - $200

  • While COVID is still prevalent in our world, safety is one of our top priorities. We need to make sure we can make Dead Girl while also staying as safe as possible by purchasing all the necessary PPE and supplies to keep our cast and crew safe and healthy.

Marketing/Distribution - $500

  • Marketing will allow us to promote our film, and make sure it gets out into the world.  This includes creating posters, social media promotions, and other promotional materials. The next step is to submit Dead Girl to film festivals so it can be seen by the world.

Expendables - $200

  • Some items such as tape, gels, and batteries that must be purchased to create our film. Without these little things, our film won't be possible!

 

Risks & Challenges

COVID-19 presents challenges that everyone in our world is facing on a daily basis. However, our team is working hard to ensure we can create our film while still following health and safety guidelines. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Spread the word! We would love it if you shared our IndieGoGo, or Instagram page! @deadgirl_film
